Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: mitwcook
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days here with my family during Spring Break. The hotel is elegant and timeless. Its proximity to excellent restaurants and major French Quater attractions make doubly attractive. We took breakfast at the hotel each morning. The food and service cannot be beat. Our children loved the rooftop pool. The room, while a little small, was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monteleone and The French Quarter Festival”
Reviews.Author: Billie D
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my yearly trip to New Orleans and The French Quarter Festival. I always stay at The Hotel Monteleone and have done so for many years. The Carousel Bar has been enlarged to include entertainment on the Monteleone Stage; very nice. Currently, the restaurants are closed for renovation but they still provide a buffet breakfast for those who are interested and room service 24/7 with good service and food. I request the larger of the preferred double rooms for myself and find the room is very accomodating and the bathroom is large with bath and granite tiles; my room is quiet and always very clean. The hotel itself is beautiful in architecture and perfectly located in the quarter; I highly recommend a stay. Laissez les bons temps rouler! Bon Jour

Reviews.Title: “Monteleone Hotel, A New Orleans Treasure”
Reviews.Author: maggieminn
Reviews.Content: From the lovely restuarant to the carousel at the bar, it's a lovely experience. Our room was small but is to be expected when staying in the French Quarter in an old historic hotel. It was a beautifully decorated room; very clean and wonderful view of the Mississippi. From the receptionists at the front desk, to Lucille in the restuarant to the housekeepers....we were well taken care of. The location is excellent if planning to visit the waterfront, about 8 blocks away. Burbon Street is a block. The casino is about 6 blocks. Shops and eateries are everywhere and walking is very safe. All tours can be booked from the hotel. I did alot of calling to the hotel ahead of time to asure that our rooms were correct and getting help on tours. The staff was always extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, but some good points as well”
Reviews.Author: saiyingpun
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time at the Hotel Monteleone and I'd like to say it was all good but it was not. Cons: First we had one of our wedding events here on the roof top after dealing with horrible staff that went back on a signed contract we had with them (long story). Then most of our wedding guests stayed here and had complaints about the size of the rooms, which are tiny and a bit outdated, and about the staff, who were rude to a lot people at checkin. The hotel is classic but is also very set in their ways and it is tough to find anyone helpful (which we finally did, and that definitely helped and really changed the experience at the end into a positive one) Pros: The Carousel Bar is a must-do. The location is also great, and the roof top pool is quite nice but backs up onto one of the suites which is a little odd and not very good for privacy. The hotel markets itself as 5-star which it is really not. They are undergoing renovations so I believe they are working on improving it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rest is soso”
Reviews.Author: traveltheglobe1
Reviews.Content: Great old hotel. Member of Preferred group so expected great service. Disappointing service, unhelpful staff all around except for concierge Anita who was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: mitwcook
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days here with my family during Spring Break. The hotel is elegant and timeless. Its proximity to excellent restaurants and major French Quater attractions make doubly attractive. We took breakfast at the hotel each morning. The food and service cannot be beat. Our children loved the rooftop pool. The room, while a little small, was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monteleone and The French Quarter Festival”
Reviews.Author: Billie D
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my yearly trip to New Orleans and The French Quarter Festival. I always stay at The Hotel Monteleone and have done so for many years. The Carousel Bar has been enlarged to include entertainment on the Monteleone Stage; very nice. Currently, the restaurants are closed for renovation but they still provide a buffet breakfast for those who are interested and room service 24/7 with good service and food. I request the larger of the preferred double rooms for myself and find the room is very accomodating and the bathroom is large with bath and granite tiles; my room is quiet and always very clean. The hotel itself is beautiful in architecture and perfectly located in the quarter; I highly recommend a stay. Laissez les bons temps rouler! Bon Jour

Reviews.Title: “Monteleone Hotel, A New Orleans Treasure”
Reviews.Author: maggieminn
Reviews.Content: From the lovely restuarant to the carousel at the bar, it's a lovely experience. Our room was small but is to be expected when staying in the French Quarter in an old historic hotel. It was a beautifully decorated room; very clean and wonderful view of the Mississippi. From the receptionists at the front desk, to Lucille in the restuarant to the housekeepers....we were well taken care of. The location is excellent if planning to visit the waterfront, about 8 blocks away. Burbon Street is a block. The casino is about 6 blocks. Shops and eateries are everywhere and walking is very safe. All tours can be booked from the hotel. I did alot of calling to the hotel ahead of time to asure that our rooms were correct and getting help on tours. The staff was always extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Monteleone is marvelous!”
Reviews.Author: jordanja
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, historic building combined with southern hospitality of the attentive staff, a rooftop pool retreat, carousel bar and wonderful local music nightly made our 6 night stay delightful. Its location on Royal makes everything easily accessible. The room was very comfortable and pretty. Room darkening draperies, a decidedly plush bed and a fantastic HVAC system made for a refreshing nights sleep repeatedly ! My husband enjoyed the nicely equipped workout space with great views of the city. Pool was wonderful as we're the poolside drinks. Chairs on the sunny side fill up quickly. Carousel bar is quirky and filled every night. Go late afternoon to experience the most expertly prepared cocktails and interesting company. All in all a wonderful refuge after the mysteries of the NOLA culture. Highly recommend the breakfast buffet. Broke our "never eat at buffets" rule. Fresh juices, fruits, strawberries were in season, and after days of rather exotic offerings it was refreshing to partake of an expertly prepared and presented fare. We shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rest is soso”
Reviews.Author: traveltheglobe1
Reviews.Content: Great old hotel. Member of Preferred group so expected great service. Disappointing service, unhelpful staff all around except for concierge Anita who was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, New Orleans - Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelluver
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. Previously, my husband and I have stayed at both the Loews and the Marriott Convention Center, which we enjoyed. But there is something special about the Monteleone. Our room on the 11th floor, while not extremely large, was adequate in size and furnished quite nicely in a traditional fashion. The bathroom was on the small size, but immaculate. Housekeeping was wonderful, and even provided evening turn down service. You must visit the Carousel Bar. We were there during the French Quarter Fest and the bar, as well as the hotel, was hopping. The location for the Fest can't be beat. I found the staff pleasant, but a little less than stellar. The front desk gal could not locate a shop on Royal Street only a few block s from the hotel, and the concierge advised me against taking the streetcar to the 3500 block of Canal Street (she suggested taking a taxi for safety, during the noon hours), which was rather silly as the area was perfectly safe. I didn't sample any of the hotel's dining options but the restaurant was doing a brisk breakfast business. The roof top pool as well as evening entertainment in the lounge are nice pluses. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Elizxabeth
Reviews.Content: I got to stay and play while my sister attended a conference in this wonderful hotel, in this wonderful city. The hotel was the perfect location for walking everywhere in the French Quarter and the wonderful sign that could be seen towering above the other buildings made it so easy to find my way back. The room was a bit small but very nicely decorated with great black out curtains if you need to sleep in! Didn't make it to the pool but heard it was great. I would certaiinly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluesgirl72
Reviews.Content: I was here for a convention. The staff seemed very professional and accommodating, although I didn't use many services. The parking was pretty expensive, I think it was $30+ a night. As with many historic hotels, the room and bath was on the smaller side but it was nice. The location was good, convenient to walk many places. The Carousel Bar is fun, but it was always crowded and service was generally pretty slow. I snagged a seat on a Tuesday evening and went an entire revolution (the seats actually revolve very slowly around the bar) before managing to get the attention of a bartender and order a drink. Overall though a nice classic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: Twohappyguys
Reviews.Content: I was there to see my son be installed as the President of a National Organization. The Monteleone is close to everything: Bourbon Street, the night life, the ambiance that is uniquely New Orleans. During the day, we walked to Cafe DuMonde from the hotel, then it was just a beautiful stroll along the Mississippi River to the Aquarium. The banquet for the final night was beautifully done. The filets were done to perfection, I would recommend the Monteleone to anyone. And when we return for a longer stay, it will be in the French Quarter, at the Monteleone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and suite!”
Reviews.Author: cfrare
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 5 nights at the Hotel, with 3 friends. We upgraded to suite 1462, which we later learned was one of the haunted rooms!! We had a fantastic time there!! The room was lovely, housekeeping kept everything spotless!, the rooftop pool was amazing!, the bartender at the pool was so friendly and helpful, the breakfast was excellent! The hotel is in a perfect location! Very easy to get everywhere we wanted to go in the city right from our front door! We loved our time in New Orleans, and are already planning our return trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy, clean, convienent”
Reviews.Author: Overlooker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our first trip to New Orleans. We like to try historic hotels and this one has a historic charm to it. Many famous authors stayed and wrote here. As with most historic hotels, the rooms are smaller than those in more modern hotels. Still, with our teenage daughter with us, we didn't feel crowded. Our room had a commanding view of the Mississippi River and life along the waterfront. The heart of the French Quarter was just a walk of just a couple of minutes. The Carousel Bar was unique and staffed with very friendly bartenders. The bellmen, concierge, and doorman were all courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm....The Charm is Gone”
Reviews.Author: LANative72
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in an ideal part of the Frech Quarter, close to great restaurants and of course all the excitment of New Orleans. I came here for a work event for 5 days. The rooms are extremely small (the size of ones that you would find in Europe). If you are a light sleeper, do not bother to stay here. The plumbing is loud, so if your neighbor wakes up before you do you will know it. The rooms are also very outdated. I know that the hotel strives for keeping their theme of Old New Orleans but their so called "upgrades" are not clearly seen. The staff in the catering and the restaurant are great except for the those at the front desk. I do not know if they were stressed out since the hotel was full due to a conference but they were rude and unprofessional. I have stayed at the Windsor Court which is walking distance from the French Quarter. Their rooms are decorated in a similar fashion but there is more room and the staff is much more accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: NovaCath
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during French Quarter Festival and this is a great location to be able to walk to the different stages. It is close to a number of good restaurants and just to walk around the French Quarter. We have stayed here before and have returned because of the location. Royal is much quieter than Bourbon but the street performers on Royal during the day are just down the street from the hotel. The room and bathroom aren't super large but the bed is very comfortable, there are enough towels and they are not super thin, they have bathrobes, they restocked the coffee and cups each day, the internet connection was good, and the in room safe worked. There was a flat screen TV in the cabinet and I had previously figured out how the cabinet doors can be pushed back while open so the doors do not block the TV. We had a room with two double beds and there was adequate closet space and storage space as there were two small closets (one on each side of the cabinet) and three drawers. There was also a desk with a chair and another chair for sitting in the room. While I could not see the TV from that chair, I do really appreciate not having to sit on the bed to read or use my laptop while my husband sits at the desk. We knew that the restaurant was closed for renovations before we got there. The concierge was very helpful and made reservations for us for dinner at Mr. B's and a reservation for me at the New Orleans School of Cooking for an afternoon class. I also went to Spa Aria, which is in the hotel, for a pedicure. It was very clean and the message chair was relaxing. I got compliments on the nail polish shade when I wore sandals at work after I returned home.

Reviews.Title: “They will rip you off!”
Reviews.Author: Kmarschhauser
Reviews.Content: I organized a group of 16 people to go to Mardi GRAS this past year. We planned the trip 6 months earlier, selecting the hotel Monteleon for our accommodations. We PREPAID, as required, for 4 rooms, 3 nights each at $300 a night in September 2011. The actual trip went well, the hotel itself was fine. When we returned back, my friend (who was the first to check in and thus had put his cc down for incidentals) had a $300 charge on his cc which monteleon is saying is for an extra night. We have now been battling them for 3 months to remove this charge since we didn't stay any extra nights (and then crazy thing is that they affirm that we didn't stay the extra night but somehow are saying that we wanted one). After giving them $3600, it is insane that they are trying to rip us off for additional money with no good rationale. I WOULD NOT recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: c105
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the Monteleone. We travel to New Orleans every April and have stayed at different hotels each time, while always admiring the Hotel Monteleone as it is a fixture in the city. This time, we decided to finally stay there and LOVED it. It is a gorgeous hotel with character/history. The hotel bar is a must see in New Orleans so it's great to have it right in the lobby. The carousel bar has started to do live music now and so it was great to hear music while sitting in the bar several nights during our stay. The location of the hotel is the best in New Orleans. It is located on Royal Street, a beautiful street in the quarter lined with antique shops. Cafe Beignet is right down the street so you can walk there for a coffee or beignets in the morning. You are close enough to anything you might want to do while also having the ability to avoid the noise and chaos of Bourbon street when you want. We would stay here every time in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monteleone, French Quarter Festival”
Reviews.Author: sienaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Comfortable beds, great location, lots of shops, roof pool, view of mississippi from the room, helpful staff....definately has the amenities to make a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lp813
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful and location was awesome for us. We stayed during the French Quarter festival and all the staff was outstanding, friendly and eager to help with directions or anything really. Glad I chose this hotel for my first trip to NOLA but I think the rooms are a bit overpriced. But then again it's the French Quarter so all hotels are pricey. I don't have any complaints

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: mutiaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Mardi Gras festival for 3 nights. Seriously, it was perfect location. Only a block away from Bourbon street and Canal street. Jackson square and other place within French Quarter area was in the walking distance range. The doorman and bellboy was nice. The receptionist was busy but still nice. The room itself has an antique or old decoration. Quite small room and small bathroom though. We already got a high floor room but still can hear noise from outside. But what can you expect ? Its Mardi Gras ! So we were okay. It was quiet enough compare to real thing down there. So we really recommend this hotel especially for Mardi Gras.

Reviews.Title: “Paying for location”
Reviews.Author: ebaci37
Reviews.Content: Great location, cool looking bar, but everything else is sub par for high price. Room was very small and black mold growing in air ducts. My suggestion is stay just outside French quarter in CBD/warehouse district. It is close enough with better value for $$.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: jbgator22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the middle of the French Quarter and within easy walking distance to great restaurants and Bourbon St. No complaints at all about the hotel, one of the best I have stayed in. From the staff to the bar the entire experiance was great.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans - March 2012”
Reviews.Author: Jsingle3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for a work meeting, and had a nice time. The rooms were very nice, a tad on the small side. And you can't get a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: OneFunRedhead
Reviews.Content: We stay here for Mardi Gradi 2012 and it was THE PERFECT location, one street over from Burboun st. Reception staff was so helpful, the late night staff was not so helpful unfortunatly, room was clean and spacious and just what we requested. During Mardi Gradi they do cut back on some of the services.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: egas40
Reviews.Content: We got in on Friday and went straight away to the Carousel bar at the hotel, it was packed and stayed packed until we left on Wednesday morning. Very interesting bar that seemed to do a lot more business than a lot of those in the French quarter. Hotel is located at the most convienent spot in the french Quarter, it is near to everywhere. we went to the riverside , easy walk, to the casino, easy walk all through the quarter , very easy walk , i suppose they had this hotel in mind when they said the BIG EASY. the door men were great , they knew their stuff as for the consierge , you could not ask for better. The hotel is so central it was easyb to get to all the sights we wanted to see. Definetly would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Service, and Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: atticus22
Reviews.Content: Great location. In the quarter but not on Bourbon. Rooms were the perfect size. A couple blocks off of Bourbon street so it was not too loud. Everything is walking distance. Only downside was a daily fee for internet and all surrounding wifi connections were blocked.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloGryde
Reviews.Content: We LOVED it here. A short walk and you could be just about anywhere in this great city ! Burbon Street, Jackson Square, the Casino,the River Walk or the Convention Center all within 20 minutes. The Hotel itself is marvelous in its architecture and accommodations. If you are looking for a special little getaway after a long day on the town check out the pool on the roof ! It's a bit pricey but isn't that what luxury is all about ?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: queenbee853
Reviews.Content: Beautiful traditional hotel located in a very convenient location to Bourbon or Canal Sts. The Carousel Bar is very unique and very popular. They good local entertainment during the weekends. If you plan to visit the bar, do it during the day when Marvin is bar tending and have him make you a Lemon Drop Martini.

Reviews.Title: “Still full of charm & grace”
Reviews.Author: Alexa8776
Reviews.Content: This grand hotel has always been on our bucket list - and she did not let us down. We arrived around midnight in March and from the moment we stepped in, the hotel service staff was on mark. The room was perfect, the bathroom quite large and your comfort was paramount. The fabulous "rotating" hotel bar is a must see; staff can make everything and anything you desire and the crowd is perfect for "people watching". What more can you say other than LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. Could not be better; in the heart of the Quarter but away from the big party scene of Bourbon Street. The only down side was the parking charge is quite high - and they add extra on top of you have a "larger" vehicle. Our cross-over SUV was in the "larger" fee area. Stay here at least once to see it all for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ja8130
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for the french quarter and I think the nicest hotel there. Staff is wonderful and the history and charm of the hotel are attactive as well. Now this hotel is older and so the rooms are smaller than the average hotel and the walls are not sound proof...more like paper thin. Beds are comfy but no charger for an iphone or mini bar in the room? Who doesn't have an iphone charger in the room anymore?? Had to walk down the street to walgreens and buy one for $12. If you are a smoker, you'll have to stand right by the front door entrance because this is a non smoking hotel and the rooms do not have balconies and the windows in your room are sealed shut. This is a really nice hotel and bottom line, I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Misonix
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just stayed at the Hotel Monteleone for Final Four weekend. Its a beutiful, charming hotel that we had a wonderful experiance in. we stayed in a suite which was fresh and updated. The hotel is as nice as the Ritz but for less money and the location cannot be beat. Its on Royal street, one block from Bourbon street, away from the noise but a short block to the fun.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, memorable, classy - best of the best!!”
Reviews.Author: TexasDJD
Reviews.Content: We can't wait to come back!! Excellent location on classy Royal Street & a block away from Bourbon Street. A gorgeous hotel with excellent service. They upgraded us upon arrival for our anniversary & made our stay extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Our best hotel experience ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Sigintdevildog
Reviews.Content: It's nice to see that the ideals of "service" still exist. Every member of the staff did everything they could to make our stay as pleasant as possible. And the location couldn't be better, on Royal Street and just 1 block from Bourbon Street and a short walk to Jackson Square. We will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “As promised”
Reviews.Author: D2squared
Reviews.Content: We were told that this was the place to stay and we were not disappointed. Great staff, great location, great amenities. Excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me!”
Reviews.Author: Mandi M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice. I didn't have to worry about things being dirty. That said, the bathroom was ridiculously small and difficult to maneuver in. The ONLY way to park is by valet. We were staying there for a conference and paid a "conference rate" of $199/night. There is no way that place was worth that! From the outside, the hotel and the whole French Quarter looks like a filthy, grafittied, disgusting area that I wouldn't want to be. I was very disappointed with New Orleans and I don't EVER plan to go back! We only spent two nights, so following the first night, by around 4pm, housekeeping had not come, so my husband tracked down a maid and asked to have our room cleaned. For that kind of hotel you shouldn't have to do that!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but no free wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: Simone A
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monteleone is a nice hotel in the french quarter. We stayed recently and found the Royal Street location close to everything in the quarter which was convenient. The traditional king room was nice but a little small and there was virtually no counter space in the bathroom. Also, the bathroom outlet did not work. Although we spent most of our time sightseeing and enjoying New Orleans, we would have liked a comprehensive cable package and free wi-fi in the room. Found the carousel bar charming and the service was very good. We will probably stay in a similar hotel that offers free in room wi-fi on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and heritage in prime FQ location...”
Reviews.Author: radiowitch
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monteleone twice in the last seven months, with the last being over Christmas of 2011. I was pleased on both occasions with the quality and cleanliness of the rooms, and the attentiveness of the staff. I am a huge fan of the Carousel Bar that is located near the main entrance. It is often difficult to find a seat in there, but when you do, it's worth it. The location of this hotel is convenient to most FQ attractions/restaurants/sites, and you feel appreciated when you stay here. I concur with other posters who noted the beauty of the main lobby, which is particularly glorious over the holidays. My only complaint is that the hotel's gift shop is rarely open/attended. When you're in a hurry and need a postage stamp or something small, having this as a resource is valuable. Waiting around for someone to open the locked door (when the hours of operation are posted but not honored) is frustrating, and most of the time, I abandoned my efforts and went elsewhere. Cost me some time. But I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates high quality and elegance in their accommodations and hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Old world elegance if a little past its prime”
Reviews.Author: Lina
Reviews.Content: Situated right on Royal at the Canal end of the Quarter, the Monteleone is in the thick of it. The doormen, reception and concierges were all extremely friendly, efficient and helpful. The main lobby is bustling and beautiful - decked out with chandeliers, comfortable seating areas and fabulous floral arrangements. Forewarned by reviews here, we ask for a quiet room on a high floor. Reception was very responsive and accommodated us with room 1447. Though our friends were in a much smaller room on the 15th floor (1538), we were very pleased with the size of our room. The marble bathrooms are on the small side with one sink, a tub with shower and a toilet on a strange angle. Were we to stay in the Quarter again (which we would not do) we would stay here. We do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A fine home base for exploring NOLA”
Reviews.Author: DCGuy1414
Reviews.Content: This is a charming, historic hotel with a ton of character. It's location is perfect--close to the action on Bourbon Street, but set a block away so you can avoid a lot of the noise and insanity when you're ready to head home for the night. My room was quite small, and looked out into an interior courtyard housing the A/C units, so that left something to be desired. But Being in New Orleans, you probably don't want to be spending too much time in your hotel room anyway. Overall, a good place to stay, with a strong sense of history.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel, great location, but can't quite cope with success”
Reviews.Author: AssimilatedCajun
Reviews.Content: I love the Monteleone because it's where my grandparents used to stay when they would take the train from Lafayette forty and fifty years ago. So I've stayed here myself many times over the years. (And, although the Sunset Limited now runs only three days a week, I still take it whenever I can.) The hotel had a major restoration a few years ago and came through it well: the public areas and the guest rooms still look like they are a hundred years old, but in a very good way. The bathrooms have basins of polished stone and the bedrooms have Audubon prints on the walls, and everything seems to work. But the Monteleone is a large hotel, and when it's full or nearly full -- as it often seems to be -- the staff seems overwhelmed, the lines can be long, and the lobby and restaurant/lounge can be so crowded as not to be very inviting. My last stay happened to be on one of the many spring weekends when there is a lot going on in New Orleans. In this case it was the national college basketball championship tournament, but sometimes it's just a major conference or two. The hotels fill up and so do the streets in the French Quarter, until very late. My room was on a high floor but it faced Royal Street, which meant it was only a block from Bourbon street. There was a lots of street noise until quite late, and this was compounded by the occasional drunken revelers who walked past my room at 2 a.m., apparently on their way to an after-party in a room down the hall. And I didn't even try to go in to the Carousel Lounge for a drink or a snack. (The good news is that Arnaud's Jazz Bistro, only a block away, wasn't too crowded. It's a great place for a light supper and a glass of wine.) I'll always love the Monteleone, but next time I'll try to stay at a quieter time (a Wednesday night in July?) and get a quieter room, preferably facing away from Royal. These rooms also tend to have better views, since they face in the direction of the Mississippi River which is only a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, a few blips”
Reviews.Author: EllenDelller
Reviews.Content: The building is beautiful and could not be better situated in the midst of the French Quarter on the relatively calm Royal Street. Despite the hustle & bustle outside, the room was very quiet and we only heard neighbors once when they were having a mercifully brief party. The rooftop pool is lovely and the exercise room small but adequate. However, at the high price, I would expect more bathroom counter space (there's practically none) and something other than styrofoam cups and plastic coffee maker. The bathrobes are a nice touch, but the towels are thin. The concierge was not available enough, and the desk staff-although very polite--were clueless about what must be FAQ's about trolley cars, directions, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a central location with a lovely pool”
Reviews.Author: PikoVancouver
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monteleone is a grand hotel in the heart of the French Quarter. The preferred double double we stayed in was spacious and lovely. We had plenty of room to unpack in, and the bathroom was large enough for the 3 of us (two adults and a 13 year-old son). We highly recommend signing up for I Prefer, since doing that gives you free internet access, which is otherwise $10 a day. Breakfast is not included, and there are several good places nearby: Jimmy J's and Camellia Grille. While the rooftop pool is small, it is warm and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel but make sure YOUR needs are Met”
Reviews.Author: CardinalsLady
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - very clean, great service, wonderful location, and the Carousel Lounge is terrific. My only complaint is that when we checked in, we were told there were no King rooms available - and my reservation had been confirmed two months earlier. We agreed to a double the first night but asked to be moved the next day. It took THREE room changes before they put us in a King. If they confirm a specific type of room, they should deliver. As I said, I was finally satisfied but it took persistence and should not have been an issue in the first place. (Seriously? Three different rooms and they couldn't tell these were doubles and not a king?) Otherwise, once you get the room you want, you'll love your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: moodles33
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monteleone for a conference and had a great time. Perfect location, friendly and helpful staff, amazing rooftop pool. Only downside was that the rooms were a little small and seemed a bit dated - but it is an old historic building and that's part of its character. Overall, I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: TravelFoodDreams
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights and had a great experience. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms were very clean. The service was wonderful. The only reason I gave it 4 out of 5 starts is that our room smelled of smoke. It really bothered my kids but once in the room after a minute I didn't smell it anymore. The beds weren't queen but full so for my hubby and I it was a little tight but hey, I didn't really mind that all that much...lol I would recommend this hotel. I am sure if I would have asked for a room change they would have, but in New Orleans, there is way to much to do and see and we spend all day out anyway. I love historic hotels, and the ghost stories too...ask the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Has to be the best hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Gilles D
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Monteleone... Both on business. This hotel is THE historical hotel in New Orleans, staff polite, very clean rooms, service impecabble. If I ever have to stay in NO (I intend to) on business, pleasure, with or without my family, this is the place I'd choose.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: budgetgirl85
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a New Orleans gem, and we only live 10 minutes from the city. We booked 2 nights here for my wedding weekend as well as offered a hotel block for our guests. We booked a Vieux Carre suite, which was spacious enough for myself and 5 others to hang out and get ready on the day of my wedding. We also spent time at the bar the night before and had a great time dancing to the live music and catching up with out of town guests! We had a slight issue with the air conditioner the day of the wedding. The hotel upgraded us to the Ernest Hemingway suite Saturday night to solve our problem! Such a nice gesture and that was an amazing suite! {Too bad we won't be able to afford it for our anniversary visits ;) } Rooms facing Bourbon can hear the street noise, but it is tolerable. Overall a great hotel, can't wait to visit at least once a year for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel007
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for a few days this month and absolutely loved it. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The rooms are beautifully decorated. There is no free wi fi, but you can sign up for a fee. There is a coffee shop around the corner that offers free wi fi that is an option. The rooftop pool is lovely and the pool is heated. The location is superb, one block away from Canal St. and Bourbon St. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “First Class All The Way!”
Reviews.Author: dschlich
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Hotel Monteleone February 25-28, 2012, as a three night add-on to the end of our RCCL cruise. We were able to book a standard king room for the military/government rate which is a significant discount over the regular price, our room number was 953. I did some research before our trip and found that if I signed up for their free rewards program called â€œI Preferâ€� we could use their Wi-Fi internet (which is normally $9.95 per day for basic and $15.95 per day for high-speed) at no charge. They have a special luggage storage room where we were able to store our luggage until our room was ready. The room is locked and we were given a claim ticket. We walked around the French Quarter including Bourbon Street where the party was already (or still) in full swing. Bourbon Street was loud and obnoxious and I was grateful we were booked at the Hotel Monteleone which is located on Royal Street. Mid-afternoon we wandered back to Hotel Monteleone. Check-in was quick and easy, everyone we encountered was very friendly and helpful. Because the hotelâ€™s restaurant is being renovated, the front desk agent offered us two free drink coupons for the Carousel Bar which was a really nice gesture on the hotelâ€™s part. I pointed out that we belonged to the â€œI Preferâ€� rewards program and she said we could sign into Wi-Fi and all I need do is come to the front desk on the day of check-out and they would remove the Wi-Fi charges from our bill, which they did with no problem. I asked which Wi-Fi speed it covered and I was surprised and pleased when she said high-speed. The Monteleoneâ€™s lobby is grand complete with marble floors and chandeliers. It looks exactly as the pictures on their website indicate. We headed to our room and were pleased to see a fairly large room with a king sized bed, a table, two nightstands and a large TV cabinet/armoire that included two separate closets and four drawers. The bathroom was nicely appointed and very clean. Housekeeping did a thorough job cleaning and detailing our room each day. We had plenty of towels and when I called the front desk for another blanket it was promptly delivered. Our room was dark and quiet at night and the bed was very comfortable. We used the fitness center every morning. All the machines worked great and they provided towels and water, they even had a bowl of apples and oranges for their guests to take. We ordered room service on two of the nights. It took about 45 minutes to arrive and it was hot and tasty. One evening we took our two drink coupons and wandered down to the Carousel Bar. This bar is round like a Carousel and it slowly rotates so you have an ever changing view. Be warned though, the drinks are $12 a piece, I was grateful for our drink coupons. Check-out was fast and efficient and as I said earlier, they refunded our Wi-Fi charges without any question. All in all we had a wonderful time at Hotel Monteleone. We found it to be first class all the way and I highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a high quality hotel in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pertzsch
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are small let me say I enjoyed this hotel and the staff. Very nice people, especially the garage attendants. It is close to some very good restaurants and cafes. One we really liked was about 2 short blocks away. I would recommend eating at the Fleur de lys. Quieter then Bourbon St. Didn't like the lack of ANY free Wifi. You had to pay for all, even in the lobby or business center. A little hard to print off boarding passes. Breakfast buffet was very good and not that expensive. I would go back if I ever go back to New Orleans, which isn't any time soon as I just did not like the city or the area. Was disappointed in Bourbon St. Seems to be just a tourist trap and the first two blocks are one stripper bar after another. Some are just sleezy.

Reviews.Title: “Monteleone's charm & location”
Reviews.Author: happytillie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for the past 30 years. The charm of this hotel is outstanding and gives you a true feeling of what the French Quarter is about. The location of this hotel is perfect if you want to focus your stay on the French Quarter. Walk out the front door of this hotel and you can wander the quarter all day and night. Great if you want to drop off all your shopping bags and head back out for more. Rooms can be small so when making reservations and staying in a standard 2 queen bed room, ask them for a larger room. There is a different in the size of their rooms. They used to have wonderful weekend rates and perfect for a family experiencing New Orleans but they seem to charge higher prices which now excludes families on a semi-budget due to the recession. Parking is outragous and for a hotel to still charge for wi-fi is crazy. It feels more like gouging then building a return and faithful following like they used to.. I grew up visiting New Orleans and this hotel was the only place my mother would stay during 30 years of staying at the Monteleone. Our last stay was August 2011 & when I went to make the reservations, I had to check out other surrounding hotels and their prices. Keep in mind their room prices are expensive, sale tax is outragous and parking costs can make this hotel out of your price range. It's difficult for me ( and my family) to stay at another hotel due to our love for this hotel even with all the added expenses. As you walk into this hotel you feel the history in it but how much time do you really spend in your room when visiting New Orleans? The hotel room does not match the glam of the main floor of the hotel. Call the hotel directly and see which ammenties they will offer you free, weekend prices or room upgrade. Go for out for breakfast and skip the pricey one in the hotel. The location is the best part of this hotel. Have fun....It's New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monteleone Ideal French Quarter Location”
Reviews.Author: katiebug123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Monteleone in New Orlean's French Quarter. The hotel presents a beatuiful appearance indicative of the time period it was originally built. We were with a rather large group and in the past check-in has been a slow process but not at the Monteleone. We had our room keys and waiting mail all under five minutes of our arrival. We stayed in a king bed room on the 8th floor. The room was clean and had all the necessities: coffee maker, refrigerator, blow dryer, flat screen TV and internet ($10 a day charge). The bed takes up the majority of the space but for two people there is plenty of room. The bath is small and the sink extends out quite a ways all of which I can ignore because there is an abundance of hot water and enough water pressure that the shower head actually has a decent spray (a pet peeve of mine). The staff was incredible! Any staff member we passed in the hall always greeted us with welcoming smiles. The service in the restaurant was fast and friendly especially in the morning when you need to get off to appointments. The doormen had a wealth of information, directions and stories to tell. The location of the Hotel Monteleone is unbeatable! Canal and Burbon streets are just short strolls as is the River Walk and casino. The banquet staff served over 200 people flawlessly and the food was delicious. The banquet menu is limited to two options; something they might consider expanding. Overall we very much enjoyed our stay and would return without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Visit to the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: John N
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Hotel Monteleone in New Orleans! This was our second visit to the city and our second stay at Monteleone. We enjoyed our view from the 15th floor. The hotel is old but much care is taken by its housekeeping and maintenance staff with regard to its upkeeping. The hotel is beautiful and a must when staying in the French Quarter. The carousel bar was recently renovated and is even more fun with live music! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to sleep at night”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelWithFam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Monteleone during the marathon weekend (from Friday night to Tuesday March 3rd to March 6th). The hotel was lovely and historic and in a wonderful walking location for sightseeing, but if you are like me and choose to sleep between the hours of 10 pm and 3 am, then you will not want to stay on the Bourbon Street side of the hotel. When I booked our room in early June (for a stay the next March), I specifically requested a room with less noise on a high floor and they said that they would try to accommodate me. However, both of our first two nights we heard loud bands playing and crowd noise from 10 pm to 3 am. This is not good if you are trying to get up early (like I was when running a big race). After two sleepless nights, we requested a room change and were granted one. Unfortunately, the hotel made us check out of our first room at 11:00 am and we were not granted a new room on the quiet side until 5:00 pm. This made napping or rest impossible after a night with no sleep. If you want to party all night, this is a great hotel. If you want to rest at night and have fun during the day, try somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Hazel132
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent business trip and found the hotel and location to be fantastic. The room was a bit small but charming. The bed was comfortable with soft, crisp linens. The building feels old but in a good way. All too often we stay in chain hotels that lack charm and character. This place has both. The location cannot be beat, right in the heart of the French Quarter. Bourbon street is around the corner, close enough if you want it but not in your face if you don't. A small, quaint coffee/lunch spot is a few doors down, Cafe Beignet. The guy at the counter promised that their beignets were much better than Cafe Du Monde's. After happily sampling both, I have to agree. The cafe au lait was excellent as well. At the center of the hotel is The Carousel Bar, a seemingly authentic revolving merry go round. It is a great place to meet for a drink. We had appetizers in the bar one afternoon which were surprisingly good. Also, as it was a corporate event dinner was on property. I was surprised at how good the food was. I was expecting the usual rubber chicken fare but it turned out to be very tasty. Breakfast was also quite good. There is a roof top pool which unfortunately I did not get a chance to use. The lounges looked like a nice place to unwind after a day of sight seeing. I came for business but would definitely return for pleasure given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of unauthorized charges”
Reviews.Author: CaribIbnBattuta
Reviews.Content: I pass through New Orleans often and in general have enjoyed sitting and having a sazerac at the Hotel Monteleone's Carosel Bar. My enjoyment changed dramatically, however, during a recent trip when, as per usual, I ordered a single drink, paid for it with my credit card and closed out the account. The total I was to be billed was $11.88, so imagine my surprise when I looked on my statement to find that the hotel was withholding two separate sums from two fraudulent transactions totaling $12.35 and $99.50. I called the hotel with the original receipt in front of me and after being passed from employee to employee was finally connected with the credit manager who told me that the discrepancy "should be taken care of" sometime in the next several days and that there was "nothing she could do about it." I said that I had been to the hotel many times before and that I closed out my card after a single drink to which she kept asking, as if brain-damaged, "did you close out your card?" All in all the staff were thoroughly unhelpful, adding to the impression of dishonesty in connection with the Hotel Monteleone this incident left me with. I will not be going back, and will instead spend my money at the far more convivial Columns Hotel on St. Charles Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do a corporate event at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melissa E
Reviews.Content: We had $300 worth of corporate shirts stolen from our meeting room. The guest services representative, Riccio, promised to 'look into' the incedent by reviewing camera footage from the 2 cameras stationed at the two entrances. Nothing was done. After returning home, I contacted the hotel to find out if there was any consequence to the theft and I was dismissed. It was our fault, I was told (this only after we had left the hotel. While still there, we were told that everything would be taken care of...) We had rented the meeting room for 2 and a half days and nothing was offered to compensate us. Also, my private room was left open by the maid (number 934) when the deadbolt was left extended, so upon returning to my room in the afternoon, I discovered that anyone could have walked in and helped themselves to my belongings. DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL FOR ANY EVENTS. Stay at the OMNI.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: CourtCH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monteleone for New Years Eve with my fiance and parents...we loved it! The hotel is very beautiful, historic and classy. The rooms are small, but didn't bother us as we only needed it for getting dressed and sleeping. The Carousel Bar is a lot of fun, the rooftop pool is heated in the winter and they have a fun little bar next to it, perfect for the summer. The River View Room is amazing at night..def worth a trip up there, we took some drinks and just sat looking out of the windows one night after our night on the town. The hotel is in the prefect location...you can easily walk to Bourbon St, Jackson Square, River Walk, Casino, Etc. Overall it is a fun & classy place to stay, I highly recommend for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Winter getaway with extended family”
Reviews.Author: Ann M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's first visit to New Orleans. A colleague, formerly from New Orleans, had highly recommended this hotel. If I could not get into this one, she had said to try Hotel Bienville. We were able to obtain a room. The price is a little high but the quality and location are supurb. The staff in the Carnival lounge could use a few helpful hints in being friendly and courteous. We were in there on 2 different occasions with 3 different wait staff and they were perfunctorily performing their duties. There was a musician at night who found a niche in an auditorium of sorts made out of a closed store's entryway just across the street. The sound seemed to billow up to our hotel room almost as if the window was open. When he decided to end for the evening, sleeping was a breeze. Given the location, good accommodations and doormen; I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Super customer service”
Reviews.Author: sowherearewegoing
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this beautiful classic French Quarter hotel January 31st to February 4th. While the rooms were fairly typical for a nice hotel, the overall ambiance of the hotel was great. But what really inspired me to write this review was the superb customer service I received from the concierge, Joey. We had traveled 30 miles outside the city limits with some friends to eat at a restaurant, where I inadvertently left my prescription glasses. With no rental car at hand, I wasn't certain how I would retrieve them. Joey called on my behalf, found a member of their staff who lived in his area, arranged to have the glasses brought home, and picked them up for me, delivering to me my glasses within 36 hours of my losing them! Now that's exceptional service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: SBlack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monteleone Feb 9 - 11 and found the staff excellent, the rooms clean, the Carousel Bar a great place to socialize, and the breakfast buffets delicious. The location is within walking distance for all major sights and events - Canal St., Bourbon St., the Casino and The River Walk, are easily accessible. There are 100's of fabulous restaurants in this area. I would advise any 1st time visitor's to take a city/county bus tour. Visiting NOLA a week before Mardi Gras still provides lots of sights as well as parades. This Hotel is the 'best' and NOLA is absolutely wonderful. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Gorgeous Oasis in the French Quarter!!!”
Reviews.Author: SalisburySaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days whilst visiting famiy in NOLA which also took in Mardi Gras. Where to start - the hotel is gorgeous, the staff were really friendly and helpful (with the exception of the concierge lady - I think she was German) and carried on smiling all the way through the chaos of Mardi Gras. We booked a room with a view of the Mississippi which meant we were at the back of the hotel which was lovely. Breafast is excellent value for money - we ate here a few times - and the Carousel bar is great fun - slightly more pricey but then you would expect that in a hotel of this calibre. Gym and pool were both great. The location is on Royal Street which is one back from Bourbon so you can avoid this completely if you want to!! Top tips for breakfast are Something Else Cafe (at the end of Exchange Alley), Daisy Dukes (they do refillable Bloody Marys) and Cafe Beignet which is just up the road. We also explored the Garden District and Magazine Street which are well worth a trip on the St Charles Streetcar. We can't recommend this hotel highly enough and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Location great but service poor”
Reviews.Author: luvtogo6
Reviews.Content: We travelled from the UK to experience Mardi Gras at this expensive hotel, worth the price we thought. Not so sadly. On the plus side, as Mardi Gras is madness so there must be allowances for that, but be aware that the party carries on late into the night. So the location is wonderful if you want to party, a short walk from the parades and river front. Worth walking to the river and eating there too; and walking further up Bourbon St for more bars. On the downside when we asked for more teabags for our room they seemed to not want to give us any, we cannot be the only Brits to visit and ask for tea. They then would not send milk, we had to go back to our room, call room service and wait for it to be delivered. This is not what we expected from this calibre hotel; we got better service in Holiday Inns elsewhere. I would not stay there again, too pricey, service not up to standard but the location is wonderful if you want to party - and they do party!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: flavere
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice recently. It is a very upscale older hotel that is perfectly located just a block off Bourbon St. in the French Quarter. Never worried about walking there and back even at night. Well appointed rooms and nice employees make for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: MartiniGirl717
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monteleone for 3 nights over Mardi Gras weekend. The location is 2nd to none. We've been to NOLA at least 10 times but never stayed in the French Quarter before this trip. That was a BIG MISTAKE. Everything worth seeing & doing during Mardi Gras was within walking distance of this hotel. The lobby is grand. The Carousel Bar was a lot of fun. The place was super clean. Rooms are on the small side, but this was not a problem. We upgraded to a higher level room, which gave us a magnificent view of the Mississippi. We will definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary513
Reviews.Content: My friends and I just came back from New Orleans after being there for a bachelorette party. It was Mardi Gras while we were there and this hotel was in the perfect location. When looking at it on the map we thought it was going to be far from the French Quarter but it was only about one or two blocks away. Everything was in walking didtance and we never even had to take a cab. Canal Street was down the block which is where the parades were. We were able to walk to the French Quarter and were glad that we were not staying right on Bourbon Street because the crowds were ridiculous. It was nice to have our hotel on a more calm block, which was actually pretty fun and busy also. The location was also perfect because we were able to walk back to the hotel for bathroom breaks since the location was so perfect. As for the hotel, the rooms were clean, people who worked there were extremely helpful, and I would definitely stay here again. It looked like one of the nicest hotels in New Orleans. I would positively recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever!!! Unsafe!!!”
Reviews.Author: jaime c
Reviews.Content: I woke up in the middle of the night by a couple trying to break into my room. I called down to the front desk for help. They sent the bell hop to investigate instead of security. I heard the bell hop ask the couple if he could help them. The couple said that they were friends of mine and they had left something in my room. I had no idea who this couple was and never met them. I could not belive it but the bell hop tryed to use his key to let them in my room. lucky for me that I had the latch lock on the door to stop them. I hurryed and called the front desk again to ask for security. I told the lady at the front desk to get rid of that couple that I didnt know them. This time they sent up the maintence man instead of security. He proceeded to use his tools to try and get into my room to let the couple in my room. I again called the front desk to complain. Finally someone told the staff to tell the couple to go so they all left but now I couldn't sleep now because I didnt trust the staff at the hotel for safety. I finally got up and had to packed my stuff up and checked out. I called the next day to complain but nobody at the hotel seem to care. I asked to speak to supervisor or the hotl manager or concierge but there never anyone there to talk to. I called several times and left several messages for someone to call me back and no one ever did. I figured out who the general manager was and left several messages with his secretary and even his voice mail but still never received a call. I would never ever recommend the Monteleone hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, but bring ear plugs!”
Reviews.Author: stemiliongirl
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to New Orleans for Mardi Gras and stayed at the Hotel Monteleone. I have stayed at this hotel in the past, but I do not remember the rooms being so small and noisy as they were this time. The noises had nothing to do with Mardi Gras, either; toilets flushing from above, babies crying across the hall, etc. As for the room size, my husband and I both have lean builds and it was near impossible to navigate between the small space at the end of the bed and the armoir. The rooms are long and linear at the Hotel Monteleone - maybe if the bed was re-oriented the space in the room could be better utilized. Otherwise, the location is fantastic and the Carousel Bar is worth a ride.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST STAFF IN NEW ORLEANS..”
Reviews.Author: dfuhrman
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay again I would recommend to anyone going to New Orleans!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras 2012”
Reviews.Author: Kevin S
Reviews.Content: Was here for Mardi Gras. Location is excellent. No free wifi - was $10 a day. When we booked there was supposed to be a free continental breakfast. When we got there it wasn't included anymore. We brought this to their attention and they said unless we have something on paper too bad. Although very nice, I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location; not to mention comfy!”
Reviews.Author: pennydaredevil
Reviews.Content: .......... or at least I thought this hotel was a perfect location because I was able to walk to so many different places (shops, restaurants, the French Quarter) without having to rent a car! The shuttle from the airport is so conveniant that renting a car would have Only meant more expense. Why? I would have had to pay for parking. Shuttles aren't for everyone but it was perfect for me. If you choose to stay at this hotel I don't think you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: la-rick
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Monteleone for Mardi Gras several times. We generally go to the city on Monday and leave on Wednesday so we don't have to try to get away on Fat Tuesday (which we did once to our regret). It's a great location, close enough to be able to get into the swing of the holiday but not right on top of insane revelry. I'm ready to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS MY OFFICIAL HOTEL!! BEYOND PERFECT FOR MARDI GRAS!”
Reviews.Author: Katrice383
Reviews.Content: My husband and friends chose this hotel for Mardi Gras based off TripAdvisor reviews.This was the perfect hotel ever! Staff was excellent. Our room was a little on the small side but perfect for the amount of people staying. The bed were really comfortable. The updated bathroom was small but the granite counters and floors for some reason just made it seem nicer. Bathroom was also very clean. We had no issues with the noise level. Breakfast was to die for! The original description made it seem as if the breakfast buffet was included.. surprisingly it was a whopping $18 bucks but we weren't really upset because the food and service was worth it. Location was fabulous!!!! Once again the location was FABULOUS!! The only down side was housekeeping was not fully operating due to Mardi Gras so no one ever came to clean our rooms so we had to clean ourselves. When we called to ask for a trash bag no one ever bought it up to us so we had to use our shopping bags. We plan to come back and hopefully the housekeeping will be better.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: workinggirl2
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite choice in the French Quarter. The hotel is easy walking distance to all of the French Quarter, Frenchmen Street, the street cars, etc. The standard room was small but clean. They will check your bags if you arrive early so you can start exploring as soon as you get to town. The Concierge was helpful and booked hard to get reservations. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly!”
Reviews.Author: rfmezzy
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was not part of a big national chain -- we wanted more of a local flavor but did not want a bed & breakfast (shudder). The location looked perfect and so we booked. When we arrived, emboldened by a colleague who told me she always asks for upgrades and it never hurts to ask, I asked! We were given the chance to upgrade to a much more expensive room for a discounted price (so more than our original room, less than it would have been had we booked it originally), and we took it. It was spectacular -- 2 room suite and best of all, 1.5 bathrooms! Jacuzzi tub, river view, very comfy and relaxing. Our 5 nights at the Hotel Monteleone were perfect. Without a doubt, the best location in NOLA -- everything we wanted to visit was walkable, the shops and galleries were interesting to see as we walked by, not too noisy like Bourbon Street, which was only one block over and really fun to visit but wouldn't want to stay there. The hotel restaurant (Carousel Bar) was undergoing repairs so we were given a complimentary continental breakfast each morning. We had delicious room service one night for dinner. I agree that no hotel should be charging for internet access in this day & age but that was a small thing and the rest of the experience was idyllic. STRONGLY recommended and we will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: Therese K
Reviews.Content: We got a room through Priceline for $150 per night and were very pleased. The central location is very convenient, without the noise and activity of Bourbon St. Per earlier TripAdvisor recommendations, we requested a quiet room on a high floor, with a view of the river. The room afforded a small view of the river and the white brick wall of the adjoining building. Still, I'd take it any day over a room over a noisy street. The room's king sized bed was very comfortable, with high quality linens. The room was very, very clean and for an older hotel, quite spacious. The front lobby is opulent, and the room are very traditional--heavy drapes,muted colors, etc. Given it's prime location and its quality, it was well worth the money. Concierge was readily available to give us suggestions on routes and activities. Cons: Wifi not complimentary, even in the business center

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Sea_Rah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Monteleone and had a wonderful experience. First class service and entertainment for the duration of my stay of 5 nights. Breakfast buffet was not included in the price, and was a tad expensive at ~22 taxes and tip incl. We ate there due to time contstraints and the conference we were attending was at the hotel. It was good but I would go elsewhere if the time allows, as we did the last day. Location is great, so close to bourbon street and all of the beautiful shops on Royal. The hotel is spotless. Rooms are smaller than average, but how much time will you really spend in your room while staying in the French Quarter? I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and large old style hotel”
Reviews.Author: wandw
Reviews.Content: The location could not be better. Staff are excellent - knowledgeable and helpful. Our room was tiny but updated and lovely. The Carousel Bar is one of those New Orleans things not to miss. The $10 for wifi is ridiculous as a previous commenter has said. You do get the feeling that they wanted to make sure they get every last nickel out of you. The location is close enough in the quarter to walk everywhere but not in the middle of all the hyper crazy touristy things. Royal street has wonderful shops too. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Dallas David
Reviews.Content: Here for Mardi Gras and you couldn't ask for a better location. One (crucial) block off Bourbon Street near Arnaud's and Brennan's. For the money the rooms are small but hey it is a 125 year old hotel so it is quaint rather than confining. The Carousel Bar off the lobby actually turns like a carousel and is always packed. Staff is nice and the place feels very safe-even during the craziness leading up to Fat Tuesday!

Reviews.Title: “Noise problem not resolved”
Reviews.Author: Rob B
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel. My stay - room 339 Feb 11- Feb 15. Two problems: 1) Less important - their rediculous Wifi charge of $10/day. Nobody charges for wifi anymore. 2) We unfortunately encountered very loud and continuous construction noise beginning at 7AM on Monday Feb 13. When we called the front desk, they offered to move us to another room. TOO LATE. While moving may have provided restful sleep for Monday and Tuesday night, it did not come close to providing restful sleep or making up for the night our sleep was disturbed - a night, I might add - that came at a substantial cost. Further explanation was that the restaurant work had to be completed that week so that it would be ready for Mardi Gras. l guess my stay was not as important. Anyway - major disappointment that no discount, or even a free drink for that matter, was offered. It would have meant a lot. Doormen were great. I do not think I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “An enourmous historic hotel in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: RealLilyBart
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in a more elegant area of the French Quarter devoted to antique shops and an historical mini-museum. The rooms are small and basic, but clean and updated. Expect a very long wait (over 20 minutes in line on all the days that I was there) for the elegant breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Bar, Great Location, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cavanburen
Reviews.Content: The Monteleone is a very clean and nice hotel in the heart of the French Quarter. Unfortunately during my stay, they were completing construction and the restaurant was not open. However, the Carousel Bar was and it is quite beautiful. The rooms are very basic and on the small side, but that is to be expected for a hotel of that age. I was here for a conference and the one day I had to sleep in was the day the construction crew needed to use the jackhammer at 8 AM. Other than that, everything else was "acceptable". The staff is very nice and, as mentioned, the rooms and overall hotel are very clean. This hotel is in a great location with almost everything you'll want to do within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras Weekend”
Reviews.Author: RumCajun
Reviews.Content: My wife and I brought 15 friends to New Orleans for the first time to experience the City and Mardi Gras. Having stayed at this property before, I knew it would be the perfect hotel for all there is to see and do in the French Quarter. Not to mention it's only a block away from the parades on Canal Street. Everyone in my party was completely impressed with the Hotel and their staff. The rooms have almost as much character as the employees. You never get a corporate or brand hotel feel, you know you're in a nice property. The Hotel's famous Carousel Bar is a great atmosphere for drinks, conversation and the live music is great. I would highly recommend the Hotel Monteleone for anyone looking to experience the French Quarter by walking around. This is a great hotel full of history.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: dmp96
Reviews.Content: Montelone is a wonderful place to stay. It is perfectly situated on Royal St. so you can grab the street car or head towards Frenchman St to catch great music. Our room was great and the service exceptional. I did recommend, however, that they should put bottled water in the rooms daily. Other than that, we plan on staying there on our next visit. And don't miss the Carousel. Very unique, great drinks and entertainment nightly.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite, will be back!”
Reviews.Author: aliceisacat
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days in NOLA for our wedding anniversary so we wanted someplace special. The Hotel Monteleone did not disappoint! Staff was very courteous and accommodating, gave us a terrific room with a view when they heard it was our anniversary. Room was clean and comfortable, housekeeping service was great. I like a hotel where you can count on housekeeping coming to tidy up the room at pretty much the same time every day. They were great, very efficient and friendly. The hotel itself is beautiful, has undergone a big renovation. We liked the historic building and modern amenities make all the difference when it comes to comfort. This Hotel got it exactly right. Would go back in a heartbeat. LOCATION CAN'T BE BEAT, you are literally steps away from the heart of the French Quarter, we were easily able to walk everywhere. TERRIFIC OVERALL, will absolutely be back!

Reviews.Title: “So convenient - has never disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mvanderford60
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. On Royal in the French Quarter and lots of parking. Not cheap, but optimizes both convenience and quiet. Easy walk to Arnaud's for dinner and antique shops. Always has lots or room, great service and has always been clean. Like to take a bottle of wine to the rooftop pool to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDawg78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a business conference which coincided with the very beginning of Mardi Gras. It's a perfect location for going to the parades and for quick forays to Bourbon Street. Also can easily walk around the French Quarter We were on the 11th floor and still had plenty of street noise especially Friday and Saturday nights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the Heart of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: soonerjen
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay at Hotel Monteleone. The Carousel Bar was unique and fun. We were in walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go, including Cafe du Monde for breakfast! The room was smaller than a typical chain room, but updated and very nice. The only complaint is how loud it was outside the hotel until very late hours. I would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer pampering”
Reviews.Author: Jan F
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Monteleone for a conference. From the minute I walked through the doors until I left, I felt like a pampered guest not just a customer. The food was extraordinary and service friendly and very attentive. (The gumbo must be tried!) I also ordered room service and found the same to be true. The room and bed were divine and plush. Bed of heaven comes to mind as a means to describe it. The location of the hotel is great - right in the French Quarter. You can easily walk out the door and find many fun things to do. The concierge had some really good suggestions for local restaurants. Another important factor to me is peace and quiet, which was in rich supply in the evenings when I wanted to wind down. Everything was top notch and what one would expect at a five star hotel. I never wanted to leave. I always try to rate exceptional service when I find it. This level of service, quality, and attention to detail are becoming more rare in our society today. This hotel knows what it is doing and richly deserves the kudos it receives. I will be back for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, New Orleans charm and PET friendly!!!!”
Reviews.Author: delfinazul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel for two nights (Wed-Thu) the 1st week in January, so the Quarter was not crazy which was a plus for us. I went to school in NOLA and wanted to get back there with my husband who had never been. I wanted a hotel in the Quarter which had the New Orleans charm but modern amenities, walking distance to everything but not on Bourbon St. and that would accept our dog Jack. The Monteleone met all of our requirements and exceeded our expectations. I followed another reviewer's tip to book thru iprefer to get an upgrade and free wifi which was really great cause we got fantastic treatment. We even got a welcome kit for Jack (a food dish with a placemat, a bone to eat and one to play with and baggies for you know what;). We've stayed in wonderful hotels with Jack all over the US and Europe, but never got this kind of kit. The room was just the right size with a King size bed (super comfortable), plasma TV and usual amenities. We were on the 14th floor without a view (well, not one to rave about since it was a brick wall), but we really didn't go to New Orleans to stay in our room so it was totally fine. Besides you can go to the rooftop for a great view of the city and a nice pool, gym area. The staff was extremely helpful, friendly and professional. We spent our first night at the Caroussel Bar and got tipsy even before our first drink (it moves slowly but you feel it). They had just remodeled the restaurant area in a modern yet classy style. Very nice! We never ate at the restaurant, so can't comment on that. Breakfast is $20 so we opted to go elsewhere and explore the wonderful Cajun cuisine. As far as prices, it's comparable to other hotels in the area (not cheap), but we felt that we got ours money's worth given the location and excellent service. Needless to say we loved everything about this hotel and the city. We'll definitely stay here again on our next visit to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great location amazing view”
Reviews.Author: CaseysCreoleKitchen
Reviews.Content: From the Carousel bar to the roof to pool and an amazing view you will not go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler185
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful!!! Dripping with old Southern charm and exquisitely maintained. The staff welcomes guests like family, and the rooms are gorgeous. The hotel's location is perhaps one of the best in town - walking distance to everything in the French Quarter, CBD, Treme, etc. I look forward to my next stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place, But watch your charges, THEY DO NOT RETURN CALLS”
Reviews.Author: MooreMusick
Reviews.Content: The first thing I will say is that the hotel is beautiful. My room was a small corner room which I loved and it was on the 11th floor. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I had breakfast there only one time, the reason is that it was almost $20.00 and the eggs were old and nasty, in fact, I couldn't eat them. So I had a choice of soggy potatoes, yogurt, fresh fruit, and the normal breakfast things. I was disappointed to say the least as I was looking forward to something more than a limited breakfast buffet. The real issues started when I asked the front desk person to charge my personal CC for my last night and leave the rest on my AMEX. When I checked out Laura (very nice person) assisted me and put 1 night on my personal cc and the rest on my AMEX. GREAT! Not really, I checked my account this AM only to find I had been charged over $900!!! I called accounting at the hotel and talked to Brittany who said to "just wait a couple of days and it will be refunded". I personally don't have a spare $900 laying around so I told her that was unacceptable and said I would call my bank. She said call my bank and then call her back and conference her in. When I tried that her phone went to voice mail. That was about 8 hours ago and I have still not heard back from her. VERY FRUSTRATING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KKH13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a nice street close to downtown, Bourbon St, the river and the stadium. My room looked at a wall, but it had a fridge and the bathroom was fine. The spa was very nice. Good workout room - small but enogh stuff and a great view. Breakfast buffet was very good, and while the restaurants weren't open for dinner you could get light snacks in the bar - very good and good people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Historic boutique property a block off Bourbon St.”
Reviews.Author: dfkcluv2travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 3 day business trip. The location is ideal for walking around, taking in the shops and galleries down Royal Street then going a block over for fun of Bourbon St. You are also a few minutes walk from the Central Business District. Also like that a Walgreen's is right across the street. The property itself is a warm, intimate, elegant your typical historic boutique hotel. Nice lobby although you have to drag your luggage up a few stairs, no way around it. Cool Carousel Bar in the front that was recently renovated and constantly is turning.
