Staff is very helpful and friendly, no problems there. Free 24 hour fitness center. Lots of treadmills, a few bikes & ellipticals and a handful of machines. Adequate for sure. Always like apples to take with you. Nice small rooftop pool area, I think it is heated. Meeting and banquet spaces are fine, perfect for a group under 50 or so. The basic rooms are small but fundamentally adequate, not unusual for an older property. I always love a large amount of bathroom counter space, but this did not have that. Weird that the morning I checked out the blow dryer had disappeared. Everything is clean and functions fine. I would stay here again and recommend as it was fairly priced, well located, clean and very functional.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful area, lovely lobby”
Reviews.Author: lauraleeNorthfield
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Monteleone in a preferred double/double room. Room size was fine, bathroom updated. Other room furnishings were traditional...perhaps a little worn, but acceptable. My only real complain about room were the beds. They were small doubles and they wobbled! I felt they weren't good at all. Rooms were clean. Our view was not good, but we got by. The lobby and carousel bar were wonderful...great entertainment and such a fun place to hang out. The location fantastic. So nice to be in the french quarter and in a clean, lovely and happening location. Lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monteleone”
Reviews.Author: adventureseeker321
Reviews.Content: The location is terrific. The Carousel bar is not to be missed. The staff friendly and superb. The hotel's renovations are magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but needs work in other areas”
Reviews.Author: rachel80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Monteleone for my husband's 40th birthday trip to New Orleans. We had a fantastic time overall, but I found The Monteleone to be lacking. The positive points were great location in the French Quarter, gorgeous building & wonderful bar. The Carousel Bar was fantastic as it is not only unique & beautiful, but attracts amazing singers every night. The negatives were that I consistently found the staff to be less than friendly & helpful, both on the phone prior to our trip & in person. Also, while I appreciate the old charm & aesthetic of New Orleans, I expect a hotel like this to offer clean & well kept rooms. Ours had dirty worn out carpet. We found hair ties on the floor right when we walked in, which tells me that the vacuuming job was not very thorough & the chair was beyond worn out with tears & cigarette burns. There were hairs (not ours) on our "fresh" sheets. I travel alot & know where/when to give & take, but this was a disappointment. I will definitely choose a different hotel when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: meterman2
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here while attending a conference. Stylish old hotel with very nicely decorated rooms, albeit very small in size. Enjoyed the peaceful pool area on the roof. Didn't eat or drink at the hotel. Was surprised how efficient the elevators were with only two elevators for my 15 story tower. Best of all was the location in the heart of the French Quarter. All and all, found the hotel to nicely fit my needs. The few flaws noticed here and there are kind of like fine scratches found on a nice piece of leater. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: BHdweller
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights for business and had a great experience. My room was a decent size and very clean, and the hotel was located in a great place to see the city (when not in meetings). I would stay there again for personal travel if I had the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Rockin' in comfort!”
Reviews.Author: LeftGoose
Reviews.Content: The Monteleone is center stage in New Orleans and wears the honor very well. Located in the middle of the French Quarter it could not be better positioned in this fantastic city. At 125 years old, the hotel is as famous as it is good. A recent renovation has brought the rooms and public spaces up to a very high quality, and the staff are equally good. Great value in a rockin' town.

Reviews.Title: “must return post renovations!”
Reviews.Author: nickijags
Reviews.Content: why did our room not have any windows?! it was like staying in a cave. the hotel is under construction so it doesn't seem far to review it now. the lobby was crowded. the service was average (no room service, concierge was always busy). BUT even in this state (and our horrible room), it is obvious this hotel has preserved the wonderful charm of it's history. the location is wonderful. the pool was lovely. the spa was clean and the technicians were friendly. i'd go back in a heartbeat. and request a room with a view. or at least a window!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: NVCBJ
Reviews.Content: Very good location; good service; famous bar. But our "standard" room was nothing special for the price paid. Well appointed, but on the fifth floor we only had a view of the brick wall and windows of another wing of the hotel. The king size bed had a mattress on which a movement on one side reverberated across to the other side. WiFi was an extra $10 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Pricy but worth it”
Reviews.Author: zgiant1
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful old hotel in a great location in the French Quarter. We booked a "Veiux Carre" suite, which had two rooms. The lobby is very nice. The Carousel Bar is something you have to see. We didn't have to deal with the staff very much, but I talked to the concierge and he was very helpful in giving me tips for the St. Charles streetcar, which is only two blocks away (exact fare only, $3 day pass) and finding live music away from the craziness of Bourbon Street (Frenchman Street). The room had high ceilings and cool old-fashioned drapes. This was the olny time I've been to NO, so I can't compare it to the other high-end hotels there, but I know it was pricy, but the location and ambiance made it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: stuey
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed one night before and one night after a cruise at this hotel. The room was lovely, the staff was very friendly and helpful and the location was great - just one block off Bourbon Street. We felt very safe there. Would definitely stay there again. We just loved New Orleans - weren't there long enough.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Weekend”
Reviews.Author: KateAptos_California
Reviews.Content: A friend from Baton Rouge arranged for a party of people from different states to stay here over the New Year's weekend. This is a charming, comfortable hotel in a great location in the French Quarter. We had a number of functions to attend and we walked to all of them. On New Year's Eve the Carousel Bar was reopened after a major remodel. Great space. Hotel is in the Register of historic hotels. It has a lovely large lobby, a feature which we enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Mariefla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monteleone during Christmas week. A beautiful hotel right in the middle of everything. Walking distance to everywhere in the French Quarter. Great lodging, wonderful festive lobby and a quiet place away from it all. I would definitely return. Reasonable and well kept and a perfect place to stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: azbellb
Reviews.Content: we have stayed here on many of our trips to new orleans, it is a wonderful hotel in a great location, within the french quarter, near all the site and great food

Reviews.Title: “I found my New Orleans hotel”
Reviews.Author: erriew
Reviews.Content: Whenever I come to NOLA I will be staying at the Hotel Moneteleone. On a recent stay at the hotel there was a problem with the reservations. Long story short, every single member of the hotel staff treated me with respect and as a true guest rather than a client. They trusted me to stay in the hotel until the problem was cleared with no stress or jumping through hoops. The hotel bar is excellent and the rooms are above average, but it is the people who make the hotel worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Guest045
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the end of December before our Christmas cruise. Overall we had great value for our money. This hotel is in the heart of the French Quarter. It is clean, nicely kept and has a excellent free breakfast. Washroom was a good size and was very clean. Room size was average size for New Orleans French Quarter. We had a lap top along and paid $10 dollars for 24 hours of wi fi. We booked our hotel thorugh Perfect Escapes - we got an excellent deal for $99 per night for 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “Classic New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: jackfu123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is classic New Orleans with modern touches while maintaining it's historic architecture. Fantastic location on Royal street along with the amazing carousel bar. This bar is unlike anything I've ever seen. We were there over the holidays so there was more of a family atmosphere. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: 875caroln
Reviews.Content: The location was great. The rooms was beautifully decorated but a little bit small, specially bathroom. The staff was friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: passy56
Reviews.Content: Had a preferred room on 15th fl. with view of Mississippi. View was nice. Room was tiny. I could deal with that. However a high end hotel should have plush, very nice towels, not the case they seemed to be at least 15 year old... same with sheets. Bedding should be top of the line, not a comforter but a duvet. Pillows were tiny and were all soft... no choice. A hotel of that reputation should have a very good coffee maker and excellent coffee. And please have china cups-- not paper cups. Those days all hotels have those amenities even holiday inns. Had breakfast in room (once only). Coffee pot was plastic! Milk (or cream) was in a ugly glass small server. When you stay in a high end hotel, you expect top of the line. This hotel gets away with bad quality everything. Location is not enough. On the night of Jan.13th, at 2:00 am, someone was trying to enter the room. I looked through the viewing hole and saw one man, I hit the door with fist and yelled to get away which he did quickly. Unfortunately I did not report it. Should have since I realized that the same week someone entered a room. Scary! There is a great choice of hotels in New Orleans, French quarter and close by. I absolutely do not recommend the Monteleone. Sorry, I am sure it was an excellent hotel once upon a time. This hotel needs to reevaluate itself.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about character”
Reviews.Author: kamitravel
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel and we loved it. This hotel is quite old, but in decent shape and of course , it has LOTS OF CHARACTER ! It is located in French quarter in walking distance to antique shops in royal street and the nasty Bourbon street! The hotel is far enough from Bourbon to be safe from the noise of all the party animals, meanwhile close enough just to walk one block to get to that place. great restaurants and attractions are all in walking distance. The hotel doesn't have parking and the valet will cost extra, which is understandable in French quarter. The moment you arrive in the lobby, the decorations of the roof and magnificent chandeliers are eye catching. The revolving bar is quite cool too. Our room was basic and on the smaller size. Carpet of the room and the lousy bed could see more TLC. Bathroom had granite countertop and was in a very good shape. Basic channels on the TV and the coffee maker were more than enough for us. In general our room and the furniture were dated but they were still in decent shape ( you really shouldn't stay in your room if you stay in French quarter ! ) . The roof top pool in quite nice, but the water was cold to get into. There was a business center on property and you had to swipe your card and pay to use the computers. I found this very greedy though ! Pros: hotel's character ( an old historic building ) , location ( great spot in French quarter ), revolving bar Cons: extra fee to use business center, cold pool ( all these cons still cannot convince me to drop a star from this gorgeous place ) I am so glad that I didn't reserve a hotel on Bourbon street , since it gets crazy noisy at night. I really liked this place for its 150 years of history. This may not be the case for you, especially if you are looking for ultimate luxury. ( In that case Ritz-carlton might be your best bet )

Reviews.Title: “Robber entered room while we slept â€“ hotel manager never contacted us about incident”
Reviews.Author: tashmc
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Monteleone January 7-10. We had two connecting rooms â€“1032 and 1033. Our party consisted of my husband, myself and our 3 young children. On the morning of January 10 we returned to our room at 12:15 am and entered and closed the room to our hotel room â€“ 1033. My husband stayed in the room with our boys in 1032 while my daughter and I were in 1033. We had the connecting doors open at all times. At 4:55 am I was awakened by what sounded like a door closing. I assumed that my family in 1032 was going to the bathroom. I rolled over and went back to sleep. Approximately 10 minutes later I woke up again and noticed that the bathroom light in my room had been turned on. Thinking that one of our children was sick I began to get up to check on them. At that time I noticed a man crawling on his stomach in our room toward my bed. The man appeared to be in his late twenties to thirty year of age. He was Caucasian with a shaved head and was wearing what looked like a black T-shirt with white design on it. This man was no more than 3 feet from me. He looked me directly in the eyes and then grabbed my purse which was lying against the wall closest to my bed. He hopped up and dashed out of our room and turned to his left towards the stairwell. I know this for sure because I ran after him to ensure that he would not harm my 5 year old daughter who was sleeping in room as well. When he turned the corner and entered the stairwell I ran back into the room to wake up my husband and call the front desk so that they could alert security. Within 10 minutes security found my large red purse in an opposite stairwell from the one that he fled to upon leaving our room. The only thing missing from my purse was cash. Hotel security as well as two New Orleans police officers came to our room so that we could file a police report. The hotel security was unable to find the robber even though we called them no more than one minute after the robber fled our room. I asked if they could review the security camera tapes and was told that this could not be done until a manager arrived. We were scheduled to leave the hotel at 7:00 a.m. and were told that we would be contacted by the hotel with information later that day. They NEVER called! Any contact that has been made about this incident has been initiated by me. Once arriving home I called to speak to the hotel manager, Stephen Caputo. I was told that he was busy and would call me once he was available to discuss the incident. He NEVER called! Instead Mr. Caputo delegated this responsibility to Bertilia Burton, Guest Services Manager. She called me later that day and told me that she would need to meet with their security company the next morning and review video camera footage to see if the could determine who broke into our room. She also proceeded to tell me that their computer entry showed that no one had entered our room with one of their keys after 12:15. I am certain that the door was shut. One of the police officers noticed that even though you closed that the door to 1033 the lock was not catching. You had to really push and slam the door in order for it to catch. The officer proceeded to pull the door from inside the room without turning the handle and it opened. I was told by Ms. Burton that she would contact me the following day with any information that they could gain from watching the security camera videos. At approximately 1:30 pm I contacted Ms. Burton to see if they were able to learn how the intruder gained access to our room. I was told that they could not find anyone in the vicinity of our room or hotel at the time that the intrusion occurred. My first question was â€œYou didnâ€™t see him in the stairwell carrying a large red purse.â€� Ms. Burton replied that there are NO SECURITY CAMERAS IN ANY STAIRWELLS. I was in shock. My response to her was, â€œSo you are telling me that our throats could have been slit by this intruder and you would have no security camera to help piece together a crime.â€� She said let me put you on hold. Ms. Burton then returned to the line and said that she had confirmed that there are no security cameras in any stairwells. Instead they have a security guard walk up the stairwells about every 30 minutes. No security cameras in stairwells after a MAJOR RENOVATION. I asked â€œWhere are the security cameras located?â€� I was told that she wasnâ€™t at liberty to say. Several things about this incident seem unusual. The robber/intruder knew exactly where to flee so that he wouldnâ€™t be caught on the camera. Also, we discovered a final checkout bill outside our door that didnâ€™t belong to us. The corner of the bill was a little mangled and it belonged to someone several floors up from us. I am curious to know who was putting out the final bills that morning. At one point after I told the security guard what the robber looked like he said that they have several people that would fit that description on different floors. Later he told me that he thought the robber fled an emergency exit. Yet the guest service manager told me that if he fled an emergency exit it would have set off an alarm. There are too many conflicting stories. They have an exact window of when this happened and they canâ€™t pinpoint anything about the crime. Lastly, why would the hotel manager, Stephen Caputo, feel that an in room robbery isnâ€™t important enough to contact the guest directly? Our family has not heard a word from him certainly not â€œI am sorry that this happened and we are doing what we can to keep our future guests safe.â€� I canâ€™t imagine what could have happened had I not awakened and startled the robber. He could have severely harmed me and my 5 year old daughter. She has been terrified at night since the incident â€“ shaking and teeth chattering because she is so scared that someone could enter our home like this man. I find myself jumping up when I hear any little noise during the night. I see the manâ€™s face over and over when I lay down to sleep. This complaint is not about the cash that was stolen. It is that the hotelâ€™s level of security is inadequate. I have stayed in many hotels across the country. Most hotels of this caliber you must show a key to get into the elevator. It was chaos in the hotel. The hotel bar is right beside two of the three sets of elevators. ANYONE could get into the elevator. There was no one checking guest keys before entering the elevator. The bar was packed with football fans who were in town for the BCS National Championship game. I would like to know if the hotel added extra security staff for the night due to the fact that this was such a huge event and they expected so many people inside the hotel bar. In my opinion they hotel is negligent in providing adequate guest safety. Knowing what I know now about the security of the hotel and the attitude of its management I feel that our story must to be told. Once others know about our experience perhaps management will decide to make changes to ensure better safety of future guests. Hopefully the Hotel Monteleone management will begin show cooperation, understanding, caring and follow-up to guestsâ€™ problems as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: one-celtic
Reviews.Content: We somehow got great prices on our rooms, below their average. Enjoyed the carosel bar, convenient to all the FQ and an easy walk to the Dome.

Reviews.Title: “Five Visits and Still the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: conniec63
Reviews.Content: My reviews look at the establishment as a whole - not whether or not I've ever had one negative situation with a member of the staff (which I have not) and there is just not one bad thing I can say about Hotel Monteleone. We have stayed there five times and each one brings the same positive experience. The ONLY negative things that have ever happened throughout five visits is once there was a "less than quick" bartender on the pooltop bar and once we had to change rooms two times on the same visit (smell of smoke and one of the rooms was not cleaned properly). Neither of these things are reasons to give less than five stars based on the entire experience Monteleone offers. It is a "classic" hotel in every sense of the word. The elegant foyer and check-in area and beautiful decor let you know you're in NOLA! From the get go - you are greeted by friendly doormen and desk clerks. Feel free to ask for a room upgrade - if they have them they will give them to you. Feel free to ask which way your room faces and don't hesitate to ask for a change if you find you're room is right over the air conditioners. They will do whatever they can to accommodate you. From there you'll find the concierge staff to he extrememly helpful, the bell people to be a blast to talk with and the carousel bar to be the best place to start you stay. During our last stay the first room they gave us smelled a little of cigarette smoke. I am a smoker - but not in my room and I don't like the smell when I'm sleeping. They immediately gave us a different room which disappointingly was incredibly small and not exceptionally clean. This being my fifth visit I knew this wasn't representative of what you usually get at the Monteleone. Upon talking with the front desk we were given a 2-room suite that made us never want to leave the hotel. There was no bickering - no attitude - nobody made us feel as if we were out of line for expecting something better than we got. It was apologized for and taken care of with professionalism and friendliness. Monteleone has multiple sections and you'll most often find you'll be walking up three stairs and down three stairs to get to your room. We sometimes get confused on which elevator to take to get to the pool - but you always find it. Pool is small - but you're in New Orleans. This isn't an all inclusive Jamaica trip. Ground space is a premium and pools on the roofs. In the summer pools are hot. It's 110 degrees there - so nobody should be surprised. The rooms are nice sized (again - remember you're in New Orleans - all rooms are somewhat small), beds are comfortable, sheets are clean and we're not afraid to walk barefoot in our rooms. Bathrooms are clean - nicely equipped - and if you need anything it's just a phone call away. Service is prompt and friendly. Tipping is appreciated - but not expected - and these people deserve it. We have truly NEVER had a negative feeling from any of them. Even when I've called to ask for four extra pillows at 3:00 a.m. But, again, remember.... these people work hard and leaving $5 or $10 on the bed is nothing compared to the luxury of knowing you will never run out of towels and will always have a stocked mini-fridge. Carousel bar is a great place to start with a good drink and conversation. You will never be bored and be sure to ask the bartender how long it takes for the carousel to make one complete spin. Drinks are good - prices are reasonable. Location is perfect for everything. Walking distance to anything you could want to do. Close enough to the action - but far enough to be in the quiet area. There is no noise and not a lot of annoying street activity. We're all about having fun in NOLA but when we want to relax and/or sleep - we want quiet, clean and calm. While there be sure to eat at Coops, drink at the Chart Room (BEST place to people watch) and if you want an outstanding upscale dinner make reservations at BonTon. All these places are off the beaten path and not the "typical" NOLA haunts. Classic - well worth the time - and gets you away from the tourist feeling of Bourbon Street and Brennan's (which are great places - but everyone needs a break once in a while :) Also, be sure to take the trolley ($5 for an all day pass) and ride - get off - ride as often as you like to stop at various places and see the beautiful homes of NOLA. MUSTS: (I know a few are repeats) - Coops - AWESOME fried chicken - Johnny's Po' Boy (the best sandwiches and mufalettas (yes - better than Napolean House) go there for breakfast and start your day with a good base - Tour the Garden District via Trolley - Look for a street wedding - Bon Ton for an expensive - but wonderful meal (lunch is the best time to go) - Chart Room (best people watching - great bartenders - wonderful drinks) I know everyone has to do Acme, Brennan's, etc. once - but those truly aren't places you have to go to "feel" New Orleans. And - you definitely don't need a $12 Hurricane from Pat O'Brien's. O'Brien's has a beautiful outside garden - but staff is a bit arrogant and they definitely aren't in it for the "service".

Reviews.Title: “Not happy”
Reviews.Author: Gordosmum
Reviews.Content: Won an auction for this hotel on Skyauction but was told it was not available on the dates I wanted even though the hotel's own site says rooms are available.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel still has charm”
Reviews.Author: a_dreamrers_night
Reviews.Content: We originally stayed in early November just for a day before we left on a cruise. They were doing renovations outside the hotel which we knew ahead of time that was going to be happening. We were given a key to a room on the fifth floor but were having problems opening the room. Couldve been user error but I went to the front desk and they changed rooms to a room on the third floor, door was still kind of tricky but I got it this time. The whole hotel was wonderful. Room was clean, a lovely pool on the rooftop (even though they only had one or two elevators that headed to the rooftop so it was kind of hard to figure out which one did). The continental breakfast was nice. We were allowed to leave our luggage there the day we checked out before the cruise left so we didn't have to drag them around NO. A little weirdness (and maybe just part of a charm of an old hotel) was the stairs in the hallway of our room just made it a little difficult to navigate the luggage. The hallway looked like one of the hallways from a scary movie just waiting for two little ghost girls to pop out ;-) The location is great. It wasn't close at all if your taking a cruise out of NO. You need a taxi. But we were in the heart of the French Quarter. Good food. A taste of Bourbon St. without all of the fuss and lots of good shops. All in all I would stay here 100%. Just wish we did stay here the day we got back from the cruise.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE! "What exactly do you expect me to do about it"”
Reviews.Author: Basma B
Reviews.Content: Mad as hell at the belligerent attitude of the receptionist who, frankly, should be immediately removed. Her attitude is entirely unsuitable for working at a hotel front desk. We booked after reading the reviews. MISTAKE. We build hotels and we spend 200 days in hotels every year. The fiasco began with a telephone booking when driving down to N O, we were stopping in the historic inns of the south. At making the reservations, the reservation lady was at best half hearted in making the booking, not at all helpful and she would not even divulge what kind of room we booked, every time i asked I would be quoted the rate, never the kind of room.We asked for an upgrade on arrival as a note on the booking as this is standard for us as we spend 200 nights in hotels every year.We never received a confirmation and the note on the booking never showed up on the booking. Upon arrival we found that our request on the reservation had not even been noted, and the receptionist was very dismissive and supercilious. After a brief word with the reception manager, we were allocated a preferred room 1482 Having completed the process we were then informed that all the restaurants were closed but for breakfast. That should have been made clear at time of booking.When I asked why that had not been made clear the receptionist was very very belligerent. She pointed that that have been mentioned in the email confirmation,you know, the one we had never received.She raised her voice with "what exactly do you expect to do about it?". Not acceptable at all. The bell captain Sergei was the only pleasant character in the whole hotel.are Beware of room service extra charges.$ 2.25 PER PERSON delivery charge, presumably you can have room service without having it delivered.On top of that an obligatory gratuity of 20% plus sales tax of 9.75%. Very mean hotel. The lobby is small and not at all as it appears in the pictures.The chair covers are shabby.Tired and run down.The rooms are very small, but clean. The carpet could have used a good deep clean.The television cabinet was falling apart.The internet connection is not free but at 9.95 for a standard connexion or 15.95 for an enhanced connexion. The difference between the 2 is not mentioned anywhere.This is at a time that even a McDonald's will give free wi-fi.Please just include it in the room rate please, it's an embarrassment. What ticks me is that a cheap Holiday Inn can afford to give away free wi-fi and cheap or free parking (30 USD here, which of course was not mentioned) Surly staff, haphazard, overrated.

Reviews.Title: “The Real New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Renee H
Reviews.Content: My husband, a 4th generation New Orleanean, refers to the Monteleone as "the real New Orleans, baby." Its location on Royal Street, one of the world's great shopping and strolling streets, can't be beat: one block from Bourbon but you're surrounded by antique stores and cute little shops, not noisy bars. (There are some nice hotels on Bourbon - but if you face Bourbon you had better be able to handle a high decibel level if you want to sleep). We were at the Monteleone for Christmas with my family and had 3 rooms. I didn't have to ask, they put us close together on the same floor. The housekeepers were wonderful: after 2 days of telling them "no, we don't need a thing," I got a call at 8 at night, making sure we didn't need anything. The wait staff at breakfast remembered us the 2d morning. Even though the Carousel Bar (a NOLA institution - the locals still go there, which is not true of many places in the French Quarter) was mobbed with holiday crowds, we always got served quickly and efficiently. I'm thinking Christmas at the Monteleone may become a family tradition !!

Reviews.Title: “joan & chuck”
Reviews.Author: Happy60373
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Monteleone was extraordinary. It is a "world class" hotel with true New Orleans flavor, ambiance, and elegance. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in New Orleans. The location is absolutely perfect! The 4th generation, family-owned hotel is within walking distance to everything you would want to see when visiting the French Quarter. We had a beautiful view of the Mississippi River from our 11th floor hotel room. Staying at the Hotel Monteleone made our trip to New Orleans "extra-special" and so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A great historic hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: 65Wagonaire
Reviews.Content: For my first visit to New Orleans we chose this historic hotel in the French Quarter a block off Bourbon Street, and it was a great all around experience. We like historic hotels so we didn't mind the smaller rooms and the slowl elevators. The hotel was busy because it was Christmas, and there were some renovations taking place that we never saw but caused the hotel to include a free breakfast with the room which was a nice surprise. Our room was very comfortable and the staff friendly and helpful. It had all the ambience of the French Quarter I wanted for my first trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hambonez
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here. It was close to everything by walking, right in the middle of the French Quarter on Royal St. Lots of shopping and restaurants available close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: 1967grad
Reviews.Content: One of my sons, his wife, children and I traveled to New Orleans during Spring Break in March 2011. My son was attending a conference & while he was busy listening to speakers, his wife, children and I shopped the streets of New Orleans. On the first day, we visited the Audubon Aquarium of America--it was awesome! My 3 granddaughters loved watching the fish swim around in their glass homes! After leaving the aquarium we rode the trolley and enjoyed beignets and hot chocolate at Cafe Dumonde. Be prepared to wait when you visit this cafe--so many people want to sample their yummy food. We visited many art galleries and dined at some of New Orleans' best restaurants--many in the French Quarter. The Hotel Monteleone is a landmark and nice people are happy to help you in anyway. This hotel will definitely be on my list next time I visit New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “This IS the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: ilovelowly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel. It's an original, in the most original city I've ever been. The room, while small, is charming and spotlessly clean. The bathroom is pretty tight, but modern and attractive, with quite a large tub, perfect for soaking away a long day or getting ready for a night on the town. Room service food was decent, and reasonably priced. You can't beat the location, and it's easy to find....the huge sign guides you back from the reaches of the Quarter. The whole place is steeped in history, and staff is great. I would definately come back to the Hotel Monteleone!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with a wonderful, friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sheryljean
Reviews.Content: My two girlfriends try to go somewhere fun every year. This past October we met in New Orleans at the Hotel Monteleone. We lucked out with a lovely suite. Since the hotels two restaurants were closed for renovation, the hotel offered a wonderful expanded continental breakfast in a lovely dining room. The concierges and the doormen were so helpful with suggestions for restaurants, shopping, directions, etc. New Orleans is a fascinating and fun city.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Hotel Monteleone on Royal Street”
Reviews.Author: Bob L
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable hotel in a magic part of the world. New Orleans. Best most relaxing vacation. Ever. Historical and interesting. Would recommend to a friend. Go there. Stay at this awesome hotel. Just do it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sharon214
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December 2011 and thought it was a beautiful place. The lobby was decorated for the holidays, the Carousel Loung was great although we only got to sit at the bar once it was always packed. The room was small but how much do you really need when you are traveling with two people. I thought the bed was great and the pillows, oh the pillows were so comfy. Location was great and we enjoyed the French Quarter. This was our first trip to New Orleans and would have no problem staying at Hotel Monteleone again!

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans must stay”
Reviews.Author: TMacKnox
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite hotel experience in New Orleans so we try to stay here every year for our anniversary. Luckily it falls during the Christmas holiday so we take advantage of their Papa Noel special of $99/night. They also accept any size dog (even 75lbs) and have bowls, treats, bags and toy ready in the room. They are currently renovating all of their restaurants so they offered a free continental breakfast each morning to compensate. The location is unbeatable! The service is of the utmost! The classic architecture sets you back in time. The Carousel Bar in the lobby is always a fun time. The only negative was how long it took to get our car from their valet. Understandably, it was during their busiest holiday time. Until next year, take care my Monteleone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand the hype - small and noisey”
Reviews.Author: fnr2001
Reviews.Content: Based on all the glowing tripadvisor reviews (ranked #9 in New Orleans??) and the not-exactly-modest rate, I had much higher expectations for this hotel. This hotel plugs itself, both on its web site and in its pricing as being something of a luxury hotel. It is not. The rooms are atrociously small. I had a feeling they would be based on the fine print on the web site, but the double (not queen) beds crammed with minimal closet spaces and a teeny tiny bathroom made staying in the room to pass time undesirable. The towels/bedding and other such amenities were average at best, as was the staff. No one was rude, but no one was out-of-their way friendly or helpful either. Don't get me started on the noise - NOTHING is soundproof in the hotel. I was on a high floor away from the street and could hear all the street noise from Bourbon, everything in the hallways, and even the people in the room next door to me laughing and conversing. The bathroom is not soundproof either. Speaking of, on the last night, some friends a couple rooms down the hall had all the lights go out in their bathroom, and the hotel did nothing to accommodate. The lobby was chaotic, though my trip was during a holiday weekend, so that is somewhat understandable. I know people rave about the location, but let's be honest, all the major French Quarter hotels are about a 5 minute walk from each other. I kick myself for succumbing to peer pressure and not paying the $60 more a night to stay in the spacious, luxurious Ritz Carlton or Windsor Court rooms, or substantially less to stay in the Omni, JW Marriott or Sheraton, which I cannot imagine to be any less average than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe it's just not my style?”
Reviews.Author: amm9179
Reviews.Content: First off, let me start by saying that the Carrosel Bar in the lobby is a must see. Even if you aren't staying at the Hotel Monteleone, I would check this out. The whole bar rotates like a carrosel. I travel to New Orleans often since it's only 2-1/2 hours away from where I live. We often take weekend trips or mini vacations there for weddings, parties, sporting events, & even work. I've stayed at several hotels all over the city. Hotel Monteleone was a little too over the top for my taste. However, if you are traveling to New Orleans for the first time & are looking for a great experience, this would be a great place to start. It has tons of charm & the staff is well above average, they are great. I just prefer a little more modern hotel. The price is a little high just for a weekend trip for me, but if I didn't live so close, I would gladly pay this price to have a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but small rooms, noisey!”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveler0625
Reviews.Content: Just returned from celebrating New Year's Eve in NOLa, chose the Monteleone based on location and price. Pros: great hotel bar, live music on the last night, accomodating staff, walkable to everything. Cons: rooms are small (only comfortable for 2 people), windows let in all the sound from the street outside, walls are pretty thin and you can hear everything.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: JeanSju
Reviews.Content: While the location is excellent, almost every hotel in the quarter is walking distance to everything, the staff is friendly and the rooms clean, the Montelone is certaintly not a 4 star hotel. When travelling, especially at $300.00 per night, you expect 1. nice towels - not here - tiny flimsy, 2. a hair dryer in the room - there was none, 3. decent shampoo, soaps, etc - here they are some off brand that dry out your skin and hair, 4. good pillows - no, just flimsy feathers 5. nice decor - while I understand this is a historic hotel the rooms were decorated in the 1980's I don't know what history that would be. We made our reservation through AmEx - which I thought would help, no, in fact the front desk seemed upset we used them and said they only way to get a room we want is to book direct (not good business if you ask me since I am sure AmEx is good to them). We were given a room with 2 double beds (there is room for 2 queens which I would suggest the hotel switch to) but since it was a holiday no king rooms were available - uncomfortable. We NOLA at least once a year and won't go back here.

Reviews.Title: “thieves among them”
Reviews.Author: Tammy B
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent Friday December 30, 2011 at the Hotel Monteleone. It is a very expensive place to stay, the rate for that night was $219.00. We checked out the next day and drove home. When I got home, at 4pm and unpacked I noticed that I didn't have the clothes that I had place in the dresser at the hotel, which was a pair of Miss Me jeans(that cost $100) and a sweater that still had the tags on it. My husband immediately called the hotel to see if they could locate these items and after several phone calls they could not locate them. To me this is unacceptable. With that quick of a call they should have been able to locate the clothes. If the room was cleaned properly the house keeper should have found them and turned them in. If she didn't find them they should have still been where I left them and at 4pm a new guest was probably not even checked into that room yet. So I believe there are thieves among them. Someone got a nice new outfit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: truthFULLUsa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business. The Lobby is beautiful. The room are standard and mines was clean. This is a good hotel for price and location! I hear the place is haunted, but I'd didn't see any ghosts :)

Reviews.Title: “Among the best Hotels I've ever Stayedm but did not like the area much”
Reviews.Author: blah114
Reviews.Content: Great location overall. I prefer, for tourists, to stay in the Marigny/Esplanade area.. that's just me. This hotel is world/top class. There were problems: noise inside the hotel was inexcusable at times, but we moved rooms to the 14th floor and it was quiet. The elevators here are a pain as well because you must (currently) exit on floor 8 up/down, catch a DIFFERENT set of elevators to go to/from the upper floors. This was due to the construction going on in the lobby, which made its backside elevators out of order. It happens, but around NYE week, there were times we waited 15 minutes on floor 11 for an elevator. The hotel has character, class, and charm. If you get a room, I suggest going to floor 14 because otherwise it could get quite loud (kids--like 4 yrs and under playing football in the hallways--for this I blame the idiotic parents, not the hotel). Also get a room, please, with a strong blower to make noise. Our first room on floor 11 had a smaller bathroom than 14's.. and its thermostat was useless.. you could not adjust the temperature nor the strength of the blower in a meaningful way (the room was freezing, actually, no matter what setting we used). Once we moved to 14 (after the kids nextdoor began wrestling and jumping off their beds, we think), our stay was amazing. Our floor 14 room had a larger bathroom than our previous room, strong AC/furnace blower, and adjustable thermostat that actually worked(!). Both rooms were "preferred" rooms. Both rooms had saggy mattresses, and I'll never understand how a hotel like this has such horrible mattresses, yet invests a fortune into Speakman showerheads. All aside, the hotel's breakfast was great, efficient, and quick, despite the hotel being sold-out. The Carousel bar looked nice, but was way too crowded to bother with; since this is a tourist attraction a lot of people at the bar don't appear to stay at the hotel (we watched them in the bar talking about what hotels they were staying at). The doorman provided great dining advice. I would choose to stay elsewhere next time because this hotel , in my opinion, begins the "shady area.." past this hotel towards the trolley, we saw a lot of fighting and crack/drug/homeless people. These people were not unfriendly, but continually asked for money. We're talking about 1 block past the hotel, making a left out of the hotel's entrance (passing Mr B's Restaurant). Outside the hotel, we were continually accosted for "a dollar" and it got really old--a few people were really insistent and got in our faces. We've been to new orleans many times and much prefer the area by the French MArket (outdoors) because it's residential--bad things happen anywhere, or can. We saw a woman get run over by a bike, literally, as the rider was cycling away from a crime he'd just commited on a sidewalk. He had a knife, showed it, and had stolen a guy's cell phone. The woman was okay, but the guy riding the bike had no remorse and pulled a knife on the guy whose phone he'd just stolen. This was 1 block down from the hotel, maybe less, outside a Walgreens which had a rentacop apparently picking his nose during all of this. So be careful if you're staying here. Seriously. We saw another guy passed out on the sidewalk 1 block from the hotel outside Felix's. We were unsure if he was dead, honestly, but he appeared homeless and high--everyone walked around him as it was a common everynight deal. If you go towards the French Quarter from the hotel, you won't see this type of stuff, likely. It is highly unlikely we'd stay here again, but that's not to say the hotel's not beautiful. Noise happens. Crime happens. This hotel, despite what people on this site will claim, is sort of on the border of where bad things happen in the area. We know a couple who's lived in the Marigny for 7 years and they warned us about staying in this area. It's not that dangerous.. but it's not necessarily safe, either and I've visited some very dangerous areas around the world (NOLA pales compared to most of them). Nice toiletries, peaceful once we moved to floor 14. Loads of ice available at ICE STATIONS, complimentary buffet breakfast daily (juices, cereal, bagels, yogurts, fruit, no eggs, pancakes, bacon, or anything hot/cooked, and that's ok for us). Wonderful shower pressure. Great doormen outside 24x7. Ornate lobby. Carousel bar is on the lobby floor, not the top of the hotel as some herein claim(?).. this hotel is "the place to be seen" but it is nice. Everyone working here was wonderful. We are stil haunted by seeing a woman run over by a bike, but this is not the hotel's fault. Keep your wits about you when venturing out from this hotel (when going left out of the hotel's entrance); even the locals warned us. Nothing ever happened immediately outside the hotel, but venturing down about 100' began the "hey, gimme a dollar" tirades.. not kidding. That got extremely old and it's sad to see teens begging for money.. it's also sad to see guys wearing $100 sneakers asking for a dollar, while high as kites on drugs/alcohol.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: CPACHIC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very quaint and you definitely feel that you are in a special place. As others have noted, the rooms are on the small side but certainly adequate. We found the linens to be comfortable. The only real drawback was that the elevators were limited in number, small and tended to be slow. The staff was very friendly and the doormen were fantastic. The location is perfect and we didn't hear any street noise. Make sure you use iPrefer when you book to get free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jessieboo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monteleone for 3 nights in December and loved every moment. The location was perfect! Right in the heart of the French Quarter and close enough to Bourbon Street without being too close (and loud). It definitely has old time charm and you can tell that it's an old building, which is refreshing when chain hotels are everywhere. The rooms were not large but they were big enough and the beds were very comfortable. The bathrooms were nice and the shower had great pressure. They're doing some construction (although I believe they may have just finished it up) so while some spaces were closed off, we never heard any construction noise. The restaurants were closed so the hotel offered a complimentary continental breakfast which was lovely. The bar on site is the Carousel bar and the seats rotate slowly around the bar, like a carousel. We saw a sneak peak in to the rest of the space that was being renovated and it looks great. The staff were friendly and helpful. I really have no complaints and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “New Orlens 2011”
Reviews.Author: nadineDeerfield_IL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very elegant. The restaurants were under construction however they offered a free continental breakfast each morning to the hotel guest. it has a very friendly atmosphere and is within walking distance to several attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Location is fantastic. Hotel is lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Carol H
Reviews.Content: Lovely, grand old hotel. Loved the close proximity to Canal Street, Royal Street shopping, restaurants, riverfront...you won't need a car! Room was recently renovated, standard king. Smallish, but beautiful, with great view of the river. Rooftop pool is great. Attentive staff. Hotel was crowded, but didn't hear a peep from other rooms, or street noise (we were on 9th floor). ONLY tiny issue...you'll have to wait for an elevator. But worth it for sure. Will stay again and recommend to all my friends!

Reviews.Title: “We always stay here!”
Reviews.Author: michiganpamela
Reviews.Content: Whenever we come to New Orleans we always stay at the Monteleone. It is very clean, friendly, and we feel quite safe here. Make sure you like them on Facebook and do your reservations through there. The rates are less and if you are lucky enough like we are this trip, they will upgrade you to a suite if one is available for just a little more. Well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from this establishment.........”
Reviews.Author: brownfalcon
Reviews.Content: We opted to leave our families and spend Christmas in NOLA and I have to say our stay was less then stellar.The beds were extremely uncomfortable. If myself or my husband moved even just a tiny bit the whole bed moved to the point of keeping us both up. The pillows were tiny little squares so if you moved, the pillows came out from under your head and again woke us because you had to readjust. Not one of the five nights did we get a good nights sleep. Upon check in the woman at the desk, with an accent almost too thick to understand,informed us we got an upgrade and it was a large suite. We were ecstatic until she told us how much more the suite was going to be. When I signed up to get an upgrade I was under the impression it would be at a drastically reduced rate based on availability at the time of check in. The website made it sound as such, I guess I missed the fine print. I simply would have made the reservation for the suite if I wanted to spend $600 or more a night. We opted to stay with the original reservation, the Deluxe King, since we were told no other upgrades were available. Upon check out the room was $20 more per night then what was on the website so I questioned it. The man at the front desk, who also had a very thick accent and difficult to understand said that I forfeited my right to get the online rate on the original reservation when I refused the upgrade. He then proceeded to tell me "how to beat the system" next time we came and we explained to him that was not necessary. We really felt duped, it wasn't the $20, that's negligible, but it is the bait and switch that is troubling in combination with the room which was very small, no real window, dirty, the carpet disgusting and the bad bed just made this visit intolerable. I explained when I made this reservation that this was a very special time for myself and my husband and that due to health concerns we would not be able to travel for a year. In the last year we have been to Santa Fe, Ireland, two weeks in New England, Jamaica, the Bahamas, Honduras, Belize, Mexico and Destin Fl. That doesn't count the trips for business. We also stay in Historic properties often. We are experienced travelers and understand that things just sometimes don't go your way and you just move on and have a good time so we are realistic in our expectations. At the very least we expect cleanliness and a good nights sleep and if we had gotten that I would not be writing this review. In addition, the desk clerk that checked us out accused me of lying and asked me if I wanted him to prove it. I may have missed the fine print and the disclaimer saying "we really don't mean what we are implying", but I was most certainly not lying. It is truly a shame, we loved the city, the doormen are some of the best I have seen, the hotel, with the exception of our room was beautiful and we are definitely coming back to NOLA but will stay somewhere else. We have booked a trip to Vegas next week to try to have the time we were to have at this establishment. On another note, we stopped in Columbus MS on the way home and stayed in the Air Force base motel as our son in law is a pilot there and as expected, the room was sparse, but it was exceptionally clean, the bed was incredibly comfortable, despite the fact it was only a queen, and there was also a separate sitting room. The first good nights sleep in 5 days. I would expect more from the beautiful Hotel Monteleone.

Reviews.Title: “The most professional team I've witnessed at one hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barbara W
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at The Monteleone in New Orleans for at least 8 years now (and getting ready to make it the 9th year). I stay there at least twice a year. I have never had a compliant and never heard of any. I hope this continues. From the time you leave your car until you get into your room, everyone's attitude is the same all the time. I must say, if you haven't stayed there, you're missing a treat and a relaxing atmosphere. KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Suite for Wedding Weekend in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Melanie J
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a corner suite for my wedding weekend in New Orleans and could not have been happier with my choice. The views from my room (on a high floor) were great and I (along with several others) had enough space to prepare the day of my wedding. The room was styled in typical New Orleans classic fashion, and the bathroom was very large and impressively designed. The room service was prompt and food was above average. The Carousel bar and lobby proved to be perfect "meet up" points for my guests, and the central location was ideal for exploring the French Quarter. Most importantly, the hotel has a traditional New Orleans feel to it from top to bottom, a trait which many other chain hotels in NOLA do not have. I have stayed in a traditional room here in the past and do recall the size being on the somewhat small side, but that it was comfortable and also well-styled. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable property, good service”
Reviews.Author: Adam F
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at Hotel Monteleone in December 2011. The staff was extremely helpful and polite. The room was clean and comfortable. During my stay the restaurants were under renovation, so I couldn't try them. The hotel is well-located for walking or taking the tram. The shower had plenty of hot water and great water pressure. My only complaint was that several of the TV channels had very poor reception.

Reviews.Title: “The Monteleone made the trip!”
Reviews.Author: fififarley
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe how beautiful this hotel was...especially for the rate. We stayed the week of 12/11/2011 and the rate was crazy awesome for an executive suite. It was so big and beautiful. The bathroom counter space is the only thing lacking when you have a mother and daughter in the room LOL. From dropping our car off at the valet to checking in to a room upgrade with free Internet everything went smoothly. Sign up for the hotel ipremerier group and you get a free room upgrade, free Internet and a free drink in the great bar. The location couldn't be better. You're right across from two great Brennan restaurants and a plethora of other famous restaurants. For you party goers, Bourbon is one block away! It was fun bringing my 68 year old mom down there (rather early for Bourbon) so she could see all the shananigans. I wish I would have stayed later as it was rather dull at 9pm, but her eyes were wide open. The hotel was decorated beautifully for the holidays. The children caroling daily in the lobby by the clock was great. Due to the renovations, (nothing disturbed our sleep) we had a free breakfast daily. The fruit was fresh, bagels were soft and many selections for cereal and a beautiful view of the Mississippi River! We stayed in 862 and the living room view was a wall, but the bedroom view was perfect. Rooftops and the Mississippi along with the steamboat daily. Jackson Square was an easy 6 block walk (or take a cab...no biggie). I had a great day by myself exploring the streets and shops of the French Quarter while mom was not feeling well from gallstones :( . I highly suggest the horse and carriage tour of the French Quarter and cemetery. It's a bit pricey, but so worth it for the history lesson. Royal St. was a great walk down to the Mississippi. There were some great street bands (street is closed until 4pm), wonderful local art shops, antique shops and local flare shops. Don't miss a walk down Royal toward the water. So for a beautiful, clean, and perfectly located room I highly suggest the Hotel Monteleone. For $69 more than a substandard Fairfield Inn in some dumpy town you can have a beautiful suite with a full living room and bedroom, 2 huge TVs, a mini fridge, great room service, excellent location and a wonderful staff ( the bed could be a bit more firm, but that's all I can pull out of my butt to "complain" about LOL). ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the right place.”
Reviews.Author: coughy
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Monteleone for a pre Christmas getaway. Not our first time in New Orleans but our first French Quarter hotel and we loved it. Because we were having so much fun we overlooked a lot. We got connecting rooms for my husband and myself and our 20 year old son. It was a good thing we took two rooms as their traditional rooms are VERY small and we would not have been comfortable. The beds were so-so and the bedding was awful. The cooling/heating system was also not the best and blew directly on us all night. Bathroom were newly remodeled and clean but also small. I would consider staying here again as the location was so good. I do hope they upgrade their linens.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected....and more”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Monteleone 2 weeks before Christmas so the lobby had a very festive and warm atmosphere. Weather was a bit chilly outside but once inside the hotel, I felt very cozy. I traveled with a friend and we found our room overlooking Royal Street spacious and quiet, though the coffeemaker didn't work. Since the hotel is still undergoing some renovations, the restaurant was closed but guests were offered a delicious complimentary breakfast buffet which was a great start to our days. And the revolving Carousel Bar that looks out onto Royal Street through large fan windows is a lively gathering place after a day of sightseeing. It's true that the French Quarter begins in the lobby of the Hotel Monteleone. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ramblinman
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times. The rooms are mediocre, the Carousel Bar is a trip, although the new food service was very slow. Bartender was very apologetic, but 45 minutes for an appetizer I should have been comped a drink. Hate to complain, but must because hotel didn't respond, sent some clothes to be laundered, pants came back unwashed/drycleaned but pressed, still had the Bourbon bar smell, somebody took a shortcut. Still a nice hotel. Lots of history.

Reviews.Title: “Always a lovely stay at Monteleone”
Reviews.Author: wendigo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into the Hotel Monteleone for a Friday and Saturday night. We actually arrived in New Orleans on Thursday and spent one night at Hotel St. Marie (my review is on TripAdvisor). We knew check-in was not until 3, and that it would likely be busy during the holidays, so we decided to park the car in a public lot and do some Christmas shopping in the French Market until time to check in. We drove to the Monteleone around 3 and went to the valet parking entrance. Our car was taken quickly and we were given a ticket to have our bags delivered to our room. The hotel had an area with velvet ropes set up in front of the registration desk for "arrivals and departures," so I got in the queue and waited my turn, which only took a few minutes. Front desk staff were pleasant. I had purchased my 2-night stay as part of a silent auction package, so I'm always a little nervous that they'll have all the paperwork, but everything went smoothly. Parking for an SUV is $36/day plus taxes. Kind of steep, but not unexpected in the French Quarter. Ouch. We had a room on the 15th floor. The hotel is renovating the lounge next to the famous Carousel Bar, and the elevators we used were located along a temporary hallway constructed of plywood. Not a big deal; occasionally there was some construction noise but nothing major for us. However, the Carousel Bar had a large portion of its space - all but just around the carousel - walled off, and it was constantly packed, so revelers tended to spill down the hallway and into the lobby next to it, which caused us to have to wade through a sea of people often on the way to or from the room. Again, not really a big deal and a temporary annoyance of construction. Our room was nice - king bed, big window looking out toward Canal Street, nice appointments. The bed felt sort of springy-soft. It was kind of strange. Like the whole bedframe felt bouncy or something. Not really uncomfortable, but it felt like if you sat at the end of the bed the mattress would bend down and dump you on the floor. Like it was balanced on a pillar. I can't really explain it. The bathroom was hilariously tiny. Seriously, I don't think I've seen a bathroom this small outside of a cruise ship cabin. You opened the door with just enough clearance for the toilet, which was basically set back into the tiny counter top ledge shared with the sink. The tub was right up against the sink, although it did have a curved shower rod, so once you were actually in the shower, it was roomy. The shower did also have good water pressure and an adjustable spray shower head. There was a hairdryer provided. It was just kind of weird.This isn't really a horrible problem, and the space that was there was nice, all marble, and clean. But really, you had to laugh. It probably was funnier to me b/c the last time we stayed at this hotel we got upgraded to a suite, and the bathroom was enormous, with a huge square walk-in shower, double vanity and giant jacuzzi tub. There was a coffee maker in the room, on a small table/desk. Housekeeping forgot to replenish our coffee when the cleaned our room, so on the second morning we only had decaf. There were initially paper coffee cups, and we didn't have any of those either, so my husband ended up drinking his coffee out of a water glass. Not optimal. The Hotel St. Marie had real coffee mugs. Despite being on the 15th floor, I heard a lot of street noise, which seemed strange. Maybe I just slept lightly. It didn't bother my husband at all. Check out went smoothly, although the valet parking was pretty backed up when we went to retrieve our car. It probably took 20 minutes to get our car; not too bad. We checked out sort of early, too, around 9:30, so I was surprised it was already so busy. Overall, we had a very nice stay. I was very glad we had decided to visit the Carousel bar on Thursday night, before we actually checked in at the Monteleone, because it was totally packed out at almost any time of the day or night the rest of the weekend. I guess that's a good thing! The renovations are nice, although I think I actually liked the more gaudy paint on the carousel before the renovation. I'll be interested to see the whole thing once they open the lounge area. I would stay at the Monteleone again and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, Location”
Reviews.Author: elector
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel only one block from Bourbon Street and less than 5 minutes (walking) to St. Louis Cathedral. Excellent Service, the rooms were recently remodeled and very clean. The bed is little bit on the soft side. Our room was on the 8th floor (no ghostly encounters to report) the room was small, but very nicely furnished and adequate for two people with a very nice King size bed, the bathroom was also small but very clean and recently remodeled. You do not need a car, if you are going to stay around the French Quarter during your visit. Transportation from the airport is $33 dollars flat rate (taxi) for two people. The ride from the airport is about 15 min. Breakfast was included, but with CafÃ© Du Monde (5 minutes walking) and CafÃ© Beignet (Royal Street) two blocks from the hotel, the fresh beignet and coffee in the morning were hard to resist. Highly recommended we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: SAJAC-FL
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the French quarter, walking distance from everything, and away from all the noise of Bourbon street. The hotel staff was very accommodating, their meeting rooms were very nice, and the food was delicious. The Hotel Monteleone was a very good choice for our meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: AdamEvan
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my first tip to New Orleans, I really liked the city and the Hotel Monteleone. The hotel is in the absolute perfect location, surrounded by great restaurants and far enough away from awful Bourbon Street. Royal Street is loaded with cool shops and makes a prefect home base. Everyone at the hotel was very nice, but the door men in particular were awesome, they gave me the best advice as where to go and what to do. The hotel also has a nice heated pool on the roof. If I return to NOLA I would only stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: abudd77
Reviews.Content: Great location , great staff and service , the room with the Garden tub is beautiful River view suite

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: wyked
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monteleone is in the heart of the French Quarter, one block from Bourbon Street and close to tons of great restaurants and shops. The hotel is beautiful and elegant and the staff was friendly and helpful. The restaurants were closed for rennovation while we were there but that is hardly a deal breaker with so many restaurants to choose from right outside your door. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: LCF48
Reviews.Content: Warm, comfortable, luxurious... Excellent! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: LakeWylie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Monteleone for the first time during a recent conference. It is an old but very nicely refurbished classic hotel in the heart of the French Quarter. The location is excellent and convenient just a couple of blocks from Canal Street and Bourbon Street. Everything was first class. I was upgraded to a small suite and was quite impressed with the room. The bathroom was beautiful with a separate granite shower and bath. The room was very comfortable, well appointed and luxurious. The hotel staff was top notch. You can't go wrong with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - overall great experience”
Reviews.Author: Karyn S
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised with our stay at the Hotel Monteleone. The staff were all extremely friendly and accommodating (although we did need to "fight" for a king bed rather than two doubles). Everyone had a smile and greeted us as we came and went each day. The rooms were much more spacious than I was expecting. The bathroom size was particularly impressive. The lobby was beautiful and very tastefully decorated for the holidays - just gorgeous. The one negative I have about the Hotel Monteleone was the cleaning staff. While our room was very clean and well kept, they would consistently clean the room around 4:00 pm. We typically left each day around 8:00 am and returned around 3:30 pm to rest before heading out for the evening. Having the cleaning staff come at 4:00 became very frustrating. That said, we would happily stay at the Hotel Monteleone in the future. Perfect location for exploring the French Quarter and enjoying both day and night life.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Old”
Reviews.Author: 60795Marco
Reviews.Content: The Monteleone is located on Royal street, the nicest street in the Quarter, full of antique shops and other boutiques. The hotel is on the old-fashioned side: large bedrooms and bathrooms, marble and wood trim, chandeliers, etc. It's very quiet, rooms are well sound-proofed, service is commendable, breakfast quite appetizing. It has the best location of any hotel in the city, and if you like the comforts of the past (but including flat-screen TV and Wi-Fi) , it's the place for you

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: arbeedc
Reviews.Content: Monteleone is an older but recently refurbished hotel in a great location -- a block off Bourbon, close to the action but far enough away to be relatively calm. We had a "traditional king," which was a little on the small side. The bathroom was noticeably small as well but still perfectly adequate. The Carousel bar was fun (highly recommend the Vieux Carre cocktail), and the location could not have been better. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A Special Place”
Reviews.Author: ogler
Reviews.Content: Every year my husband and I travel to New Orleans before Christmas for the Papa Noel Festival. The best restaurants compete with one another with Revillion dinners. We always stay at the Hotel Monteleone for its ambience, location, and the Carousel Bar. The bartender makes the best negronis this side of Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheryl123Florida
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and opulent hotel in the quarter. Wonderful service . Cannot wait to come again. Extremely comfortable beds and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise trip to watch the Saints!”
Reviews.Author: travelling_chris_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Monteleone at the end of November 2011. The hotel is in a perfect location for sight seeing in the French Quarter. Hotel was very nice. The only negative was that the restaurant was closed for renovations, just bad timing. However, there are plenty of nice restaurants close by. The hotel is old, but as in "historic old", but very nice - no complaints. The rooms were nicely decorated, clean and quiet. Anything that you needed, they were happy to deliver. One note - if you are going to the French Quarter and don't plan on doing any sight seeing on your own outside of the city, do not rent a car - no need for it, everything is within walking distance. This was our only mistake - it sat in the hotel parking lot the entire time and was just an extra unneeded cost. Was disappointed that there was a charge for computer access and a 1-800 call to the airlines.

Reviews.Title: “The way a local hotel should be...this hotel is incredible”
Reviews.Author: Dana3putt
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed in many different hotels in NOLA as we live close by. This is my favorite in the city and here's why: The concierge, the front desk, the incredible pool, great rooms, and fantastic treatment from beginning of your stay to the end. I love that this is a family-run hotel and has been for 90+ years. The rooms are clean, well equipped and spacious. I love that the people that work there -- from the sundries store desk lady to the morning bellman, have been there for 15+ years. This hotel is always working to improve. This new Carousel Bar is supposed to be incredible. I can't wait to see it. Each year, I take my son for his birthday. This year, he turns 12 and we are headed back. It's all he wants for his birthday every year -- a trip to NOLA with me and a stay at the Montelone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property at a more amazing price point”
Reviews.Author: EBDMarinaDelReyCA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monteleone for over two weeks, in connection with a business event, to which we added an extra week. We are occasional visitors to New Orleans and have stayed at the Royal Sonesta and another small French Quarter hotel in the past. The Monteleone outdid them all, by leaps and bounds. The hotel was undergoing a restaurant renovation during our stay, and to compensate for that disruption (which was hardly disruptive) they served a free breakfast to guests. This was buffet style but with white tablecloths on the tables and servers to bring coffee, tea, etc. The spread was lavish and easily the equivalent of the $18.95 pp breakfasts served at other hotels. Due to our connection with a conference held at the hotel, we were given a special rate of, before taxes, about $105 for the room. They upgraded us to a junior suite at no extra charge! The room was beautifully appointed and the spa tub in the bathroom was a welcome extra. Staff was somehow both largely invisible but attentive; towels etc. were changed out seeming all through the day. Everyone we interacted with on the staff, from the doormen to the breakfast servers to the desk clerks, was friendly and helpful. Couldn't ask for more. The Monteleone has become our new standard for excellence. Just stayed at the Westin in Palo Alto, which did not fare well in comparison. But that's another review. Finally, the Monteleone is perfectly situated off of Bourbon Street just enough to escape the worst of the crazies, but very close by to all the French Quarter's many attractions. It is also within walking distance to other sights such as the Insectarium and Imax Theatre, a boon when we were entertaining our granddaughter. We'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: jen4k2
Reviews.Content: I was already gaping when I walked up to the hotel, but when I walked in my JAW DROPPED. How many adjectives can I throw out here? Stunning. Amazing. Lavish. The Old World drama of this place is outstanding, easily on par with the Royal Sonesta and Roosevelt. The staff was warm, friendly and efficient; this was incredibly impressive given the horde of people from my conference arriving almost literally all at the same time. They made hospitality look easy. The pool fantastic, beds oh-so-comfy, pillows perfectly fluffy, and the shower's water pressure was perfectly adjustable -- and I like my shower pressure really, really high. Bonus: hilarious bartenders at the Carousel Bar. Yes, the bar actually rotates! There are many GREAT restaurants (and great values!) are within easy walking distance, and there's a 24-hour Walgreen's on the corner across the street. Part of the charm of the French Quarter is its nightlife. All the fun of Bourbon Street is literally around the corner, but you'll want to choose THIS hotel over ANY directly on Bourbon Street because everyone likes to sleep (eventually). My one complaint is that the meeting spaces are a bit hard to navigate without a map or someone who knows where they're going (inevitable, given its age and history) and it is not very handicap accessible, especially with a horde of conference-goers crowding the twisty hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: Finoke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a conference and I guess I was likely wowed by my first trip to New Orleans but the hotel played a big part. We had a smaller but very nicely appointed room and beds were comfortable, room was very clean and everything about the hotel was excellent. the check-in and service was far above average and you could see that they wer into taking care of people. We had a breakfast buffet one morning at the restaurant inside the hotel (I apologize because I cannot remember it's name) and it was likely THE BEST breakfast buffet I've ever had and I've had many! Being Canadian we have a lot of real Maple Syrup in our area but most restaurants rarely give you the real thing, this place actually provided miniature 1=2 ounce bottles of it for your pancakes! The food and service was incredible. It is in the French Quarter so from the hotel to all the sights and sounds that make New Orleans popular. The restaurants in the area were off the chart as were the local shops and street musicians. Highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Good Location, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: weeiiss
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monteleone over Thanksgiving with family. I called the hotel directly and got a great offer since we werent staying over the weekend. Our room was a double double preferred that had high celings and was newly remodeled. There was a refrigerator, flat screen TV, in room safe and small sitting area. The room was very comfortable with enough room for four people. The bathroom was updated with granite and marble. The lobby is beautiful and the employees from the front door to the parking garage were all very helpful. Loved the location because we were close to shops and several wonderful restaurants. Walking distance to the trolleys, Aquarium, Cafe Du Monde, etc. We would stay here again and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: lja9799
Reviews.Content: We went for one day with our boys had a very nice time, our room was nice and clean. The beds were comfortable. The bathrooms were remodeled and clean. Great location around the corner is Dickie Brennans steak house n Mr. Bs bistro n Acme oyster house, A block from Bourbon and Canal blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: C B
Reviews.Content: Monteleone is beautiful old, elegant, well maintained property located in a great spot in the French Quarter. We walked everywhere. Room smaller than modern day rooms but beautifully decorated and very comfortable. Our 8th floor room looked out over Royal Street but streets are so narrow you cannot see anything. It was quiet which was great. Love having refrigerator in room. Stocked with Diet Cokes bought at Walgreens next door (this is handy). Parking is expensive - $30 a day.
