Only complaint was the buffet breakfast (included in room price) they were serving in a mezzanine ballroom as restaurants & lounge were closed for remodeling. There was not enough seating in the ballroom so there was line for breakfast. Staff was not happy when I just went in and got a couple of danish and took back to room on check-out day when we did not have time to wait for table. I did not understand why they would mind. Remodeling should be finished by first of year and this should not be an issue. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Charming”
Reviews.Author: sunshinekisses71
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to New Orleans and everything was wonderful. We had a great room in this historic hotel. The beds were very comfortable, and the bath room was great loved the glass shower. The hotel had a great breakfast and was located in a very convenient area. We walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Older but great location”
Reviews.Author: ems1714
Reviews.Content: I was there this past weekend and spent one night. It was nice and quiet which was a great contrast to the noisy bars on Bourbon Street. The room is smaller, but certainly enough room for two people. My bathroom was gigantic! The bed was super comfortable - not firm but very soft. I really liked all of the small touches the hotel does in the room, especially the bathrobes! I didn't have a view at all but that didn't bother me as I spent most of my time out of the room. The hotel has a lot of charm but the front lobby is a bit disappointing at the moment as they are doing renovation. Overall, this was a pleasant experience and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming, great location”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoSanAntonio
Reviews.Content: Found a really good price on this hotel (probably because the restaurants were all closed for remodeling) and am very glad we decided to stay here. Has all the charm (and quirkiness) of an older hotel. I found our room to be very well appointed - small but definitely adequate for our needs. I think it had been recently refurbished and it was very tasteful and comfortable. Spent a good bit of time in the carousel bar and at the rooftop pool and really enjoyed our time spent in both. The carousel bar is kind of a historic treasure and should be checked out even if you're not staying in the hotel. Snagging a seat on the carousel can be a challenge but is so much fun. The location of the hotel couldn't be beat - very close to most everything but far enough away from Bourbon Street to be able to get away from all the noise and craziness at the end of the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey but nice”
Reviews.Author: rmbt58
Reviews.Content: We were here over Halloween. We were on the 10 Floor,facing Bourbon street and we heard the noise until 2-3 am. Fellow travelers on the 12th Floor said the same. Travelers facing the Mississippi heard nothing. Old hotel, they are remodeling and that noise starts at 7am and we woke to that each morning also. To compensate a free continental breakfast was served. Great location, walking distance to everything. Famous carousel bar under renovation, drinks can be ordered in the lobby. Room size good, bathroom small. Would try again, but only if I knew I could get a water view. Fee for internet use.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Raydios
Reviews.Content: The Monteleone is only about an hour's drive from my home so when we visit New Orleans, we often stay here because it's convenient to most restaurants we enjoy and is at the entrance of the French quarter. The staff is great, very friendly. It's an old hotel, charming but rooms tend to be small, especially the baths even in Jr. Suites. We stayed this week 11/15-16, 2011 and missed the wonderful breakfasts in their cafe which is being remodeled but they compensated by offering free bkfsts in a large room on second floor. Bar is closed, too, in November, but we were pleasantly served drinks in a section of the lobby. We definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “On the edge of French Quarter and very nice.”
Reviews.Author: KnoxTrouter
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night after airline departure mix-up extended our New Orleans stay (discovered after we had checked out of another hotel). Very nice hotel. In the midst of renovation but not noticeable from the inside except that the carousel bar was closed. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Booked the room through Expedia while in a taxi to the hotel. Our reservation hadn't reached the hotel's data base when we arrived so we checked our bags and asked that they call when our room was available which took no more than 10 minutes. Rooftop bar and pool make for a nice place to relax. Excellent breakfast offered during renovation at no charge. Hotel's own coffee blend was good enough to buy a bag to bring home. This place projects elegance and succeeds. It's on Royal Street which has art galleries and other interesting shopping and is only one block from Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy2468
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during a recent business trip to New Orleans. I thought the hotel was very nice, one of the oldest in the French Quarters. The rooms are small but that is typical for older hotels. Be careful of the rooms with the French Quarter view - below the 5th floor the noise will keep you awake to wee hours of the night and above the 5th floor there is really only a view of rooftops. Our rooms though was nicely furnished, looked to be recently remodeled. Staff was very accomodating. Would have liked to see the carosel bar which was being remodeled. Lots of nostalgia. Walking distance to most anything in French Quarters and lower downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Closer to 3 stars than 5”
Reviews.Author: unocarter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Montelleon for four nights in october,excellent location but the hotel was below expectations,it is nice but no more, Staff ranged from excellent doorman to downright rude barman, Wont be going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Jim B
Reviews.Content: Off the beaten path and close enough to Bourbon Street. A famous elegant hotel, roof top pool, fully serviced with bar and thick beach chair towels and palm trees so elegant, striped canopy awnings and glass french doors leading out to the pool. Elegant chandlier entrance, signature grand old clock, fine cocktail lounge, and the place smells good. Large tiled lobby and showcase windows displaying temptations. Royal. Very clean very professional staff who remember you. The rooms are small, but well appointed, some have no window, so beware. The Peliguin Club restaurant just behind, wow good. As is Armod's Restauant with live music, and Bennan's for banana's foster and the lump crab omlette, so good. Famous people have and do stay at the Monteleone. I feel safe and well cared for there. The building is white and detailed design very French. Antique stores everywhere and dining galour. Best Aquarium I have ever seen, a great Zoo, old railway cable cars, and the Casino all a short walk. The river boat dinner tours, paddle boats are fun, and music is everywhere. A fun place to go even if you do not party hardy. There is No place like New Orleans. This Hotel made me feel very special I Thank the staff for all your considerations. I would recommend The Monteleone to anyone who has an appreciation for the finer things in life and deserves to be pampered . Great to give back to a community that has been through so much, I gladly will spend my hard earned dollars here, and look forward to the next visit. Just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Heather O
Reviews.Content: Decided on a last minute trip to New Orleans and thankfully the Hotel Monteleone had a few rooms still available. Wonderful place to stay in the French Quarter with access to everything you might want to see or do! Plan to stay again next time we go to NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fish4fun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October and loved this hotel. The rooms were clean and fairly good sized for the area. The beds were comfy and the view was beautiful. We stayed on the 15th floor in a deluxe king, which I thought was worth the upgrade. The hotel itself is beautiful and filled with character and warmth. The staff were helpful and friendly. I would stay here again anytime in was back in NOLA!!

Reviews.Title: “rather disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JPHMCK
Reviews.Content: the Monteleone has a great location on Royal St in the lovely french Quarter but as far as being a five star hotel goes it lacks especially on the service front.On arrival the check in girl informed us she didnt have the preferred king room we had reserved was not available so we were being put in a preferred twin.Despite my obvious displeasure she just commented "its all we have so too bad". We went for a drink at the pool bar which was filthy and the barman could only locate ne wine glass and served my wine in a beaker. There was no bottled water in the bedrom and we had to wait over an our to get any. The q for breakfast on the first morning was 15 minutes wait. We didn't even try the second day! Loved the Big Easy but not the Monteleone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, just far enough away from Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: grapevine53
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and just far enough away from Bourbon Street, not to have to wear ear plugs to sleep! Location to all of the French Quarter was fabulous and even though I only spent 1 short night there, would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good things come in small packages!”
Reviews.Author: meow50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 30th wedding anniversary. The room was surprisingly small, but comfortable. The hotel is elegant, the staff friendly and the rooftop pool is fantastic. The spa is fabulous! Withn walking distance of everything and in house parking. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monteleone”
Reviews.Author: Amy D
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Monteleone. It is in a great location, walking distance to everything in the French Quarter. Everyone at the hotel was very nice and pleasant, Randy our door man was so great, and was always ready to answer any questions we had, and he gave us a history lesson as well of New Orleans. He was very helpful and friendly. We would stay there again if we are ever there again.

Reviews.Title: “The heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: MsGandT
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel I stayed in when in New Orleans for a girls weekend with 2 friends. We wanted to experience staying in the French Quarter and so chose the Monteleone for our final two nights in the city. Our room was on the 14th floor, which is the one which is supposedly haunted, but aside from two of us having the same dream one night about a ghostly visitor, nothing more untoward to report on that front. The room was a little small, but as others have said, as expected in a historic building. The pool bar was a nice spot to enjoy a sundowner and the Carousel Bar was a must visit. The staff were really excellent and very friendly and the continental breakfast on offer in lieu of the restaurant that was being remodelled was great. The location in the French Quarter is perfect as it was a short walk to all the main attractions - Jackson Square, Bourbon Street and all the rest. We loved our stay in the Monteleone and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel/great location”
Reviews.Author: neicie
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to New Orleans so i don't have a lot to compare it to, but the Hotel Monteleone was perfect for us. It is located steps away from the french quarter and Jackson Square is right down the road the other direction. We walked everywhere. The lobby was beautiful, and our room was perfect. It was very clean and romantic. Yes, the room is small, but not as small as i was expecting. The hotel employees were all nice and helpful. We did use the rooftop pool and it was clean and beautiful as well. The drink service at the pool was great. We didn't ever try the breakfast so we can't comment on that but there was always a line so it must have been pretty good! We will stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from conference”
Reviews.Author: catdfromsc
Reviews.Content: Room was small but very nice and what I expected from a historic property. Bellmen were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Front desk was nice but a little clueless on the concept of delivery lost luggage to my colleague's room. It was hard to hear speakers while in the large meeting space as doors were open and staff was loud. Carousel bar was closed but I hear it's nice. The exercise room was well equipped and clean. Overall, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: MarkMichigan
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay for a long weekend in the French Quarter. Hotel has a great location - right near everything, but just far enough away from Bourbon street. Had a great room on the 14th floor that looked out over the city. Room was clean, plenty big. Good roomy bathroom. Friendly employees. Bummer that the hotel bar was closed -- but they did serve drinks in the lobby. Rooftop pool area was nice as well. Very nice workout room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and great location”
Reviews.Author: zoom101
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Hotel Monteleone as part of a group attending a wedding in New Orleans and were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is large, elegant and well-maintained. The staff is very welcoming, as is the overall atmosphere. The location is excellent, one block from crazy Bourbon Street in the thick of the French Quarter with its many shops, galleries and restaurants. Free breakast as a bonus. Expanded continental is how I would describe it, but enough to get you going for the rest of your stomach-busting day in this town of great dining and beignets. Our room, on the 10th floor, was smallish but nicely decorated and very quiet, with an open city view. The pillows were amazing and we ordered two for home use--a first for these frequent travelers. Concierge was very helpful with maps, information and suggestions. The hotel is a short walk from the streetcar for a ride to the Garden District/Tulane, and a longer stroll to the World War II Museum, which we enjoyed. This hotel, with a long history and huge rooftop sign easily spotted to help you find your way home, is a good choice overall.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely french quarter hotel; will return”
Reviews.Author: Marisol M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was undergoing renovation during our visit, but it is a lovely property. Beautiful interior, nice spa, hotel roof pool. Rooms are old but updated, and we were on the edge of the french quarter, close the action, but away from Bourbon Street so we could get some sleep. We checked out other hotels in the area, but this one, just seemed to have the right dose of charm, cleanliness, and atmosphere for our needs. We are planning to return to this exact location in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, just not as great as expected”
Reviews.Author: misterburns
Reviews.Content: Went for the New Orleans Horror Film Festival and for Halloween weekend, and had a friend who recommended this hotel to us and also got us a great deal. Unfortunately we didn't get to stay on the 14th floor, which is supposed to be haunted - but we were on the 11th floor. The room was really nice, 2 double beds, small, but quaint, with a fabulous bathroom. The other positives - it's a very nice hotel, historic, old, beautiful, yadda yadda. They are doing renovations so we got an amazing expanded continental breakfast for free each morning, with great service from Inna - she was wonderful! We also got free bottled water each day in our room. The hotel is a great location - close to Bourbon street, but far enough to way. You can walk everywhere. Now the negatives - for a hotel that supposedly has a reputation for very fine customer service, I thought it was lacking. The front desk staff, whenever I interacted with them, seemed disinterested and like I was a bother. The doormen never greeted us personally, just held the door. When we departed, we had to get a cab ourselves. Overall, it felt like we didn't matter to anyone, because there were a LOT of people staying at the hotel. (Oh yes - our mattresses were EXTREMELY soft. So if you require a sturdy back-supporting mattress, you might want to ask about your room.) Don't get me wrong, it was a nice stay. I think I was just expecting more of a personable feel.

Reviews.Title: “Still a classic in the middle of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: edwardcali
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with top service (friendly and helpful) and location. As pointed out undergoing renovations, the rooms, pool and common areas are done. The restaurants and now the famous bar are closed for a few months. The hotel does offer a free continental breakfast in one of the meeting rooms and still have full room service. They also offer drink service in the main entry way. The rooms are smallish and the bathrooms even smaller, not European small but American small. Still they are very nice with great beds and new furnishings. You are only one block from Bourbon Street in a wonderful spot of the French Quarter. Dozens of great restaurants within walking distance and but a half mile from the river and Jackson Square.

Reviews.Title: “Just back from the Monteleone”
Reviews.Author: LyndaGM
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Monteleone. It is a wonderful hotel, old, historic and beautiful. The Carousel Lounge is fun. The roof top pool was great - shielded from wind and beautifully sunny. Staff are helpful. The hotel is certainly on the high end which makes some of their charges difficult to understand. For example, computer use in the business center requires a credit card and the first few minutes cost $7; a glass of coke at the pool was $3.75. Its not the money, just seemed like a lot for the quality of the hotel. Room was small but beautifully appointed and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “despite renovations, a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: erinmargo
Reviews.Content: The Monteleone is undergoing renovations, but to accommodate guests, they provide free continental breakfast. The person checking us in was so friendly and helpful. Even though I had stayed here once before, it had been a while and he was helpful at re-orienting me. Bed was very comfortable. Also, we arrived very early (11am) but our room was ready! Rooftop beautiful (even though too cold to swim). Fitness center has more than a bike & a treadmill -- and an awesome view to distract. Central location is great -- but not smack in the middle, so its a bit less crazy. Great staff, nice room (but no view) and excellent location. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Kimm992
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from staying 5 nights at Hotel Monteleone and I can't say enough great things about it! The staff was excellent - always friendly and smiling and happy to help with whatever we needed. They helped us make tour reservations and dinner reservations and were very knowledgable about things to do! The rooms were very nice and very clean (a little small, but that's to be expected in an old hotel). I would call house keeping each day when we were going out for the day and without fail our room would be clean when we returned. We were not bothered at all by the renovations. The free breakfast was actually really great - pastries were SO good. There was sometimes a line to get in for breakfast but it always went very fast. They were happy to let you bypass the line if you wanted to just run in and grab your food to go. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay”
Reviews.Author: joerenta
Reviews.Content: Just a very nice hotel. Old and going through a renovation. I'd stay again in a heartbeat. A place with charm. Can't wait to see if after the renovations are complete.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Under Renovations”
Reviews.Author: rcarrtx
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Monteleone before, we were really looking forward to our next visit to New Orleans. The staff is always very friendly and the lobby area was clean. The carousel bar area was open during construction but had been reduced in size temporarily while the renovations take place. We enjoyed a preferred king room on the 14th floor but were dissapointed that the network channels were not available in HD. Also disappointing was the $10 per day charge for wireless internet. Everything was great except for the daily 7 am wake up from the construction crew. I will definitely stay at the Monteleone again but will wait until renovations have been completed to return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with warm southern charm”
Reviews.Author: Acydman
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel right in the heart of the tourist attractions, felt very well looked after from valet right through to room service and housekeeping. Nothing was too much trouble. Rooms a littler smaller than usual but it is an old hotel and built when the room size was acceptable. The free breakfast got very busy and was waiting 15 minutes in line for a table, but the service was that good no wonder some people stayed and had another coffee etc. If I ever come back to New Orleans I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: gao1014
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monteleone is a classic, New Orleans hotel, perfectly situated in the French Quarter. The rooms were of good size and the king bed was actually a king bed; (we measured it!) Too often hotels list rooms with king sized beds but you get the feeling that it is really a queen plus. This bed was the real deal; the mattress a little too soft for my liking, but it did not prevent me from sleeping well. The service was pure southern hospitality (even though a lot of the lobby staff seemed to be from Eastern Europe). The housekeeping staff was great. The room was made up perfectly and even items that were left strewn about were neatly folded and placed on a chair. Even the toiletries in the bathroom were laid out on a towel and aligned perfectly. The Carousel Bar was definitely a highlight. The seating area around the bar actually rotates 360 degrees every 15 minutes. You don't even realize that you're moving. On top of this, the bartenders were spot on, no matter what drink you ordered. And although the prices were hotel high, you did get what you paid for. O.K. That was the good news...now for a little of the bad. We stayed at the Monteleone from October 24th and checked out on the 29th, 2011. I can't review the restaurants since they were all closed for renovation. In itself, this wasn't so bad as you got to experience a lot of the local fare in the Quarter. The problem was; noise, Noise, NOISE. Our room was on the 15th floor (highest room floor) and every morning, just about 7:00AM, the hammering and drilling started. We ended up complaining every morning and the noise was quickly shut down, but the damage was done. Yes, we did receive free drink coupons every day, but a little more sleep would have been more appreciated. So, if you're expecting a quiet room, do yourself a favor; either skip the Monteleone until after renovations are completed, or I would suggest a lower floor. Since we really liked the Hotel, go for the lower floor and enjoy the experience. Ordinarily, this would be the end of the review. However, I'm a little too lazy to do separate reviews and I wanted to give people an idea of the great restaurants, shopping, etc. we were able to enjoy while in town. The French Quarter - This section of New Orleans has everything you could possible hope for in one location. Bring soft shoes because you will be doing a lot of walking. Royal Street is loaded with antique shops and art galleries. You can literally spend an entire afternoon just walking up and down Royal Street. ****Beware - Stores open at their leisure and except for the tacky tourist shops, most do not open their doors before 10:30AM and close by 6:00PM. The Art Galleries are loaded with local artists, some of which are really talented. I have never seen a greater collection of 'weird' or 'voodoo' art in my life. Really cool! The Antique Shops are, well, antiquie. If you're into that, I'm sure you'll enjoy them. Bourbon Street - I guess that your level of appreciation is directly correlated to your age. This street runs for about 5 blocks and is pretty much where all the action is at night. There are 4 types of establishments that occupy Bourbon; Restaurants, Bars, Tourist Shops and Strip Clubs. It is also one of the few places I have ever been where they advertise 'Drinks to Go'. It is legal to walk down the Street, getting plastered. I guess that's why the Strip Clubs are doing so well. My Wife and I enjoyed Bourbon Street for, I guess, around 1 1/2 blocks. We both had headaches by the time we turned off the Street. Not that I didn't like the music; the problem being that every other place had live music and it kept rolling around in your brain. The better thing to do is to pick out one place and park your tush there for awhile to really enjoy the sounds. Other than that, watching people stumbling down the street with drinks in both hands was not exactly eye-pleasing. And some of the women hawking the strip clubs?; I've seen better T&A at Wallmart! Restaurants - Here is where the French Quarter really shines. Be prepared to spend some hard cash, but the food is out of this world. *****Note***** There are some lesser priced restaurants in the area, but you really have to search them out. I'm listing below the ones we ate in and the cost for 2 people. ***Also beware that their tax is outrageous; bordering on 10%. Felix's Restaurant - Forget Acme's. That's the place all the tourists go to.There are always long lines at Acme's and the prices are high!!!! Felix's is directly across the street (739 Iberville St.) and has absolutely the best oysters around. Well, I shouldn't say that since everyone's oysters come from the same place. But get this.. A dozen of these beauties at Acme's will cost close to 15$; at Felix's, only $11.50. Get the point? Also, the char-grilled oysters are to die for...They cost more ($9.95 for 6) but worth every pretty penny. Their bread pudding is to die for; warm and with a whiskey-based sauce ($5.00) On Wednesdays, you get a free draft when you order a dozen oysters. And the staff is great; outgoing, friendly and helpful. The Marigny Brasserie - This place is a little out of the way; at 640 Frenchmen Street. Take a cab. I had the fried chicken which is one of their specialties. It is Crispy, to say the least and the pieces barely fit onto a large plate. Share it with someone since you won't be able to finish it. My better half had the BBQ shrimp and grits (another house favorite), This was the first time I tasted Grits and actually enjoyed them. Dinner for two - $62.00 including tip. Antoines - Make sure you have room on the credit card 'cause this baby will cost ya. The grandest of the grand restaurants in New Orleans as well as the oldest. I wanted to go there after watching one of Emiril's shows. It included Antoine's and a dish he really enjoyed. He was spot on. The dish is referred to as Pompano Pontchartain and it is simply outrageous; a fillet of pompano (lightly breaded and pan seared), topped with loads of crab meat. OMG - heaven on a plate.We also had an appetizer of breaded oysters with this sauce (didn't need it) and a nice salad. For dessert, we had the Baked Alaska. At $16.50 (yes, that much) it was listed as dessert for two. Yeah right! It could have fed us and the two tables nearby. As a special treat, they flambe' it for me (my birthday present). The tab was , you ready? $120.00 including tip..and this was just 1 appetizer, 1 salad, 1 entree and dessert. Our most expensive meal, but really well worth it. It's a pleasure to sit at a table with white cloths and tuxedo dressed servers who are well versed in their field and really enjoy making sure that your experience is a great one. Olivier's - You will not find this place in any of the guides. We were directed there by one of the bartenders at the Monteleone. Good choice; Great Food. Only a couple of blocks from the hotel. My wife had Creole Rabbit and this was out of this world. I was in the mood for meat (carnivore that I am) and had one of the most tender Rib-Eyes I have ever had. Cooked perfectly to medium rare. Make reservations..This is a smaller restaurant and fills up quickly. Dinner with one drink and tip - $75.00 American Sector - This is one of John Besh's places and is inside the National WWII museum. We went there for lunch and had a great time. The restaurant is themed in the 1940's and the food is served in tins, cans, etc. Done really well. We didn't go into the museum proper but it seemed like a cool place to spend a couple of hours. The restaurant is worth it. We had Rabbit pate', with celery root slaw and horseradish and for the main course, we shared Pork Cheeks. Yes, pork cheeks. They were out of sight, so tender and tasty and they came with black-eyed peas and corn bread. The servers were all dressed in the outfits of the times and, once again, were extremely friendly and out-going. Total bill around $40.00 including tip. Best dining surprise? Fried Green Tomatoes. Honestly. Finally, one of the cooler things we did was to take a cooking class at the New Orleans School of Cooking. It only costs $29.00/person and is well worth the visit. You're seated at tables of 8-10 and they take around 100 people at a time. This was an open lunch class and started at 10:00AM and ended up around 12:30PM. Our 'instructor' was Aunt Sandra and what a character. This woman talked non-stop the entire session, while she was cooking the whole time. She was great, giving us a history of New Orleans, the foods, etc. After each course was finished, food was served. We had a creamy artichoke and shrimp soup, crawfish etouffee, bread pudding and pralines. Everything was delicious. There is not a better way to spend 2 1/2 hours!. Overall, I would rate our trip a 9.5 out of 10. We had a fantastic time. Yes, sometimes you couldn't tell the homeless from the tourists, but hey...that's true in a lot of cities. New Orleans is on the mend welcomes all with open arms.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm but so noisy”
Reviews.Author: keldes
Reviews.Content: This is a cool, old hotel in the heart of the French Quarter with a lot of charm but the renovations woke me up every morning even though we were on te 10th floor. We stayed in a preferred room which was smaller than the average hotel room in NOLA. The bathroom is especially tiny and uncomfortable with poor lighting. The HVAC system in our room was not under our control and led to our room remaining a chilly 60 degrees no matter what temperature we set the thermostat to. The Carousel Bar was unique but a little too small to accommodate the guests. The free breakfast was inadequate and did not make up for having an operating restaurant. The pool area is very nice with poolside drink and food service and the gym was adequate. Housekeeping was good and service throughout the hotel was fair.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: Brandy6301982
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a bad stay at Hotel Monteleone but we'll probably stick with Omni Royal Crescent in the future. We weren't impressed with the size of our room or it's decor. Other than that, it was a pretty decent stay. The place is clean and the staff is friendly. It's definitely in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Even while under renovations this Hotel was excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mel C
Reviews.Content: This Hotel went out of their way to provide excellent service. This is a historic hotel with lots of character right in the heart of the French Quarter in New Orleans. Great roof top pool, exercise room and spa. The hotel was in the last stages of renovations so there were some restaurant services not available, but they compensated with a great complementary breakfast. When the renovations are done, this hotel should have excellent dining areas. There are dozens of excellent restaurants, shops and attractions within walking distance of the hotel. I was there for business, and we found the meeting rooms to be very good. All the resources we needed to conduct business were provided without any problems at all. The Hotel is surrounded by narrow busy streets, with lots of pedestrian traffic. I would not recommend trying to bring your car there... Parking is expensive, and once you are there, there is no need to have a car. You can walk anywhere you want in minutes, and there are Taxis available all the time. I stayed in a standard room with two double beds. The hotel is historic so the rooms are not huge, but they have been upgraded with marble bathroom fixtures. All the amenities are available in the room. High speed internet is available at a fairly pricy cost. Our business planner negotiated the internet into the room charge. Otherwise the highspeed service was over $15 per day. That seems pretty expensive to me. I'm used to that being a free service. One other thing to consider... this hotel is one block off Bourbon Street... There are musicians playing on the street right next to the hotel... and pedestrian traffic all night long... lots of partying going on until late in the morning 3-4am. My room was only 3 floors up and there was lots of music and noise from the street. So this isn't the hotel for a quiet retreat. Maybe a room in the 14th or 15th floor would be quieter. The rooftop pool and courtyard was however a great retreat spot... a quiet place set apart from the hub-bub.

Reviews.Title: “Home in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: rkoonce
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Monteleone again last week and it was a great stay, as usual. The downside with this trip was that the restaurants were closed for remodeling (we knew about it before we made the reservation). Even so, the hotel provided a complementary continental breakfast in a big meeting room each morning, so it worked out fine. The staff is the best. Raoul was our bellman both on check in and check out. Nice man who has worked there for decades and who always remembers my name. Lucille is my waitress and she's the same, she always remembers us and seems genuinely happy to see us again. Our requested room was not available when checked in, so our first night didn't have a river view, which we always request (the hotel was fully booked), so the next day they moved us to a river view room in the western side of the hotel. Not quite as nice a view as other rooms we've had, but we could see the big bend in the river and watch the ships and barges coming and going. The room was comfortable and everything worked well. There are new bathrooms in this section with the toilet mounted at a diagonal so the door would clear, a little odd, but functional. The famous Carousel Bar was open but was reduced in size by the renovations, but as I understand it, it will be back to its original size after construction with a lighter decor as differentiated from the piano lounge that was there before. They'll have some more window seats which I enjoy. Great spot for people watching on Royal St. The bartenders did their magic and kept the place going with excellent cocktails, even with special requests. Try a Sazerac. I had a massage at Spa Aria and was very pleased with the service. I consider the Monteleone my home when I visit New Orleans and I'll continue to stay there every time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Monteleone”
Reviews.Author: joepeg
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Hotel Monteleone every year and are never disappointed. The staff are always friendly and helpful, the rooms have a river view that we love, and the Carousel Bar is always turning. You can walk anywhere in the French Quarter and you don't need a car.

Reviews.Title: “Three stars for the price of five”
Reviews.Author: SFKSAW
Reviews.Content: The hotel could be lovely. The people certainly are. The location is superb. It is the details that are missing. When I was there I had an Executive suite. Quite large given the typical size of the rooms. Expect small - very small. But all the restaurants were closed so they staged a fairly lame attempt at breakfast in a conference room on the mezzanine. Of course it is OK to close restaurants and renovate. It is not OK to make people line up for a croissant and some fruit. Who was in charge of this idea and do they still work there? The poor ladies who serve the coffee are left to deal with somewhat disgruntled guests. While the overall quality of the amenities was OK it was not great. For example, I've seen better towels in a lower end chain hotel. If you want to charge big $$$ one of the must-haves is nice towels. So go there for the location and the nice people. Go there for the carosel bar and the history of the building. But I do hope that they will figure out that they need to continue to improve or they won't have much of a "brand" to promote.

Reviews.Title: “Well located but a little steep.”
Reviews.Author: Palman13
Reviews.Content: We were coming to New Orleans for parents weekend and it turned out hotel prices were a bit steep. Turns out there were many activities going on in town this weekend so all hotels prices were high. Originally made reservation at another hotel but saw the reviews on tripadvisor were in the 80s so had seen Monteleone on previous NOLA trips and the tripadvisor ratings were good and price was competitive. Overall the hotel was good, good location to Quarter and good service. It was steep because the price was a little steep for the size of the room which was tight with the king bed. The valet parking added to the cost but necessary being in the heart of the Quarter. May want to upgrade next time to a bigger room or Jr. Suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TurtleTurtle
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat. Off Royal Street, one block from Bourbon Street. Yes, the room and bathroom is small. Great water pressure in the shower! Internet was a bit pricey, the had two plans. Opted for the $10 plan, and service seemed pretty slow. The only thing that could have been improved was the timing of the cleaning service. We normally get off to an early start and come back to the room in the late afternoon for a break. Our room was never cleaned by that time or we were in the room when they wanted to clean. However, this was probably luck of the draw for the floor we were on. Also, friendly/professional staff. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Thief Amongst Us”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghMS
Reviews.Content: Do not, even accidentally, leave any valuables unsecured in your hotel room because the staff will steal them. The hotel management will not only do nothing about it, they will have the exact same staff be assigned to clean your room for the remainder of your stay. Otherwise, a beautiful hotel in the heart of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Karlyforet
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful historic hotel. Guest rooms were kind of small but it's a historic building. Great location. Right off of fabolous bourbon street!!

Reviews.Title: “Historic and Cool!”
Reviews.Author: The_Traveling_Texan3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week while I was on a business trip. The hotel had just finished a remodel and was looking great. We had been told that this was one of the most haunted hotels in New Orleans...no dice on actually seeing a ghost though. It's in a great location and though it may be on the pricey side it's well worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: swmasson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week for a shirt vacation... We enjoyed staying at the hotel, which was really nice, the rooms were a little small but was probably spoilt after a couple weeks in a Houston hotel... Roof top pool was really nice and relaxing, spa was decent, carousel bar was enjoyable and the gereal location of the hotel couldn't have been better! Parking was a little expensive at $30 per day and they charged $10 per day for Internet... So costs during the stay increase significantly... All in, I would recommend this hotel to most people, but be prepared to part with a lot of cash, value for money is maybe not the best, but still a great vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: MargaretJay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights. I've given it 5 stars for everything as I really couldn't fault it. I had joined the Iprefer scheme fortunately so Internet was free and fast.And I was given a voucher for a free cocktail at the Carousel Bar, a great place! Service was excellent. Breakfast was great: a free continental breakfast while the restaurants are being renovated. But I don't take a cooked breakfast and there was a wonderful amount and variety of fruit, which I particularly like. The room was lovely, and will be hard to beat on my current trip of USA using 12 different hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: LillyAtlanta
Reviews.Content: If you want to be centrally located in the French Quarter, Hotel Monteleone is your place. Convenient to everthing from the Riverwalk/Jackson Square to spots on Bourbon and shops on Royal. Hotel is very old school elegant, with the funky revolving Carousel bar providing a good setting for a late night apertif. The bar could use a bit of a facelift (duct tape was covering several rips on the black leatherette banquettes) but the other restaurant areas are in mid-renovation so the Carousel could be on the list. Speaking of renovation, as a favor to guests who were unable to eat in the hotel restaurants the hotel offered free continental breakfast. Nice perk but "free" created a cattle car type atmosphere, as people were lined up four deep waiting for tables in a tiny makeshift dining room. Also, they happened to choose a room that was directly above the renovation work, so drills and chainsaws were buzzing away loudly during breakfast. I'd skip the breakfast, or get it to go. Another small complaint was the hassle in retrieving a valet parked car. Waited for over 1/2 hour for the car and then as I was trying to drive out, I was totally blocked by a car the valet just left in the garage entrance. Had to wait another 10 minutes for them to undo the parking mess. I'd definitely opt to self park if I had to do it over again. All in all, the service at the hotel and the atmosphere is top notch. And did I mention the location?? Rooms were small but elegant and the beds were comfortable. Can't wait to stay there again when they finish the facelift.

Reviews.Title: “great choice!”
Reviews.Author: adancewriter
Reviews.Content: This hotel proved to be a great choice for our one night stay in the french quarter -- the service was great and everything was clean. We ordered room service for dinner and it was very good! Only drawback was that the room was very small -- but I think that's true for all the older hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Again”
Reviews.Author: Jelo11
Reviews.Content: Hosted a perspective customer from Argentina. Hotel stay was fantastic. Have stayed at the Monteleone four times in the last two years and never had any issues. In a normal year I spend 100 nights in a hotel and this hotel is in the top 5. Location is wonderful for access to Bourbon Street and restaurants along with shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: BarleyHops
Reviews.Content: The outside might look plain, but the inside is just beautiful. Make sure to check out the roof top pool and the Carousel Bar. The service is excellent and the hotel is only a couple blocks away from everything. The only reason I gave it 4 out of 5 stars is that the hotel was a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tony M
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely impressed with the hotel as a whole. The front desk staff were helpful and very friendly. We did not have a long check-in process, and they called us when the room was ready! The lobby was absolutely gorgeous replete with wonderful antiques that we really enjoyed. The rooms were small, but quaint, and very clean. Also, the towels were plentiful, and we really appreciated this, as there was no shortage during our stay. What stood out the most was how friendly everyone was, and how willing they were to help us with any questions! Also, due to renovation occurring, we were granted a free breakfast, which was just splendid--fresh fruit and all. It was our first trip ever to New Orleans, and when we return, we will definitely stay at the Hotel Monteleon. And, when, you go make sure to say hello to Lucy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kapper5
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monteleone is situated in a great location, however, it comes at a price... Noise level. If you enjoy a peaceful sleep, ask for a room on the fourteenth floor away from the elevators and facing the Mississippi. Also, be prepared to pay extra if you have more than two people in a room... We were charged an additional $30.00 a night for a third person. Wifi is also an additional charge... between $9.00-15.00 a night. The rooftop pool was very relaxing. We had beautiful weather during our stay, so it was really nice to have access to an outdoor pool. The hotel just needs to turn up the pool heat a few notches. If you can, try to avoid ordering any food from the pool area as two of our three orders were incorrect. The hotel is currently under renovations and offers its guests a free continental breakfast. We found this convenient as our group didn't care to search for a place to eat first thing in the morning. Arrive before 8:00am to avoid a line that stretches down the hall, around the corner and into the hotel gift shop. All in all, my visit to Nola was one of my favorites trips to date. I will definitely be back... I just don't know if I'll be back to the Hotel Monteleone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jay T
Reviews.Content: We arrived and did not like the floor we were on, we like the lower floors and were immediately switched. The rooms were clean and the beds were wonderful. The pillows were wonderful. I usually bring my own and I wanted to bring these home. It was not noisey and we were on the 5th floor. Really enjoyed the the carosel Bar. They had the best drinks and the people all around were very friendly. A great time. The hotel has a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michellegfs
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, but a bit worn (like most of the hotels in the French Quarter). I think a little work on sprucing up the hotel would make it fantastic. All and all, a good, New Orleans experience.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been something special......”
Reviews.Author: huntow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a weekend in New Orleans as a quick getaway. I had wanted to take her there for some time as I had been there for work numerous occasions and enjoyed the city. After much research, I opted for Hotel Monteleone because of its location, reputation, and old New Orleans charm. I also got a good rate on Get A Room.com which was slightly less than other comparable hotels near the FQ. But in hindsight, I regret my decision. Although the staff were professional and check in was easy, the room was a disappointment. I expected it to be on the small side based on reviews I read, but I did not expect it to smell old and dank. My wife called and asked for a different room, but were told there would be a wait involved, so we decided not to worry since we would not be in the room much. We tried to take brief nap, but there was too much commotion and noise ( a sign of bad things to come!) We straightened up and headed out to explore the city. The Carousel Bar was cool. It was small as well, but packed and had a good vibe. The cocktail menu was impressive and our drinks were excellent. That was the highlight of our stay. Although we enjoyed the city very much, when we came back to our room around 11 PM, the noise was unbelievable. It seems as though the walls are paper thin. We were on the 4th floor, but we could hear people's conversations on the street outside our window as well as in the hall through our door. My wife had ear plugs but said she could still hear music and some voices. I could hear horns until about 2 AM and could hear every voice anytime someone spoke in the hall. I heard yelling on the street when the bars closed around 4 AM. This was the least noise-proof room I have ever stayed in my lifetime. Needless to say, I did not sleep much that trip. The next morning, we went to have continental breakfast, and there was a cluster of people. The line wrapped around the hallway, and even though they offered plates to go, the coffee pot was set up right next to the hostess stand, so it was an absolute cluster. We checked out and left to go to the French Market instead, passing on the "free breakfast". It seems as though they are renovating this hotel and it may be improved somewhat in the coming months, but beware. If you value your sleep, unless they soundproof the rooms/windows/doors better than what they have today, you will not sleep well at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Dingo06
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and nice but the rooms and bathrooms are just a tad small. It is fine for one or two people. The Hotel location is excellent. Easy access to Bourbon Street yet far enough away so that you don't get the noise and crazy. Staff is polite and very accommodating. Breakfast just okay but I stayed during the time that the hotel's restaurant is under renovation. I prefer something a little more substantial in the morning. Carousel Bar is nice. If you donâ€™t mind the small rooms/bathrooms then I recommend this place. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: John_of_GA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monteleone as part of a convention for three nights. While the hotel is well-situated, it has more than its fair share of problems that need to be resolved before it is a true four-star hotel. Upon arrival, the bellman helped me with my luggage up the 5-6 steps from the street to the lobby and the front desk staff handled check-in very efficiently. The hotel's convention facilities are under construction so most of our meetings were held in the Marriott 2 1/2 blocks away - not a big deal. There really wasn't a big deal problem, just several nits. First, "traditional" is a euphemism for tiny, as my traditional room was very small. The A/C could not be controlled - it was always cold even when the thermostat was set on 80F. The maintenance man had to adjust it from the hall closet. The flat screen TV was nice, but I did not get any of the local (ABC, CBS, FOX, NBC) stations. The bathroom had a nice finish, but the toilet was so close to the sink that my shoulder touched it. One bottle of water was in the mini-fridge, but it was never replaced. The mini-fridge could not reach a cool temperature - milk surely would have spoiled. The hotel claims it is AAA 4 diamond, but turndown service is not offered automatically. The second night I requested it, and it was a total joke. The maid placed a chocolate on the bed but did not remove the bedspread, turn down the sheets or remove the throw pillows. She removed two wet towels and the bath mat from the bathroom but did not replace them. She was probably in the room a total of 30 seconds. The bathroom did have plenty of hot water and good water pressure. One afternoon, my meetings ended early and I tried to catch up on e-mails in the room. It was hard to concentrate with the maids yelling up and down the hall to each other. Luckily, I didn't hear any hall noise at night. The Carousel Bar is nice if a bit kitschy with its rotating bar, but is very $$$. I asked the waitress for the price of a drink and she said it was "either $6.50 or $7.50." When she brought the check the drink was listed as $9.25. She said, "Sorry" as she dropped off the check and kept walking. Unbelievable. And, don't order a martini unless you're on an expense account - those run $15.00. The rooftop pool was very pleasant and the hotel had a nice continental breakfast set up at no charge due to the restaurant reconstruction. The breakfast waitress was friendly and kept my coffee topped off. A hostess sat you at a properly set table, so it was much better than your typical motel continental breakfast free-for-all. The hotel lobby is what you expect a grand hotel lobby to look like - very nice and old-school. Check-out was quick and seamless and the bellman made sure that my taxi accepted credit cards. Would I recommend this hotel? That is a difficult question. The location is excellent and the front desk staff is wonderful. However, the tiny room had more problems than it had square feet. Unless you upgrade above the standard/traditional room, I think you can do much better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Girls Night/Weekend”
Reviews.Author: DCTower
Reviews.Content: I loved their location and outside pool courtyard. It was gorgeous. The rooms were nice, and the bathrooms larger than some of the older hotels. We had two beds and four of us shared a room. The beds were great, and I loved that they gave us a firm AND soft pillow so that you had your choice, that was a very nice touch. Good location, just one block off Bourbon between Conti and Iberville which I love because I just toddle straight down Iberville to Acme Oyster House!! It was also just a block away from our favorite bar the Famous Door. The concierge was not very helpful, luckily I come back to NO every year so that was not critical, but everything else was great. I would stay here for business, family, solo or friends, if I was a couple I would find something a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JasonBCessna310
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be in the absolute best location to access the french Quarter. The rooms are very clean and an amazing value relative to the other hotels in the area. The staff was a bit indifferent when asking questions about location of tourist attractions. I imagine they have so many patrons asking them the same questions over and over they become apathetic. Overall an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SonyaDye
Reviews.Content: I booked four rooms for a friend's 40th bday party this past weekend (Sept 24 2011). We ended up not needing one room and called exactly 24 hours in advance to cancel the room. The reservations lady said you will be charged no matter what bc there is a 72 hour cancellation policy. I would think 24 hours is sufficient!!! Not to mention, one friend needed her room for another night so we were still spending the exact same amount of money. So, We arrive to check in and they demanded that we still pay for the room we did not need ($300.00 might I add). We stood at the counter for 30 minutes trying to get checked in. (They said "Christian" was the mgr on duty who wouldn't let us out of our room) After I was charged for the room, they did not even give me a key to it!! I had to ask for the key to the room I was charged $300 for! Anyway, this was the start to a fun weekend planned in New Orleans and it was ruined by the hassle and run around given by the staff at the Monteleone. Obviously, they only care about ripping their customers off instead of making it an enjoyable experience. We went straight to the Ritz Carlton around the corner to have drinks because we did not want to spend another dime at the Monteleone. Of course, you can imagine the difference in customer service. If I were you, I would book at the Ritz where you will be treated like you should be!! I will NEVER stay at the Monteleone again!! EVER! OH!! one more thing...be sure to check the price they quote you for room and the price they print on your bill when you get there. Totally ridiculous! Sonya Dye

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 243travel
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4) stayed at Hotel Monteleone during Christmas in 2010. We were travelling with our children and for the first time our dogs. It was a great choice. Perfectly located, beautiful hotel, warm friendly staff. Our suite was spacious enough for all of us. It's an easy walk into the "fun areas" but while inside the room you don't hear any noise. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: seashell3
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! There were four adults and three children, including a 5-year old, and EVERYONE enjoyed this lovely, historic hotel. The location in the French Quarter is one block off of Bourbon Street. The good news is that we never heard any B-Street noise. AND the good news is that both of our rooms had beautiful views, including a view of the river. We had requested two rooms adjoining or near each other and they accommodated us beautifully with rooms across from one another. There is some construction going on but we never heard any noise from it and it did not disturb the lovely ambience of the Carousel Bar. The continental breakfast buffet was one of the finest I've ever seen with fresh pastries and croissant, none of your packaged stuff. The staff treated the children very well and it was a chance for our grandchildren to get a taste of an elegant hotel and how they should behave in it!!! There is a delightful pool on the roof, with plenty of chairs and towels. The children really enjoyed that. And there is a bar as well. The pool is of a goodly size and they use some of the newer chemicals - not chlorine. There are antique stores and bookstores in the immediate area and the French Market is probably a 20-minute, fascinating walk away. That's assuming you won't stop at any of the stores and the fact is that you probably will! The hotel has a fascinating history which includes quite a few famous names. It also is said to be haunted, although we did not have the pleasure of meeting any of the resident spirits. I WILL come back to New Orleans and I WILL stay at the Monteleone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Wardy1950
Reviews.Content: Enjoy this beautiful old hotel situated in the heart of the French Quarter. Check in and out was very efficient. Super clean with friendly staff. We stayed 4 nights in early September and although they are in an "under construction" mode we never heard a thing. We were offered free Continental Breakfast for an inconvenice the construction may have caused, but there was none!!! Rooms are fairly small but very clean and the beds were excellent. I would highly recommend. There have been quite a few movies filmed at this hotel, probably the most know was "Double Jeopardy" with Ashley Judd. Just a little trivia!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff”
Reviews.Author: childofchaos
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a prime location in the heart of the French Quarter. The room we had was a bit small but enjoyable nonetheless. The staff was the most friendly and attentive I've ever had the pleasure to deal with at a hotel. We had requested a fan to help with air circulation and the staff sent one up within 15 minutes of our request. Room service was also quite fast. The staff was very knowledgeable about the best places to dine or even have food delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: BeachbumAggie
Reviews.Content: Hubs and I spent 4 nights at the Hotel Monteleone, we booked in June and got a very good price due to the renovations I guess, we were in no way bothered nor did we ever hear any noise so that was a really great deal!! Our room walk on the 12th floor facing Bourbon so we had a neat rooftop view of FQ. The rooftop pool has a fabulous view and the gym has great views of the river and the FQ-the weather was so nice that I walked outside daily but it's good to know that their cardio machines have such a view with walls of windows!! The staff were very friendly, especially the gentlemen working the front door-not sure if they're bellmen, porters or what exactly but they opened and held the heavy doors and called our cabs and chatted and were so friendly every time we walked in our out. The gentleman working the baggage check room was a sweatheart to visit with, the front desk was helpful and prompt. Only complaint was that hubs had do not disturb sign out until noon on Sunday but then took it down, when we returned to room at 2 it hadn't been cleaned, when we returned at 4:30 it still hadn't been cleaned so we just called for towels, when we returned late at night we had a 7:30pm voicemail from housekeeping wanting to be sure that we'd decline our cleaning for the day-we'd not but it was a little late by then. Otherwise our housekeeping was good, they were very friendly. We did have the alarm system go off on our floor at 4:30 am one night, I'm assuming a drunk pulled the fire alarm but I never asked. We had to throw on some clothes, grab purse and wallet and jewelry and head out of room, luckily someone from staff met folks in the stairs to advise that it was a false alarm-it took about 15 minutes for the very loud alarm to cease-not too fun at that hour but I doubt that was the hotel's fault and the staff were again helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel review”
Reviews.Author: ginny k
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff. Rooms are very nice bed is very comfy. I prefer to stay at hotels such as this instead of chains. Pool was clean with bar service and food service. Frenchman Street was a nice change from Bourbon Street, jazz venues were good. WWII museum a must see and Garden/Cemetary tour was informative and interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jfmayo
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to New Orleans and we chose to stay at the Hotel Monteleone because a friend recommended it to us. It is a terrific place to stay. The staff is friendly, the premise clean, and the beds comfortable. Because we had a lot of activities packed into the day, we didn't spend much time in our room, but the time we did spend was perfect. The staff was pleasant and were very accomadating. This is definitely one great place to stay and we'll be staying there again when we go to New Orleans next year.

Reviews.Title: “Really beautiful hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: cassijensen
Reviews.Content: It is just lovely, perfect location. right in the French Quarter, so everything is close by. The staff went out of their way to be helpful, and everyone was very friendly and professional. Our room was small but well laid out and comfortable and beautifully decorated. The free continental breakfast was a great way to start off the day; loved the rooftop pool, and even the Carousel Bar was pretty cool, for only one drink though.. it kind of made me feel dizzy! As other reviewers have said, it's close enough to Bourbon Street, that you can visit and then escape back to the hotel. Royal Street itself is fun to walk along and window shop as it is mostly antiques and art, beautifully displayed. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, absolutely loved it~

Reviews.Title: “A SOLID A”
Reviews.Author: dennis248
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at the Hotel Monteleone. The Monteleone gets a solid A. The rooms are clean and comfortable although the bathroom was a bit small. The staff was top notch especially the front desk assistant Danielle. She helped me pick out the right room when I checked in and assisted with a billing problem at check out, she's quite an asset. If you get a chance spent a day at the Monteleone's spa, it was an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gordon55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel twice and found the rooms, although on the small side, to be very comfortable and clean. The hotel is located in the center of the French Quarter and the roof top pool, bar and exercise facilities are outstanding. They also offered an excellent free continental breakfast during the almost completed renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: TO_traveller41
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very well located close to Bourbon St., but not too close so that you could escape the craziness. We loved the Carousel bar located off the lobby with the rotating bar. It was a great spot to perch and watch the world go by. We could easily walk to the waterfront, markets and attractions. Hotel rooms were a bit small (it is an older hotel) but clean and well maintained. The beds were quite soft, but I like a firm mattress, so that is just me. The rooftop pool was fabulous. It was a great spot to relax with swim and a drink after a long day. Definitely a pricier option for hotels in that area, but you do get what you pay for. Recommended hotel for visitors to the French Quarter

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! A must see for 1st time visitors to New Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: WhoDatAdvisor
Reviews.Content: My wife and have stayed at this Hotel several times but the most recent is when we were married there this past May. There is not anything bad I can say about this place, employees, food. Excellent service, Amazing food. My wife felt like a princess. The carousel bar is the most original place to have a cocktail in all of the city. You will not be let down with your stay here unless you dislike a great location and an upscale experience. We will always come back to Hotel Monteleone.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: cathybirdlady
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pricey, but worth it. The room was large and comfortable, and the lobby is opulent and lovely. The location is ideal--just far away enough from Bourbon St. to be quiet, close to many French Quarter restaurants and attractions, quick walk to Canal St. and the streetcars, convenient to the Convention Center (which is why we were in town). The view of the river out the window of our room was worth the price! Unfortunately, I did not encounter any of the reputed ghosts, which I was hoping for--despite staying on the "13th" (marked 14th) floor. My traveling companion made daily use of the fitness center and pool, and was very pleased with them.

Reviews.Title: “a great girlfriends getaway!”
Reviews.Author: bgaddmarve
Reviews.Content: What a spectacular place! While the hotel is older, it has been maintained well and still retains its old school luxury, charm and appearance. The best part? It is close to all of New Orleans' great shops and restaurants. It is within walking distance of anything and everything that is worth seeing in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Logan25
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Hotel Monteleone from Sept 7-10, 2011. The hotel was lovely. The rooms were small but clean. We had a preferred double room on the 14th floor. Thought we were to have a view of the river but we didn't we overlooked the street. Didn't really matter as we were hardly in the room. The beds were very comfortable. Water pressure was amazing. We could faintly hear outside noise at night but not enough to disturb our sleep. However on Friday night there was a group of people who decided to party in the hallway. We called security and it didn't last long. The doormen are wonderful, so friendly and had good tips on restaurants, sightseeing etc. The hotel was under construction but other than the sidewalk being blocked didn't notice it at all. The free contintental breakfast had a great selection and the staff was very attentive to refilling coffee cups and clearing dishes. It was really quiet while we were there so had no problems with line ups as others have. We went up to check out the pool and it was a nice size and a good area. The lobby is gorgeous. The Carousel bar was fun and the bartenders were very friendly and took the time to stand and chat. The hotel is close to all the shops on Royal Street and to many wonderful restaurants. I would highly recommend the Monteleone to anyone who wanted to be in the Quarter but away from all the noise and crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Spinner101
Reviews.Content: Older hotel. Much history. Staff was helpful and the service was good. Close to all things in the French Quarter.Would stay there again. Thin walls though, heard partying next door untill 5am.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: dechalk
Reviews.Content: We arrived early for check in due to flight changes, so had to wait a while for a room to be ready, but we still got the room long before official check in time. The staff (particularly Danielle) were very helpful and we cannot speak highly enough of them (again, especially Danielle who went out of her way to be helpful to us). The hotel is a fantastic old hotel with recent renovations (still ongoing in the restaurant area). It reminded us very much of the Waldorf Astoria, with it's old world charm annd high quality service and facilities. The position is perfect, close to Canal Street and Bourbon Street (do not stay ON Bourbon Street if you wish to sleep). If we return to New Orleans, we will stay in the Monteleone.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean!”
Reviews.Author: ccarterk1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel!! Great little perks. Bathroom mirror treated so it doesn't fog. Robes. Great continental breakfast. Middle of town, but far enough that there is not a ton of street noise. Very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, large in quality”
Reviews.Author: jsandoval562
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay. I might have been in the Carousel Lounge at the same time as noted by one of the other reviewers. The bartenders were very attentive. They took the time to remember my name when I paid with a credit card. They set the tone for a very friendly atmosphere. I had a positive experience with everyone that I encountered during my stay. Housekeepers, frontdesk, doormen, etc .

Reviews.Title: “Great old New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KJUNBEACH
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here and absolutely love it! The rooms are relatively small but big enough for 2. The beds are very comfortable and all the staff from the parking garage to the front desk are wonderful. The hotel is undergoing renovations so the guests were provided a free continental breakfast. Expecting stale donuts and cereal, were were very pleasantly surprised by an abundance of fresh (house made) pastries, great coffee, beautiful fruit, cereal, bagels and bread. The waitress was a real sweetheart who made sure our cups were always full without hovering. One of these days we hope to time our trip right so we can sit at the Carousel Bar which is always full. We even had a thank you note when we checked in for returning to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: janeausten4ever
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for many reasons. Historic, walking distance to French Quarter (not on Bourbon Street) and Streetcars, non-smoking. What an amazing experience. Our room was large, recently upgraded. Concierge was knowledgeable and helpful. But the most wonderful person at the hotel is Lucille, serving complimentary breakfast buffet in the Grand Salon. Lucilleâ€™s friendliness and positive attitude, along with attention to detail allowed us to start each day with a smile on our face.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but lousy service at the Carousel bar”
Reviews.Author: Vicki F
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel through A/Express travel-paid for continental breakfast with hotel booking, the breakfast turned out to be complimentary because of construction. Upon arrival, the hotel staff that checked us in was very aggressive about "no guarantees because you booked through Travelocity and not the Hotel" which we didn't- really a snooty young lady, but we kept our cool because it was a Saturday night and we had a 3 night stay ahead of us and needed the two rooms we had paid for. Rooms are small, but very nice (European style), hotel is close to everything. Only other issue was the HORRIBLE Carousel bar. Four of us sat down at the bar (last day of our trip), the bartender carded our two daughters, laid the napkins down, and walked away. Proceeded to serve/make drinks for another couple, two ladies and then a guy that came in after us, while two other bartender/helpers cleaned galsses. Three of us got up and walked out, while my husband asked the bartender what the problem was, why wouldn't he take our order? The bartender turned out to be the MANAGER of the bar (after my husband asked to speak to the Manager)- not only did he lose our business, but future hotel customers-we were really disgusted by his customer service and attitude-

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: dr_iggy
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel. Despite its size, it has a very homely feel. The service is impeccable, and as many previous reviews have noted, the location superb. I was fortunate to snag a very advantageous mid-summer rate which included a complementary breakfast, all to compensate for the remodelling of the downstairs restaurant area. This was a generous offer considering these renovations were not at all intrusive or noisy. My room was immaculate and beautifully decorated, with a great view over the French Quarter and beyond. I also loved New Orleans itself! The locals are great - so welcoming and laid-back. Anyone who has not been to this fascinating, friendly city should put it onto their list immediately! I can't wait to get back here - and I will certainly be booking the Monteleone again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DCSpartan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monteleone for a family wedding in late August. The hotel is absolutely beautiful-- from the lobby to the guest rooms. Service was wonderful; due to flight cancellations and rebookings, we had to extend and shorten our stay more than once while we were there, and they couldn't be more accommodating or efficient. Location is great; close to Bourbon but not on it, meaning it was not loud and crazy during the evenings. The rooms are small, as expected in an older facility, but they are nicely appointed. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “our honeymoon couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: unplainjane
Reviews.Content: Just came back from an incredible 4 night stay. We came here for our honeymoon as we wanted a hotel that was a bit more high end, had a boutique feel, but was still reasonably priced. As well the roof top pool sealed the deal. We found a great rate on their site which was a $500 for 4 nights for a king room. And we selected the upgrade for the preferred king which was $15 a night extra if they had availability when we arrived. When I booked the room I wrote in the requests area that we were on our honeymoon and that we would like a quiet room on an upper floor. When we got there the front desk lady was very pleasant and told us that they upgraded us to the vieux room on the top floor which was a very big upgrade as itâ€™s pretty much a suite. Huge score! As well she gave us a congratulations card from the hotel that had 2 complimentary drink tickets for the carousel bar. The drinks at the carousel bar are a bit expensive so we were so happy to receive that as well. The room was big and beautiful. The bathroom was especially luxurious with a jacuzzi tub. We couldnâ€™t haved asked for anything nicer. The carousel bar was very unique. I would definitely have a drink there. Strong drinks and great service. I never got a chance to use the pool as it was so hot during the day that the last thing I wanted to do when I got back to the hotel was roast in the sun. but my husband used it but because the pool is small found it too busy to really enjoy it. He said there really wasnâ€™t room to actually swim. There are lots of lounge chairs and he enjoyed sitting up there but found the bar drinks expensive. Breakfast every morning was great. I wasnâ€™t expecting much as I heard there would be lineups. Weâ€™re not very patient for our coffee in the morning so I almost expected to have breakfast at a close by cafÃ©. But we headed down at 8am every morning and got seated immediately every time. Breakfast options were very nice with lots of fresh fruit, nice pastries, cereals, breakfast breads, and freshly squeezed juices. Service was excellent during breakfast. In the evening we would often take cabs and the doormen were always prompt and friendly and hailed us cabs quickly. The location of the hotel is fantastic too. Right in the middle of everything so walking around to all the shops was easy. Itâ€™s only a couple of blocks from bourban street but you would never know it as the hotel is very quiet. As well there is a walgreens next door which was very convenient. Definitely eat at mr. bâ€™s bistro across the street. It was the best meal we had during our stay. As well the acme oyster house around the corner was great too for lunch. I would highly recommend hotel monteleone. The service, location, and rooms were all great and made our honeymoon fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully renovated, will definitely stay again next trip”
Reviews.Author: AmyGOhio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in the French Quarter on Royal st. The rooms were recently refurbished and are clean and lovely. The only thing that keeps it from a 5 star rating is that the rooms are on the small side. Staff is helpful, plumbing fixture are new, and the maid left the room spotless every day. The bed is super comfortable. Highly recommended! We used to stay at the W French Qtr, but this is our new hotel of choice..

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: HKFoodie
Reviews.Content: At $226 p.n. (inc), Hotel Monteleone is good choice if you want to stay in the French Quarter at reasonable price. The rooms are nice size although the discount rooms have no views. We received free breakfast while the hotel was remodeling part of their ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, wonderful room, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a New Orleans stay. Old world environment, gracious staff, elegant.

Reviews.Title: “We can't say enough good things! amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: adrienne r
Reviews.Content: We were only here 1 night and that is truly a shame because from the minute we arrived, we were in love with this hotel. Because it was our honeymoon, the hotel was very generous. I loved the little extra touch of a congratulations card. the staff were amazing, especially their doorman who had us in stitches. always pleasant and helpful. i've travelled all over the world my whole life and this is truly one of the best hotels in which i have ever stayed. if I/we ever return to new orleans, this is the only hotel in which we would consider staying.

Reviews.Title: “A cool jewel in the sleazy heat of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: TrippoDicko
