Reviews.Content: Magnificent hotel that puts customer right at the heart of its offer. Small but comfortable rooms, great location, bags of old-world charm. Superb rooftop pool (best avoided at the weekend when it is full of pig-ignorant redneck fratboys). Special mention to the lovely Danielle on Front Desk who sent fresh milk and cookies to my room (no charge) when she discovered it was my little boy's 9th birthday. She was absolutely perfect. Just like her hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Michael267
Reviews.Content: The Monteleone was a charming old world hotel, with southern charm and a New Orleans experience. The room was small, but well decorated, if not over decorated, and clean. Upon entering the hotel, one is immediately struck by the hotel's opulence and royal treatment by the staff. The concierge gave us great tips regarding local eateries and local points of interests. I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Bayou_Believer
Reviews.Content: We go to New Orleans often and generally stay in the quarter or on Poydras if going to a conference or Saints or Hornets game. Hotel Monteleone's location is the best in the quarter as far as we are concerned. Closest to everything but just a block off of the loudest activity so you can still sleep. Just know that currently the restaurant is being remodeled but Mr. B's is across the street. The remodeling did not interfere with our stay but there can be an elevator wait.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hotel in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: murphthesurf1
Reviews.Content: First Class Hotel in the Quarter, near everything ~ I will stay here again next year, if they are not sold out ! Old World Service - at a reasonable price Great Pool and Carousel Bar ! Btw- We actually stayed here in January 2010, the radio box did not have a drop down for that, still, the Nicest Hotel in the Quarter !~

Reviews.Title: “Vehicle vandalized in the garage - will never stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: eeewelch
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Monteleone numerous times. My parents stay there, my grandparents stayed their on their honeymoon back in the 30's. It's a true gem in the city of New Orleans and was my favorite place to stay until last weekend. My husband and I visit New Orleans at least once a year and always try to go for my birthday in August. This year a friend was having his wedding at the same time and blocked rooms at the Monteleone. We checked in on Friday and left our car with the garage. We never saw, accessed or drove the car until we checked out on Sunday. When we picked it up I walked around the outside to check for damage and my husband checked the console glove box in between the seats. Everything seemed ok. I got on my phone to call my mom to tell her we were leaving and checked Map Quest about the detour on I-10. I regret not paying more attention to the inside of our SUV. On our way home we noticed "Steve" carved into the INSIDE of the passenger side door. The angle is such thought that the vandal had to be standing outside the car, which we thought was strange. I immediately called the hotel and were told to email pictures which I promptly did from my phone. The next day we were told that the security tapes were viewed and they saw no wrong doing. SInce I know that "Steve" has never been in my car and this damage was not there before my stay I asked to speak to the manager. He called us two days later and told us the same thing, he viewed the tapes and saw no wrong doing. He did tell us that it is hotel policy that the windows of all vehicles are left down and the keys in the ignition, confirming what we thought about the signature. He assured us only employees could access the elevator to the cars. Well obviously that is not true or one of the employees did this. The staff has always been wonderful and I know most of them have been employed there for quite some time so I doubt it was a staff member. I'm sure it had to been someone who accessed the garage somehow. The parking manager also told us when we "return to the hotel" for another stay he's comp us overnight parking - as if we will be returning. I never plan to set foot in this hotel again. He didn't even offer to return our money for the $64 plus tax we spent on our trip to park in the garage over the weekend. If you do choose to stay at the Monteleone I HIGHLY suggest using another garage as theirs is not safe!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras was fabulous at the Monteleone!”
Reviews.Author: kkkkathy
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel about 5 days prior to Mardi Gras. The rooms are a bit small in the hotel but they are immaculate. We were able to hit some great restaurants nearby and the parades were just 1 1/2 blocks down to Canal Street. It was a great location, the staff was excellent and we are going back for mardi gras 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monteleone is a Stand Out in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: OutsideAnswers
Reviews.Content: There are many Hotels in New Orleans near the French Quarter but this one is such a stand out with their amenities, gorgeous rooms and decor, amazing food, the friendliest and most accommodating Staff. A big plus with me was the unbelievable comfortable beds and linens. To think that I actually slept till 8 each morning is RARE!!! There was even some remodeling taking place during our visit but you never felt any less about the ambiance. The Hotel did a fantastic job with written communication delivered to the rooms outlining any elevator changes or areas of the property that would be affected that day by the work crews. The front door men were so polite and very patient with our "how do we get there by foot" questions. I don't think I ever opened a door by myself going in and out. The pool on the roof was such a surprise and Spa Aria pampered us to total relaxation. That Spa is top notch with their staff, rooms and products used. Such a delight!! We both had such a grand time and even though the city is filled with boutique hotels and large Corporate owned chain hotels I felt at "home" at The Monteleone and plan to return......HOPEFULLY SOON.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel next to French Qtr”
Reviews.Author: desertpole
Reviews.Content: Good place to consider if staying in NOLA. Swimming pool on the roof was excellent. Clean and comfy beds. Hard working staffs and good breakfast. Vallet parking was combersome to get stuff out of the car, but they will keep the car until 5 PM which was very nice. Always have good tips handy for the parking staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fancy place.”
Reviews.Author: plmok
Reviews.Content: While the rooms were gorgeous, we were pretty cramped with 2 adults and 3 kids in a 2 bed room. Kids loved the idea of haunted rooms, and the location was great for exploring the French quarter. Courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: thatgrl88
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Monteleone! We are a family of 3 with a teenager. We booked this hotel off the reviews we saw here and were so happy with our choice! The hotel is in the perfect location. It is situated between Bourbon Street (1 block) and the river - about 5-6 blocks (where we booked quite a few tours). We are from the Boston area - so we thought a block would be pretty long- but the streets in the French Quarter are compact and narrow, so you can walk anywhere pretty quickly. The staff was wonderful and check-in was a breeze! We had a small issue with our bathroom light, but it turned out to be just the ground fault on the outlet. We fixed it ourselves just as the facilities employee arrived. So no big deal. He was great! The rooms are on the smaller side, but they are in every city we've been to. We didn't want to stay at a big chain - we wanted the whole New Orleans experience and a 125 year-old hotel that is said to be haunted fit the bill! We did not experience any visits from beyond....but.... I thought that the fog-free area on the bathroom mirror might be the work of a spirit...my husband convinced me it was the housekeeper....still - a really cool little touch that I have never seen at any other hotel. There was construction going on, but you'd never know it and the complimentary breakfast was more than adequate. Lucille, part of the breakfast staff was AMAZING!! She was so wonderful and attentive that we would go back just because of her!! Having a 14 year old, we didn't make it into the carousel bar, but it looked lovely and the rooftop pool was a treat!! It was really quiet at night and we were so happy to be just that far from Bourbon St., which was crazy...but an experience! Not recommended for small children!! So my best tips: 1. Cab it from the airport - it was $42 one way for the 3 of us and we tipped $10 We also booked him for the return trip so we wouldn't have to worry about it. We were lucky enough to get Daniel from Amazing Grace cab. 2. Beignets are awesome!! Get them daily just around the corner at Cafe Beignet at Music Legends park. We sat outside and enjoyed the live jazz. You can get coupons for a free small cafe au lait at the tour company by the river. We preferred this cafe to the famous Cafe du Monde - there's were good - but too similar to the fried dough in New England - we preferred the more doughnut like quality of Cafe Beignet's. 3. You really can fit a lot into just a few days....we had 3 full days - Rode the steamboat - don't get the meal ticket - you can get stuff onboard ala carte), visited the WWII museum (tour company by the river provides transportation with ticket purchase), took a Swamp Tour (way better than I thought it would be), went to the State museum, walked all over the Quarter, and heard Jazz at Irvin Mayfield's. Plus....went to tons of great restaurants. So much amazing food and music!! 4. If you can splurge - go to the Pelican Club restaurant....that was our personal favorite and just around the corner from the Monteleone. Dress is business casual. 5. You can follow @hotelmonteleone on Twitter and Facebook and also @VisitNewOrleans to know what's going on around the city and the hotel. Above all.....we loved the Monteleone!! Safe, quiet, clean, and friendly was our experience. We went on a whim through a vacation package with JetBlue and were so happy that we were able to choose the Monteleone!! If we're ever lucky enough to return, we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoyalSovereign
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the feel of a European continental hotel; it could be in Paris apart from the Monteleonâ€™s superior customer service. Its rooms are small but bright and clean. The hotelâ€™s location is excellent; in the French Quarter and surrounded by bars and restaurants. There was road works going on during our stay but we were not disturbed thanks to our high floor room. Staff were friendly and the Air-con was quiet and effective in the New Orleans steam. The Monteleon is a haven away from the heat and chaos of a good late night/early morning spent in the Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Does the AC not work? At least it is quiet !”
Reviews.Author: dnwarwas
Reviews.Content: I have to have it cold when I sleep. The room was barley cool. I would say 78. I put the thermostat on 60 and I never cooled down. Pillows sucked. There was a leak under the faucet in the bathroom. Only good thing was that it was quiet at night. No loud noise from the street! Just seemed like an average place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of the many choices!”
Reviews.Author: LuckyCat111
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights and couldn't have been happier with our choice. We have stayed at several of the best hotels in town and found this to be the best. It is the whole package. Royal Salon was spacious with a wonderful bathroom, a/c worked wonderfully, water pressure was great and king bed was very comfortable. All aspects of service were wonderful and it doesn't get any better than the Carousel Bar. Location is unbeatable. Construction is a non-issue. This will definitely be our new "go to" home in NOLA. Thank you Monteleone for our best trip yet!

Reviews.Title: “Very calm oasis, excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: pearscr0
Reviews.Content: Although there was some building work gooing on, this in no way spoiled our enjoyment of the hotel. all the staff were very friendly. The aircon in the room was pleasantly quiet (not often the case in the USA). The Carousel Bar was a nice novelty too - it carries the drinkers round every 15 minutes....

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A E
Reviews.Content: We visited New Orleans and didn't know quite what to expect. We had the most memorable time there. The Hotel Monteleone will always be our place to stay when we visit again. Our room was on the 12th floor and was quiet. The breakfast was wonderful. The staff treated us so nicely in every respect - the front desk, the two concierges, the bellmen, the garage attendants, and the breakfast wait staff. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful. We just had to have a drink one night at the Carousel Bar even though we never drink! We could walk to all of the sights from the hotel. It is located right in The French Quarter. Hope to go back again soon! Our thanks to everyone at the Hotel Monteleone.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, great service”
Reviews.Author: Aaron H
Reviews.Content: Very nice looking hotel with great customer service. I recommend the Carousel bar.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Atoche
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in French Quarter one street over from Bourbon St. Nestled among quaint antique shops but close to night time hustle of Bourbon St. The hotel is under renovations but it is a minor inconvenience except for restaurant availability for breakfast. Continental breakfast being served in a smaller room for now. The only place to stay in New Orleans. Clean, well appointed rooms,comfy king bed...miss it already!

Reviews.Title: “Went there for a medical conference!!!”
Reviews.Author: asefermd
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel in August 2011 for a medical conference. The hotel is nicely located in the FQ and everything of interest was in a walking distance. The service was horrible and no matter how much money I wanted to spend, the hotel staff made it impossible to spend it. Tried to book a spa package, they were rude and not very accomodating. Pre-ordered some champagne and chocolate covered strawberries, but never got them. The only excellence I saw during my stay was embodied in the one of the managers Mr. Bradley Latham, who made our stay bearable and did above and beyond to rectify all the mistakes others made. If I ever come back it would be because of his professionalism and the amazing people skils.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is....”
Reviews.Author: LasVega5
Reviews.Content: Reading the prior reviews, we were worried we had picked a bad hotel. Some folks loved it and other hated it. We were so relieved to find it was an excellent hotel, and you just have to take it as it is. The location is fantastic, right in the French Quarter. That said, 2 nights the jazz music kept up awake, and we were able to watch drug deals go down from our hotel window. Welcome to the French Quarter. The plus side is we were in a very safe, posh hotel and did not have to walk far to enjoy everything that Bourbon Street offers. The rooms are quite small, but big enough for Mom and I to enjoy the luxury of the room. The bathrooms are quite small, and get very hot as there is no vent/fan. It was big enough to do everything we needed to do, and we kept the door open so it was not such an oven. Some of the doormen were exceptional, but the one guy who only spoke German was terrible because he could not answer any questions. Why have a doorman who cannot communicate in english? The free breakfast had a very long wait every morning, but it was free. The hotel pool was very small, but it was on the rooftop, and had several seating options and very nice towels. We would stay there again for the price (got an excellent package with Frontier Fly Away Vacations-I will use their vacation packages for every trip in the future! Excellent service, value and options). We knew what to expect and enjoyed ourselves. The lobby was awesome, the location was awesome, just remember what the French Quarter is famous for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: hmp324
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay here for a long weekend trip to New Orleans. The location is ideal for exploring the French Quarter and the shops on Royal Street but also just steps from Canal St. and the streetcar. Every employee I encountered was pleasant and helpful, from the doorman to the front desk to housekeeping. I had a king bed room and while small, I would hardly call it cramped. The bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows. I did have noisy neighbors but it's New Orleans; you can't expect it to be as quiet as a nunnery! The only downside was the renovations that the hotel is undergoing. While the work is going on, continental breakfast was offered in a room that was too small for demand. There was a line out the door on a Friday morning. My friends and I decided not to wait and went to a local cafe instead. A shame since breakfast was included in the rate. Overall though, Hotel Monteleone is worth it and will be even better when the renovations are done.

Reviews.Title: “Hot fun in the summer time...”
Reviews.Author: southernstyle
Reviews.Content: We just celebrated our anniversary in New Orleans . Anyone who has every visited New Orleans in the summer is familiar with the intense heat and the high humidity. Be forewarned, if you can't stand the heat don't go in August. Since we had done this numerous times before, we chose to return. We stayed at the Monteleone, a beautiful, old hotel in the heart of the French Quarter. It is celebrating its 125th birthday this year. There is some renovation going on that involves the two restaurants that will continue until November. Room service, pool bar service and the light menu at the Carousel Bar is still available but not the restaurants themselves. To help compensate, all hotel guests were given a free continental breakfast. This is a minor inconvenience because there are so many restaurants, of all kinds and price ranges, within easy walking distance. We love the old hotel and its rich history and the effort that is made by the management and the staff to keep it alive and thriving. We will continue to make it our hotel of choice when we are in New Orleans. Be sure to visit the Carousel Bar if you go. It is just off the lobby and is looks like a brightly colored carousel that slowly rotates the bar stools, on the outer ring, around the centeral core of the bar. It is a wonderful place to spend time out of the heat of the summer. It has a good combination of locals as well as tourists. We did have one problem, a leaking shower. We made management aware, and without hesitation, they moved up to an up-graded room. If you are going to New Orleans, go by and say "Happy Birthday" to the Monteleone

Reviews.Title: “two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: joseiw
Reviews.Content: Very attentive staff and a clean, well run hotel in a quieter part of the quarter. TheCarousel is a great place to listen to an old piano and drink the house cocktail, the Vieux Carre.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: Gl64
Reviews.Content: i love this hotel, if you are from new orleans and want a nice classy breather, this is the place to go. the staff is incredible and the experience is always first class this is the only 5 star place in the city other than the roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historic Hotel..Fab location”
Reviews.Author: DOCJR
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days in a Junior suite and had a great time. The hotel is historic and old..but thats the way it should be. Romm was appointed well and housekeeping kept it immaculate. Great to be so close to Bourbon street but easy to escape from its maddness when the party is over! Would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and far enough away from the craziness of Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: AsISeeThem
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April 2011 and really enjoyed myself. The rooftop pool is a nice escape from the craziness of Bourbon Street revellers but close enough to dive into it any time you feel like it. It was within walking distance of Canal, Bourbon St. & the French Market. The Carousel Bar in the lobby was fun, featuring a Louie Prima tribute on Wednesday nights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Old New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: jrf1969
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful Anniversary getaway! Loved everything about the hotel. Location! Service! This hotel is a step back in time but with all modern amenities! Highly recommend & will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: LaurenS06090
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 4 nights at the Hotel Monteleone. I can't rave about it enough! the location is perfect, right near all of the action on Bourbon street, but a good block away so it's quiet. I was in town for business with another female from work and we both felt very safe walking around the hote; area. There was a police station close, and doormen always outside. The rooms were very clean and bigger than I expected. They are doing renovations to the hotel but no matter what time of day or night I went back to my room, I didn't hear a single noise from it. I believe they aren't placing guests in the sections they are redoing. You will not notice a single thing while you are there. No noise/dust/etc. Due to the renovation they are offering a bigger continental breakfast there. A ton of fresh fruit, coffee, pastry selection, cereal, yogurt and the like. All served in a dining room, and was very well done. White tableclothes, and perfect service. The second you are done with a plate or need a coffee refill it is taken care of. There is a cute logo shop there for some last minute things you may need, and hotel merchandise. You cna even purchase the bedding. And you will want to after using the hotel pillow. They were so comfortable! I didn't want to leave them. The carousel bar is fantastic. It slowly rotates while you are there, and the bartenders were very friendly and joked around with the guests. There are a ton of other places to eat and drink all around the area too. It was the perfect location for shopping, dining, bars, tours, and anything you could want to do. I can't wait to come back to New Orleans, and I will be staying at the Monteleone for sure. It really was a top notch experience, and I'll never even consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic New Orleans Experience”
Reviews.Author: craigo826
Reviews.Content: We are frequent guest and would recommend the Monteleone if you want to experience a superior relaxing lodging experience in the heart of the French Quarter. From its historic architecture, the elegant rooms and grand lobby, the helpful and service-oriented staff; you will be more than satisfied and like our family return often. While other hotels may offer fine amenities and promise an enchanting lodging experience; the Monteleone continues to stand out among the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtravelerfla
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a pleasure trip this week. Great choice in a great city

Reviews.Title: “Great locale for a girls trip!”
Reviews.Author: jacquiejune
Reviews.Content: Rooms were spacious and fairly quiet for such a raucous city! The rooftop pool is small but pretty. The jewel is the Carousel Bar downstairs, filled with locals and visitors alike. Close to great places to eat, music on Bourbon St.and some very cool shops too, like the custom hat store just down Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Veronicaj1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous, the Carousel Bar is fun, the locaton is perfect for walking to restaurants and shops. Mr. B's Bistro right across the street has delicious Barbequed Shrimp, recommend Acme Oyster Bar over Felix for its atmosphere and customer service. Do not recommend Pere Antoine on Royal Street - overpriced, overcooked bar food is what we found there. The bed was the most comfortable I've slept in. Would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “The Traditional King Room”
Reviews.Author: Radioheed
Reviews.Content: Be advised that the Traditional King is a very small room. Perfect for one person but fine for two. Â I hate to post something even remotely negative about this hotel, but I don't want to repeat what others have said before...or maybe I will! Â The location is PERFECT, I can't emphasize this enough! You can walk to everything but are still far enough away from the insanity on Bourbon to feel safe and have peace and quite. Â There is a walgreens right next door and a liquor store across the street from it that we used for snacks and cocktails under $10. The renovations being done are completely unnoticeable from inside. The carousel bar is wonderful, the food (even with the restaurant closed) is fantastic, and the service is beyond reproach! We got the summer special rate and had an 8th floor room with a partial view of the river and St. Louis Cathedral. Â Perfect for a romantic getaway! We even had a semi-celebrity encounter when Gov Edwards was checking in!

Reviews.Title: “Old & the real thing”
Reviews.Author: Gamocha
Reviews.Content: Not a pseudo-historic place with old-timey fittings, but a real place with stories to tell, comfortable rooms, great food and service, and a carousel bar!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for the price”
Reviews.Author: beenthere12
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money on a high floor for the view. It consisted of a dirty alley and a view of a hotel competitor. And don't count on the free breakfast they are offering while they remodel unless you are prepared to stand in long lines and wait. Considering the reputation of this hotel, I expected better service. However the location in the French Quarter is great, the doormen at the hotel are exceptional, and room service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: TomRinA2
Reviews.Content: I do not understand why you would stay anywhere else. Perfect location, friendly staff,elegant public areas. Cleaniness of room was exceptional, best made bed I have ever slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: MomMomGoose
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monteleone is absolutely beautiful, a truly grand hotel. We arrived late and due to a change in travel plans, had two separate reservations. Front desk staff were able to make our check in smooth and get us to our room quickly. The valet and bellman were wonderfully polite and friendly- our room was spacious and bedding was very comfortable. The location is also extremely convenient, walking distance to most activities. By this point in our trip, Hotel Monteleone had earned 5 stars, no questions asked. In fact, most of our stay earned 5 stars. Some highlights: -Excellent dinner room service with friendly staff -Beautiful roof-top pool with bar -Great rooms and bathrooms -Refrigerator in the room (very important when you have a young child who needs snacks and drinks regularly) We did run into a few unwelcome surprises though: -$30/night valet fee, which is really unavoidable (you don't have other choices for parking, as far as I could tell) -Valet was not very pleased (although they did accommodate) when we needed to retrieve items from our car the next day. It was clear they were inconvenienced. -Breakfast was not available except through room service. They posted a continental breakfast option by the elevators, but due to an event, it was canceled. There was no notice of this and we only found out because we asked. We were given vouchers to go to a nearby restaurant, only to be told (rudely) that we had missed the breakfast time (at 10:30 am). The vouchers were also valid for room service, so we returned to the hotel and ordered a continental breakfast which never arrived (we waited over an hour, with a starving 2 year old). The hotel manager was apologetic and refunded one night of parking, but didn't appear too sympathetic. -The pool closed for a private event one afternoon, which would have been fine, had we been given notice. As it was, I was swimming with my son and suddenly everyone else was gone... Not really a nice way to learn about the pool closing. When we asked, the front desk was able to tell us about alternative arrangements at a hotel pool around the corner. Again, it was made right, but we really had to ask before we were given information. Overall, the hotel was really very nice and most staff were exceptionally friendly and accommodating. Unfortunately, the negative experiences we did have really put a damper on our stay, especially since the breakfast issue was the day we were checking out. Number one tip: Be sure to ASK people when things are closed, etc. They don't post the information or make it easily available, so you need to be upfront.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Dame Hotel Could Use a Little Upgrading”
Reviews.Author: RedSabre
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been coming to New Orleans every year for Jazz Fest, and have always stayed at either the Royal Sonesta or the Ritz Carlton. This year, we decided to try the Monteleone for a slight change of scenery. Location-wise, being on Royal Street as opposed to Bourbon Street made a difference -- no need to push through throngs of inebriated people to enter the lobby, no need to worry about choosing an interior room to get a good night's sleep, and one block closer to the shuttle stop for the Jazz Fest buses. The public areas of this hotel are elegant in an old-timey way -- lots of marble, brass and crystal. The Carousel bar is a must-visit at least once. But there are several minor deficiencies in the hotel which certainly didn't spoil my trip but will make me try harder to get into my preferred hotels next time. In terms of reservations, the website for the hotel didn't let us specify that we preferred a king room instead of two doubles (either that, or our request wasn't honored); for two tall people, neither sleeping together on a double, nor sleeping separately on our own double, was ideal. The room, while clean and generally comfortable, could have used a bit of updating and freshening up, and the bedding was not the high-thread-count cotton I've come to expect even at mid-range business class hotels. We had long-ish waits for elevators, because there are only two, and the crowds in the lobby (which has lounging areas just outside the elevators) led to some clumsy maneuvering one leaving the elevator. That aside, the location is good, the hotel is reasonably comfortable, and the service was fine. But it's not my first choice of New Orleans hotels.

Reviews.Title: “a luxurious, comfortable, and historic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: StCharlesLA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in the New Orleans area, so we know the reputation of local hotels. Therefore, when we booked a room at the Monteleone, we knew it would be great. Everything about our stay was great. Throughout our stay, we continuously remarked to each other how caring and attentive the staff was; each department - from the parking garage to the front desk to housekeeping, dining, and the Carousel Lounge - were all at the top of their game. It was also amzaing how meticulously maintained this 125 year old was; we found no wear and tear anywhere - everything looked new! The decor is luxurious, with fine furnishings throughout the lobby and public areas, and beautiful wallcoverings throughout the corridors. We were first placed in what they call a "Traditional Double" room - it was beautiful and comfortable but somewhat cramped. Then we upgraded to a Vieux Carre Suite, and how sweet it was! With views overlooking the French Quarter and the Mississippi River, we were mesmerized. Two TV's, three phones, two bathrooms - one boasting marble floors, granite countertops, a Keurig coffee maker, a glass-enclosed shower and the very best jacuzzi I have ever been massaged by - and the bed...ooooh, the bed was so very comfortable! The spacious, well decorated living room (yes, the chairs were upholstered in the same pattern material as the drapes) made the suite all that much more of a retreat as we went back and forth on our daily outings in the French Quarter. Don't miss the rooftop pool! We love that it is only 4 1/2 feet deep, which allowed us to lounge and chat with new friends while drinking frozen drinks from the poolside bar. The other bar - the historic Carousel Lounge on the ground floor - is also not to be missed, as the 20 or so patrons on the barstools surrounding the bar move round and round at a very leisurely, relaxing pace. Another outstanding amenity is the fitness room; there is a very good variety of strength and cardio equipment, and each of the cardio machines have a personal TV attached...or you can just look out over the city or watch the riverboats and ships pass by in the Mississippi. The only difficulty we had during the entire trip was finding the right elevator to the rooftop pool; coming across a female employee who was keeping the lobby spotless, when I asked directions, instead of telling me or pointing the way, she actually walked us across the lobby, around the corner, pressed the button for the elevator, and held the door as we entered. Talk about service! Another nice touch was the ever-present doorman. All in all, the Monteleone is a luxurious, comfortable, and historic place to stay, and its perfect location in the French Quarter (there is no need for a car if you are vacationing here) only makes it better. Do yourself a favor and spend some time at the Monteleone, like we did. We'll be back! Nearby dining tips: The continental breakfast buffet was outstanding - in addition to nice pastries, cereals, and juices, it had the best fruit and berry selection I have seen anywhere except Hawaii. Just around the corner, the Pelican Club was great for dinner, and the "Someplace Else" restaurant was good for lunch. Living nearby we can also highly recommend K-Paul's and Arnaud's for great dinners, and the Napoleon house or the Crescent City Brewhouse for lunch or drinks. Susan Spicer's famous Bayonna Restaurant a few blocks away is also nice, but don't bother - the quality is just a bit too subtle to justify the high prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: su2doz
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed here during a weekend in July. Breakfast was included: bagels, pastries, fruit, cereal, yogurt. Yummy! The beds were comfortable, rooms were clean, and had a rooftop pool. I wish the pool was indoors because it rained most of the weekend. The carousel bar was a cool addition in the lobby and the conceirge was helpful in reserving us a table at one of Emeril's restaurants. All the workers were very nice and professional. There is a Walgreens next door, which came in handy for snacks, drinks, and umbrellas. Canal street and Bourbon street are VERY close. FYI- if you are looking for great live music, go to Frenchmen St inside of Bourbon. (The locals go there and it is a very chill area). Make sure you take some tours--this city has lots of history!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location...but needs a little work”
Reviews.Author: Court18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the third week of July for a Family Reunion (which I was one of the hosts). We stayed here probably 10+ years ago as well for the same reason. Unfortunately, I only remembered the good and not the not so good. First off I will say that it is in a good location. One block over from Bourbon and two blocks from Canal. Plus you are in prime walking distance to many restaurants including Felix, the Oyster House and Deanie's Seafood. The lobby is beautiful and though I didn't utilize it the revolving bar was kind of interesting looking. The pool is on the roof and very nice looking looking, however somewhat small. Now, the rooms are small. Though I realize that most rooms are small in the French Quarters, I just don't remember them being that small. In addition, please note the Hotel has a renovated and non-renovated side. Ask for a room on the renovated side, they are slightly bigger plus you can actually control temperature. The bathrooms are also small and not updated. The beds were comfortable, given me a good night sleep every night I was there. Some of the workers could use a refresher course on hospitality. I had an incident where I remarked that a conference room was locked that we were supposed to be using to one lady who was working on the floor. She preceded to tell me 'she couldn't help me and maybe you should go ask someone else'. It wasn't what she said, but how she said it. Also had an incident where the fire alarm went off (we were on the 15th floor) and we had to take the stairs down. Once we got to the 4th floor we were told it was a false alarm. However, when my mother (who is recovering from double knee surgery) was remarking how upset she was about the strain going down stairs had put on her one of the workers actually LAUGHED in her face. Restaurant was closed for renovations so the hotel offered free Continental Breakfast. Get their early if you don't want to wait in line. All in all this hotel probably use to be one of the gems of New Orleans, but their are numerous things that need to be worked on to be that way again. When I travel back to NOLA I will probably opt for a hotel outside but near the French Quarters. There seems to be better accommodations there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel! We loved it and plan to come back!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelhayes
Reviews.Content: Employees were very helpful! Hotel atmosphere was lovely! The location was excellent! We thought the $30.00 plus tax was expensive for parking. As we never moved our car for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: NomiaRiver
Reviews.Content: Thought the hotel was very clean and not noisy at all. Great location! And walkable to everything in the French Quarter. The concierge staff were very helpful in making sight-seeing suggestions and dinner reservations. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: penny585
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for one night prior to a cruise that left out of the port of orleans. We had a room on the 15th floor. Not a good view though. It was clean and had a nice marble bathroom. I did not like the way the front desk was set up. I called from the airport and was not wanting to give my credit card info over the phone in a crowded area so had to wait to reserve the room till i was actually in the hotel. We went to the front desk and they couldn't take the reservation there either. I had to go around the corner and make the reservation by phone(in a crowded area), giving my credit card number in the earshot of others. Then I was able to go back around the corner and check-in. I would have preferred to make the reservation and hand them the card so the numbers never had to be spoken. There is a nice pool and bar area on the 16th floor. On this trip we did not go into the carousal bar. There is construction going on which did not impact us at all. They offered a complimentary continental breakfast but the line was extremely long so we did not take advantage of this. Almost forgot. There were 2 pillows on my bed that were not good for me....way too soft.

Reviews.Title: “Was a nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: kenkraw
Reviews.Content: The room, which we booked with an AARP discount, was very clean and neat. The A/C worked fine, and bed was comfortable. The room itself was on the small side, as was the bathroom. Guess you can't do much about that, as the hotel itself is old, but suspect they sacrificed room size in favor of the suites in the hotel (we were in rooms 674; our friends in 684). On the bad side, the lobby was SO crowded during our two day/night stay, that we couldn't enjoy anything about it, and had a hard time getting anyone's attention (it was Tales of the Cocktail Time, and very rowdy as you would expect since there were freebies too). The Vieux Carre is fun anytime though, and that made up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MCH11062010
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monteleone was beautiful and definitely didn't feel like a chain hotel. The service was excellent and we lucked into a time when the Cafe was being renoveated so a complimentary breakfast was provided. I think this is only during their renovations this summer but rarely do you get such a nice breakfast for free. We stayed for 3 nights in a room on the 12th floor overlooking the french quarter and the river- beautiful! We had a traditional room that was a little small but very nice, clean and newly renovated. The staff was very helpful and I really enjoyed the fitness center (which has excellent views) and the roof top pool which was very nice on the wretchedly hot days. The pool bar also catered to me from my chair after I ordered my first drink. The Carousel Bar is located in the lobby and is a fun place to visit. We sat at the carousel and then at a table beside it to be entertained as it went round. The Pimms Cup is delightful. Reservation Tip: I reserved the smallest/cheapest room online via the hotel's website and noticed that it was $30 per night ot upgrade to the next option. BUT after I made the reservation I had the option to upgrade for half price ($15 per night) IF the next largest room was available. When I arrived the upgrade was available and we were able to get it at the discounted rate- it is a chance you may consider taking if the budget it low.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: happy34678
Reviews.Content: Location, staff, clean, comfortable all excellent!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Value! GREAT Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mikeisgus
Reviews.Content: By FAR the most hotel for the money in New Orleans!!!!! Perfect location. Helpful staff. Room was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Good but I expect more from a 4 Diamond hotel”
Reviews.Author: monkeybay
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monteleone won a 4 diamond award several years ago from AAA so my expectations were high. The hotel certainly thinks a lot of itself and its place in New Orleans history and its fabulous location in the French Quarter. Here's the good: the bellhops were wonderful fonts of information on where to eat, drink, and be merry. The doormen brave torrential rain to hail taxicabs and escort guests into their chariots with large umbrellas. The location is sweet and a stone's throw from Bourbon Street and several amazing restaurants. The rooftop patio has a bar, a lovely lounge area, nice comfortable chairs and a pool (that could be a little more clean), and a fairly nice view. The carousel bar is nice... but the food is only so-so. Here are the cons: it is overpriced for what you get. The rooms are small and have rather frou-frou drapes and would benefit from a more minimalist makeover. There isn't a lot of soundproofing so be prepared to hear the goings on in neighbouring rooms (particularly when the showers are engaged as it may sound as if someone is taking a shower in your room). While renovations are ongoing the restaurant is closed but there is a complimentary continental breakfast... HOWEVER the staff are ill-equipped to deal with the demand for this free breakfast. The line up to get seated for this free breakfast snakes around the halls and takes up to 30 minutes. While a nice gesture, when you understaff and make so few tables available for this breakfast it almost makes the sentiment begrudging rather than generous. In fact, I ended up giving up for two of the four nights I stayed here. Furthermore, when I did finally get seated for breakfast one morning I asked for milk rather than cream with my coffee. The waitress informed me that there was milk available by the cereal carafes... so I got up and walked across the room and poured some milk directly into my cup from the milk fountain which seemed like a very strange thing to have to do in a hotel that charged $30/day for valet parking. Hotel Monteleone: are you fancy or not? What's the deal? The gym is small and its equipment is a little rickety but you do get an amazing view from the treadmills. Spa Aria on the 2nd floor is very nice though. Several people in my party had massages and contend they are among the best they have ever had. And then there is internet. In a world in which every Holiday Inn, Crowne Plaza, and Radisson is offering up free internet it is a bit weird to be hit with a daily 10 dollar fee for internet usage. And finally in a gesture I found to be rather disgusting, the hotel asks in its final bill it leaves under your door to rate it 5 out of 5 on Trip Advisor if you enjoyed your stay. It came across a bit like asking for a tip. This hotel is ok but nothing spectacular. It could be incredible if it revamped its rooms, installed a barista in its lobby, maintained its pool a little better, made internet free, and made its hotel more of an "experience." It doesn't take much... free drinks on check-in, or welcome packages, etc. To me, that's what constitutes a true 4 diamond or 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FrederickNorth
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, it is two blocks from bourbon st, but you would never know it, very quiet. They had a great roof deck pool and lounge. The price was great oo. I will be back

Reviews.Title: “What consistent memorable experiences!”
Reviews.Author: drdonaldorb
Reviews.Content: As a near monthly traveler to New Orleans for nearly 10 years, no other hotel in New Orleans compares in offering the charm, elegance,service and capable staff that Hotel Monteleone does! On occasions during peak times of the year when emergency travel necessitates a hotel stay and there is no accommodationd available, I refuse to stay elsewhere, and resort to stay in other out of the city locations. Simply put, there is no place in New Orleans like Hotel Monteleone!

Reviews.Title: “We've stayed at the Monteleone several times and we are always pleased.”
Reviews.Author: Calliewee
Reviews.Content: Living in Mississippi affords me the opportunity to visit New Orleans many times a year. I always stay at the Monteleone. The staff is consistently courteous and knowledgable. The rooms are clean and comfortable and you simply cannot beat the location! A favorite attraction is always the Carousel Bar. I was worried that with the renovation it might not be as fun and frankly might be noisy...the bar was still a blast and I never heard any noise from the renovation. Stay here and you will go back again!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite New Orleans hotel yet!”
Reviews.Author: keegrsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in his hotel while on a business trip and it was perfect! Beautiful hotel, very clean, wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Betty2me
Reviews.Content: I first discovered Hotel Monteleone post Katrina. I found a discounted rate and chose it for my annual conference. The service, appearance and location blew me away. I've stayed at the Ritz and other high-end hotels but the staff here are amazing. My second stay, I had a double room with a giant granite bath. Housekeeping, superb. Front desk, wonderful. Doormen, make me smile even in the pouring rain. Beds are super comfortable and we were lucky enough to receive an enhanced continental breakfast during our stay due to the reconstruction / remodel of The Hunt Room. I just booked a room for March that is non-business. The location is out of this world and the roof top pool astounds me. Best hotel in NOLA. Family owned.

Reviews.Title: “Monteleone Basically Good”
Reviews.Author: arewenotmen
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Monteleone in mid-April. We arrived around 1 am, and the parking attendant and bellman were very attending. I was really pleased with the room; it was nicely appointed, had high ceilings with a chandelier. The room was very well it which I really liked as often hotel rooms do not have enough light. The room was also very clean. The problem I had was no one ever came to clean my room. I stayed three nights, was gone the entire day each day, and when I returned to the room around 5 pm, the room had not been cleaned, the bed was not made, no fresh towels, etc. I then had to call down each day to get someone up to clean the room. Also the refrigerator did not work, so I had to call down to get another one. I love the location of the hotel right in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Charlie628
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on business/vacation trip and was very pleased with location and service provided by hotel staff. Hotel was being renovated but outside of the restaurant being closed you wouldn't notice. And since restaurant was closed a free continental breakfast is provided every morning which wasn't great (no hot food), but was enough for me. It takes a little getting used to finding your way around the hotel - I had to go down one elevator from my room to the lobby and up another elevator to the pool for example. Only other complaint was being charged $7.00 to print a few pages in the business center. I had a room facing the city - better view from the other side facing the river. What makes this hotel great is the location. You're right in the middle of the French Quarter - just step out your door to all the restaurants, bars, shops, and everything else you want. And there's a Walgreens right next door as well.

Reviews.Title: “A Classic in the Crescent City”
Reviews.Author: seagirtlight
Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans for the American Library Association conference in July 2011, my second time in the city, and having decided to go at the last minute a day before colleagues, I needed a hotel. Since I'm always looking for a place with a little character, I checked the National Trust for Historic Preservation's Historic Hotels website, and found the Monteleone available for $100/night on a summer special. How can you turn that down? (I paid the convention rate for part of the stay.) The hotel definitely lived up to my expectations for character and quality. Upon arrival, the front desk had no issue linking my two separate reservations seamlessly, and unlike other times I have done that at other hotels, the electronic keycards never locked me out between "stays." The hotel was under renovation during my stay, so some facilities were reduced; the restaurants were closed, and there was a continental breakfast that I didn't avail myself of -- how can one do that when the delicious pancakes of the Camillia Grill are now just a few blocks away in the Quarter? The Carousel Bar was still open, a fantastic venue for getting together after dinner, or writing during some quiet hours. My room, #745, was a nice corner king. The bathroom was somewhat small, but totally functional for me. The room exudes an old-world character, something I've felt in other classic hotels like The Greenbrier in West Virginia and The Palace in San Francisco. The biggest problem with the room was one that's unavoidable in the hotel's location -- it's never totally quiet at night. The Monteleone is probably just as soundproof as any hotel of similar construction in the country, but having Bourbon Street a block away does not make for a perfectly silent night. However, if you're going to stay in the Quarter, you have to take the noise as a given with the location. That said, my room more than redeemed itself with curtains that created complete blackout conditions, something I crave after living in NYC for three years! Overall, the family-run character of this place shows through. Unlike at a larger chain place, I felt like the staff connected more with guests, while still being completely professional. I admit I'm a softie for historic places as a history geek, and someplace that's turning 125 years old this year may allow me to overlook some flaws. But overall, I felt that the Hotel Monteleone delivered much more of an old-world Southern atmosphere than my coworkers got at the MC Marriott or the Royal Sonesta. I'll be back next time in town.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Revolving Bar”
Reviews.Author: Sneekee
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel located in the heart of New Orleans. We went over the holidays and was decorated with Christmas decorations and when we arrived a local school was inside singing Christmas caroles. The revolving bar inside the hotel is also a lot of fun and they make a great Gin Fizz, which is unlike anything I've ever had. Delicious. The rooms were very cozy, clean, and even though there is a rumor that there is a ghost in the hotel, we did not see one. Great hidden gem. Will always stay here if in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL IN PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: DOCTORDINK
Reviews.Content: Nicely appointed large hotel with excellent, courteous staff. The executive suite was of nice size, clean and had a nice view. Rollaway bed was able to fit in the room with the pull out sofa. Restaurant under renovation during stay. A rather pedastrian continental breakfast provided, but it required waiting in a long line as it was served in modest sized room and was not set up for a carry out option. Rooftop pool provided a nice view and was very peaceful. Carousel bar was unique and fun. Drinks were nothing special however. Superb location in the French Quarter as it was just a block away from the fun and madness of Bourbon street and near the trolley cars.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Hospitality and Charm”
Reviews.Author: BrookeLynne7
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 day stay that was part-conference, part-vacation. My friend and I loved the Monteleone! Our room was comfortable, clean and quaint. The hotel is in a great location for exploring the French Quarter and Canal Street and the CBD. Streetcar stops are just a two minute walk, if that. We loved being able to stop back at the room to freshen up before heading back out in the heat again. The service was a treat, real Southern Hospitality. Not the stuffy, stuck up type you get at "trendy" hotels. The concierge was fantastic recommending places that were not the usual tourist traps. The doormen took great car of us too. Will definitely return to the Monteleone. Can't wait to go back to New Orleans again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, immaculate, old-fashioned hotel - best place in Nola”
Reviews.Author: Nance1600
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to the Hotel Monteleone, and I only have good things to say. This time our room was small, but made good use of space, and everything else was spectacular. Wonderful location. But I especially want to mention the excellent service, particularly of the weekend concierge, who found me an excellent French Quarter dinner reservation for a party of 9 at the last minute on a busy Saturday night!

Reviews.Title: “We wanted it to be great, but it wasn't.”
Reviews.Author: BostonHunter4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Monteleone for two days in June. Things we liked about the hotel include a great location in the French Quarter, a lovely bar in the lobby, a comfortable room,the rooftop pool and great service upon check-in. Unfortunately, the hotel is undergoing construction that led to loud banging (possibly driving piles?) at 8:00 in the morning directly outside our window. Also, because of the construction, the hotel did not have any restaurants open for breakfast. To make up for this, the hotel offered a free continential breakfast- great! The line for it was never-ending and we were not allowed to take food to go- not great! So basically your choices were to wait over half an hour for your free continental breakfast or leave the hotel, which I opted to do. This could easily have been remedied by the hotel if they just would have allowed me to take a muffin and banana to my room, which I don't think is unreasonable. Overall, the Hotel Monteleone was very beautiful and I'd stay there again- only if it wasn't under construction.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: vicvic47
Reviews.Content: We are from north Louisiana and have been to N.O. many times. First time stay at the Monteleone for me, but others in family have stayed here before. We know the reputation for this hotel, so when I saw the Summer Special of $99/night, I jumped on it. We weren't sure how the renovations would affect our stay and not having a restaurant there, but boy were we surprised! The continental breakfast was outstanding, especially compared to the usual ones you get with hotel chains. We went down to breakfast about 30 minutes before it was to end. There were many people eating, but we did not have to wait. The white table cloths, silver, china, etc were so special. The food assortment was wonderful and fresh. The wait staff were excellent. Our waitress even offered to send us off with a cup of coffee to go after eating even though we didn't request one. I took her up on it Every staff member had a smile on their faces always, wanting to help you every step of the way. The rooms are small, but all the historical hotels where I have stayed in the Quarter have small rooms, some even have a musty odor. Not this one! We made no specific requests regarding floors or views. We were on the 5th floor facing Royal which we liked and maybe would request a higher floor next time for an even better view. I must comment on the shower. Usually the showers in other hotels where I have stayed have no power and the spray spreads out too much. This shower head was powerful and more condensed. Loved it! Also, we had a call from housekeeping in the late afternoon asking if there was anything we needed. That was a first! I was very impressed. The mattress was a little soft for me, but the rest of the family loved it. Don't miss the pool! Beautiful view, especially at night. I had read other reviews that the valet took a long time to receive your car. We waited about 5-to minutes. No problem. The only complaint I have is that the valet parking is very expensive. But it seems that way throughout the Quarter. If it were about $20/day, I would say everything is perfect at The Hotel Monteleone.

Reviews.Title: “Looking Forward To Trying Again After The Renovation”
Reviews.Author: RomanticNHopeless
Reviews.Content: Oh how I wanted to love this hotel. I read some of the negative reviews and thought these people just don't get historic hotels which I love. Well this place could be really great but they badly need to update the rooms and hallway carpet and fixtures. The bed was lumpy and uncomfortable as were the pillows and the desk chair in my room was broken, god only knows how and he's not saying probably for a good reason. Also to say this hotel is centrally located in the French Quarter is a bit of a misnomer. It is actually on the edge of the French Quarter as I found out while trying to explore the French Quarter in 100 degree heat. Still the Carosel Bar was just as charming as I had hoped. It really does inhance the drinking experience if you are not stuck next to a conventioneer talking about the latest in medical devices all night but instead you are slowly moved towards a hottie on the other side of the room who has been giving you the eye from across the bar. Not very high tech but it works. The hotel was also very close to Galatoire's where we ate dinner. That was great given that we were wearing coat and tie as required by the restaurant and as mentioned above it was 100 degrees during the day and the nights only cooled down a little. Still I would try this place again only after they complete thier reservations. For my next trip to New Orleans I will be trying the Omni Royal Orleans which I passed on my explorations and for my money was more centrally located and some of the rooms looked to have thier own old fashioned metal lace balconies so you could sit out and enjoy the passing show from your room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: moburton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is going through a series of upgrades, which means that currently there are no restaurant facilities. Howevr, to compensate this, they provide a free continental breakfast, which includes fruit, cereals, yogourts, bagels, toast, and coffee. Be warned though- if you don't get down early, you will stand in a queue! The staff are very friendly. We arrived at 1pm, having taken over 3 hours to drive from Lafayette,( should only be 2 hours, but because of road works, there were long jams), but were still able to check in, which was a blessing, as we were very tired! We were on the 15th floor- the rooms are small but adequate. They provide the usual 2 beds, an ironing board and iron, hairdryer, plus all the complimentary bathroom shampoos etc. The hotel is on Royal Street, in the heart of the French Quarter, so everything is near and walkable in that area. There is also a lovely small rooftop pool, which is very welcoming after a long day in the heat and humidity. The concierge was very helpful, and booked us on a swamp tour, the price of which was added to our room, which made things easier. A great place to stay the the big easy! My only negative was that you had to pay 10 dollars a night for wifi, the only place on our trip which didn't offer free wifi. However, I believe that this is common practice in New Orleans-slightly left a stale taste in our mouths, as they must all make so much money from tourists, it seemed particularly stingy! They do have car parking facilities, but charge around 30 dollars a night, so we handed in our rental car at the airport, and took a taxi in,a s everything is so accessible, either by walking, street car, or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic French Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kernow86
Reviews.Content: I visited with my partner to explore NOLA. The service was excellent, all the staff were genuine and helpful - most notably the concierge and one of the valets. The location is excellent for exploring all the highlights of NO. The room was quite small but well maintained and authentically decorated with a comfortable bed, nice bathroom and large flat-screen TV. We were both annoyed that the WI-FI wasn't complimentary but would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: zamorna621
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! the room was quiet; the bedding was luxurious; I loved the comfy terry robe, french soap and toiletries. I loved the roof and rooftop pool. It was near everything. I have a special diet and there were good dishes on the menu for me. The room was luxurious..felt like Buckingham Palace! the room service was great..and cheap! everyone here was lovely. I didn't want to come home! 'Nuff said?

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelcityguy
Reviews.Content: The hotel provided a quiet room with comfortable surroundings. It was a very comfortable and restful place after the conference and busy New Orleans nightlife. The bed was extremely comfortable. The hotel is centrally located within easy access of all of New Orleans. The staff is very helpful and food at the hotel well prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel....”
Reviews.Author: jjapples
Reviews.Content: I reserved a preferred king on an upper floor in the Hotel Monteleone as a suprise birthday getaway for my wife. The hotel was recommened by a friend plus it received good reviews on tripadvisor. I noticed that the hotel accepted pets which I am very allergic to. I called the hotel direct, advised the reservationist of my concern and was assured that I would receive a room where a pet was not in and it would be prepared with care. Upon arrivel at check-in I asked what type of view the room had and was told that it was a view of the city. I asked if a river view was available and was told there was not and was also told that there was a note on the reservation from the reservations manager that the room was specially prepared for my concern about my allergy to pets. I was very impressed that my concern was taken seriously because in the past in other hotels they showed no concern at all, so because of that I usually avoid any hotel that accepts pets but because of the good reviews I decided to put my faith in the hotel and was rewarded by enjoying our stay in a wonderful hotel with a great staff....Joe A.

Reviews.Title: “Historic elegance under renovation”
Reviews.Author: CulinarySnob
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Wonderful classic historical interior. A bit of rennovation going on. Not really a problem, they gave us free breakfast as compensation. Service overall good, attentive. Room comfortable. Great location in the quarter. Rooftop pool 15th floor very nice. Gym fair to average. Was overcrowded each morning. Nice views of city and river. Needs more aerobic equipment. 6 or so weight machines, but no free weights or benches. Internet was $10/ day which always pisses me off, should be included given what they charge. Breakfast was buffet and woefully devoid of protein (no eggs or meats). Breads were so so. Fruit was fantastic, but not enough for my bkfst. Servers were ok, didn't like constant reminder that while food was complimentary, service was not. Not anymore inclined to tip here than a hampton inn bkfst.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in teh French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Devilgirl08
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and clean. Although small rooms and the pool area is small, but adequate for sure. That aside it is well maintained and very clean. The service at the front desk was okay, the doorman (the big guy) is super friendly and the bellmen were fine. The location is perfect to all the areas most tourists want to be near. We did a ton of walking and had no problem nagivating the city fromt he hotel or feeling tried after walking around. The bed was really comfortable and I didn't hear a lot of street noises. The continential breakfast was fine but very busy. The line moved well and the servers were friendly and efficient. The carousel bar is so cute! We had drinks there and it was always packed. I would stay again in this hotel and recommend it to anyone who isn't too concerned about the size of their room. You have to think about it with some logic: the hotel is 125 years old, they weren't building places in those days. The hotel isn't haunted either, nothing weird happened to us during our stay. All the craziness is out on Bourbon Street, wow, it's something to see.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Comfortable bed.”
Reviews.Author: travel4fun71
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location, comfortable bed, nice clean rooms, friendly service. Housekeeping seemed to be invisible--you never saw them, but if you left your room for 40 minutes, you'd come back to a perfectly clean room. The Carousel Bar was cool and always busy--so busy that we never did stop in for a drink. We loved the history of the hotel. One doorman was wonderful! Cons: Inconsistent service in the dining room at breakfast (actually, to be fair, one morning we had the BEST service and one morning, terrible, terrible service. Not only were they horribly slow, our server told us it's because all the hotel guests "choose" to come at the same time--guess it's OUR fault... Also, service at the pool bar was awful--nice kid, but definitely a kid--super, super slow, and out of nearly everything. One doorman was awful--he literally watched us as we struggled to get our bags through the heavy doors. I would say that all the cons were training/management related, and can be easily fixed. The location, history, and feel of the hotel are all wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Probably not again”
Reviews.Author: KMTravels
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monteleone isn't a bad hotel, it just isn't for me, I guess. First of all, it was so crowded when we arrived Friday evening we had to circle the block several times to finally get a spot in front of the hotel to pull the car. On a Friday evening in the French Quarter, this isn't exactly fun or easy. We then encountered a rude valet attendant and could not find a bellman to help with our many bags -- at a full service hotel and for this price, you expect there to be one available. There was a line at check in, and the person checking us in did tell me the hotel was completely full. This was obvious the next morning for "complimentary, expanded continental breakfast." There was a line at least 20 minutes long! I had to order room service so I could be somewhere I was scheduled to be that morning. We all know how room service goes .. .far, far from free. The next morning I woke up even earlier so I could get continental breakfast, which was basically just pastries, cereal and fruit. I was told by the server that the breakfast was free, but service was not. (Hello, if you are waiting my table I do not need to be reminded to tip you.) That was a little weird. It was more the fact that the hotel was so crowded inside and out that made our stay less than perfect. I prefer to stay on the other side of Canal Street -- within walking distance to the French Quarter but far enough away from the crowds -- and at a smaller hotel with more personalized service.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: FamOf3_11
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in NOLA to celebrate a milestone birthday and were delighted with the Monteleone. The location can't be beat: right in the heart of the French Quarter but relatively removed from the Bourbon Street hoopla. You'll hear the odd sidewalk musician or two, though, so bring earplugs if you're really sensitive to noise. The neighborhood, lined with antiques shops, upscale jewelry boutiques, and more, was lovely and felt completely safe. We could walk everywhere we needed to go and never took our car out of the parking garage (which is a little steep at $30 per night). The hotel has so much history and character and offers a sense of place you can't get with any of the chains. The staff clearly love it, which shows in their warmth and graciousness. There's a hint of wear and tear around the edges, but the charm and old-fashioned elegance more than compensate. Our room had been updated and was beautifully appointed, if on the snug side. A drink in the Carousel Bar is a must (it fills up fast, so get there early or be prepared to wait for a spot). We didn't dine at the in-house restaurants, but the menus looked excellent. We'll save those for the next visit, hopefully sooner rather than later!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Pool Scene”
Reviews.Author: harleybonz
Reviews.Content: I stayed once before years ago,We are locals.We took an upgrade to the next step up , in rooms ,and I tell you the room was very nice.You could tell there were renovations.The bathroom was very large.The view was awesome..Can I have this room again please? The pool scene was very cool ,mostly adults cooling off with a nice drink from the poolside bar,soooo hip..Great job Monteleone..The breakfast line was way too long.,,,but I shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: spoonieluv
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with real-world character. Very French Quarter and fits the culture nicely. I utilized the spa and that was great as well. The bar is a fun, unique carousel (a la the rotating restaurant on top of the Space Needle). People were VERY friendly and the family-owned attitude came through all the employees I came across. Room was clean and bath was great. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: TigerBaseball
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monteleone on Thursday and Friday, 6/9-6/11, overall the stay was quite nice, the location was great for French Quarter activities. The one drawback was that we had an outside room on the 9th floor facing the Marriott and Friday night the street noise was very, very loud. I am not a light sleeper by any means and the noise kept me up all night. If you are there for the weekend, I would request and interior room, our traveling companions had one, and you may avoid this one drawback, they did. Otherwise, I would suggest you stay here if you want the full French Quarter feel.

Reviews.Title: “All we could have ever wanted and then some.”
Reviews.Author: tunistx5
Reviews.Content: For the 2 of us it was the perfect room. Great king sized bed, super water pressure, and no external noise which made for a perfect sleeping situation for our 3 nights. Always cleand to perfection when we returned from a meal, shopping or sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite getaway place”
Reviews.Author: jlegendre
Reviews.Content: The location, service, and beauty of this hotel make it a great place to visit the french quarter of New Orleans. We especially enjoyed the carousel bar and the availability of great restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: courtney_meinen
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay in New Orleans - great French Quarter location close to wonderful restaurants and all of the bars. Also not too bad of a walk to Harrah's. Beautiful hotel. the Carousel bar downstairs is a lot of fun! Clean, nice rooms - a little on the small side, but that was expected.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: julieros
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in early June with his sister and her husband. I cannot recommend this hotel enough--the service was friendly and impeccable, the room was clean and wonderfully luxurious for the price, and the overall facilities (especially the rooftop pool) were terrific. One morning I went looking for the concierge, who was away from his desk, to find out about boat cruises. Before I could even ask one of the bell staff for help, I was approached and asked what I needed. The bellman then spent 15 minutes answering questions and providing advice. When I am lucky enough to return to New Orleans, you can be sure I'll stay here rather than at any generic chain property. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Fun for the girls!”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl024
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monteleone on our first (middle-aged) girls trip to NOLA in 2010 and returned his year. The location is wonderful -- easy access (1 block) to Bourbon Street without the noise and ickiness. We liked the accommodations and the people there. Everything was clean. Staff were accommodating. During renovations of their dining rooms, they offered a complimentary continental breakfast. They did not describe this well -- it may not have included eggs or French toast, but this was well beyond my idea of "continental." Only complaint was a minor one: the TV was limited and many stations were inaccessible -- but it's New Orleans, so how much TV would you watch anyway? :) Go. Enjoy! (P.S. The Monteleone also is more affordable than many other nice places in town according to my research.)

Reviews.Title: “REALLY NICE”
Reviews.Author: Julesb49
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful, no view but we mainly slept there, clean as could be. Everyone was friendly and cordial. I certainly would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: safety86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monteleone over the Memorial Day weekend as a return guest. When I entered the hotel, I was greeted by friendly desk staff. The bellman from the carribian was so nice as he talked with me while going up on the elevator. My roon was spacious and very clean. The bathroom was modern and clean. The rooftop pool was nice with a great poolside bar. The nightly turn down service was a good touch. It was good to go out and come back to a bed ready for you with some mints. Checkout was fast and easy.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Icequeen2921
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I have stayed at this hotel & hands down it beats staying at the generic, boring hotel chains that are available there. The location was perfect being just 1 block off of Bourbon St & 2 blocks from Canal St.. The service is impeccable & I love the Carousel Bar. The rooms may be smaller than the chain hotels but that is a small price for the ambience. I will always stay at this hotel if given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “manifique!”
Reviews.Author: kakiLouisiana
Reviews.Content: Excellent, beautiful hotel! Histotic, charm, absolutely loved it! Great location near the French Quarter. the staff was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent location...excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: valita
Reviews.Content: Our room was small, but immaculately clean, and for New Orleans (and Royal Street!) was ***quiet***. Service in every part of the hotel was excellent, including the Aria Spa. As previously noted, the internet service is not good, and the bed cover has to go (it slides all over the place!) but this was still an great hotel overall. We've been to New Orleans many times, but this was our first stay at the Monteleone. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Exceptional Staff and Service”
Reviews.Author: MaryBeth5150
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 4 days in New Orleans and we stayed at the Hotel Monteleone. Check in was quick, although our room was not ready as we had asked, but I realize that early check in is something that may not be able to be accommodated. They were kind to call when the the room was ready and the friendly staff member checked our luggage promptly in the lobby. The room was beautiful, roomy ( we had a royal salon) and the housekeeping staff quickly arrived with a firmer pillow when asked. Another friendly staff member arrived promptly when we had difficulty with our room safe - fixed on the spot - no further problems. However, what I feel makes the Monteleone the exceptional hotel it is, is Miss Eva, the concierge. She was literally our "fairy godmother". She answered all our questions, offered helpful hints and advise and all with a delightful sense of humor. If you are looking for a hotel where you truly feel pampered and special - look no further, the Hotel Monteleone is all that and more. It's location is close to everything. We walked to the aquarium, River Walk shops, the French Market and many of the sights of the French Quarter. You are so close to everything. It was also easy to catch a streetcar to the Garden District (thanks for the help, Miss Eva). The only challenge I feel this hotel has is that the rooftop pool (spectacular) is quite small compared to the number of guests the hotel welcomes. However, even during the busiest times, Zach the bartender and Meredith, a pool staff member always remained pleasant and helpful. I believe the hotel was particularly busy given the Memorial Day Weekend and a wedding that was being held there.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: TampaScott
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Monteleone for an entire week. The room is above average size for New Orleans, and the hotel itself, on Royal Street, could not be in a better location in the French Quarter. The staff were all excellent, the room service food was outstanding and even made formal with a full tablesetting. Why would you order room service in New Orleans? Well, as rookies, we had not yet discovered the power of the extraordinarily strong beverage called the "Hand Grenade!"
