I had two of those the night before, and did not feel like going out for dinner. Nonetheless, the food was very near of gourmet. The one complaint is the horrendous Internet service. Fortunately, my iPad has the cellular service, so it was not a big problem for me. Still, there are times you would like to get on your laptop, and I wound up subscribing to the city service for $19.95 a week. Please, do not even bother with that, as it will make you feel like you have entered a time warp and have found yourself back on dial-up. All of that said, this should not be a deterrent to anyone, because notices were delivered to each room that starting next week they are upgrading room-to-room Internet service to modernize the hotel as far as technology. In any event, awesome property that I would not hesitate for a second to stay at again. We had the opportunity to see the Royal Sonesta, as our friends were staying there. That is also a nice place that I would not hesitate to book, however, some friends on the Bourbon Street side of the RS had noise complaints. There are no noise issues whatsoever with Hotel Monteleone.

Reviews.Title: “Lap of Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: stingerjeep
Reviews.Content: This was actually just a stop-over on our way to Florida, but our stay at the Hotel Monteleone became a highlight of our trip! We pulled into the Hotel parking garage and was quickly met by an attendant, who gathered our luggage, sent it up to our room, and took care of our car. Burt, our Bellman, was at our room quickly and had some suggestions for dinner - and some relief for my husband's sore foot. A quick walk to the drug store on the corner and I was back to our comfortable room as my husband soaked in the tub...refreshed and ready for a wonderful dinner and drinks in the hotel's carousel bar. The bed was perfect, and although the bathroom was small, it was well-planned and had plenty of room for the two of us to get ready the next morning. We'll definitely stay again, and hopefully have more time than just one night. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Have a drink at the Carousel Bar!”
Reviews.Author: MardiGras7
Reviews.Content: How charming! We love this fabulous hotel and always have to stop for a drink at the Carousel Bar. It's worth the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Keep your wallet open”
Reviews.Author: grandma_eccie
Reviews.Content: Just home from 3 days in NO with husband (his business trip) and granddaughter (graduation gift). The hotel is clean and centrally located. Beds comfortable. Service good. But, as others have said, bathroom is small, little space for toiletries, lots of mirrors but no fan. Noisy area and we heard music from Bourbon Street well into the night, even on the 10th floor. And they don't want you to do anything yourself: park the car - tip - carry bags - tip - all phone calls, even local - surcharge - internet - surcharge - even computers in the business center - surcharge. Parking expensive. We had free internet in the room, but only because there was a problem with the system. We never use room service, but there are extra charges there as well - delivery plus gratuity added to the bill. The French Quarter is an expensive area. If you are young, like noise and crowds and don't mind paying for all the extras, it is a lovely building and not a bad place.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly Poor Rooms. Extremely Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jpete02
Reviews.Content: Although the Monteleone charges a nightly rate on par with a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons, this hotel is far from a four or five star hotel. The worst part, by far, was the room. Extremely small and cramped, the soundproofing was non existent. On both sides of my room was a connecting door, which may have added to the noise problems. You could hear everything going on in the room next to me and it wasn't because the people next door were loud or inconsiderate. There was no relief either in the bathroom. Extremely tiny, even with the attempts at putting extra mirrors in the bathroom to make it appear bigger. Also, extremely strange was no bathroom fan! A fan sure would have been nice to keep the tiny bathroom mirrors from fogging up and from overheating. The toilet was extremely loud and was of the type you would find in a shopping mall or high school bathroom. Incredibly, the hotel has been recently renovated. It is hard to imagine that these rooms actually used to be worse! The hallway in which my room was located (9th floor-Iberville Tower) actually had a piece of duct tape on the carpet! Maybe because I had the "discounted" convention rate of $169 (regular rates were over $200), I didn't get the greatest room. But at $169, you expect a lot more than what you are given here. You are basically paying for the famous name and location. While the location is good, it is not like you are overlooking Jackson Square. You are one block from Bourbon Street but you are located on the far southern end of the French Quarter. In other words, you are much closer to Canal St. and the central business district, than the French Market. Parking is $30/day and the hotel has its own garage. There is a pool and fitness center on the roof. Bottom line is to look around and you will find much better values and much nicer hotels in the French Quarter than the Hotel Monteleone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Monteleone!!”
Reviews.Author: avd79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a one week stay at the Hotel Monteleone and must say we really enjoyed our stay at this property. We arrived during the first weekend of Jazz Fest and although the hotel was busy, we found the service to be very attentive, with one exception (see Carousel Bar). Upon arrival around noon, our room wasn't ready yet, however the lady at the front desk checked us in and told us to go out and enjoy the Quarter and that she would call us to let us know as soon as our room was ready. My husband and I proceeded to go out for lunch, and within an hour we received a call from the front desk advising us that our room was ready even though it was well before the check-in time of 3:00 p.m.!!! Our room, a king size delux, was on the 12th floor and although not large was beautifully appointed with classical furnishings. If you are looking for a room with a modern sterile feel, this is not the hotel for you. Amenities were what you would expect from a top level hotel, and toiletries were alway replenished. Housekeeping was excellent!! We made a point of calling down to let housekeeping know when we were leaving the room and within an hour of our calls each day our room was serviced!! Service throughout the hotel was top notch, from the doormen, to staff in the Cafe, who were pleased to sit us for just coffee on Sunday morning (we had brunch reservations elsewhere for later in the morning and just wanted a cup of coffee and toast to tied us over), to the staff at the pool on the top floor. The pool is small and if there are large groups, it can be difficult to get chairs, but given that you are in New Orleans and most properties don't have pools, this location was a welcome spot after a busy morning/afternoon in the Quarter. The area has a bar, and food can be ordered through room service. The Carousel Bar is not to be missed!! It is a fun spot to stop for a drink or listen to the music/songs of John Autin in the evenings. Given that we were there during JazzFest, the Monteleone had other guest performers join John Autin each evening. Service however in this bar was the least consistent of all the hotel. If you are able to get a seat at the Carousel (very popular), the bartenders were attentive. If however, you sat at the piano section, service was inconsistent. Some servers were very good and always made sure you had snacks and drinks, while others brought you a first drink (without snacks/chips) and then forgot about you unless you called them over. We stopped off at the Carousel each night before retiring and it became obvious to us that this was an issue. With so many great bars in New Orleans, this is an area that the Monteleone needs to improve. All in all a great stay at the Monteleone and would return whole heartedly upon our return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jinxkingston
Reviews.Content: Cant beat the location. The rooms were nicely appointed but not overly big. The washroom seems to have been redone recently. We didn't manage to get a room with a single king bed, but the two double seemed bouncy to me. Service was good and prompt, despite having a large number of conventioneers in the hotel. The Carousel lounge was fun and always buzzing in the early evening. We managed a drink on the first night we were there and the drinks we're pricey, but weren't watered down. We didn't make it up to the pool, but it seemed to be popular. I would return for the quality of the hotel and especially the location. The restaurant was nice enough, but the food was just a bit above marginal at best. Service was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, just awful”
Reviews.Author: Kath610
Reviews.Content: We were attracted the Montelone because we love classic old hotels. It was horrible - we left after 11 hours. The rooms was small and dirty. Holes in the sheets. The staff ranged from unfriendly to indifferent. We moved to the Roosevelt and LOVED it! Save yourself the aggravation - book the Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “The happiest & friendliest people ever!”
Reviews.Author: sammbo
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to New Orleans more than met our expectations. There was so much to see, do and experience. The people couldn't have been nicer, the food tastier and the sites moving. Highly reccommend beignets at the hotel dining room for breakfast, a tour to Laura's Plantation and a cooking class at the New Orleans School of Cooking! The World War II Museum & Imax theather are very moving.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: jfos63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I from Australia stayed at the Monteleone for 5 nights in April 2011. This hotel was in a brilliant location in the French Quarter if you like to be amongst it but away from the noise of Bourbon St. This was out first time there and was unsure what to expect but besides the small rooms (which we did read about on tripadvisor so wasn"t surprised) the hotel was well above our expections. Rooms were clean. Concierge and doormen were excellent. My only complaints were 1. that our room was next to the employees elevator and you could hear it go up and down all night and 2. we left a camera in the room and it wasn't handed in so we did not get it back. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Monteleone”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTeacher013
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the at Monteleone post-cruise. We picked it because we stayed there 4 years ago and loved it. There have been many improvements since then and we enjoyed the updated beds, which were very comfortable and the updated plumbing, which increased the shower water pressure. The staff is as friendly as always, from the front door attendant to the check-in staff to the bartenders in the Carousel Bar. Our room was not ready upon arrival but 1 hour later we were notified by cell phone that we could check in. Most rooms in the older hotels (and some of the newer ones, as well) are small and this one was no exception. The location is perfect: in the Quarter but off of Bourbon Street, so noise was not a factor. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: lindata
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights - ending on Easter. They had a great deal going on for Easter that I couldn't resist! The location was fantastic - close to great food and Bourbon Street and the Canal/Garden streetcars. The room was not too big but I was expecting that. We were on the 3rd floor with no view at all - but also expected that given the great rate I got. The Carousel Bar was great. The rooftop pool looked nice but I expected a better view of the area/river.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time - First time in New Orleans - N'awlins!”
Reviews.Author: tresh20723
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monteleone is perfectly located for visitng the French Quarter for the first time. It is one street over from Bourbon and within easy walking distance to everything in the French Quarter, The Aquarium, Harrah's and the business district is also close-by. The hotel is clean, rooms well-appointed and lots of amenities - updated and modern. Daily room service does start a little later (hence ends later) than a lot of hotels we've stayed in. One day, the room was being serviced @ about 5 p.m. when we were returning from a day out of sightseeing and walking. The only other slight complaint is with the POOL area - way too small for a hotel of this size. We realize it is a historic hotel built many years ago, but since the weather was gorgeous, we wanted to sit byt he pool one day - the area can hanlde maybe 100 people (if that) - for a hotel with almost 600 rooms - is nto adequate.... if relaxing poolside is important - look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: MJG2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my spouse after a cruise. Our room was not immediatly ready due to our early arrival but made every effort to get us into our room at the first possible moment. The location of the hotel is in the French Quarter but away from Bourbon street excess, The hotel bar and roof top pool should not be missed. The history of the hotel and opulance of the building is a welcome change. Definately will return.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: blondemommy05
Reviews.Content: After years of visiting New Orleans and a brief stint living here, I had the opportunity to stay at the Monteleone. Mostly because almost every hotel acceptable to me in the city, including my preferred, the Loews on Poydras, was booked for the ACC conference the same weekend I needed to be in town. But I was excited because I love the Carousel Bar and had always fantasized about staying at the Monteleone. Well, I knew from a long time ago not to expect a huge room, and since I booked in the traditional part of the building, I knew that I'd be getting something 'petite". So no surprises or misconceptions there. But, I have to say, the view they hide with multiple layers of drapery is worth hiding. Basically what we call in NYC, an air shaft. OK, I wasn't there for the views from the room. But I have to say the carpet was a little worse for the wear. And something I didn't notice until my traveling comapnion did - our room abutted a mechanical closet which meant that we went to sleep with a vibration and a buzzing in our heads. The hotel could have avoided this in our room entirely by placing the beds on the opposite wall. Or by hiring an engineer to insure proper sound insulation for guests. And our room was more than $200/night. The entire time, my poor friend had to listen to me compare the room and value to the Loews - which I stay at regularly. All in all, nothing beats the location of the Monteleone. But I doubt I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at monteleone”
Reviews.Author: manyadm
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed a lovely visit to the Hotel Monteleone. I lived in NOLA for 11 years in the 90s and always wanted to stay there, and this trip offered the opportunity for a visit. Lovely, gracious, very New Orleanian in all facets. Lovely, cozy rooms with fantastic views. (Definitely worthwhile getting an upper floor for the river view!) Personnel professional and kind. Easy to stay there as a woman alone (not always true), but would also be fun for family; will bring them along next time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fun at one of the most haunted hotels in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: racole
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel was for an education conference. The event happened to be on the same weekend as the New Orleans Jazz Festival. I did not hear any of the noise and festivities from my hotel room. The room was quiet and the daily housekeeping excellent. They came late daily to clean the room but it was done right and made brand new each day. The hotel concierge staff were very helpful in recommending restaurants and trip ideas. We had a problem with being picked up for the City Tour van but the concierge took care of following up with the tour company so our day was not spoiled. Overall, the hotel was wonderful. We did not see any ghosts from the 14th floor but the hotel's reputation is part of New Orleans lore.

Reviews.Title: “Great French Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loveagreatvacation
Reviews.Content: My trip was dual purpose. It started out as a conference and ended with a visit to Tulane University which my daughter was accepted to. I stayed at the Monteleone for 5 nights. An added bonus was being in the French Quarter during French Quarter festival. All in all every aspect of our stay was amazing. The conference rooms were comfortable and the food the hotel served during the conference was amazing. We had a great visit to Tulane University. The ride from the hotel was either a 15 minute cab ride or a 45 minute street car ride. We did both. If you enjoy being in the French Quarter where al l the action is you will love this hotel. It is located on Royal which is the prettiest street in the French quarter with many galleries, antique stores and great restaurants. It is just one block away from Bourbon St. We enjoyed relaxing at the rooftop pool after a long day of walking all over town. I love NO and would highly recommend this hotel. One problem with NO in general is that when it gets humid (which it was for part of the stay) the rooms start smelling musty. I think this is a problem in all NO hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: marsk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monteleone during French Quarter Festival. The location is perfect. I loved the coral orange begonias in the window boxes flanking both sides of the the front entrance to the Hotel. I requested a quiet room and my request was honored; my room was quiet. The room was lovely and well appointed. I loved the high ceiling & the deep bath tub was a plus for sure. I had a nice stay with just one hiccup; my room service tray was never picked up even after I called for pick up. I ordered breakfast on my first morning there and the tray never was picked up; I checked out and the tray was still there at check out time. I had a Spa treatment at SPA ARIA; the sugar scrub massage. It was heavenly. The shower after the scrub was wonderful; it had a rain shower, a hand held shower plus shower jets! Maylin has magic hands. She had perfect pressure and was a genuine & pleasant person. I asked her how many rooms the Hotel had and she wasn't sure. I asked the woman at the reception desk at the Spa also and she did not know. The woman at the desk looked like she could be a Supervisor or Spa Manager. I was surprised that she did not know. Even if the Spa is a separate entity there should be some basic knowledge of the Hotel that the independent vendor should know about the Hotel they are located in. We had drinks both nights in the Carousal Bar and Julie was one of the best cocktail waitresses I have ever encountered; great customer service skills. Three things that should change at the Monteleone; 1. Do not charge for Computer use. Even some motels do not charge for this amenity. I know people who will not stay in places that charge for computer use especially when paying full rack rate for a room. At $300 plus per night with prepayment in full in advance; this should be included in the rate. 2. The entry way stairs carpet is tired & worn looking. It is the first thing you see entering the Hotel and does not give a good first impression. 3. The mattress was a little too soft & worn. All in all I enjoyed the Monteleone and will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location”
Reviews.Author: ChicaTexas_USA
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel recently and loved it! We arrived in New orleans early in the morning as we had a 9.00 meeting - the hotel allowed us to check in early which was awesome. Staff were very helpful, the bathroom was huge and although we faced the front of Royal street we never heard any street noise. We did not eat a meal here but did have drinks in the bar and coffee etc. Close to great reataurants and all the major sites and the doormen are fast at getting cabs. The pool is a good size - overall we loved this hotel and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Hotel Monteleone”
Reviews.Author: flosue
Reviews.Content: It's a pretty expensive place to stay but we love to pamper ourselves when we travel so we figured what the heck. A great friend recommended it. It's pretty and grand when you enter but don't rely on the bellman to assist you in any way getting your heavy luggage up the few stairs because they are busy smoking outside the hotel. We hoped to leave the thoughts of cold Michigan weather and lounge around the cool outside rooftop pool drinking cocktails. NOPE! Pool was closed for a private event that no one told us about when we booked our room. Wouldn't you think the reservations office in the Monteleone would kindly tell people that the pool would be off limits for several days? Creeps! Also, we wanted to check our email while there and get this...$7 for twenty minutes to use the computers in the business center. One of the four treadmills in the exercise room was broken my entire stay. Our TV in our room did not get NBC or CBS and while this wouldn't normally be any big deal it was this trip because we wanted to watch the basketball finals. Would I stay at this hotel again? Not on your life. Would I recommend traveling to New Orleans? Yes! It's a city full of fun, history, and good times. Just stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DolceMeta
Reviews.Content: This historic hotel is in the perfect location in the Quarter. One block from Bourbon so as a business traveler I had all the restaurants and sights around the corner, but since the hotel is on a side street, I was able to sleep at night. The rooftop pool is perfect. Meeting facilities can be kind of confusing to find at first, but that is due to the historic build. Staff is great and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good yet disappointing”
Reviews.Author: leswitch
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby, one block from the French Quarter with helpful and attentive staff. However several key short comings: 1) The room was small. So small that it barely had 18 inches of space betwwen the end of the bed and the credenza that housed the TV. I had to walk sideways to get through to the bathroom.. I am average size for a man at 5' 9" and 180 lbs. I can't imagine a big guy getting through without sliding accross the top of the bed. 2) The Hotel Cafe/dining room was very mediocre. One morning I was served eggs benedict on an untoasted chewy muffin and on a second morning I was served a rather look warm waffle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Monteleone”
Reviews.Author: hpjet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monteleone to celebrate our 30th anniversary and had a great experience during our four night stay. The cleanliness of our preferred king room was excellent. Towels were plentiful and the daily housekeeping was always completed before we returned from our daily activities. The bellman who assisted us upon our arrival was quite informative and made us feel very welcome. Upon check in we received a nice card and two complimentary drinks at the Carousel bar. We slept well and weren't disturbed by any noise from the hallway or nearby rooms. Considering the hotel was full with NCAA enthusiasts, we were pleasantly surprised that noise wasn't an issue. The service in the Carousel bar was a little slow and the staff wasn't overly friendly. The wait staff in the Cafe couldn't do enough for us and seemed to be very attentive to all of its customers at breakfast. The location was perfect !! We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again on any future trips to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not what we expected...”
Reviews.Author: marnold99
Reviews.Content: Prior to booking our trip, I reviewed what other folks had to say about this hotel. One had mentioned the air conditioning system and the noise from the streets at night. I thought they were just being picky and decided to book anyway. I should have taken their advice. The cooling system was not good. We were either freezing or hot because the air blows directly on you as you try to sleep and it never regulates. At one point I tried to turn it off but then the noise from the streets was too loud so I needed the cooling system in order to fall asleep. Not that we wouldn't expect the noise from the streets, it is N'Awlin's; however, we were on the 15th floor. We also had an empty mini bar - it was never filled while we were there. Not even with water or OJ. No water bottles were available either. Lastly, the pool is very small and the pictures of it on their Web site are deceiving. Also, their business center needs to be upgraded. One computer available to guests is not acceptable. At one point there was a line of 8 people waiting to print travel documents or to check email. Good things - the hotel bar is cool and fun and most of the staff was pleasant. The lobby is nice and the rooms are clean. This was our 3rd trip to NOLA and I was extremely excited about this hotel. Unfortunately I give it a C.

Reviews.Title: “Average, adequate, but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: DiveGirl22
Reviews.Content: I choose the Monteleone for location and because it's beautiful from the outside. The rooms are small, but this is normal considering the age of the hotel. The lobby and decor and quite nice although the rooms have a general "worn out" feel to them. Stained carpets, chipped paint, etc. I was disappointed to learn there were no refreshment centers or "minibars" in the room. Apparently they've been removed, but are still listed as an amenity on their website. It's nice to have a refrigerator for water or juice without having to run out for ice every few hours. My mother and I arrived via taxi and were not assisted with our luggage at all. We struggled to pull our luggage up the stairs to the lobby while the doorman flirted with a group of young girls. Check in was fine, but it took three separate calls to receive extra hangers for our room. Wifi is expensive at $11/day and wasn't even reliable. Also, I paid for two days starting at 6:00pm on a Wednesday night, but by Friday morning, my service had been turned off. This happened to me again the following week, so be warned - when you purchase 2 days, you are purchasing calendar days, not 48 hours from the time of purchase. That is a complete rip-off! As a previous poster mentioned, the pool area was generally dirty with trash, left over glasses and used towels. Nor was there any bar/poolside service available. There is just nothing about this hotel that earns it a 4 star rating. I wish I had stayed at the Ritz Carton, but my mother did not want to stay on Canal. Average at best, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Clean and Non-Smoking!”
Reviews.Author: FlyingWyo
Reviews.Content: Family trip for St Paddy's day. I reserved 2 traditional rooms using the hotel's online process and found it easy. Two days prior to the trip, the reservations desk sent a welcoming email confirming my reservations - anticipatory service! At check-in, my parents were upgraded *for free* to a king suite and it was beautifully appointed, very large - they had a k-cup coffeemaker in the suite. Our room was a 2-double traditional and it was adequately sized; I would call it a normal room with the drip-brew coffee maker. Overall, we were really happy with the cleanliness and had no problems with any noise. The hotel is right in action of the French Quarter without being in constant parade of merrymaking. We used the baggage check service both on arrival and at departure; it was very well run and felt very secure. The Doormen were gracious in providing advice on lunch haunts with real creole cuisine as well as getting taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Generally nice, a few problems”
Reviews.Author: susangz
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to New Orleans, we stayed at the Monteleone, the refurbished "grande dame" of the French Quarter. Our room was nice with a view of the Mississippi. The fitness center and rooftop pool are great if you want to exercise to justify eating all that great NOLA food. The Carousel bar is truly unique; try a Pimm's Cup if you're tired out and hot from walking around the Quarter. The location is perfect - on Royal, not noisy Bourbon Street, an easy walk from the sights of the Quarter and neighboring areas. The staff made good suggestions about places to go. However, given the high price of the rooms, the Monteleone management needs to do a few things to justify their luxury pricing. First of all, the wifi service is REALLY unreliable and the tech support, while polite, was not much help. Don't count on internet access when you need it - it may be fine for an hour or so, but we found that the signal dropped at least 10 times in three days. When you're trying to fit in a little bit of work between meals and outings, it's important that wifi be available when you need it. Secondly, cleanliness in public areas could use some work. On Sunday morning after 9 a.m., towels were neatly arranged on the pool chairs, but the deck around the chairs was still littered with the detritus of the night before - cigarette butts, food debris, and broken glass. Thirdly, participants in a large scale meeting in the rooftop conference room took up many poolside tables for work meetings (one-on-one interviews about sales performance, it seemed) during peek weekend pool hours. If a business meeting needs "break-out" space, assign them to spaces inside the building or in a separate area. It's hard to relax poolside when we had to place chairs next to garbage cans because the table were taken up by sincere young people explaining to their supervisors what factors were affecting their sales records. Finally, it's a mystery to us as to why the only African American employees we met were doormen - and the front desk and gift shop were mostly staffed by sullen Eastern European "foreign students" (as they told me). Most of the staff was really friendly and helpful - as we expected in this city of charming accents and nice folks - special kudos to the guy running the luggage checkroom and Brandon on the front desk who helped us on Sunday morning. But in a time of high unemployment in Crescent City, we can't think of any legal justification for why the Monteleone would be employing white foreigners of dubious visa status over natives of the city. Your city is full of hardworking friendly folk - you need to bring more of them to the front of the house!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: gallopingon
Reviews.Content: This grand old hotel has quiet, comfortable rooms and good beds. The hotel breakfast is a la carte, or a breakfast buffet including an omelette station. The location is excellent for exploring the French Quarter. They have valet parking and are able to retrieve cars fairly quickly from the garage. Our only negative really has nothing to do with the hotel. We found the lobby crowded with other patrons, many of whom were dressed so casually they looked like they had been on camping trips or playing in the dirt with their kids. This is a beautiful old hotel and I wish the clientele could realize that they can dress in a way that is fitting with their surroundings, and still be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, lovely family-run hotel in the hear of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: MurphBaltimore
Reviews.Content: Our family (including two kids, 10 and 11) spent a great week in New Orleans. The staff at the Hotel Monteleone was friendly and accommodating, the hotel is lovely, the rooftop pool a welcome luxury after long days of walking the French Quarter. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BuckyToronto
Reviews.Content: You are in the French Quarter but slightly away from the madness of Bourbon St. Service, from the doorman to the front desk, was excellent. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Stark3
Reviews.Content: Pros: Perfect location in the French Quarter. Walking distance to all major attractions, entertainment, and resturaunts. Just one block from Bourbon St. Check in and Check out were effortless and hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms/corridors were clean and smoke-free. The food was pricey but definitely comparable to other places in the Quarter. Late night room service was a plus. The Carrousel Lounge was a unique feature. Heated rooftop pool with nice lounge area. Although we did not use the spa, most of the services were priced competively. Cons: Vlalet parking was expensive (around $36 per night with tax), although most other hotels do charge within range. The main parking garage attached to the hotel was full when we arrived so our vehicle was parked in an overflow garage on a neighboring street. Later I learned that our vehicle was parked in a roof top spot in the overflow area, which was visible from the rooftop pool of the hotel. I was somewhat bothered that it was not in a covered area being exposed to the elements. When we picked it up from valet it was very dirty with pollen and bird droppings. Although dropping off our vehicle for valet was quick and seemless, the pick up was not. We waited at least 25 minutes for our car upon check out. I would suggest calling down ahead of time if you want to retrieve the vehicle in a timely manner. Our room was located on the 4th floor, which was still very susceptible to street noise. Therefore, sleeping was very difficult ( But I guess no one goes to NOLA to catch up on ZZZ). I found that the room was much more relaxing in the daylight hours. However, the location more than made up for the few problems we had and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Monteleone at Mardi Gras.......”
Reviews.Author: bigorange1103
Reviews.Content: I am originally from the area and brought a friend down from North Carolina for the weekend before Mardi Gras. I have always wanted to stay at the Monteleone and never got around to it. There were other hotels a little further out cheaper but I said I might as well splurge and have a prime location. It was worth every penny and more!!! The service was excellent, room spotless and you couldnt have a better location!!! It was so close to Bourbon that you could go back to the hotel to use the restroom and freshen up then head back out. I had a "traditional" room and it was a little small but enough room for 2 people. We used the valet service and enjoyed the Carousel Bar. Everything was great and will definately return!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: juju571
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 4 times over the past 2 years, great location, 1 block from Bourbon and 2 from Canal- about 10 minute walk to Jackson square. Friendly and professional staff, very clean rooms with excellent maid service- spend a little extra and stay in a royal salon room- jaccuzi tub and huge bathroom!! Rooms are nice sized with elegant decor. Buffet breakfast at Le Cafe is awesome!!!! Omlet station, biscuits and gravy, fresh squeezed OJ. We love this hotel, great romantic getaway, very quiet, heated roof top pool, this place never disappoints!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Tradewinns
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We've previously stayed at the Royal Sonesta and I was disappointed that it was booked, but it turned out to be a great opportunity to discover another great hotel in NOLA. We had a two room suite and it was very large. The living are included a 1/2 bath and the bedroom was large with a large master bath with a separate tub and shower. The room was clean and comfortable and the maid service was great - we even had turn down service each night, a nice touch. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and I actually enjoyed the quiet of being one block off if bourbon. I still prefer the pool at Royal Sonesta, but this pool scene looked pretty lively, it was just smaller. Over all it was a great stay and now I have two favorites in the French Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: marssl
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is fantastic. In the quarter, but away from noisy Bourbon. Rooms are adequately apportioned, but are very small. The decor reminded me of a nice Hampton Inn - clean, but nothing special. At the time I booked, the Ritz was only $30 more per night. I should have spent the extra money as the Ritz's rooms are about 3 times as big and much, much nicer. That being said, I would stay here again, but it would have to be a really good deal.

Reviews.Title: “would not go anywhere else in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: jamesdyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed the the Monteleone in February after discovering it last April. It was wonderful to enter the beautiful foyer and be welcomed again. The weather was unseasonably cold, but my wife worked out each morning, then swam in the heated rooftop pool - even though the temperatures were in the low 30's. It is a joy to be in the heart of the French Quarter, just a block from Bourbon, but in the peace and quiet of Royal Street. We loved walking everywhere in the Quarter and finding great restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel (as well as dining at the Hunt Grill in the restaurant). We had a ghost on our floor, but will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lizziern
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to New Orleans and I was very happy with our chose of hotel, thank you tripadvisor. The staff was professional, friendly and very helpfull. Our room was beautiful, very clean and the bed was soooo comfortable. Not knowing the french Quarter, we found the location to be great, close enough to everything but still maintaining some quiet. Will stay here again without hesitation and recommend it to anyone visiting the city!!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm in the Heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: sandiagal
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here and loved it! Full disclosure...if you like big bathrooms, do not stay here. This is a historic hotel which means the rooms and bathrooms will not be as large as more "modern" hotels. With that said, it is a beautiful and elegant choice for those who want to be in the Quarters. Walking distance to restaurants, shopping, etc. Wonderful service, elegant fixtures, comfortable bed/linens. I would definitely recommend it and would stay here again! One recommendation though...We are living in the Internet age. Please consider discontinuing your fee for WiFi. Annoying to have to pay for it and the process to initiate it was NOT user friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: drmgeorge
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monteleone during a business trip. I had a very positive experience. The rooms are a bit dated and small, but certainly adequate. $11 for Internet is a bit much. The pool area was closed for renovations, which was disappointing. The meeting facilities were very nice, and all of the staff friendly and helpful. Overall, a good place to stay in the heart of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing and poor”
Reviews.Author: brf78
Reviews.Content: the room wasn't ready before 5pm! service at the reception was a disaster thinking that it is normal that the room is not ready before 5pm!!! the hotel is not clean at all : dirty carpets... it is not worth the price at all! on top on that more than 10$ to get internet access, isn't this nice???

Reviews.Title: “disapointed”
Reviews.Author: david8009
Reviews.Content: great hotel great position unfortunately a let down for us, very poor room maid service we had been site seeing only to find room not cleaned [4pm] when we wished to rest before dinner. then the maid appeared looking for a tip. The hotel also let the room knowing the fridge did not work, for that sort of money it's just acceptable. Come on Monteleone pull your socks up

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel inside and out...”
Reviews.Author: MSBENNY
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night here on February 12, 2011. We arrived early around 10 am, expecting just to drop our luggage off until our room was ready at check in, 3 o'clock. But lucky for us our room was ready at 10 and we were able to put our luggage in our room and rest a little while before heading out to see the city. The hotel is beautiful inside and out. Just one street over from Bourbon Street and a few blocks from Canal Street. The only drawback from staying here was we still heard the noise from the street, although we were on the seventh floor. Not enough to keep us up at night, but we were woken up a couple of times from car horns blowing and people yelling out, I guess heading home from late night partying on Bourbon Street. The room and bathroom were super clean and nice. We ate at the Hunt Room Grill in the hotel for dinner and I can't say enough about the food and the service. Our meal was wonderful. We were here in New Orleans for the Marathon/Half Marathon. My husband ran the half.

Reviews.Title: “Here for the party...”
Reviews.Author: ACMan53
Reviews.Content: First time to New Orleans and we wanted to stay near the French Quarter (A disappoint). We came to celebrate my father-in-laws 70th birthday. Picked the hotel by random, having not been there before. But it was a pleasant surprise...it was in the Fench Quarter, so everything was reachable by foot, but far enough away from Bourbon St. that the noise was not a problem. The staff was extremely friendly from the valet, to the front desk to the room staff. We got a suite, which was perfect for the two of us

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 or 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: BLovell53
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a decent 3 star hotel centrally located in the French Quarter. It may have been a 4 or 5 star hotel 30 years ago but now it is past it's prime. The rooms are very small, at least ours was. The first room had no windows and wasn't much larger than the king size bed. I asked for another room with a window, which they promptly gave us, and we had a window view of a brick wall, but at least we had a window. The bathroom was tiny and the bed was springy. That said, the staff was all very friendly and helpful and the concierge, contrary to some of the reports here, was also very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!! They saved our New Orleans Trip!”
Reviews.Author: estrnmountain
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I decided to spend a long weekend in New Orleans, I immediately did research on hotels via tripadvisor.com and this hotel was highly rated. I tried to make a reservation, but unfortunately all rooms were booked at the time of our visit due to two large conventions going on in town. I made a reservation for place d'armes hotel instead. Upon our check in at place d'armes, I knew immediately that we would not be able to spend 4 nights there. At 2:15 am, I called Hotel Monteleone and spoke with Monique in reservations and explained my situation to her. She was outstanding to work with! She was so accomodating and did all she could to find me a room in the hotel. After talking with her for about 30 minutes, she could not book a reservation because all rooms were showing as being booked. Due to the recent storms that hit a lot of the States, Monique recommended that I either call back later in the morning or come into the hotel directly to see if there were any cancellations. Later that morning after trying to sleep a few hours at place d'armes, we went to Monteleone, and between Monique and Iriana (I may have spelling wrong), they were able to confirm a two night reservation for us. Hotel Monteleone is beautiful! It is such a great property and the location is excellent! It is right in the heart of the French Quarter, and very close to all the great places for food, drink, art, music, etc. It is very close to Bourbon Street, but far enough away to escape the noise and have a restful night of sleep. We walked just about everywhere from the hotel, and only took a cab when heading into the Garden District for dinner. Our room was very clean and very comfortable, with very nice appointments. The rooms, along with the rest of the hotel are very charming and very inviting. I did see some folks state in their reviews that they experienced bad service. Maybe it was just an off night when they were there, but I can tell you that the service we received was outstanding the entire time of our stay. The doorman was always very friendly and nice, and provided great recommendations. Each night we walked out, he would ask 'where are you heading to dinner tonight" and would provide recommendations from the menu. We spent a few hours in the Carousel Bar and had a great time there, again with outstanding service. If you do stay at the hotel, please find time to go to the Carousel Bar. It's a great experience! So, to sum it up about the service, for us, who did not have a reservation prior to walking into the hotel, I have to say everyone we encountered treated us like we were old friends and frequent stayers at the hotel. this hotel and staff truly made our first trip to New Orleans a great one, and a very memorable one. Had we not been fortunate enough to get a reservation there, we would have had to stay the full 4 nights at the other hotel we were booked at, and that would have resulted in a very bad time in New Orleans. Thank you Hotel Monteleone for an outstanding weekend! Monique and Iriana, you two are the best and we can't thank you enough for all you did to help us! We will most definitely stay at this hotel again the next time we visit New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Primo Location/Old Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunner01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monteleone with a small group of friends for the pure pleasure of staying in the French Quarter. The location is 2nd to none. You can walk everywhere important, Bourban Street, the mall, the casino, Cafe DuMonde, etc. For that convenience, you must pay the price. The hotel is quite old so it comes with the stylings of an old hotel, however, it was comfortable and the staff was helpful. The most challenging part of the stay was the old guy who insisted on singing right in front of the hotel entrance at midnight. His not-so-glorious sounds echoed to all of the rooms with front facing windows. Also - this hotel DOES NOT offer free internet nor does it have a business center. I thought that was ridiculous, you can generally get free wi-fi at just about any 4+ star hotel. Also, I highly recommend that if you're interested in city activities, tours, etc. that you not go through the hotel concierge. She was only slightly helpful (after I waited 10 minutes for her to finish another phone call) and they pump you into the most pricey and least interesting tours. If you leave the hotel, walk to the left and walk about 1.5 blocks and there a little shop on the right that specializes in all kinds of tours, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, BEAUTIFUL STAY will go back again”
Reviews.Author: tvsethi
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience I highly recommend calling into the actual hotel for questions and rates, I actually found this hotel by mistake driving by but was VERY HAPPY with my stay!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel - I'll be back again”
Reviews.Author: BusyMoma
Reviews.Content: I've been to New Orleans 5 times and this is my third stay at the Monteleone. Why? Because it is such a welcome haven after touring all day (and half the night!). The staff is very helpful, really friendly, and everything is well-maintained for such an older hotel. The lobby is comfortable, and the beds are the best ever! The only reason I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 for rooms was because this was the first time I was given a small room. I usually get a much larger room but for some reason the room assigned was very small. There was only one chair so one of us had to sit on the bed. Also, we both couldn't pass in front of the bed at the same time - it was a very narrow space to get from one side of the room to the other. This was the only disappointment, as I've never had such a small room here. I am not sure if it had anything to do with the room being booked on a third party site vs. directly with them, which is what I normally do. But otherwise, a great hotel, I highly recommend it for the superior staff, furnishings, bed comfort and general ambience.

Reviews.Title: “2011 Anniversary at the Monteleone”
Reviews.Author: ronroberts
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights for our anniversary and I must say that everyone was very courteous, but Ken the bellman was extremely nice, polite, informative, and just all around a perfect gentleman. The location was perfect. The bed was a little hard according to my wife but I had no issue with this at all. I do however wish the refreshment center in the room had not been out of order but definitely a must "stay at again" for me. Ken, if you happen to see this review the Old Coffee Pot was delicious, and the service was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monteleone offers best of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: CaroleLois
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Hotel Monteleone. We enjoyed it so much that it well be our go-to place for all our future trips to New Orleans. The hotel is lovely, extremely clean and full of amenities: supercomfortable bed, well-equipped fitness room, rooftop heated pool even in winter, excellent service. The cafe offers an excellent breakfast buffet that is delicious and extensive with many food choices. The famous Carousel bar and lounge is hopping and services great cocktails. And the location, right at the entrance to the French Quarter on Royal St, is ideal. One tip for your trip: no need to rent a car as a taxi from the airport (standard fee) is cheaper and faster than an airport shuttle, and since you can walk easily walk to everything, you also avoid the hotel parking fee! Do take the walking tours and guided tours that are great sources of the history of this great town.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice hotel but Housekeeping is poor”
Reviews.Author: tennis0228
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my 19yo son for a few days of R&R. Chose this hotel because of its French Quarter location and previous Trip Advisor reviews. Parking garage is a bit odd to get to but once found, it works. Checked in no problem but when we went up to the room which was located right next to the elevator. Bedside lamp did not work and once we turned the ceiling light on, Skittle candy was on the carpet between the two beds. Had this room been cleaned recently? Not wanting to know the answer to that question, I called down to the front desk and spoke with Gabrielle who pleasantly stated that she would get back to me in a few minutes which she did. We were switched to a different room and then Gabrielle followed up with another phone call to make sure we were happy with the room change which we were.Staff were friendly and helpful including Lucille,a server in the Le Cafe restaurant, the bellman and concierge Eva who arranged a sightseeing tour for us and then the next day asked us about the experience. While much is positive about the hotel,Housekeeping was poor enough to question how well the room was cleaned each day. For two days, the same hair remained in the sink and the same piece of trash laid on the bathroom floor. One day we did not receive toiletries. Toilet needs repair, water leaking from the toilet and yet if the housekeeper cleaned the floor surely she would notice the pool of water? Despite the privacy sign hanging on the door, the housekeeper nonetheless knocked on the door. Privacy means no disturbance right? Even with the questionable Housekeeping, I would stay at this hotel again because of the location and the value.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: tennrose
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monteleone has the most courteous and friendly staff of any hotel I've ever visited. This extends to the restaurants located within the hotel where I was treated like I was special. The rooms were immaculately clean with all the amenities needed for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: studentcl2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the weekend on our first trip to NOLA. The hotel is beautiful. We arrived several hours before check in and they had a room ready for us and allowed us to check in at about 10:00am. The hotel lobby is very nice and is really bustling in the evenings. I can't complain about the size of the hotel room. We did have the basic king hotel room, but I actually expected it to be much smaller. We did not stay in the room much. It was basically just a home base for us. The location was great for us. We spent the entire weekend walking all over the French Quarter, and even walked quite a long walk to the Garden District. We ended up getting a taxi back though, because it was quite far. It was far enough from Bourbon street to avoid most of the noise, but we still did here some on Sunday morning even at 6:00am. It didn't bother us too much because it is New Orleans and we just expected to hear drunks out in the street at all hours. It wasn't too bad though. Beds and pillows are comfortable, room had a flat screen TV. The fridge didn't appear to be on, but we didn't need to use it so it didn't matter to us. We really are not picky people at all. It would really take something big for us to complain about a hotel. We have no complaints. It was a nice room, great location, and no complaints from us. We did not eat or drink in the hotel restaurants or bar. We went to the roof to check out the pool and fitness center and both were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Great location”
Reviews.Author: jjw503
Reviews.Content: Wife and I went for our anniversary. Staff are very friendly and helpful. We stayed in one of the junior suites so we had plenty of room. Will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't honor "Best Rate Guarantee"”
Reviews.Author: journeyn2now
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel promises a "best rate guarantee", on its website, don't believe it! I read the small print and complied with the requirements. When I called to request the best rate guarantee, it was clear that the hotel never had any intention of honoring its guarantee. I don't understand why a hotel would promote something that it clearly has no intention of honoring. All that does is make people mad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel but Small Room”
Reviews.Author: Kabecka
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the location of Hotel Monteleone, very close to great restaurants and shopping on Royal Street. It is less than 10 minutes to walk to Jackson Square. It is just a few minutes away from Bourbon Street. The hotel is very clean, very pretty and very characteristic of a hotel in the French Quarter. We stayed in a room with 1 King sized bed. It was pretty small, not leaving a lot of room to walk around the bed. It was just my husband and I, so it was fine, but there wouldn't be much room for another person. Perhaps other rooms are bigger. I must also say that the walls are a little thin, we heard a toilet flushing and...ahem...some other noises during our stay. Overall though, I would recommend this hotel for location, service and decor.

Reviews.Title: “A new orleans gem”
Reviews.Author: Randolph0918
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the Christmas holidays for 3 nights . The service was excellent at the front desk and the concierge Cleatta was wonderful . The Carousel Bar was a delight and we never had trouble getting waited on whether at the bar or at a table . My only complaint was that they should have saved some reservations for the Christmas day buffet for hotel guests . We were on a waitlist but had to go to another restaurant because there was not an opening until right before the opening of the restaurant . They should probably ask guests at the time of booking on holidays if they would like reservations in their restaurant as a reminder that they can be sold out .Overall a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Great front desk staff, disorganized and Up-charges $$$”
Reviews.Author: McGunn
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monteleone is beautiful on the inside and very clean. The front desk staff is friendly, well-trained and organized. It is well-known for having ghosts and is charming. They are also pet-friendly and greet the pets with their bag of goodies, place mat and their own bowl. The outdoor swimming pool on the top deck is clean and warm. Now, this is where the problems begin. The bar at the pool does not open until they feel like it. The service is slower than molasses and the UP-CHARGES BEGIN...If you buy a beer it may cost $7.50, plus an automatic gratuity of 18%, plus s New Orleans tax, plus a regular tax....wow, that Stella just got up to over $10.00 dollars. They make you tip whether you get your food in 20 minutes or an hour. Yes, it is that disorganized and that pricey for room service as well! In addition room service hours are limited. They offer a Pet-Friendly hotel but there is not ONE ITEM ON THE MENU FOR A PET! WHY DON'T THEY OFFER ROAST BEEF OR CHICKEN OR ANYTHING FOR A DOG! They charge a $100.00 dollars and than $25.00 dollars per day for the dog. They charge $30.00 a night for parking. The management is friendly but the kitchen is DISORGANIZED and they forget the coffee or the toast or the eggs, etc. Since it was the Thanksgiving Holidays and we wanted to have a traditional Turkey, etc. we went on-line and checked out the hotels and restaurants. We chose the Monteleone because their website offered the Tur-Duckin, a turkey stuffed with duck and chicken. We made reservations and when we arrived no one knew what was going on. It WAS A BUFFET THAT WAS LESS THAN MEDIOCRE AND VERY, VERY EXPENSIVE. It was too late to change and manager came over and showed us the menu and it was nothing like we saw on-line. The next day we talked to the concierge about the menu....and lo and behold she had a TOTALLY DIFFERENT MENU THAN we had! The kitchen staff and the restaurant manager need some serious direction. So, in conclusion, the Hotel Monteleone may offer discounts and pet-friendly but the up-charges are outrageous. In March, I will look for a hotel where all of the charges are up front. The automatic gratuity stinks because the wait staff doesn't care how long it takes. They get rewarded whether they take 10 minutes or 30 minutes. In the bar area, if you are lucky enough to get a seat at the Carousel bar, you get good service. However, if you have to sit at one of the tables, I wish you a lot of luck getting waited on. The staff gathers in the service room and chit-chats with each other. We were there for 5 nights and believe me, it became a joke. They throw a bowl of snacks in front of you and charge $15.00 dollars for a martini, including up-charges of course! I plan on finding a much better hotel in New Orleans and I will let you know what it is.

Reviews.Title: “I'm not sold if your a light sleeper :(”
Reviews.Author: dianetravel
Reviews.Content: Okay so to start the Monteleone is beautiful. The staff was super friendly when we got in and the lobby is beautiful. They also have a great bar. The bad....walls are like paper. If you are a light sleeper this hotel is not for you. Sad to say it but its the truth. Heard my neighbors talking and even coughing. The bed however was really comfortable and the pool deck was gorgeous (even though it was too cold for us to swim). Also no free internet in the rooms :(

Reviews.Title: “We'll be Back for Our Anniversary!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsDola1230
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monteleone from December 29-31, 2010; this was our first stay. It was me, my fiance (now husband), and two friends. We got married in the French Quarter on the 30th, and from the moment we stepped out of our car until Ryan closed our trunk and we drove away, there was never a moment when we weren't treated like royalty! As soon as our bags were out of the car, they got us checked in to our wonderful rooms - 11th floor - and were practically falling over themselves to make every second fantastic!! When rain threatened our outdoor wedding, everyone was extremely helpful in offering up alternatives in the hotel. Luckily, the weather panned out...! We took many bridal portraits in the lobby and Carousel Bar, and were given every little thing asked for that day - right down to the corkscrew we asked for at 4 am!!! My husband says he wants to return and stay at the Monteleone every year on our anniversary, and we're already planning our return for 2011! Absolutely PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with location and value”
Reviews.Author: Linda36508
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Close to the heart of French Quarter but not much street noise at night. Al and Maurice made the stay very pleasant. Al has been with hotel for many years and had so much great information about local places to eat and attractions. Make sure you ask for him if you do not see him, but he was often in the lobby looking to help. The hotel itself has so much history and was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not four stars”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkMax88
Reviews.Content: I am not sure if the people rating this hotel are being paid or prompted. My husband and I read all the reviews before booking for our recent stay in NO. Positives: It has a great location and is near by all of the necessary sites. It has a heated pool, decent gym facility, and nice roof top views. There is a carousel bar in the lobby that is unique and the lounge is a nice place to hang out at night. Negatives: There is an extremely late check in, 3:00-5:00. They will check your bags for you but if you are coming off a long flight then you won't have a chance to shower before heading out. The rooms are very small and are not what is expected for a four star rating at all. As if that weren't enough, the concierge, Eva, was not only ignorant but couldn't be bothered to assist people when needed. Her favorite reply to everyone who calls, "I'm on the other line long distance and I have to call you back." She did this to us several times and answered the phone to other guests while we were standing in front of her. This is also including the time when she was 'busy' chatting to a coworker. Each time we asked for a recommendation for a restaurant, her responses were vague and not helpful at all. We had to rely on yelp for help. Therefore, if you want a hotel that is decent and it has the things you are looking for in the positives then you may not care about paying for a four star hotel that is really has two star service.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Shaheen9
Reviews.Content: My wife I stayed here during the Christmas through New Years week. They hotel was grand and majestic. If you like to have the larger hotel style with true historic charm then this is the hotel for you. The rates were very reasonable and the amenities were fantastic with a threadmill overlooking the riverbend. The staff was very friendly and attentive to our needs. I was sad that I checked out for two of the day to switch hotels for a change. I went to the W on the quarter and I was so disappointed that I did. I really missed the Monteleone. The location was also great to everything. Close to Canal and already in the French Market. The concierge could have been a little more helpful but that was ok since we did our own research.

Reviews.Title: “A great, historic, regal hotel in the best possible location.”
Reviews.Author: tuckermdmd
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was absolutely perfect. It is one block from Burbon St, three blocks from Canal St, a quick walk to the waterfront, Harrah's and many fine restaraunts. The hotel is located on Royal St which is lined with wonderful art and antique shops, street performers and Cafe' Begniet. Though the rooms are not big by modern standards, it is certainly large enough, with fabulous bedding, and most importantly- it was super clean! All staff memembers that we encountered were professional and helpful from the doorman, to the front desk, conceriege, and housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Dame of the Quarter Still Sparkles!”
Reviews.Author: jennyssi
Reviews.Content: We were surprised by the hotel's total facelift -- beautiful light, bright rooms, comfortable upscale bedding and bathroom amenities. The staff -- from reservations to front desk to housekeeping, could not have been more welcoming. We hated to leave and can't wait for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: CTtraveler1021
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Monteleone. It's only a block from Canal and the St Charles trolley and a block from Bourbon on rue Royal, so the hotel is beautifully situated for daily forays for shopping, eating, and great music. The hotel is graciously old and seems well renovated and maintained. It's definitely a landmark. Public rooms are spacious, especially the lobby, and the rooftop pool looks comfortable. Guest rooms (regular king) are on the smallish side (two people can't pass between the foot of the bed and the TV armoire) but have been recently renovated and are adequate for a couple of days. Baths have been recently updated with marble and granite. Staff service was uniformly excellent -- friendly and efficient. We were checked in early within just a few minutes, we weren't bothered with unnecessary bellman service, daily housekeeping was thorough and friendly and the doormen were uniformly smiling and helpful with the heavy doors. We will definitely look to return.

Reviews.Title: “would'nt stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: petershelle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days and did not want to leave, the staff were superb and nothing was a problem and so friendly, the hotel was very clean and we had a lovely room and we loved the location, we will definately be back we would'nt want to stay anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “the only place to stay in new orleans”
Reviews.Author: juanapvregular
Reviews.Content: Great from the time that we checked in--the bar is the best place to watch people in NO-- the rooms clean quiet--and a great place to rest when done with all that is NO-- our third time and won't be our last

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: FSTraveler99
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Monteleone. The room was wonderful - comfortable bed and very nice bathroom (King Suite - not really a suite, but perhaps a larger than normal room). The location is fantastic - walk to everything in the French Quarter, walk to the Convention Center and Riverwalk. Staff even delivered a refrigerator to my room when I asked (I was surprised that there was no minibar, though). Nice gym - great view while working out. Only minuses were the cable TV and wi fi internet. Lower cable channels were fuzzy, and wi-fi did not work on the first night when I tried to sign up (it is not free, which it should be). When I did access it, signal strength in my room was low.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: tanji
Reviews.Content: Located on Royal Street. Perfect for all French Quarter and Canal Street activities. Walk to Canal Street (3 blocks) for St Charles St streetcar and the Riverfront line. Room a touch small but spotless, upon check in the mini bar fridge was out of order, a small fridge was sent up even better since we could store our store bought water, wine and beer. All the best of French Quarter at your feet. Acme Oyster, Mena Palace Mr B's, Brennans, and Jackson Square are all a block or so away. Bourban St is also 2 blocks away but our room on the 12th floor was soooooo quiet. Staff could not do enough to ensure your happiness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Lousy Service”
Reviews.Author: dem107
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Monteleone for a week in November for business. My wife and daughter joined me at the end of my stay. I requested a crib both at reservation time and when I arrived. The standard room I received was too small for a crib. I complained and they agreed to move me to another room the next day. I left my luggage and was told by the front desk they would call when my larger room was ready. They never called. I arrived back at the hotel late and received my new room, but no crib. I called and they promised to deliver one the next day. The next night, no crib, but they promised to deliver one the next day. The next day, guess what? No crib. The next day I finally demanded that they deliver one while I waited and after an hour, one finally was delivered. At the end of my stay, New Orleans had a water problem and no one was supposed to drink the water. The hotel didn't bother to notify me. The hotel is well located, historic and beautiful, but their staff is overworked and underperforming.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: addventure007
Reviews.Content: The room was small. Unlike what the website indicated- I only had one phone in my room. The refreshment center didnâ€™t work. Bottled water wasnâ€™t available in the room for purchase. The refreshment center was inoperable. There wasnâ€™t really a place in the room for my coffee pot once I did receive it, so I had to squeeze it on a small table meant for magazines. The writing desk was small. I was traveling for business, had a lot of papers to spread, and I needed more space. My alarm clock was dated and not user friendly, and I couldnâ€™t really use it. My room phone kept ringing. I requested no additional calls for the night, yet calls were still put though and I ended up unplugging my phone. There was no room service menu in my room- didnâ€™t know that was even available until a colleague told me that there was room service. The view sucked. Even though I was on the seventh floor, I could a lot of noise from the street below. Luckily, I brought my earplugs. The room was drafty. The outlets by my bed were not in an easily accessible place. On the positive side- the location is great and the rooms are really clean. The bathrooms are actually quite nice. So if youâ€™re traveling for pleasure and simply need a clean place to lay your head, then it is sufficient. I would not recommend this location for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “It was an excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Sayerhill
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in the heart of French Quarter. It was clean, staff was very helpful, beds were comfortable, and the rooftop heated pool was cool. We experienced no noise from the streets below nor did we have an issue with cleanliness. The rooms were small but adequate considering we weren't in New Orleans to hang in our hotel room. Their carousel bar was neat too. We walked everywhere from our hotel. It was within a short walking distance from the riverfront, Canal St., Bourban St., and was located on Royal St.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the heart of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: frappeboy
Reviews.Content: About a dozen of us went down to New Orleans for a bachelor party and we stayed at the Hotel Monteleone. Good: -The hotel was in the heart of bourbon street. Walk out the door, and around the block and you're on bourbon street. Amazingly convenient. -The bar (Carousel bar) was just fantastic. As the name implies, it's a carousel and while sitting at the bar you slowly rotate all night. If you want a seat tho make sure to get there early. Off to the side there is a nice lounge with entertainment. -The rooms were clean and up to date. Most importantly the rooms were quiet. Since this hotel is around the block from bourbon you escape a lot of the noise that you get from other places. Comfortable beds (my room had 2 queen size beds). Less Good: -I really can't think of anything bad with the hotel. Can't comment on: -They had a nice dining area but we always went out to various places for food. They also had a pool but I did not visit it. All in all, this hotel was perfect for what we were looking for. If I find myself in New Orleans again I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gingerfig
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! The staff is so friendly and bent over backwards to help us with whatever we needed - especially the concierges Ken and Cleatter . And the roof top pool was great! I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I return to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Great location helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: islandrick49
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with our stay at this hotel, first off the valets were great, they helped us with a special request with our large SUV, thanks guys! the front desk clerks were kind and courteous, we asked for a upper floor and they gave us 15, the views were excellent, the lobby was very grand with comfortable with chairs and couches, I just read the previous review, and yes, it was loud on the streets, (its New Orleans) but being up that high supressed much of the noise, we came in early both nights to get much needed rest after exploring during the day, never smelled any smoke?, as I too are alergic, the room was small but clean, comfortable and perfect. The towels were all arainged neatly in the shower, and terry cloth robes hung in the closet, nice touch, this hotel has an old world charm to it and we will definalely come back, for the location and value. Next time we will take advantage of the SPA.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: texastech
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid-week for business. Nice rooms and good hotel for meetings. The best thing, though, is that it is in the French Quarter but away from the craziness and noise of Bourbon Street. The location is particularly good if you are going to be shopping the antique stores along Royal. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_TD
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. A nice break from the wild fun of New Orleans. Room was a little tight but was particularly glad that the rooftop pool seemed to be heated. The biggest critique I have is that the mini-fridge had not been prepacked with beverages and thus sat empty and apparently deactivated (Also, since it was deactivated, we couldn't bring a nice particular type of special cake in with us and keep it in the fridge like we wanted to). Other than that, a nice hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the heart of the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ctb101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights for our anniversary and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. This is a beautiful classic hotel. Our room was a tad smallish, but that didn't bother us at all. We were a little disappointed to find our window looking out to an alley, but the quiet at all hours made up for it. Even though this hotel is on Royal, a block off Bourbon I would think that rooms on the street would be a little louder. My one real complaint with the room was the jet engine toilet that could wake the ghost of Marie Laveau. We had a drink in the Carousel Bar, which was a nice novelty. We didn't interact much with the staff, as we are pretty easy to please, but when we did, they were professional, courteous and helpful. I think the best part of this hotel is the easy in and out it offers. Makes the walk over to the Westin Canal Place seem like a trek. After hours, some of the area areound Monteleone gets a little sketchy, but we found that there were always people milling around and just used some common sense. HM was a little pricey, but for weekend nights, I didn't feel like it was completely unreasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family-Owned Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrenchBroadCabin
Reviews.Content: The Monteleone is the Un-Marriott option New Orleans (not to cast any aspersions on that fine business hotel chain). Now run by the fourth generation of the Monteleone family, the hotel has many unique features that don't leave frequent travelers with that old "I've been here before" feeling. The hotel's location in the French Quarter is within easy walking distance of the area's great restaurants, shopping, and, of course, Bourbon Street. It's also a quick hop and a step to the aquarium, Mississippi river cruises, the French Market, New Orleans streetcars and a lot more. The rooms are tastefully decorated in a classic style and well cared for - everything works. The king in our room was among the most comfortable hotel beds we've encountered in a while. Most rooms are of average size for a classic hotel. We got a corner room by the luck of the draw - ask for one when you check in. The hotel offers rooms with an "enhanced bathroom" for a significant increase in price. We didn't take that option, but the bath in our room, while on the small side, was very well designed with lots of flat space for toiletries. The cafe offered a great breakfast buffet with lots of a la carte options as well. It was a tad pricey, but not much more than the breakfasts available in other nearby French Quarter restaurants. We didn't get to try the Hunt Club restaurant or the Carousel Bar but they appeared to be well patronized. We found the staff very helpful. We asked for an early room cleaning on a few days and were happily obliged. The Monteleone only provides in-room coffee upon request, but our request was quickly fulfilled. The hotel's WiFi Internet was a bit pricey, but there are several non-hotel WiFi services available in the French Quarter for a more reasonable fee. Our laptop detected at least 10 available networks. We'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Staff and Experience.”
Reviews.Author: foot5841
Reviews.Content: From the moment the doorman greets you, the excellence of service begins. Desk staff was friendly and polite making check-in easy. The concierge answered all questions with great knowledge and politeness. The rooms are a bit small, but was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. Be sure to try the breakfast buffet at the hotel cafe-delicious and a good value! Close to everything that is New Orleans-this is THE place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Holiday in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: TravlFam
Reviews.Content: We spent a 3 night long weekend at Hotel Monteleone in New Orleans - there to celebrate a special birthday with my husband and best friends. The hotel is a landmark, in a very good location and gives one the taste of old New Orleans. We found reception to be good but not outstanding. Didn't feel overly welcomed. We requested a coffee machine as they do not have coffee in the rooms and I had read on the boards that the hotel would provide if asked. We never received ours and decided not to bother to ask a second time. Room was clean, nicely decorated, great bed (king) and lovely bathroom. It was also on the smaller side and had no views other then the wing across from us. It was quiet. The rooftop pool was beautiful and we enjoyed coffee there every morning. A quiet oasis.
