We enjoyed our stay and just wish the hotel's staff matched the hotel's grandeur.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully pleasant experience.”
Reviews.Author: beckytroberts
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Monteleone in August and couldn't have received better service! This is the best place ever!

Reviews.Title: “First Visit, but not our Last”
Reviews.Author: amyt46
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviews, we were looking forward to our 2-day mini-vacation at Hotel Monteleone, before we had to move to another hotel that work was paying for. We arrived late due to weather issues, but the evening staff was very personable and quick to get us to our room. We requested a room with a view and received a corner room that was just spectacular. Everything was wonderful. The bed was very comfortable, the room was spacious and very clean, the bathroom was small-ish, but well thought-out so it never seemed cramped. The doormen were very attentive and the concierge gave us many good ideas for travelling about New Orleans. One thing that stood out was the map the hotel provides - it folds down pocket sized and was extremely easy to carry around, unlike some of the other New Orleans hotels we stayed at later in our trip. The Carousel Bar was fun and a more sophisticated vibe than that of the non-stop college atmosphere of Bourbon Street just a block away, so it was a great alternative for our friends to gather when we needed a bit of a break. We were sad to move on from the Hotel Monteleone to another hotel, it is definitely one of our favorites and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Grlbdr
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my Family (including younger children) to this Hotel. The Good: Beautifully decorated/restored facilities, Clean rooms, Great location near all the action on Bourbon Street but without all the noise, Comfortable beds with nice TV's, Beautiful Spa with nice product. The Bad: Tiny rooms with no view - I was tripping over my luggage the entire time. Expensive food - I went for breakfast one day and spent $20.00 on a basic egg breakfast - way too much! You can walk less than a block away for much less. Housekeeping Daily Service was basically non existent for our rooms - We were out of the room almost all day and when we got back before dinner the rooms were still not touched. Seems the Hotel is more interested in cleaning the check outs first... Valet took a long time - we called ahead a half hour went down with our luggage and waited another 15 minutes after they helped others that just walked right up first.

Reviews.Title: “lobby is nice, but rooms are tired and service was awful - hotel is overrated”
Reviews.Author: dottie dog
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a few day conference. My room was small, not updated, not comfortable (terrible lighting at the desk, hard to maneuver around the furniture). But service was really the worst part, The front desk couldn't be bothered to help, room service breakast was very late with no apology... just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Sparty2007
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. Hotel was clean, quiet, and the service was excellent. I stayed in the Waldorf just outside the French Quarter previously, but was not nearly as impressed. I will definitely stay here on all trips to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Best Showers anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Izzy350
Reviews.Content: We went here for a weekend getaway! Very nice hotel, I would definately stay again. Close to all the action, but peace and quiet too. The showers were the best ever! You get soaking wet (lots of water pressure)and the hot water will last for days! The one surprise was no real access to your car and you have to pay $30 a night for parking. If you do need your car or something out of it, you will need to be prepared to wait while they retrieve it and tip the guy too. Wasn't a big deal for us, we walked everywhere, but something I wasn't expecting. I would definately stay here again, we stayed in the newest section, so I can't speak for the other rooms. The room was small, but very clean. Oh, one thing, we did have a problem with housekeeping. Despite our privacy please sign, we had 2 ENTER OUR ROOM while we were there. They claimed they had us on the list to be checking out, although our reservations never changed. I called the desk to complain and they said they would call me back, but never did. We didn't let it ruin our time, but is upsetting when you are trying to nap for a late night out on the town.

Reviews.Title: “Storied hotel- inflated prices- questionable service”
Reviews.Author: Sundrop110
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at Monteleone in August. The service was OK - the food was pretty good, and the location was great. There were just.... holes. It wasn't a seamless stay. The hotel is ridiculously hard to navigate and there aren't many maps to help guide you. For many rooms (including the Pres Suite) there is only one way to get to it via one elevator. I know it's because the hotel is several buildings pieced together but wow. I'm a literature buff so it was cool to see the artifacts but other than that, eh. Everything is RIDICULOUSLY priced there. My mini bar wasn't working the entire time, apparently no one's was. But if you get a drink at the Carousel bar, yes it's cool and spins around but wow- you need a second mortgage to afford your tab. The cleaning staff was great and friendly - they cleaned my room every day and were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay In A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bigredsetter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a stay at the Hotel Monteleone last week. We enjoyed our stay and the comfort and convenience of this hotel. Our room was a standard king and while it wasn't the nicest room we've ever stayed in, it was clean and had everything we needed. We really enjoyed the roof top pool and the weather we had while in NOLA was perfect. We also enjoyed the Carousel Bar and the wait staff was very pleasant. A very nice feature of this hotel is it's location. It is located on Royal Street which has some great shops to explore and it is within walking distance to many of the French Quarter's attractions. This was our first time to stay at this hotel but from now on, it will be our "go to" hotel when visiting New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Polite and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: CatherineLeonia_NJ
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very convenient to most desired sites to see in New Orleans. Staff is very friendly and polite. Did not encounter any problems with staff member, however we made no specific requests. Minuses: No shower caps in bath, very few extras anywhere, no room service coffe tags left after first day. Pluses: two bathrobes in room and we were given a room with river view, Hotel is clean and bar is fun area with piano and singer. Front doormen very prompt and courteous. I would stay here again and request missing items if necessary. Did not eat at hotel but others told us the breakfast is very good.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT ACCOMODATIONS AND LOCATION, FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: RRANDCR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 5-night stay at the Hotel Monteleone in New Orleans. It is located in the heart of the French Quarter (near but not on Bourbon St.), offers GREAT accomodations, and employs a friendly and helpful staff. We saw many parts of New Orleans, and were always glad to return to the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Monteleone Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: BubbieTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the old New Orleans charm that you should experience if you come to and stay in the French Quarter. The stay was expensive but has a great location one block from Bourbon Street. The lobby is quite large and beautiful. The room was very clean and well furnished. The only down side was that it was pretty cramped and had a view of the neighboring building's roofs. All in all it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with great service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: arienne410
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monteleone is a beautiful hotel on Royal Street, one block away from the lively Bourbon Street. The rooms are charming and have all the amenities, such as the terricloth robes hanging in the closets. The Carousel Lounge is a revolving bar and even locals will stop in for a drink and a chat. The pool is on one of the upper floors and is small, but has a view that's not to be missed. The staff were wonderful and helpful. You can walk to everything in the French Quarter, yet it is on a quiet stretch of the block. They have a very impressive breakfast buffet in the morning. We just love it there and it's the only place we stay when we visit the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “we slept great with a we priced room”
Reviews.Author: toddandjenn
Reviews.Content: we received a room on one of the higher floors so street noise was not an issue. the carousel bar was a great place to finish off the night following a walk along bourbon street. good location for safe walking to many tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE The Monteleone, husband and I were treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: MrsRupe
Reviews.Content: NOLA and the Monteleone was the destination for our honeymoon. Upon arrival, I was blown away by the friendly valets and door folks. Then I got to the lobby, it was like a fantasy...after check in our friendly bell hop lead us to our room. Husband and I found champaigne chilling, a nice congratulations note from the hotel and one of my personal favorites, chocolate covered strawberries. The room was gorgeous, had a river view, clean, quiet, comfortable king bed, jacuzzi tub in the bathroom with lots of mirrors and a gleaming glass shower and granite countertops. Room service was prompt, everyone friendly and helpful, needless to say we didn't want to leave our slice of heaven....I can't wait to return to NOLA, and will definately stay here again. Very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel in best french quarter location”
Reviews.Author: travelgill
Reviews.Content: From the moment I entered this hotel, it was truly a fantastic experience. I slipped in past the bellman and he raced up behind me to help me with my bag and then explain the historic nature of the hotel, the carousel bar, the grandfather clock in the lobby -- and he wasn't jockeying for a tip -- just being of great service. Upon check in, they give you your key in a paper holder that has an awesome new orleans map folded into it -- what a great idea. The room was beautiful -- i expected it to be small but it was really spacious with 2 queen beds, a huge armoire that held a large screen tv and the bathroom was large as well. No great view -- but who cares in New Orleans? The beds and linens were super comfortable, the shower was fantastic - great pressure and hot water -- the bathroom amenities were nice as well. Two ice machines were very close to the room. Elevators were somewhat slow, but there were also many elevator banks you could easily switch to if one was slow. Loved the fitness room, good selection of machines each with a fan on the machine and closed caption tv (great to allow you to "read"TV and listen toyour ipod at the same time -- they had towels, water and fruit available and great view of the river from the treadmills. Was going to meet my friends at the pool -- but it was very small, with very few seats and very crowded so we decided to skip it. Also tried to make an appointment for a massage in the spa but they only had 2 30 minute massages at times that didn't work for me - kind of disappointing there. Didn't eat anything in the hotel so can't provide any reviews on that front -- the location is just awesome, hotel is beautiful and service was great.

Reviews.Title: “A Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wiliwali
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully maintained classic hotel. The location is perfect - a block off Canal Street right in the French Quarter. I was attending a big conference, but brought my wife along for a little mini-vacation. l lived in New Orleans over 35 years ago, and the hotel lobby and "Carousel Bar" look just like I remember, and have apparently been well maintained over the years. The service - including the doorman, bell man, front desk, maintenance and housekeeping - was great, and always made you feel like they were glad you were there. Being an old hotel the rooms are small compared to modern hotels, but our room seemed to be recently refurbished with new paint, wallpaper, furniture, beds, large flat screen TV, valuable safe, and bathroom fixtures. We were on the 10th floor on the Royal Street side, and you could not hear any of the activity on the streets - even on Saturday night. The rooms being small, there is limited drawer and closet space, and we had to settle for two double beds instead of a king size. There is a sundeck and pool up on the roof that looked nice, but we did not partake .... The WiFi worked fine, but was an extra $10 a day. The hotel had a complementary computer and printer set up next to front desk so you could print out your airline boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great City”
Reviews.Author: MKopald
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights on the weekend that I proposed to my fiance. We had a very nice suite with lost of space. It was a great hotel, however the service could have been a bit better. To be honest, the staff seemed to be a bit unknowledgeable and really uninterested in helping, especially the concierge. The room and hotel were great though and the location was unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel; Low End Service”
Reviews.Author: boyanddog
Reviews.Content: We tried hard to make this a good visit. It took 5 phone calls and a room change to get a roll-away bed. Our room had no windows to the outside and the bathroom had no exhaust fan and the hotel was VERY noisy. The walls were paper thin. We were there for two nights and our room was never cleaned. When we talked to the hotel about our concerns, they were unapologetic and tried to tell us we did something wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Older Hotel”
Reviews.Author: legallyred
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an older, beautiful hotel. The rooms are on the small side as you should expect with an older hotel. The maid service was great. (They did fold our clothes which might bother some people but was fine with us). The hotel is just one block off of Bourbon but the room was quiet and dark at night. The pool area was nice and wasn't too crowded. The bar was lovely with a slowly moving carousel. The doormen had excellent suggestions for places to eat and things to do that werenâ€™t too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: FWA2006
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, calm and elegant. The lobby is beautiful and the bellmen were helpful and friendly. My room was perfect for me but might be tight with two people sharing a bathroom with not much counter space. One day the rooftop pool was too busy to enjoy but on the next two days it was cool and refreshing. The Carousel Bar off the lobby was a great place to meet and share plans and/or experiences of the day. It was crowded at times but we never felt neglected. I thought the servers were very good. The in-hotel spa was great. I had the best salt scrub from Brandy. Take advantage of this if you can. It's a beautiful facility.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonEmmy
Reviews.Content: We Stayed here in September as part of our 30th Celebrations the Staff could not have been nicer from check in to check out, we spoke with several very Helpful concierges and enjoyed several nights in the Carousel bar. our room was really nice and clean, and the pool was an added bonus, I would recommend this hotel to anyone, if we ever get the chance to go to new Orleans again, I already know where we are staying!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: hoel
Reviews.Content: You truly can't beat this place for the location and price. It is one block off Bourbon Street, next to Acme Oyster House and a short walk to Brennan's. The doormen are incredibly friendly and helpful, and the staff is always aiming to please. We stayed in room 1232, which is the back side of the hotel (river side). Never any noise from the street, although some friends who faced the front of the hotel on Royal said they could hear noise from Bourbon and a guy who was singing in front of the hotel. Be sure to request a room off of Royal. Beds slept great-- towels and bathroom amenities were very nice-- and the King Preferred was perfect for two (although we didn't have a coffee pot in the room). The only small issue we had was at the Carousel Lounge-- where we had to hunt down the waitress to get our bill. It also seemed that the bartenders had their heads down and didn't notice new customers. All in all, this is a place we would stay again. Loved the people and the place.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in great location, but kinda pricey”
Reviews.Author: PlannerGeek
Reviews.Content: Used the Monteleone as home base for a recent NO bachelor's party. The hotel is beautiful and very comfortable, really a very classy place. Great location, a block into the French Quarter and close to everything downtown, only 1 block to St Charles Streetcar to the Garden District. My only complaints -- expensive, even with a "special" group rate, $180 / night, which seems really pricey. Also, charge for internet, $5/hour. If you really need internet, you can walk 2 blocks over and use for free in the Marriott lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, small room”
Reviews.Author: mimi117
Reviews.Content: Booked a preferred king room - and would hate to see a regular king. I know people who won't stay anywhere else in New Orleans, and I can only think that they must have had an entirely different experience with this hotel. The room is very small. The bathroom is minuscule. There is no in-room coffee maker. One of the robes was taken and not replaced on the second day. The ice bucket was taken on the next day. Most importantly, the room, on the tenth floor and facing Royal Street, is incredibly loud. There is considerable street noise from Royal, and you can hear Bourbon Street quite well from here. Had I not been visiting with a group staying at this hotel, I would have checked out after the first night and gone to one of the many quiet hotels in which I have stayed before here. On the plus side, I will say that the rooms decor is charming, it is very clean, and the staff are pleasant and professional. But, I value my sleep and I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised with small, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: Carebear59
Reviews.Content: We booked our room thru Perfect Escapes and got a fabulous rate on the least expensive room. I joked that we would probably be staying in the "broom closet". I was very pleasantly surprised when we opened our door and saw how beautiful it was! Of course, we did not have a view (window faced another wall), and the room was small, but it was above and beyond my expectations. The bathroom was also small, but had a marble floor and granite counter, and lots of mirrors with plenty of light. The room and bathroom were very clean. The bed was comfy. The hotel lobby was exceptionally beautiful. The carousel bar was a very busy and popular place! I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Magical perfection!”
Reviews.Author: phoebecasey75
Reviews.Content: For a special birthday, I chose this hotel based on its location and interior which includes a revolving carousel bar a must visit, it didnt disappoint! very french looking from the outside and a wow factor when you walk in, soft lit crystal chandeliers, and a chiming grandfather clock sets the mood in the lobby. Staff so polite and welcoming on all levels, consierge are very helpful and have your best interest at heart. Doormen have a lovely sense of humour and greet you by name after a few days, personal touch. Our room was amazing very chic and again with a french style, with a view over the city and the mississippi. Excellent location on a lovely street with wonderful restaurants, in the middle of french quarter, everything within walking distance. To top it off it has a roof top pool which offers the same high standard of service at the pool bar, towels available and a real sun trap. Lastly the room service and the grill/cafe serve amazing food, quite resonable but as all places in america dont forget the tax and tip on top which can be the shocker! Would I go back to this hotel??.....in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Funky, fun, bustling, noisy and nice”
Reviews.Author: MelvinaSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Tuesday for a fun three night stay. We paid extra for the preferred king room, my sister and her husband did not. Our first room, on the 10th floor, was okay, but as soon as we started unpacking we noticed it was a connecting room, and we could hear EVERYTHING from our neighbors...whispering, coughing, sneezing.... everything. We went down to the front desk to ask for another room, preferably not connecting. They said all rooms that are preferred king are connecting. (Really? Weird.) We asked if we could get a room with no one in the next room, and they graciously agreed as the hotel was not full. Our second room, a corner room on the 11th floor, also a preferred king, was substantially bigger, I mean really much bigger. So I guess there are preferred preferred rooms? Our first room was about the same size as my sister's standard. Everyone who worked at the hotel was very pleasant and friendly. I called the concierge the day before we left to see about getting a bottle of champagne for the room ( I didn't like the choices and the prices, plus the service fee/taxes/tip that bring the cost way up. We are very particular as we own a wine store.) He suggested a wine shop nearby, which was really nice of him. The Carousel bar is fabulous, we had drinks there two nights. We also really enjoyed the rooftop pool area and bar, even though it is rather a small space. Okay, I am a light sleeper. Even without noisy neighbors, we overlooked a street trumpet player who played much later in the evening than I stay up. Also, our bed creaked horribly, until we shoved a pillow between the bed and the backboard. Also, we could hear guests stumbling to their rooms after a wild Bourbon Street night. Yes, this is New Orleans, and not unexpected. I only say this because I discovered an i phone app for white noise that I am going to use all the time now when I travel!!! It was great! I did get a kick out of the fact that the bathroom was so small the toilet actually sat somewhat sideways to fit. The last day we were there they had a meeting going on, and some meeting rooms are on the top floor (15?) We were on the eleventh. This meant long waits for the elevator, then they would come to our floor and be too jammed with people for us to get in. This happened multiple times. I don't really see how this problem could be fixed, as it didn't seem that other sets of elevators went up to this top floor. Also, one day we consulted the concierge for restaurant suggestions, then asked them to make the reservation for us. When we got to the restaurant, no reservations. The restaurant was rather snotty, and said our concierge never called. We used our cell to call the concierge back, then handed the phone to the restaurant. They argued back and forth about whose fault it was, the restaurant blaming the hotel. We didn't really care, we just wanted to eat! It was weird, but we felt it really was more of the restaurant's fault, especially instead of them just saying "sorry for the mix up, we can squeeze you in." They said "if it was indeed our fault, we apologize." Anyway, great service, nice people, fun, funky old hotel, would recommend and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: CLK08
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans for a conference and stayed extra for a little R&R, and The Hotel Monteleone could not have been more perfect for both. The location was great, the rooms were beautiful, clean, and comfortable while the staff was friendly and helpful. We will definitely return to this fine hotel and recommend it highly to others.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfection”
Reviews.Author: happygirlSoCal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 30th anniversary in N.O. and could not have chosen a better hotel. The staff was outstanding. Everyone we dealt with was so pleasant and helpful, especially Michael at the front desk. Our room was lovely and the bed was extremely comfortable. The pool area and Carousel bar were great places to hang out. The only negative was no coffee maker in the room. But that's minor considering how great everything else was. When we told Michael it was our anniversary he gave us vouchers for breakfast and cocktails - a very nice touch. We had pretty high expectations and the Monteleone totally exceeded them. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Best in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: EddyEdster
Reviews.Content: We used to live in New Orleans and struggle to find clean accommodations with top notch service on our returns. The Monteleone has spoiled us to all others. We have been lucky to get good room rates. Have stayed on both side of the hotel and both are enjoyable. Desk staff are efficient and kind. Besides, the Carousel Bar is the best in town for people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Sojourner9355
Reviews.Content: Had a great visit! Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Our room was spotless and comfortable. The lobby was "Nawlins" through and through. Great location. What else can I say, other than I will definitely stay here again. Highly, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Katiebearcat97
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at the Monteleone for 3 nights at the end of August. What a wonderful hotel and a great experience in New Orleans! We arrived at the hotel a bit early, but were pleased that our room was ready. After settling in our room, we quickly realized that the temperature was quite warm, and not cooling off despite turning the thermostat down. We contacted the front desk and an engineer was sent up promptly. We were advised that the air conditioning was not working appropriately and that we would be moved to another room. We were updraged to a preferred double/double room which was lovely. Though the room was small, it was adequately sized for 2 adults and all our luggage. In addition, the room was nicely appointed with a very comfortable bed, soft sheets, and a spacious bathroom. As others have mentioned, the mini-bar was out of order in the room, though was not at all a concern to us. We simply walked less than a block down to the Walgreen's for a drink or snack. The location of the Monteleone was perfect! We were on the 15th floor and heard very minimal (and rare) street noise, which was not at all bothersome or noticeable. We were able to easily walk to all major, nearby attractions. Being that the streets are at times quite narrow and congested, we were thankful that we did not rent a car. For a quick, rather inexpensive place to eat, we enjoyed Felipe's on N. Peters St. for fresh made burritos. We thoroughly enjoyed the Monteleone and would definitely stay there again on a future trip to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.....but....”
Reviews.Author: dodgegirl_3
Reviews.Content: I agree with everyone, the hotel is beautiful! We arrived early also and our room was ready, The only issue i had was there isn't a coffee pot in the room for that morning cup of coffee! Sure there is room service for $9 for a pot of coffee. The one other thing that was annoying was that the roof top was closed due to the weather (it was drizzlling) so had to go down to street level to smoke.....the funny thing was that the day before it was pouring all day and the roof top was open...didn't understand that. Oh and the hair dryer wasn't that great either. over all its in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - Absolutely Recommend”
Reviews.Author: MSP_one
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Monteleone on Friday, August 27th for our anniversary and all the rave reviews are spot on! We booked the standard room directly from the hotel - go this route, it was $10 cheaper than Priceline and even though the online hotel booking said full day of - we were able to call the hotel and book the room with no problem. The hotel surprised us with complementary champagne and chocolate covered strawberries for our anniversary. Very impressive!! We checked in and then hit Bourbon St - very convenient one block away. When we returned the hotel had been cleaned for turn down service with more chocolate. The beds were super soft too. For the price, location, and service this is more of a 4 star hotel than the reported 3 star. Go here and book directly with the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Staff, and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ThisFloridaFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin. I called a week ago to book a night at the Hotel Monteleone and spoke to a very nice lady in reservations. I booked a standard king room for Sat. night at the summer special rate. I told her that the night we stay will be our anniversary. She told me that they would send up a bottle of champagne and some chocolate covered strawberries complimentary. I thought that was pretty cool since hotels usually charge extra for that. She also mentioned to called when we were about 30 minutes away to check on the status of our room since we would be arriving early. When we got there the valet was helpfl and polite (I like that fact that the hotel has their own parking garage right next to the hotel). We then went in to the reservation desk and were going to just go check in our bag til the room was ready but to our surprise it was all ready for us. We were given the Ernest Hemmingway Suite up on the rooftop next to the pool. We have never stayed in a suite like that before. It was fantastic! There was a balcony facing Royal and also another door leading out to the a patio next to the pool. The suite was beautiful with an old world charm to it. Chandelier in the livingroom (also a fireplace in this room) and one in the master bedroom. There was bar area with a small fridge and ice machine. THe bathroom was great too it had a big jacuzzi tub, seperate large shower and large vanity sink. Also the conceirge was very helpful with questions we had about the area. Don't forget to stop by the bar downstairs The Carousel and have a Martini. It rotates around. One last thing supposively this is a haunted hotel like many in New Orleans. Well there was one instance that the elevator did stop on the 14th floor with out the button being pushed. We were going up from downstairs to the 16th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Price, Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Catdaddy5150
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 weekend night in August. Arrived early and was extremely happy to get an early check in at 9am!! Room was fine, even though it was a standard King. Great location to all French Quarter attractions. Walked past the bar, but did not go in due to crowd. Looked like fun, though! We cant wait to return to NOLA, and will definitely check on rates for the Monteleone. If you are considering staying here, I would have to give it a big "thumbs-up!!"

Reviews.Title: “April Stay at Hotel Monteleone”
Reviews.Author: redfreakUA
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel. It has quite a bit of history to it and is supposedly haunted, although we seem to have missed the ghosts. The rooftop pool is small, but a nice place to relax. The fitness room is also fairly limited but does boast wonderful views of the Mississippi River. The room was small but well furnished with a very comfortable bed. The location in the french quarter is great. It was nice not to have to stumble too far at the end of the night. I never ate in the restraunt, but the food they catered for our meetings was excellent. I would definitely visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “They had me at hello”
Reviews.Author: PeghandleMike
Reviews.Content: The total hotel experience was nothing short of perfect. Upon arrival we were greeted promptly by a valet who seemed glad we arrived and offered help with luggage. The check in procedure was prompt and courteous. Since we arrived in the AM our room was not available. The bellman graciously stored our luggage and the front desk clerk called us on our cell phone when the room was prepared. The lobby is gourgeous and grand. Our riverfront suite rm 1050 was absolutely exquisite. The sitting area consisted of a desk, couch, a few chairs and an armoire with a 30inch? flat screen TV, and it's own bathroom. The bedroom had an additional armoire with flat screen. The master bathroom was large, filled with marble and contained a glassed- in shower and separate whirpool tub. Everything was exceptionally clean and well maintained. ( No chiped tiles, no mold or dirty caulk, no scuffed moulding, etc). The minbar was not operating but that was of no concern to us.Besides you'rw only 1/2 block from Walgreens. The showers were the best I have ever experienced at at hotel. The water temp was always hot and constant, even late in the morning. The water pressure was full and unvarying. No water saver showerheads. The room was cool,quiet, and afforded a beautiful view of the Mississippi. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. (I slept better than at home). Be warned that the Wi-Fi is about $10/day.We visited the pool in the mid afternoon and there were maybe 8 people there in total. The hotel itself is centrally located in the french quarter which makes it convenient to everything. This is also is a plus when shopping you can drop off packages readily or freshen up vs hotels in CDB or other outlying areas. The carousel bar rotates completely around 4 times/hr is unique and a must. The bartenders are cordial and professional but not real personable. This is truly a top rated hotel and the rooms and customer service are far superior to the Ritz. Some people have commented on the price. However, you get what you pay for. If you want at 1st class expericence come to the Hotel Monteleone but be prepared to pay. Ps parking is $30/day but hello visit any big city and you will find the same.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Atmosphere, Excellent Location, Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: chantss
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Monteleone and was pleasantly surprised with the friendly service and welcoming decor of the hotel. It could not be in a better location, a block from canal street, bourbon street, and a few blocks from decateaur street...everything worth seeing is within walking distance. The beds were lovely and comfortable and the bathrooms were very clean. The only complaints I would have would be that our mini fridge was out of order, which I have seen as well on other reviews and that the pool was quite crowded some days. I would definitely reccomend the Monteleone to someone looking to stay in the french quarter for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Best night of sleep in a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: familytravel75
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for 4 nights. The Monteleone was in a perfect location in the Quarter. We could walk to everything, and nothing was far. The hotel rooms were smaller than what we normally stay in, but they were perfect for sleeping. The beds were great. I usually have problems adjusting to a hotel bed, but I slept great every night. We were on the top floor, and did not hear street noise. Our friends were down 2 levels, and did hear a lot of noise. I would recommend picking a room that does not face the main streets. The staff was exceptionally great!! I have stayed at the Windsor Court, Sheraton, and Ritz Carlton while in New Orleans before. The Monteleone has everything these did, but at a better price. We took the kids to the zoo, and a Swamp Tour. They had a blast!! We also did a horse and carriage ride at night where they took us around for 30 minutes to show some sites. Great time, and would do it again when not so hot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in the quarter”
Reviews.Author: bdt
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay in the French Quarter. Getting there by car during the day can be a hassle, because they are often closing off the street for events. If you're going to do your own driving, you might want to stay nearby at the Marriott or the Sheraton. But if you're cabbing it and want a nice place that's an easy walk from everything in the Quarter, this family-owned hotel is as good as it gets. Rooms can be a little on the cozy side, but are beautiful and immaculately kept. Service is wonderful. They were keeping all the room termperatures at 60 degrees F when I was there in late July, which was a bit chilly. But that initial burst of cold air sure felt good when you walked in from the balmy French Quarter. The Carousel bar is exactly what it sounds like - a bar where the customers' seats rotate around the bar. Mr. B's restaurant is right across the street, while Brennan's is halfway down the block, and Dicke Brennan's is around the corner. You can eat with the whole Brennan family in one week without hardly leaving your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay/Decent Price/Overcrowded Pool”
Reviews.Author: ksfmom
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two night at this property when traveling to New Orleans with friends. Our decision to stay here was based on our desire to find a hotel in the French Quarter at a decent rate - this fit the bill. Being a weekend in the summertime, our rates were $109 for the 1st night and $99 for the second night - you'd be hard pressed to find anything else of this quality for those prices. Highlights of this hotel: smooth check-in and check-out (front desk staff is very friendly and professional...we arrived quite early, but they took our info, allowed us to store our bags, and called us when our rooms were ready), rooms are very clean, nicely decorated, and have fantastic showers and beds (as others have mentioned, yes, they are small, but most historic properties have this issue...how much time are you actually spending in the room?), location is ideal...still within the FQ, but away from the chaos (be sure to wander across the street to the Mr. B's Bistro for a meal or drink...also Royal St. has many antique shops and fun, little boutiques), proximity to a really great bar...you have the Carousel Bar right in the lobby (it really is as special as you may have read in any number of travel guides...there's just a very nice vibe there. Although the actual carousel is the prime seat in the house, we preferred one of the tables for two by the windows overlooking Royal Street - a prime people-watching spot). We really only had one negative experience at this hotel at that occurred at the rooftop pool. First of all, be aware that this pool is VERY small and VERY crowded...we're talking so crowded that you can barely move in the water. Chairs and chaises are plentiful, but with so many people gathering there, it's almost impossible to find a spot to even put your belongings. Our issue involved the small poolside bar. There was only one bartender on duty and when my husband went up to the window to grab a couple drinks, this server continued to take orders from others, even though my husband had been waiting patiently for some time. At one point he told my husband, "I'll be with you next," and then proceeded to clean counters behind the bar and then turned and once again, waited on female patrons who had lined up. The minute my husband turned around to leave, the guy dropped everything he was doing and then offered to wait on him, even calling across the pool area - it was just crazy; obviously he was playing games. What's that all about? Now normally, we would never do this, but after that treatment (and in protest to the bizarre bartender) my husband went to the nearby Unique Grocery (yes, that's the name), bought a few beers, and brought them up to the pool area where I was finally able to get a table and chairs. Now, we are generally rule-followers and understand the protocal behind not bringing in outside beverages, but after wasting 20+ minutes at the bar and then receiving that treatment, we didn't think twice about our "crime." Other than this, we had a wonderful stay and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “comfort place”
Reviews.Author: sannenaeie
Reviews.Content: We got there and we were checked in early just as we requested. The room was slightly smaller then what we expected but none the less very cozy.The shower was so fantastic that my boyfriend couldn't stay out of it. Also, the bed was super comfortable. He has back pain and after a nap or so he said he always felt good. As for the location, It was right inside the french quarter but far enough away from Bourbon St. The WIFI sucked as we couldn't really log on but they were kind enough to take the charge off the bill. Over all, we really needed the rest so this place served its purpose for the three days we stayed there.We will definitely go back. I just hope that next time the refrigerator will work. Also, the maid service was really slow but once they get in they do a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with pricey food”
Reviews.Author: chrissear
Reviews.Content: My husband and I won a trip to stay at the hotel. The staff were warm and friendly, opening doors and asking if we needed help. The rooms are small, but nicely decorated. The prices in the restaurant were way overpriced for the quality. However, the service was great. The location was great, just a block over and you were on Bourbon Street, but still quiet . Would definitely stay again, but wouldn't pay to eat (our food was free).

Reviews.Title: “right decision leads to great vacation”
Reviews.Author: JandDBrooks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided on 'Nawlins' for our annual summer & my birthday vacation. I was sooo stressed out looking for the best hotel closest to everything per visitors reviews & the hotel's selling points. I took a leap of faith & chose the Monteleone. The hotel was fantastic!!! Located 1 block from Bourbon St & Canal St. & the Miss.River, Casino and tour activities all within 6 short blocks or less. We decided not to rent a car and were glad we didn't; with everything within walking distance and the streets being crowded with tourists it would have been a waste of money. The room was clean and small (even smaller with the king-sized bed) but served its purpose. The staff were friendly, helpful and attentive--getting dressed to hit the town I accidentally locked myself out of the in-room safe by hitting a wrong digit. I made a call to the front desk and thought we were going to be held up for rest of the night waiting but less than 10 minutes later someone was there to deactivate the safe. I will not have to compare hotels for our future trip back---it's a no-brainer.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey; decide if it's worth it”
Reviews.Author: MKBlackwood
Reviews.Content: I stayed three days for an academic conference in April 2010, with my daughter and granddaughter - combined business and pleasure. Pros: (1) Location, location, location! There aren't a lot of options right in the French Quarter, and you can walk to everything you want to see from here. (2) History and charm (3) Comfort and cleanliness Cons: (1) Regular rooms are smaller than you might expect. (2) Cost. If price is no object, enjoy yourself. If your business is ponying up for all your expenses, have a ball. As a grad student who had pay up front and get reimbursed, I experienced difficulty when a hold approaching $800 was put on my credit card at check-in; this was negotiated down after a lot of interaction with the front desk, but it wasn't a great start to my stay. Also had to tussle with them over holds and double charges on another credit card from the "Business Center" when I wanted to print something ("It's not our problem, here's a toll-free number"). These issues, combined with parking fees ($30 a day) and hideously expensive internet access (I have mercifully forgotten) and warnings that even opening the minibar would incur a charge, led me to feel as if I were figuratively thrown to the ground and rolled for every cent I had every time I entered the lobby. This isn't an issue for every traveler, obviously, but honestly, I'm not sure staying here was worth being in the conference hotel, and in the future, no matter how much dough I have, I'll probably seek out another hotel or a b & b.

Reviews.Title: “Classic and First Class, All the Way”
Reviews.Author: hamiltonshabitat
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a number of Nola hotels that were...well...not so great. But the Monteleone(which we learned was and is still family owned) was a wonderful experience. Lovely room, gorgeous lobby, a famous far(which we didn't get to try, alas)....prompt valet. No stained carpeting, no cracked sinks, no peeling wallpaper. Just... lovely, and great service. Would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Lusianaatheart
Reviews.Content: Made reservations a few months in advance for 3 rooms for a group of 9 people. I personally made the reservations under my name, and I paid for the rooms. When we got to the hotel, they only showed 1 room, even though I had confirmation numbers. Not only that, but none of the rooms were under my name, but that of my friends. Fortunately, everything was straightened out, and all 3 of my reservations were found. I was sharing a room with 2 friends, and my key card deactivated. When I went to get it reactivated, I was refused because my name was not on the room I was in! Figure that one out.... Anyway, I walked away from the front desk quite upset, then decided to find a manager. I told him the entire story about how I had made the reservations and paid for the rooms, but could not get my key card reactivated. The manager (sorry, I forget his name, although he was quite nice), made everything right. Although check-in was a fiasco and the one incident with the key card was upsetting, our overall stay was quite pleasant; the rooms were quiet, and the beds were comfortable. I am with a paranormal group, and the reason we stayed at this hotel (on the 14th floor, supposedly the most paranormally active) was for the haunted history we had all read about. Maybe it was because the hotel was busy (with 2 wedding parties and a convention group), but we did not encounter a single paranormal occurrence while there, nor did any of us feel anything out of the ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bruce318
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 days at the Hotel Monteleone over spring break and had a wonderful time. The location of the Hotel is perfect and the hotel itself has a great feel. Nice rooms, clean, nice bar, courteous staff. I can't imagine a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Bookwoman
Reviews.Content: I'm shocked to see ANY negative reviews of this wonderful hotel! I have stayed at the Monteleone 4 or 5 times from the 1980's thru last year and am now planning to stay there again when we visit this coming September. I always recommend the hotel to friends. The rooms are comfy and luxurious, great beds, the location is the best, the roof top pool provides a delightful respite on a hot day. We found the staff friendly and helpful and appreciated small touches like umbrellas available for use on a rainy day. I can't wait to back back there in September!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in a hotel...at any price, YOU must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: JovanV
Reviews.Content: Walking past the hotel one day, I stopped in to check out the price, expecting rooms to be super expensive, but I was wrong, only 99.00 which is the bargain of the century, as this hotel has it all! So we trudged back to our other hotel, Place D'Armes and packed up and drove as quick as we could to this heaven on earth. (note: both hotels were the same rate, which is like comparing a Motel 6 to a Ritz Carlton!) The luxurious lobby sets the scene for what is to come once you enter your room. And I would like to mention that I did NOT detect any odor of tobacco in the lobby or room, as someone just wrote a July review and said the hotel smelled of smoke. I don't know what they were smelling, but we stayed here at the same time and did not detect any fragrance but heavenly aromas...maybe that was the rose scented lotion from my massage and facial from Maria in the spa? Visit the pool, visit the spa, you won't want to leave this hotel. Then across the street is the BEST place to dine, and it do mean "dine" as it is elegant yet inexpensive: Mr. B's Bistro. Of course, the hotel food is also fabulous, but if you want a change of venue, walk across the street and order a martini for 1.50 - yes, that is NOT a typo, at Mr. B's the drinks are cheaper than the ice tea or soft drinks!!! Of course, the Carousel Bar at the Hotel Monteleone must be seen to be believed, it is worth a visit to sit and spin... I must also mention that the hotel has free umbrellas for your convenience, just ask! Your wish is their command, and when we return to New Orleans we will come for one reason, to visit our favorite home away from home, the Hotel Monteleone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing in many ways.”
Reviews.Author: screennameischris
Reviews.Content: 1) The rooms may be non-smoking, but the hotel pool area is definitely smoking. It was impossible to get a lounge chair without someone next to you lighting up. It also reeks of smoke while you are in the pool. 2) Our floor had an ice maker in the middle of the hallway. We were woken up all night each time a guest used the machine. Extremely poor design on the part of the hotel - any other place I have stayed has had the ice machine in a small separate room out of sight and ear-shot. 3) The cafe's coffee was terrible and the cafe staff was sub-standard. Not a first rate hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel with tons of character”
Reviews.Author: Whatsinanayme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monteleone for a week in early June. I'd easily recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in New Orleans: from solo travelers, to a romantic getaway, to a family vacation. Pros: Great location. It's not exactly near the center of the French Quarter, but it's easily walkable. Plus it's far away from Bourbon Street that you don't get all of the rowdy and drunken noise. Fantastic bar: An evening cocktail at the Carousel Bar became part of our routine. The drinks are moderately priced. It's got a great ambiance, plus you cannot beat the rotating bar. Very friendly bartenders too. Rooms: They were clean and comfortable. The bed was great. They are a little on the small side, but I never mind that since we don't typically spend a lot of time in our hotel room. Friendly staff: Can't say enough about the concierge and some of the other staff members. Ridiculously friendly and personable. Cons: Only a few really. We made our reservations months in advance and requested to be put on the quieter Chartres or Bienville sides of the street. When we arrived, not only were we on the Royal side, but we were directly next to the elevator. We worried about noise, and did experience some, but it wasn't anything terrible. Also, the bathroom left much to be desired. Our toilet leaked and every morning we were greeted with a puddle of water in the middle of the bathroom. We requested this be fixed, but it never was. Also, the website says it has Wifi, but it's pretty darn expensive. Still, we had a great time and part of that was our stay at the Hotel Monteleone.

Reviews.Title: “marvelous monteleone”
Reviews.Author: chgoclaire
Reviews.Content: After my second stay at Hotel Monteleone, I recommend highly for New Orleans' travelers. I've visited NOLA 24 times in the last 22 years.....annually for Jazz Fest, and other tmes on business. I've stayed in more than a dozen hotels and have several favorites, now including the Monteleone. Beautiful public areas, a bar worthy of a visit even if you're not staying there, a great rooftop pool and location, location, location - for exploring the French Quarter there is no better base. This year I stayed in a Junior Suite which was charming. They should add HBO, but who's watching much TV in New Orleans anyway.....

Reviews.Title: “Poor service & unknowledgeable staff”
Reviews.Author: trave11er2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice enough. I would have given a higher rating had the service not been so horrible. After a grueling morning of traveling, we arrived at the hotel around noon excited to shower and take a nap. The clerk who checked us in told us that the only rooms they had immediately available were very small. If we were willing to wait 1-2 hours, then she could put us in a larger room. After 2 hours and still no call from her, we returned and asked her if a larger room had become available. She obliged and finished checking us in. We were surprised, then, to discover that our room was one of the smallest in the hotel, judging by the floor plan on the back of the door (and the undeniable fact that the room was, well, very small). I called the front desk and asked to be switched to a larger room and was told (by a different employee) that all the larger rooms had already been booked up for the weekend, and that this is the size room that we had booked. Strike 1. The next day, in search of lunch, we asked the concierge to recommend a nearby Mexican restaurant. She referred us to the Country Flame, which smelled like a bathroom and whose food turned out to be awful. Later, at a shop down the street, the proprieter overheard us talking about "the most disgusting restaurant we've ever been to" and immediately guessed that we went to the Country Flame. She said it is widely known to be the worst restaurant in the French Quarter! When we complained to the concierge, we got an indifferent response as well as "We eat there all the time!" We tried another staffer, who cringed and said, "Oh god, I have no idea why she would send you there! That place is horrible!" and fetched the manager. Surprisingly, the manager was the most unsympathetic of all. Suppressing a smirk, he told us that it's not the hotel's responsibility to pick restaurants and that we should have looked at the menu and decided whether or not to eat there. He was completely unwilling to accept any fault on behalf of the hotel or the concierge, and offered nothing to compensate us for our poor hotel experience and (by now) upset stomachs. We explained the irony of having found excellent restaurants on our own up to that point...some of the best meals we've ever had, really...and now the one time we ask HIS concierge to recommend a place to eat, we get the worst meal of our lives. His blank, indifferent stare said it all. Our very small room was clean and the hotel is in a good location. We would not stay here again because of the arrogant management and incompetent staff.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: courtney_paige_22
Reviews.Content: - conveniently located - helpful staff - clean rooms when I return, there is no doubt that I will stay at Hotel Monteleone.

Reviews.Title: “It's New Orleans French Quarter ...What do you expect”
Reviews.Author: gtate20000
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to be a decent place to stay if you are going to party and want a safe place to crash but even then overpriced. The rooms were not functional for business travelers

Reviews.Title: “Great--especially if it's not a Friday night...”
Reviews.Author: planktonrules
Reviews.Content: Considering how close this hotel is to everything, this is either wonderful or a problem depending on you. Everything is close by but the party animals outside may get a bit loud, as Bourbon Street is nearby. In June, the Friday night party atmosphere was very loud but completely stopped by midnight. On Saturday, though, all was very quiet outside and sleeping was a lot easier. Pluses--a very, very comfortable bed, a nice lounge and the small restaurant was a nice little romantic hideaway. Minuses--it's an old hotel, but tries its best to be clean and up to date. I'd go back--except during Mardi Gras--as it's way, way too close to the action for a dull guy like me!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Joski69
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the Monteleone for a combination of business and pleasure. Arrived on a Monday and our room was ready at 1 pm check in. Front desk clerk was slightly indifferent but effecient. Overall, process was smooth and professional. Room itself is on the small side, typical for bigger cities. Equipped with King size bed, amoir with tv, drawers and mini-bar, desk./chair, sitting chair and two nightstands. Bath is also on the small side but one of the best showers I have ever experienced in a hotel. Hot water with high pressure on demand! The whole room was a little tight for two but you are not there to spend time in the room. Bed was comfortable, A/C worked well and decor was indicative of the local culture. It was clean and serviced properly daily. Location was ubeatable. Just steps from the dining, shopping, Bourbon and anything else that you may want in New Orleans. Noise was not at all an issue on the 3rd floor but we did not experience any parades or major events. (Jazzfest ended day before arrival) Pool on the roof was a nice facility but food and drink service was slow at best.. They are not equipped for crowds so order at the bar. Gym was decent for hotel size - it gets the job done. We did not utilize room service or any restaurants on property so I cannot speak to food quality for either. There is too much close by to bother. Cannot beat the location for French Quarter. The rest is all more than tolerable for the time actually spent in your room

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Andley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monteleone from June 5 through June 7 for a birthday weekend. It was our first time staying at this property and we were very favorably impressed. The location of the hotel was ideal. The lobby was bustling almost the entire time, however, the staff managed to keep up with everyone coming and going. The Carousel Bar was also bustling the whole weekend. Our room was smallish but very nicely appointed. The bathroom was clean and provided plenty of counter space. We had a king-sized bed and it was very comfortable. We were on the Bienville side of the hotel and did not hear any noise. Our view overlooked the Quarter and out toward the river. The rooftop pool was very crowded. There was a wedding at the hotel on Saturday night and many of the guests were at the pool so there were no available chairs when we went. The bar did its best to keep up with the demand but the pool area is small and the demand that day was great. The hotel surprised us with champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries to help us with our birthday celebration! Last year we stayed at the Westin and we much preferred the Monteleone. Its location is superior as were the accommodations. Although we had one small issue while we were there, hotel management resolved it to our satisfaction. We would not hesitate to return to this hotel and would recommend it heartily.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: grettarn1234
Reviews.Content: Charming old hotel in a great location. Able to walk to everything, shopping on Canal Street, the French Market, the Riverwalk. Staff was extremely friendly. Roof top pool was small but in New Orleans not all hotels even have pools. Fitness center looks out to the Miss. River. I had a preferred King room but found it to be small, the bathroom was decent size with tile and marble. There were no drawers for clothes in the room, did have a small closet. Had nightstand, tv armorie and desk and king size bed in room. Room had a good view of the MIss. River. Close to Bourbon street but far enough away to be very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice hotel - Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: MinneapolisMojoe
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby and decor in general is impressive and the Carousel Bar is top-rated as a fun "to do" in the city. Although we had to stop by several times before we could actual get a seat on the "carousel" because it's always packed! Also, the location overall was really just perfect being between off of Bourbon street, but so close to it (no noise problems at all in the room) and walking distance to everything else - Cafe du Monde, French Market, antique stores, etc. Cafe Beignet is just a block away for breakfast too; and also Green Goddess. We didn't eat in the hotel at all. For vegetarians, pretty much the only place to get a decent meal in the quarter is Green Goddess on Exchange Place, but you have to be careful what you order, because the portions can be small. The whole French quarter is just 7 x 12 blocks so pretty much everything is in walking distance to the Monteleone in general - no car needed or desired. Taxis are also easy to get. We took United Cab wherever we needed to go and the arrived just minutes after calling every time- super punctual. There are cabs always outside the hotel as well. Agree was a bit taken a back by the smallish size of the room and bathroom, but judging by how cramped New Orleans is for space and the comments on this site in general - I think it is par for the course. This is the only reason I rated the room and value lower is the size- althugh it's just relative in comparison to rooms in other cities. Main thing that's important to me is it's clean, the water pressure is good, and the bed is comfortable. All those things are just fine! I didn't have any problems with the TV as others did and we spent a lot of time lounging around in the room between wandering to see the sites and the bars. Didn't notice the small size at all by the end of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: mhaslam5
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about The Hotel Monteleone. It was beautifully restored, our room was spacious and bright, staff was friendly and the entire hotel was spotless. It's a block from Bourbon Street and you can't hear a thing at night. Restaurant's galore, tons of shopping - everything is within walking distance. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurants, mainly because there are so many to explore in the French Quarter. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: gsp80
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay. We had a beautiful suite, which was spacious and comfortable. The bed and furniture were lovely. The location is amazing; on Royal street in the French Quarter, in the middle of gorgeous antique stores. It's nice to be in the middle of the Quarter, but not subject to all the noise from Bourbon Street. The lobby is beautiful, the staff is pleasant, and I had no complaints. The pool is lovely but small - it was chilly, so I'm not sure how crowded it gets when the weather is nicer. A very solid choice for a New Orleans getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: 2NJLUV2TRAVEL
Reviews.Content: Booked awhile ago. We drew the small straw but didn't realize it until we got to our room. We were in room 445 - the worst room in our opinion. I wish we were told that when we checked in. I could see if we arrived late or if we booked last minute. The staff knows this is room is in the worst location - right under the side building sign between the l and the m. Did not sleep the entire time we were there - the yelling and screaming of drunks hanging outside, police and fire engine sirens, car horns honking, music from Bourbon St going on all night long. I am not being overdramatic either. This was my second stay and really didn't realize it since the first time I stayed I had a nicer river view room which actually costs less. It was like a zoo when checking out and trying to get a cab while one bell person was working to help unload luggage for the arriving guests, load for the guests leaving through valet and trying to call taxis. Our room as not cleaned and when we expressed our disappointment they wanted to come when we were in the middle of showering to go out for the evening. We politely said no and then were distrubed two at our door and once by phone saying we wanted it cleaned at 5:30 PM which was totally untrue. There appears to be sheer chaos all the time - either they are inadequately staffed or have the wrong people working. My first experience at the hotel was great that is why we went back - but I would not stay there again. I should note that Mary in LeCafe was great - she was a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “a solid THREE star hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoToTheWorld
Reviews.Content: You will be impressed when you first walk into the Monteleone. The lobby is beautiful and opulent. Behind that entrance is a perfectly acceptable three star hotel, but don't be fooled into thinking this is a luxurious 4 or 5 star hotel -- it is not. But the location is outstanding on beautiful Royal St. and if you'd like to spend time in the French Quarter and be close to Canal St. and the St. Charles streetcar line, and if you insist upon an outdoor pool, you cannot do much better. Check-in staff is perfectly fine, but they don't go above and beyond. They simply check you into the hotel. One nice aspect of the hotel is the choice of three elevator bays. Any one of the bays will help you to your floor and the separate bays ensured that I never waited too long for an elevator, and I was never greeted with an overcrowded elevator. Rooms have their pros and cons. Let's start with the cons: First, the typical room is quite small . . . as small as New York small when it comes to hotel rooms and really a bit smaller than most NY rooms I have enjoyed. There is decent bedding, but no duvets. But what bothered me most about the room was the lack of drawer space. There was one dresser near the television and it had three half-size drawers - fine for one person, insufficient for two. On the plus size, there's a free safe in the room, the A/C worked well, and there's a 32 inch flat panel tv in the room. Also, the room is very attractively decorated. Bathrooms were also very small, there's very little counter space and the shower does not feature a curved shower bar frequently seen these days, making the shower seem even smaller. That being said, water pressure is great. The rooftop gym is pretty nice and features wonderful views of the city. When the sun hits, it can be hot in there but not awful. There are a handful of treadmills, a few ellipticals, a couple of bikes and some weight machines. There's also cold water and apples. The machines are in good shape. The pool area is nice, but really small for the hotel. But note that this is a very common problem in New Orleans. Almost every hotel pool in New Orleans is small and the Monteleone pool is bigger than many. But on two of my four days at the hotel, I arrived after lunch to find no chairs available (the other days I didn't go to the pool). I'm not necessarily saying this is a problem with the hotel. I'm simply saying that if you stay at the Monteleone and the pool is important to you, either arrive early or don't be surprised to find it overcrowded. Also, the pool itself was very crowded so don't expect to swim. Also, there was some garbage in the pool both days and no one seemed to care to clean it up. That being said, drink service at the pool was efficient. The Carousel bar might have been the highlight of the hotel. It was a happening spot where the seats at the main bar rotate slowly around the bar (it's a carousel). Four nights a week there's a very good piano player/singer who plays until about 1:00am and the bar closes about 1:30 (at least on weekends). As for service, my lone experience when I was relaxing in the room in the early evening before going out. The tv picture was pixelating such that there was no real picture, as it had done that same morning. So I called the hotel staff and I was told that this problem simply happens sometimes. I asked if it was a hotel problem or just a problem with my room and the person told me that it was probably hotel-wide, and didn't offer to have anyone look at it. I didn't care that much because I really wasn't watching much tv at all - I'm in New Orleans - but staff at a 4 star hotel would have been more willing to help. My other interactions with staff revealed that they're friendly enough, but I didn't experience anyone willing to do more than is barely necessary. So overall, I think the Monteleone is fine, but I say that with reservations. If you want to be in or close to the French Quarter, if you really want an outdoor pool and you want a more old school hotel, this might be the right choice for you. Don't get me wrong - the hotel is fine, it's just not anything more than a 3 or 3 1/2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: LplusP
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five day stay at this hotel. We are already making plans to go back. Yes, the rooms are smallish and the bathroom even smaller but immaculately clean. Beds were extremely comfortable. Housekeeping did a fantastic job when they came but were very late one day and neglected us completely on our first full day. Not sure what happened there. The bellhops were so much more than that. On eye contact they scurry over to see what you need and give great suggestions and detailed directions. Funny and pleasant all the time. The people at the curb were a little less friendly but fine. The bar is a slow moving carousel and a beautiful place for a nightcap or an afternoon rest stop. The pool is a nice place to relax although the lunch and drink ordering was a bit of a challenge. ("If you want lunch, use that phone to call room service -- but they are 45 minutes behind." Whaddup?) I would suggest that management seriously revisit their internet policy, however. It rubs people the wrong way to charge at all never mind $9 a day. The best thing about the hotel is the location. There is so much to do and see (and eat and drink and dance to) within a 10 block radius that every day we were grateful to be staying in the middle of it all. NOLA is thrilling but exhausting. You can literally go go go all day and all night so when it's time to get back to the hotel it was a HUGE plus to not have to walk far. All in all, one of the best vacations we've had!!

Reviews.Title: “Service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: OLDcowgirl
Reviews.Content: The service of the reception needs to be improved. When we checked in, there was a large group ahead of us and only one person trying to deal with them. The concierge went to get some more help but none appeared for quite some time even though the line behind us was growing longer. There were some other staff standing around but not doing much. They might have been bellhops, but it did not give a good impression. When we finally were served, it was by a receptionist in training who had been sent out from the back office. He was polite and seemed to be trying to do his best. On our last evening we called to request a wake-up call. The person answering the phone took our information and then just hung up. We had similar experiences when we called to ask to have a burned out light bulb replaced and making inquiries about internet service. No confirmation of the information, no pleasantries at all. Internet service was expensive and not consistent. It was a hit and miss situation with the doorman. While we are perfectly capable of opening a door, it would have been nice to have some help when we had luggage. The hotel does have a heated roof top pool, but it is small and considering the number of rooms in the hotel, there were not enough deck chairs. Our room was nice except for the fact that when we looked out the window, our view was of the brick wall of an adjoining tower of the hotel. It would have been nice if the hotel had more public space outside where one could have gone to relax and enjoy the sunshine. The location of the hotel in the French Quarter is great and the decor is beautiful. Obviously there are some things that could not be changed , e.g. the size of the pool, but a visitor's experience could be greatly enhanced by more pleasant and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A 4 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: lorialuminum
Reviews.Content: I was very very disapointed in the Hotel, the room was like a box ( very small) and we had a premium deluxe room that was suppose to be oversized.. Bathroom was so small it was not even funny. small sink, little mirror// women have a 2 x 2 space to do hair next to the bed. - Nicer hotels towards the convention center, more modern and upgraded. Had to go to Walgreens everytime we wanted a bottle of water. Crime is very bad there but they dont tell you until you step out at night - Would not suggest it at all. based on room size horrible // Spa was not worth it at all!! ended up going to the Ritz for another spa treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeeSmall
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monteleone is certainly a great place to get the French creole feel of New Orleans. It is truly an elegant hotel. Location was great and was on a street lined with art and fine shops. The beds are heavenly. The restaurant however was not very inviting and was always empty. The Carousel Bar on the other hand is a main attraction and was always open.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in NOLA - Great City, Great People, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Freespirit22206
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in NOLA. Had a great 4 night stay at this hotel. Very nice lobby - semioppulent in terms of decor...not old or dated, its just that style..esp. since location is right on the street with all the antique shops, art galleries and nice restaurants..walking distance to everything, including the touristy Decator St. area by the Square and CDM... Was able to get a room that was extremely quiet....if you're staying here, make sure you ask for a the floors/corridor that has the room numbers '(floor)28-31....the windows of those rooms face an inner part of the hotel, and there is little to no noise from the outside...avoid the room number 27 - no windows I noticed...Housekeeping was great and timely; room was always clean. Had drinks at the carousel bar - extensive martini menu. Breakfast (a la carte) at their restaurant was delicious (didn't do the buffet, but friends of mine did, and food looked good/fresh)...and even tho I didn't order these, their own beignets (a la carte) looked delicious (re. CDM - went twice since its an institution, sorry to say, but both times the dough was little 'tough'...like they overworked the dough..go to Cafe Beignet down the street. I think there's a difference. ) Overall - very nice hotel - I would stay again.. I want to say - the day I left is the same day the BP oil rig blew up in the Gulf...my heart aches over this for the people who work there, and all the Louisianans, esp. those in the fishing business, who live far beyond the NOLA FQ area We met and talked with alot of employees in the different restaurants (and even the tour guides when we took an airboat tour) where seafood cuisine obviously, in LA, is 'what they do'...I'll never forget their faces when you talk about their 'trade', the pride in that, you know is just so uplifting for them and yourself, esp. what they had faced re. Katrina...so, let me put in a plug for them (through St. Genevieve, St. Frances and St. Andrew)...KEEP THEM IN YOUR PRAYERS..I'll be back NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great service, awesome heated pool”
Reviews.Author: messyjessy24
Reviews.Content: All around very good historic hotel with a great bar. good food from restaurant, good location, and pool was sooooo warm.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Historic Charm”
Reviews.Author: feliciahemans
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of the French Quarter, just one block away from Bourbon Street. It has a beautiful lobby, a rooftop pool with poolside bar, and the charming Carousel Lounge. The bed was extremely comfortable. The room was small, but tastefully decorated and arranged. The staff phoned our room twice during our stay to ask if we were pleased with our service. Overall, we were extremely pleased. Here are a few minor annoyances to consider: 1.) Parking is $30 a night. After realizing this, we parked our car in the business district for $10/night. 2.) The restaurant is very overpriced, but there are plenty of other places to grab breakfast within walking distance. 3.) Several reviews warn that you can hear your neighbors. This was true in our room. Mostly, you can hear water running through the pipes if someone is in the bathroom beside or above you. 4.) There is no free wireless internet. 5.) The business center staff was not helpful. Only their color printer worked, which cost $2.00 a page. When I expressed that I was there for the conference and needed only one black and white print off, they suggested that I go to Kinko's across town rather than print one page for me. 6.) Someone threw up in the hallway outside our room. Although staff immediately came to vacuum, the terrible smell lingered for 2 days. This is perhaps the price you pay for being so close to Bourbon Street!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Especially during festivals”
Reviews.Author: MarylandBeachGirl_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited New Orleans for the first time the weekend of April 8-12, during the French Quarter Fest. This festival's popularity exploded this year, and hotel occupancy in the French Quarter was at 100% during this weekend. That meant that our choice to stay at the Monteleone was perfect because we didn't have to drive or park anywhere. We arrived on Thursday afternoon, and it took about 20 mins to get from the airport to the hotel. The cab cost $33 (a flat rate for 2 people). We were checked in quickly, and given a room on the 6th floor of the Iberville Tower. The room was not huge, but not really small either. I think this is typical of any hotel in the Quarter. We had a king-size bed, a good size closet, 3 drawers in the armoire, a TV, arm chair and bathroom with one sink, and a shower with excellent water pressure. They provided plenty of clean towels every day. The view was basically of a wall, which is also typical of hotels in this area, but since little time is spent in the room, it doesn't matter. We met friends in the Carousel Bar downstairs for Sauzeracs. If you've never had a Sauzerac, a word of warning: It's basically rye whiskey and it's really strong. We couldn't have more than a few sips and we were done! This bar is busy all the time, by the way. Ask for a drink list, and they do have excellent martinis. We also used the fitness facility every morning, but it was not very well equipped, unless you're into cardio. They have 4 treadmills, a few ellipticals and bikes, four weight machines (like a bicep curl machine), and a balance ball badly in need of inflating.
