There are NO WEIGHTS whatsoever, so if you want to do strength training, bring your resistance bands with you. They have a water machine, small towels and apples. It's on the top of the hotel, with windows all the way around, so it gets very hot. It was also very crowded every morning from 6 to 8:30 a.m., but I never waited more than 5 mins for a treadmill. Also on this floor is the pool, with a small snackbar/bar. We spent a few hours there one afternoon, and it was super crowded and the one bartender was superslow. One thing to note: The elevators took forever. However, all the crowdedness and elevator slowness was probably due to the fact that the hotel was at 100% capacity. They had excellent coffee in the Logo Shop. We had breakfast one morning in the cafe, and it was excellent as well. Now for notes on what we did while we were in Nola: On Friday afternoon, after leaving the Carousel Bar, we walked a few blocks to the Napoleon House for Pimms Cups, then up to Decatur St (the main drag, just a few blocks away) and stopped in a "To-Go Drinks" bar for daiquiris to sip while we continued to walk around and get the lay of the land. We ended our evening with oysters at Felix's (very good, and no wait, unlike the long line across the street at Acme Oyster House). We walked back to the hotel on Bourbon St (just one block over from the hotel). On Friday, we met our group at the Gazebo Cafe for drinks and appetizers, then crossed the street to the Riverfront and took in the music at the various stages set up for the festival. Great food and drinks were available at all the vendor booths set up as well. We also hit the French Market, but all we bought were beads (only $3). That evening, we ended up on Bourbon St., and we listened to blues music at the Funky Pirate and then headed over to The Beach (a bar), where the main attraction is riding a mechanical WHALE. Very funny, especially if it involves someone very drunk who is not yourself! On Sat., we took the streetcar up to the Garden District and followed a walking tour in our Frommer's Guide that takes you past the most beautiful mansions, many in the Italianate or Greek Revival design. My husband was most interested in the Archie Manning house, which was the least grand of them all. We had the BEST sushi at the Sake Cafe on Magazine Street -- we definitely recommend this if you like sushi. On Sat evening, we wanted to go to El Gato Negro for Mexican, because the waiter at Felix's had said that they had the best guacamole. Unfortunately the festival had just ended for the day, and there was an 1 1/2 hours wait. We ended up next door at the Louisiana Pizza Kitchen, and this was just fine. The pizza was excellent, and they had a good selection of wines by the glass. We then went to Cafe du Monde for beignets and cafe au laits for dessert. It was much less crowded at this time of day (in other words, there was a short line to wait to get in). But service was fast, and it's a classic Nola thing to do. I love sweets and was really looking forward to this, but to be honest, I didn't think they were all that great. They were good, but not as amazing as the guide books tell you. On Sunday, we went to the WWII Museum, the only one of its kind in the country. If you want an indepth learning experience, this is excellent. My husband looked at and read every single thing in that museum. I don't have as big an interest in it as my husband does (he's really into all the military tactics and strategy, etc.), but I found the more personal things interesting, such as the diaries and letters that soldiers sent back home. One case in the Pacific Theatre section displayed a letter a soldier had written to his young boys for Christmas, the Valentine's Day letter he'd writtten to his wife, the telegram 2 weeks later informing her of his death, and the photo he'd carried of her and their three children. The letter to his sons just blew me away. For a Christmas present, he asked his sons to ask their mother every day what they could help her with, since he couldn't be there to help her. And he explained that he couldn't be home with them for Christmas because he was fighting a very bad bully who was hurting people who were weaker, and that he hoped they would always be brave enough to stand up against bullies on behalf of younger and weaker kids. It was such a wonderful gift and example that he gave to his children. We also had dinner at Arnaud's on Sunday night, but we didn't think it was as amazing as we'd been told it would be. The lesson we learned was not to go to the places the guide books tell you to go to. Avoid those touristy places and just go to the little out of the way places that you stumble across instead. Those were the best ones! Basically, we never had to take a cab. The location of this hotel was great, the service and food was good., and it was easy to learn your way around. Great place to stay the first time you're in New Orleans, or really any time!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: tscteach03
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monteleone was a perfect location in the French Quarter. It is not on Bourbon Street which was a plus for us. However, it is centrally located to Bourbon Street, the French Market, shops, and loads of restaurants. The first room we were escorted to had a terrible view so we asked for a nicer one. They did move us to another room but I'm not sure the view was that much better. Toiletries were adequate and maid service was done daily. For the first two days we were there we saw the same room service trays in our hallway that were just left there and not attended to. The gym was not large but adequate. The only problem there was that it was extremely warm especially when there were more than just a few people working out. The hotel did have wireless internet service but we did not use it since they charged $10 per day which I find ridiculous. The concierge was extremely helpful when trying to find a taxi or locate a restaurant. We can definitely recommend the restaurant right across the street, Mr. B's Bistro. By far the best place we ate while in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: PawPaw57
Reviews.Content: Great location with small rooms that are nicely furnished. It can be a bit noisy, but what do you expect on a weekend in New Orleans? My only real complaint is with the surcharge for internet use. The hotel is not cheap. Why is wireless not included?

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice + Champagne= PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: ekkc
Reviews.Content: While checking in the clerk mentioned that we'd have a nice view from our room and I said I was happy about that since this was a wedding anniversary trip. When we returned to our room after dinner, there was a chilled bottle of champagne (not "sparkling wine" either) two flutes and a plate of chocolate covered stawberries! How great is that!? But even without that extra special touch, I'd still rate this hotel very highly. The location is fantastic, in the French Quarter and near good restaurants and shops etc but away from the grubbier bits. The rooms are small by chain hotel standards, but this is an historic building and the standard rooms are just fine; the beds and bedding are immaculate and comfortable. The bathroom is cozy, but super clean with plenty of hot water and towels (and very very nice bar soap too :-) Heavy draperies on the windows allow you to sleep in and there's a pool on the roof too. Oh, and the Carousel Bar off the lobby is not to be missed. When we return to New Orleans will stay there again quite happily!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: JustiD
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been a New Orleans favorite for years. It is a beautiful old hotel. The location couldn't be better . . . in the middle of the French Quarter and within walking distance of everything. Nice day spa too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: 1TEXAS1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed many times in the Quarter, first time at the Monteleone. Great location 1 block from Bourbon. The room was spotless and great maid service. You have to have one drink at the bar sometime during you stay. There is no restaurant, but you don't need one being in this location. We will be back. There are 2 sizes of rooms. Pay the upcharge and get the bigger room. The spa is the only thing we would give a thumbs down to. My wife has gone to the best spas in the Quarter, and this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Smitty-Dallas
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Monteleone. It was in a perfect location and the staff were great! The concierge could have been a little friendlier, but it didn't negatively impact our stay. The room was clean and the room service was tasty. The only issue with the room was that the bed was super soft and was comfortable at first...but then hurt your neck/back. The halls were quiet and the hotel well maintained. We would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Monteleone Hotel very dissappointing!!!”
Reviews.Author: galatravelevent
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monteleone Hotel for our anniversary last May. The hotel lobby was very nice but once we got to our room, it went downhill from there. The room was outdated, dirty carpet and the worst part - you could hear your adjacent room occupants talking, flushing toilets, noise all hours of the night. I had to call downstairs on our first night because several women woke us up partying in the hall laughing loudly and talking around 2:30 am to complain about the noise. No one came. The "hall party" must have lasted 20-30 minutes. The next night the couple next door were screaming and fighting after 1:00am so we called TWICE about them. Finally, someone came to quiet them down. I complained when I check out about the noise and there was no apology. I wrote the Monteleone Hotel and did not receive a reply. The walls there are like "paper thin" and there a huge vent on the room door that lets in all hall sound. I will never stay there again , even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel at the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: BrigH
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is top notch- from the check in to leaving the garage at the end of the stay. The rooms were small but that is to be expected from a historic hotel. The beds were the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The hotel is one block from Bourbon streeet. I was worried the noise from the street might be problematic but we all slept through the night. We visited the bar one night and relaxed while having a drink. Its a fun bar that moves while you're sitting there. Its an interesting experience. The parking price is a bit steep but the alternative is parking on the street. I will stay at this hotel any time I visit New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DSTDiva
Reviews.Content: I thought that the hotel was quite lovely. The lobby is absolutely beautifil with its marbel foors and beautiful art work. The rooms were a decent size and were decorated well. My only complaint is that at times it seemed as though the walls were paper thin since I could easily hear people moving through out the hallways. A bigger complaint that we "all" had was the fact that the maids seemed to congregate in the hallways in the mornings and in our opinion, were quite loud. I loved the location of the hotel as it is a french quarter hotel, and is near all the action. This made it easy for us to walk to most of the attractions. The front desk staff was lovely as were the bellmen. They loved to chat with and smile at the ladies. Can't really blame them though :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location! Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: HonuPhoenix
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. I really loved being there near Christmas - the decorations were lovely. The rooms are not spacious by any stretch of the imagination but they are clean. The decorations are pretty ornate and a little over-the-top but that's just part of the history and charm of the hotel. The carosel bar is nice - when it's busy, it can be fun to watch people do the carosel "shuffle" - they have to side step every minute or so to keep up with their friends that are sitting at the rotating bar :) Centrally located, friendly staff, helpful concierage. Had a exquisite dinner at their on-site restaurant. Have always been able to find amazing rates here. Only $99 this stay!

Reviews.Title: “Monteleone vs Omni Royal? Monteleone hands down!”
Reviews.Author: saraheichorn
Reviews.Content: For my trip to New Orleans because I was traveling at Carnival season I stayed in two hotels the Monteleone and the Omni Royal. Of the two both my mother and I loved the Monteleone. First the good, the Staff was very attentive even during the craziness of Carnival. The Caruosel Bar is everything it is cracked up to be so don't miss it. Our room a preferred double was lovely. The ceilings are high. The beds and pillows are soft so you sink into them. The bathroom is an oasis well lit so you can put makeup on and there is even a nghtlight that comes on when you turn off the light. It is one block from Bourbon so it is close but separate from the craziness there. Walgreens is right outside the door so you can get whatever it might be that you forgot. First the bad, you won't be impressed when you walk into the hotel. The lobby is small and serviceable and there are only two elevators. About the only ugly I can think to mention was the crowds from Bourbon sometimes spill down there so you may have to deal with rowdiness. It is also a good 5 blocks from Jackson Square. But if you like walking and want a plush, lovely place as your home away from home don't book another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: crm14210
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Mardi Gras. We selected this hotel for the location - inside the quarter, and the ambiance of a traditiional New Orlean's hotel. We were not disappointed. The location on Royal which is a more upscale street one block south of bourbon, was perfect. We walked everywhere. The lobby was comfortable and well appointed. Our room while a tad small, which one should expect in an older traditional property, was graciously decorated and very comfortable. The service, even during the crazy period of Mardi Gras, was pleasant and professional. We were quite pleased with our experience at the Monteleone!

Reviews.Title: “American Rail Tours Mardi Gras Trip”
Reviews.Author: MarkM16
Reviews.Content: Best hotel in the French Quarter by far. Historic hotel with excellent service and ametities.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sage0575
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in the French quarter. Nice room, comfortable beds. Defiantly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and Style”
Reviews.Author: highm
Reviews.Content: We planned a trip to New Orleans, before the Super Bowl wasdecided. Once we discovered that the Saints would be playing the week-end that we would be in town, we were mixed with excitement and fear over the crowds. The Hotel Monteleone handled the throngs of excited fans with grace and style. You would have never known by the positive attitudes and clenliness that anything of great importance was occurring this particular week-end. The front desk was more than helpful, kind, patient, and had positive attitudes. The Carousel lounge was beyond full with over excited patrons, and service was somewhat slow, but, the bartenders were pleasant and making the best of an over the top situation. The hotel was clean, and remained clean despite the number of people and overzealous patrons. Everything went very well, on a very difficult and exciting week-end in New Orleans. Our room was on the front of the hotel, and yes, as the celebration continued, over the Saints win, into the wee hours of the morning, it was somewhat noisy, but nothing that you couldn't tune out and sleep right on through. We were in New Orleans in what has been determined to be the most exciting week-end, ever, in New Orleans, and the Hotel Monteleone handled it well, and with totally positive attitudes and style. No employee was short tempered or negative, down to the housekeeping staff, as we had a delayed check out. Everyone was nice, and the hotel handled the throngs of people with styel and utmost grace. We didn't utilize the pool, but did check it out for future stays, and it looks absolutely fantastic and inviting. It was heated, and very nice, on the rooftop. Overall, I don't see how anyone could go to New Orleans and stay anywhere but at the Hotel Monteleone. It was the best of the best, in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect tourist location in nice old hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaloneV
Reviews.Content: Old fashioned historic hotel in a prime sightseeing location. Half block from Bourbon Street. Nice gym with a great view but no free weights. Small rooftop pool (not big enough for laps).

Reviews.Title: “hotel gave room key to stranger”
Reviews.Author: billieb123
Reviews.Content: hotel gave room key to someone not in my party. I found the guy asleep in the bed . . . after he had hit the mini-bar. I feel fortunate that he wasn't a theif, rapist or murderer. Hotel initially said they would investigate and then said it never happened. i have stayed here many time - but never again. Mistakes happen - even crazy mistakes like this. But the hotel refuses to accept any responsibility. Yikes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than the other hotels in the area”
Reviews.Author: aldean323
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our accomodations here. The room was clean and in good condition the staff were helpful. The mini fridge had two bottles fall out and I took them to the front desk and they did not charge me for them. The rooms compared to the other two hotels we have stayed at in the area were average size. I don't know why all the hotels here have such small rooms. One nice benefit of this hotel is that it is a quieter area than Bourban but, within walking distance to all the night life.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Monteleone”
Reviews.Author: WDubin
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful and service was very friendly and helpful. Of course location is fantastic. We stopped into the Carousel Bar for a drink and it was charming. We ordered room service for breakfast a couple of times and the food was very good and it was delivered at the exact time we wanted. We had two separate stays in one week. The first stay we were given a Preferred King Room but not charged any extra. It was a corner room with great views of the city. It was a nice size. During our second stay we were surprised with a beautiful suit and again did not have to pay extra. Again we had great views of the city. The bed in the suit was more comfortable than the one in the first room. The only negative thing I can say is that they charged us twice for our second stay but reversed the charges before I noticed it and when I told them I was charged bank fees they reimbursed me immediately. In fact, they reimbursed me more than the bank had charged me. All in all, we had two wonderful stays and are looking forward to returning to the Monteleone.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated! Rude staff, Paper thin walls, good location”
Reviews.Author: jko323
Reviews.Content: 6 of stayed here in 2 rooms. First mistake! I forget how small double beds are, and there is no room for a cot. In fact...we didn't know where to put our suitcases. I've stayed in small NYC hotels..but this was small! Toilet flushed LOUD!! Cleaning staff started cleaning at 9am on sunday. Check-out was 11am. We were woken up by them vacuuming above us and banging on our door to service the room. We were not checking out until monday so we found that annoying. Hotel is close to Bourbon St, Canal St, etc. But also right next door to the police station. Every morning we heard sirens! One of my friends said she heard a shooting friday night, but I did not. You definately heard people on the street, and we were on the 10th floor. Spa wasn't that great either. 55$ pedicure that was just so-so...and had to sit for 1hr for polish to dry because they have not heaters. Also, the bar staff was rude. We weren't able to all fit at the carousel so we sat at a table...no one else was there, and the waitress was like..oh did you want something. Most of the staff at the front desk had a european accent and never understood anything we asked. We asked the bellman for a cab for 7am the next day for the airport. We got to the lobby at 6:50 and a different bellman was harrassing us for being late? WTF? anyway..wouldn't stay here again, I thought it would be cute and quaint..but it was a disaster

Reviews.Title: “A New Orleans Gem”
Reviews.Author: aejii
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Had a room on one of the higher floors overlooking the street. Not a great view, but the best view is to be had on the street! I have stayed here a few times, so always request one of the larger double rooms, same price, but they are much larger. Great rooftop pool, small, but nice and family friendly. A great way to get some sun. I have never tried any of the restaurants in the hotel as they didn't look too appealing, especially with the amazing food on every corner. Reception can be a bit slow, but it comes with the city. The Carousel bar is a must see, and enjoy a few sazeracs before heading down to look at art, antiques, and things going on. The hotel is just a block or two off bourbon street, and a few blocks from the river. An ideal location. Friendly staff and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, Average Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AJ454
Reviews.Content: The only really good thing I can say about the hotel is the location. It is perfectly situated one block north of Bourbon and 4 blocks from the waterfront, but being on Royal means that it is quiet as well. The room we had was small, but fine for 2 people (although the bathroom was actually surprisingly small). But what really surprised me was how bad the service was. In general, I found the service to be sorely lacking for what I expect from a luxury hotel. Our trip started out with check in, where I was a little surprised that there weren't bellmen around to help with our bags. The following morning, I went to speak with the concierge about scheduling some tours and restaurant reservations. When I had called the concierge prior to our trip, I had been told twice that there was no need to book any tour or restaurant reservations in advance. That is why it was very aggravating to then speak with the concierge in person, who refused to help guide us with recommendations or help with reservations other than to give us a Grey Line Tours brochure. Sure enough, we called Grey Line and they were booked for the tours we wanted, and the restaurants that I had mentioned to the concierge over the phone prior to our arrival were also largely booked. One night, we went for a drink at the Carousel Bar, and were treated really poorly by our waiter. Finally, housekeeping was a disaster. Each day, something new would be missing after housekeeping came through, and we would only realize it the next morning when it was too late. One day it was shampoo and conditioner. One day it was coffee. One day it was mouthwash and body lotion. Even worse though was that when we did actually call to get any of these items replaced, the orders would get lost. I literally had to call 4 times between about 9 PM and 9 AM the next morning to get body lotion and mouthwash delivered, the only time that we were able to notice that something had not properly been replaced before we needed it the following morning. By about midway through our 7 night stay, we decided that we would use the hotel services as little as possible. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants, we didn't ask the concierge for help with plans and we didn't go back to the carousel bar. We were very excited about our trip and had heard good things about the hotel (including on this site!), but it is safe to say we were sorely disappointed with the Hotel Monteleone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BozoTours
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels on 3 continents, and just enjoyed 5 nights at the Monteleone. It is one of the finest, if not the finest, hotel where I have ever stayed, particularly in New Orleans. The staff is warm and friendly and quite attentive, as befits the care shown by an establishment that has been operated by the same family for several generations. The Carousel Bar is a lively New Orleans gathering place that serves excellent drinks and the hotel breakfasts are superb. Yes, the rooms in this older hotel are small, but clean and well appointed. If you prefer good service, from the concierge desk and the thorough but unobtrusive housekeepers, to the liveried doorman and bell staff, this is a hotel you will enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Bar”
Reviews.Author: mrmeryl
Reviews.Content: We had a good time at the Monteleone. The rooms are typically small (unless you get one of the suites), but the staff was more than willing to try to accomodate us. We were celebrating birthdays and they sent champagne and chocolate strawberries to the room upon our arrival. The Carousel Bar is a fun, fun venue--great atmosphere, friendly and Eddie is a true bartender who makes COCKTAILS--the way they should be made. The location is primo and we felt very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of the FQ!”
Reviews.Author: btlegrljessi
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a stay at this hotel for my birthday, and it couldn't have been any better! The history of this hotel sets the stage for a remarkable experience that makes you feel as though you're stepping back to a bygone era, while maintaining all of the expectations of modern-day travelers. The room was beautiful (preferred salon on the 8th floor with river view, so I can't speak for the size or state of other areas of the hotel) and the staff were very helpful. It was so nice to be able to leave our car in the capable hands of the valets and not think about it again until it was time to leave. The location is perfect- just blocks away from anything you'd ever want to do in the FQ- On our last day, we were able to walk the short block down to Cafe Beignet for a leisurely breakfast before checkout time at 11am. A great stay, and one that we plan to repeat in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel, small and slightly tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: Britontherails
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Monteleone for a conference. The hotel lobby, bar, and communal rooms are beautiful. This is an old hotel, with a lot of traditional features and fixtures, and a lot of charm from it's history. However the down-side of the history, and of the lovely communal rooms is that in the old days beds were smaller, and so were guest rooms. The guest rooms are very small in this hotel, and with a king bed there is no space. The fixtures in the rooms are fairly shabby in places too. The TV is a massive old thing without any free channels really. The bathrooms are a little tired. It's all a bit 'poky'. The main problem however is the lack of double-glazing. This meant that the room I had on the first night - facing the street and on the fourth floor, was ok in terms of size, but the noise was unbearable. I didn't sleep at all. I moved rooms the next day, but some colleagues of mine didn't, and they were all kept awake if they had street facing rooms - even one colleague on the 11th floor - the floor above the floor of my replacement room in the interior of the hotel. I will always think that an independent hotel, especially one with history and charm, is better than a faceless corporate clone. However, nothing is more important than getting a good night's sleep and it's clear that at this hotel this can sometimes be a problem. The staff were kind, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A New Orleans exterior but could be any nice hotel interior”
Reviews.Author: GoddessFreya82
Reviews.Content: I was excited about staying at the Monteleone due to some of my favorite writers staying here. From the outside it seemed like a historic and charming place. When I arrived to stay here it was full of people wanting to take your bags and expecting a tip at every corner and the historic charm was not found inside the hotel. It had been totally remodeled and you could be in New Orleans or New York City according the interior. The grande ole bohemian existence is not there instead it is a hotel that tries to be like the Ritz Carlton. That being said my main problem with the room was the thin walls. I could hear EVERYTHING my neighbors said and everytime someone shut the door to another room at night I woke up. I didn't get much sleep. Also, for the price the room is incredibly small, you get twice the size room at the Holiday Inn. Next time I go to NOLA I will be staying at a historic inn with character.

Reviews.Title: “Different hotel depending on which floor /side of the building your room was on!”
Reviews.Author: NYCFrequent_traveler
Reviews.Content: My main recommendation for other travelers based on our stay at this hotel, is that it is possible to have a completely different experience depending on where your room is. We started off in a room on the 4th floor on the Iberville side of the hotel. It was really very small (and we are used to hotels in NYC and London) but nicely appointed. We got quite a bit of regular street noise, which wasn't too bad. But then on several nights there was a band playing in the road on that side of the building. One night it went on until 11pm and then stopped, the previous night (according to members of our group who arrived a day earlier) it went on well past that and one of them requested and was given a room change. Other nights we weren't disturbed, but on our last night it started up again and was extremely loud. We requested a room change and they complied, and brought keys for our new room up to our old room while we packed up. When we got to the new room on the 9th Floor on the Bienville side of the hotel and it was a completely different world! Much larger room, very quiet and with a great view of the river. So I'd say it was critical where your room is located in this hotel. Otherwise - the hotel itself is in a great location - very near French Quarter attractions and restaurants with a great Cafe Beignet just two blocks away for breakfast. I also liked the mini maps of the area they give you with your key cards. The Carousel bar was nice as well. So I would recommend and would stay there again, but I absolutely would want to guarantee a room on a much higher floor on the Bienville side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Madge1st
Reviews.Content: The lobby is very nice and the Carousel Bar is a landmark of course. The rooms that we had were very small but were saved by the high ceilings. The casual chairs in the rooms were tired and need to be reupholstered or replaced. The comforters were very cheap... much could be improved by using down comforters and covers on the beds. All that being said, it's still a grande dame of a hotel. It's probably been a rough couple of years for business, and they will probably update when the economy picks up.

Reviews.Title: “Classic and charming hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: tanya_IN_STEREO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the monteleone in April, the weekend of Easter, and I am embarassed it took me this long to write the review of the hotel! If you are looking for an awesome hotel deal, consider Easter weekend. Our rate was only $119/night. It was for a smaller room, but it was still a great hotel room. Front desk staff was always helpful, and the doormen are very friendly as well. Breakfast definitely is expensive, and I would suggest going out to cafe du monde for breakfast instead. Carousel bar is fun even if you only try it once. Bed was comfortable and I loved the bedding. Small room, but it was functional. Rooftop pool was beautiful. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: SarahP1118
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monteleone was a great spot for our New Orleans getaway. The building is historic yet offers modern comforts. Customer service was outstanding, from the bellman to the front desk clerk to the bartender at the fun Carousel Bar. The location offers easy access to all the sights of the French Quarter and Faubourg Marigny, as well as the streetcar to explore the Garden District. Our bed was very comfortable, the shower's water pressure very good, and the setting was overall very quiet. A great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, friendly staff, comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: PeanutRoan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monteleone for our wedding/honeymoon. I was referred to this hotel by a friend. The location is perfect; in the heart of the French Quarters and close to Bourbon Street without all the noise. The staff was so very nice from the check in to the check out. Ricky, the bell hop, provided us with a number of great places to eat. Gerald, the doorman, was very professional and courteous. We valet parked and the staff was very friendly and took good care of our vehicle. The hotel upgraded our room since it was our honeymoon and provided champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries. The Carousel Bar was fabulous. The drinks were made to precision!! Our room was very romantic and spacious! The beds were very comfortable and the decor was fabulous. We had a view of the Mississippi River!! Hotel Monteleone helped make our honeymoon special and we will always have fond memories of the this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean comfy beds and pillows!! But hidden fees.”
Reviews.Author: MissJulesNorton
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay on hotels.com, and added in the search for hotels that allowed dogs, as we were traveling with ours. We very pleased with the rate at Hotel Monteleone, and the fact that it allowed dogs. At check in, they informed us that it would be a $25 a night charge for the dog AS WELL AS a $100 cleaning fee. It mentioned nothing of this on hotels.com OR their website. We also had no one come and clean our room until we called 4 times and finally got a manager. Other then that, the hotel was beautiful and in the perfect location. Just a block from all the excitement, but it was still quite. The mattresses and pillows were fabulous! All around, I'd stay there again, even with the inconveniences we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monteleone”
Reviews.Author: eclecticgeek
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, comfortable but small rooms. It's close to the trolley and main street with various attractions and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monteleone - Fancy with great location is what you get, not much more...”
Reviews.Author: JJH
Reviews.Content: Fancy lobby, fancy beds, fancy curtains, fancy staff, fancy bar and restaurants. Small standard rooms with limited vanity space. Wasn't too noisy between rooms but you could hear in rooms as you walked down the hall. Older TV's, we had problems with the remote, not that your in NOLA to watch TV but... Rooftop pool is pretty cool, added bonus and its heated, open till 10pm. However, where's the hot tub? Elevators are fast but thank goodness, on a full house there can be 600 rooms in multiple towers. Love the location but the lack of complimentary ammenities (i.e. internet) and the overpriced everything we encountered makes other facilities more enticing. Forget the fancy wallpaper and weird patterns and give us some value! Room service prices were outrageous and the $2.75 for Starbucks coffee in the "Logo Shop" is just plain unacceptable. They don't even charge that at a Starbucks! Same parking was $10 a night cheaper direct through the parking structure, it's just around the corner. Didn't even look at the two restaurant menus after seeing $17 for continental breakfast on the room service menu in our room... I'm surprised they didn't charge for the fridge in our room, but how could they it was soo crappy and tiny. The owners need to stay at some other similar priced hotels and realize what you are up against...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, quiet but very close to the Bourbon Street action”
Reviews.Author: exit98
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a gorgeous king suite. Well appointed with fabulously high ceilings! Bathroom kind of small but that's not why we come to the Big Easy. Steps from Bourbon Street but none of the noise. Have a drink in the carousel bar. It spins slowly and is kind of cool.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Dame well preserved with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Rooz
Reviews.Content: This is an historic (i.e. old) hotel, but rooms appear recently and lovingly refurbished. Great location just far enough from the madding crowd but close enough to walk to everything. Front-desk staff were wonderful. When noise from a guerilla street band threatened to ruin our sleep (literally), they 1) got police to disband them and 2) happily moved us to a room on the quieter side of the hotel. Really went the extra mile. Easy access to Canal St and St. Charles for streetcar to City Park or Garden District. Also short walk to anywhere in the Quarter. Very helpful concierge with ideas and reservations. All in all, this was a great place to stay, and I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Big Easy Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: vbailey2
Reviews.Content: We celebrated a birthday in New Orleans the first weekend in October, 2009 and stayed at the Hotel Monteleone for 3 nights. It had been recommended to us by friends who had stayed there several times before. We'd both been to NOLA several times before, but we won't ever stay anywhere else again! The service was wonderful (we had iced Champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries waiting for us in the room when we checked in!) and the staff was very friendly and helpful. HM is located in the French Quarter, but not on Bourbon Street so you are away from the noise and crowds, yet close enough to be there in just minutes. The Carousel Bar was a fun treat as well. We didn't utilize the rooftop pool, but it was lovely. We did use the exercise room - it was great and looking out over the Mississippi River while walking on a treadmill was a great way to while the time away. They did, however, have several other types of exercise equipment, and there was access to TV on each piece. We also tried out the spa and got a nice massage! The room price was very reasonable - in fact it was quite a bargain. And even though the rooms are not big compared to some standards, it was plush and comfortable. The whole place is beautiful!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jpseph172
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monteleone was a great hotel. The room was very nice and the service was excellent! You couldn't ask for a better location in the French Quarter. We were right in the middle of everything, yet it was very quiet. I never heard any outside noise or any inside noise either.We went for my husband's 50th birthday and I mentioned that when I made my reservations on line. The afternoon of our first night they delivered champagne and chocolate covered strawberries with a Birthday card. I thought that was a really nice touch. The rooftop pool was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Menteleon Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: sstrout
Reviews.Content: Was there for a user conference. Hotel was very nice. Architecture was beautiful. Food was good.

Reviews.Title: “My All Time Favorite Hotel Anywhere”
Reviews.Author: mlandrum78130
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for well over 40 years, since I was a child. Great memories. The entire hotel has been updated and is elegant and classy. The location in the French Quarter is perfect. The Carousel Bar is a must experience. Service was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “To Steve, Manager of Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Minkus40
Reviews.Content: Steve, It is rare that I would ever write a review of a hotel but I am doing just that now for my recent visit to your hotel. In short, my experience with your hotel from top to bottom was in one word â€œexcellentâ€�- From check in to check out the entire staff from the front desk folks, maid service, bell caps were all outstanding. I felt like a king at your place. Further, the breakfast buffet was â€œthe bestâ€� buffet I have ever had, and I have a lot in my travels. The room was immaculate, quiet and the bed was better than Westin Heavenly bed (where I stay mostly) Now the work-out area... immacualtely clean and three words: WHAT A VIEW! I never saw a ghost eitherâ€¦ which was a big plus for me.. :) I almost did not want to do this review as I donâ€™t want word to get out as you may raise your rates. Your hotel should be used as an example to others in your industry. Safe to say when I am back in NOLA you will see me again at your place. Well done, sir. Best regards, Mark Gates

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its Best”
Reviews.Author: tissm
Reviews.Content: If anyone wants to stay in a wonderful hotel in the heart of New Orleans this is the hotel to stay at. It is in walking distance to all major attractions and nightlife. The staff treat everyone like they are special would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel In New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: jackie0953
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a girls trip to New Orleans and stayed at the Hotel Monteleone. The location is perfect, on Royal Street and one block away from Bourbon Street. Everything is in walking distance. The beds were some of the most comfortable I have slept in. The hotel is family owned and they take great pride in delivering excellent service, I would definitely stay at this Hotel again and recommend it hightly.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, and great food!”
Reviews.Author: mcloud1000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled down to New Orleans to stay for two nights at the Hotel Monteleone in early October. The city itself is fabulous: great food, great people, great atmosphere. I was hoping that the Hotel Monteleone would provide a great way to experience all the city has to offer. The first thing that I can say is that this is a historic hotel somewhat reminiscient of a stay at the Hotel Del. The rooms, while nicely updated and furnished, still have different characteristics than the standard hotel rooms of today. That means odd shaped hallways, odd shaped bathrooms, different size standard rooms, and different architecture throughout. Some people will find this attractive while others will not. Be sure that you do not mind this feature before you book, as it could be a deal breaker for some. To myself, the hotel, especially the lobby and carousel bar, are amazing. I love the hisotrical feel and look of the hotel. The style is almost a shock to the senses after having spent so many nights in plain "modern" hotels. It should be mentioned that the hotel has done a nice job of maintaing the structure itself and has provided some modern ammenities (definitely use the workout room and roof-top pool, if only for the view). The service itself is excellent. We were graciously assisted in every aspect of our visit, from check-in to check-out. There was always a helpful hand to help out. The servers at the restaurants were very good as well. While the Hunt Room Grill took a long time to serve the food (be prepared to slow down for a meal here, do not come if you are in a hurry!), the waitstaff was extremely gracious and the food was top-notch. Filet mignon and crab-stuffed shrimp were excellent. The location is great as well. Just a jump away from Bourbon St. (without all of the noise) and located right off of Canal St. the hotel is very easy to locate. It should also be mentioned that the hotel is located on Royal St. which becomes St. Charles St., so it is very easy to hop on a street car and head off to the Garden District (which is fabulous). Overall a very good trip. I booked the trip through LuxuryLink which I highly recommend. Great rates, great service, and a GREAT experience. This website and this hotel do not disappoint. I recommend both.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: arubahoneymoon05
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay in mid Sept at Hotel Monteleone. The value was great. This time of year is the down season which is most likely the reason but stay 4 nights at $99 each night. This hotel is very nice, clean and in great location. The carousel bar is a nice touch as well. Would definitely stay here again. I can't believe the quality we got all around for the price we paid...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MHTruett
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the French Quarter, the Hotel Monteleone is a beautiful historic landmark hotel with very polite and attentive staff. The rooms are well kept and clean, with turndown service. The Carousel Bar is a great place to grab a drink with friends. You are just steps from a number of wonderful restaurants and only blocks from the Aquarium, Jackson Square or the Saenger Theatre. I have a new home when in New Olreans.

Reviews.Title: “Check your room charges before you leave. They try to add additional charges to your bill at check out.”
Reviews.Author: IndianaDesire
Reviews.Content: The original bill was correct that they slid under the door but at check out ( Kevin at the front desk ) changed the bill and tried to charge us for a mini bar we never used. They fold up your bill and put it in an envelope hoping you wont notice the addirtional charges on it. He took our original bill and just adjusted more charges on it. So check your bill before you leave this place.

Reviews.Title: “very nice with a minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: lar63
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate with their summer get away rate and they offered a great parking rate too directly on the hotel's website. My room and the hotel are very clean and kept up well. There were a few things that bothered me a little though: the room hvac vent and the bath fan vent were covered with dust to the point of being clogged. There's a rice rooftop pool but the water was cloudy indicating that the filter was undersized or clogged.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomdiations with great bar/lounge”
Reviews.Author: Biguenet
Reviews.Content: The room was well appointed with an excellent view of the river. Details such as an extra towel, shampoo, mouth wash, etc. were in the bath. The staff was quite helpful and friendly. We did arrive early, but the hotel was able to accomdate our early arrival. We vised the bar/lounge which was a lot of fun as it revolved ever so slowly. Drinks were well made and the price was normal for the French quarter. We really did enjoy our one night stay. One last thing, the swiming pool was rather small on top of the roof, but the view of the city was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - You don't want to miss staying here !”
Reviews.Author: BarbNOLA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary at the hotel. We'll be back again as everything was perfect. The suite we had was clean and beautiful with its furnishings and decor and marble and granite bathroom with plush amenities. The staff members went out of their way to help us, and the front desk were especially helpful and courteous with easy check in and check out. Food and beverage were also fantastic, as they gave great service with a wonderful attitude. I could go on and on about how fantastic this hotel is... but let me end by saying ... We had a most memorable time and reccomend everyone to be sure to stay at the Hotel Monteleone in the French Quarter. By the way, the Spa is outstanding too !!!! Barbara Decker

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed - I Loved Hotel Monteleone!”
Reviews.Author: vanitysvial
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm easily impressed, but this was one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in. I've been to New Orleans three times before this, but it has always been for Mardi Gras and I've stayed closer to the other side of the quarter. This hotel is conveniently located only a block away from Bourbon and Canal (very close to Jackson Square). I thought my room and bathroom were very cute and my view overlooking the city and the river was awesome. There was an in-room safe, and the maid left chocolates and a mini-weather forecast every night. The work out room was much bigger than expected, with multiple ellipticals, treadmills, stairsteppers, etc... all NEW and with individual TVs. They even had free apples in the exercise room. This hotel was an absolute steal at $100/night. I even got a free drink when I checked in... the bar is very cool with a "bar-go-round" that actually rotates. Anyway, the only two things I can complain about are: 1) my husband wasn't there and 2) the in-hotel restaurant was expensive and not worth it. Other than that, I really liked this place and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: ladena
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful experience here! We thought it might be noisy at night because it is only one block off Bourbon Street and has heavy pedestrian traffic around the clock. However, once we were in our room (Executive Suite) we couldn't hear a thing outside and slept soundly. Very comfortable bed and bedding, shower that never ran out of hot water, quick elevators. We only had two issues: the television in the sitting room was snowy (but the one in our bedroom was clear) and we felt that the internet access should have been free. Also, the refrigerator is not for snacks or drinks you want to bring in - it is stocked by the hotel with drinks, etc that are quite pricey. No microwave. We'll stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay..except Parking”
Reviews.Author: biggunzz
Reviews.Content: Very clean and in a great location. One block over is Bourbon Street.The staff was OK. the bar was realy neat and stayed very full the entire time. I really didnt get to see the pool or spa, I was here only one day and stayed out 90% of the time looking at the scene. The only drawback was $30 a day to park, had to use valet and it was very slow. So make sure you add $30 per day to the cost of the Hotel if you have a car. The wi fi was also $10 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Still Nice But Slipping”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler78
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Monteleone many times since the 1980s. It has a wonderful location, just one block from Bourbon Street but on relatively quiet Royale. I think the overall experience has slipped a bit over the years. Unsolicited, the doorman took the roller bags into the lobby while I paid the taxi driver. Then he hung around until he was given a tip. I realize he may have been trying to be helpful, but I had already quite easily taken those bags through 2 airports and could have taken them a few more feet into the lobby all by myself. The room was, as always, nice albeit small but the bathroom had almost zero counter space. Worse, the sink faucets leaked water all over what little counter space there was. Also, the shower head sprayed water all over the ceiling until I tightened the connection myself. As I had also found in the past, the TV offered electronic checkout but it did not work. Apparently it is not hooked up even though it is on the screen menu. There was one long line in the lobby for both check-in and check-out. After waiting a while, I simply left (the concierge said it was OK to do so) but I, of course, never got the zeroed out statement that I would have preferred. Overall, this is still a good place to stay, but I don't feel that the management is on top of things anymore like it was when I first started staying here (it was privately owned then but now appears to be part of a chain).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, more for adults”
Reviews.Author: travlmama
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my 3 1/2 and almost 6 year old children. Like most reviews, the location can't be beat. Yes, it was $30 dollars a night to park, but it wasn't worth it to park anywhere else to save $10. It was convenient to have the car ready for us when we needed it. I brought my laptop, but didn't log on to the hotel's server, which I think was about $10 day. Gerard the doorman was very friendly and my kids looked for him every time we left. The room size was fine. We have been traveling the US all summer and a few more square feel isn't much of a difference. Our room was in the Iberville tower on the 9th floor. We had a gorgeous view of the Mississippi and would watch the ships leaving port. Unfortunately, our side of the hotel also sat above two huge ventilation fans on top of the building below. The ac fan was constantly running in the room to keep the heat under control. The fan was very loud, and on the second day, I turned it off for a moment of quiet, which is when I notice how loud the fans on the building below were. I sleep with earplugs and the room fan was extremely loud even for me. It was like having a dull roar in the background the entire time. It was so hot though, that I didn't have a choice. It might be different in the other Beinville tower, though. Another thing to consider is the rooftop pool is in the Beinville tower, and we were in the other tower. So, we had to cross the lobby of the fancy hotel each time we went swimming (every day). The pool was fine, but not too many young kids (good for adults, but no much for kids). One of the in-pool lights was coming loose, so the maintenance needed some attention. The view was amazing. There is an area around the corner from the pool which is where I would have hung out, if I didn't have my kids. Everything was in walking distance, including street cars. I would probably stay here again with my children. The experience of being in the French Quarter is worth it to us.I would definitely stay here if it were just me and my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, good staff, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: 4dafun
Reviews.Content: The location and generally upscale feeling of this place are good. All the staff were very nice. Room size is a real issue and a down side to seriously consider if your more than 2 to a room. The place is dated so you get stuff like an elevator thats beautifully paneled but very very slow to arrive. The rotating bar is interesting for 2 seconds and attracted the local business crowd which means it was kind of dressy during the happy hour window. If your interested in the history of NO and want an old school feeling that also puts you within half a small block of Bourbon St. put this place on your short list. The pool is also a positive consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rbrown333
Reviews.Content: Pros: One block from Bourbon St./Completely renovated, clean and AC worked great/Rooftop Pool was unique and perfect/clean Cons: Parking is $30 a night so we did not park in the Hotel garage but rather an Independent Garage on Iberville St. for $20 a night which was only 1/2 block from Hotel Must Do: Cafe Du Monde, Vampire Tour, Oak Alley Plantaion, Cafe Beignet on Bourbon St. at night has a great band playing every evening in their courtyard, Karoake at Cat's Meow on Bourbon St. and Preservation Hall for music on St. Peter's St, Had the best dinner ever at Gallatoire's, be sure to make a reservation and gentlemen bring a jacket :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: H0lidayr0ad
Reviews.Content: Spent two weekend nights here and very much enjoyed the stay. The room rate was reasonable and you can't beat the location for easy access to all of activity of the Quarter. Our room overlooked Royal Street and while you could hear the late night revelry from nearby Bourbon Street, it was not intolerable and given the location, somewhat expected. Some reviewers have noted the carpet or curtains in their rooms were worn, but its age is a lot of the charm of the facility and if you're checking out the curtains closely you're spending too much time in the room. Staff were friendly and accommodating at both check-in and check-out and the door staff were quick to hail a cab or assist with bags. The rooftop pool area was comfortable and seemed popular with guests, although there was a steady turnover (given all of the other things to do in the area) and we were always able to find an available lounge chair. As with any older facility, there aren't enough elevators, so it takes a few minutes to get from one floor to another. And one quibble. I didn't lug the laptop on this pleasure trip, so I had hoped to check my e-mail in the business center, but the Internet rate was 45 cents/minute with a $7 minimum no matter the use. A positive experience overall though and the many reviewers seem to have hit the mark in describing the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Haphazard service didn't ruin trip, but didn't help, either”
Reviews.Author: clmfla
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 3 nights at the Monteleone. Great location, can't be beat. We were ready for a small room, and it was very nice, on the 9th floor so little street noise. Unfortunately we had a connecting room, and I don't care how nice the hotel is, if you're in a connecting room, you hear a lot (like the guy next door who talked all evening on his cell). The staff was accommodating, but... We asked the concierge about day passes to the streetcars and she sent us to a store that no longer sold them. We had to call housekeeping two days in a row because they took our used towels and didn't leave any new ones! One day they took the hotel robe my husband was using and didn't replace it. The real kicker was when we went to the rooftop pool and it was overrun with a bunch of totally wasted twenty-somethings who were incredibly obnoxious, plus an older man/very young woman practically having sex in the pool, and the hotel staff just stood back in the shade and ignored it all. Even when a little boy with what looked a lot like ringworm jumped in to swim. Needless to say, we weren't about to swim at that point. I know in New Orleans, you expect some rowdiness, and it could have just as easily been wasted baby boomers because they were all over the area, but staff should have some discretion to eject people who are ruining it for everyone else, and it was only the middle of the day. And a nice hotel with a lot of older guests. You expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cruze-lover
Reviews.Content: The Monteleone is now one of my favorite hotels in the Quarter. The location is right off of Canal Street - near the shopping and casino yet has much more charm than the chain hotels on Canal. Its a short walk to the bars and resturants of the French Quarter. The king room we booked was small (in fact the bathroom was almost bigger) but it was all we needed. Plus it was quiet and the a/c was cold. What else do you need? The rooftop bar was beautiful and we enjoyed the revolving bar. Checkin/out was pleasant and efficient!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cl1994
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Monteleone for the ELCA Youth Gathering in July 2009. The staff was wonderful, answering every question we had, holding doors, etc. The houskeeping staff kept my room nice and clean. The heated rooftop pool was great, with views of the city. A word of caution: There are three sets of elevators. Only the Iberville elevators go to the roof, the two sections of 15th floor do not connect, and not all elevators stop at the mezzanine level. The Monteleone is only 1 block from Canal St, 1 block from Bourbon St, and anly about 7 blocks from the famous Cafe' Du Monde. Overall, this hotel is a beautiful place to stay in a great and beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “well located in the french quarter”
Reviews.Author: frenchyBBN
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel in the French Quarter, convinient, quiet, evrything's ok ... but ... the style of the rooms is really old deco style !

Reviews.Title: “Best New Orleans Experience”
Reviews.Author: JetSetter721
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Monteleone with 2 friends from July 17-20. We are in our late 20s and loved the historic feel of the hotel and distinguished touches (chandeliers, classic books, etc). Location: Possibly the best location in the French Quarter. Very safe area. Close to Canal Street and trolley stop, but on same street as famous French Quarter antique shops and restaurants. Easy walk to Bourbon Street and Jackson Square, but far enough so you didn't get the stench and noise. We were able to walk the entire French Quarter handily from this hotel, and it was a stone's throw away from Harrah's and the central business district. Hotel amenities: The hotel is gorgeous. Every corner of the lobby is breathtaking. The Carousel bar in the lobby is hands-down a New Orleans gem. Bartenders were some of the best in the business and the experience of slowly revolving while socializing is great! Free peanut mix and fun oldies music too! Elevators worked just fine, and had no issues with check-in/check-out. They even let me check in very early. Hotel pool is on roof with pretty cool views. The decor on the roof is much nicer than most hotels, great lounge chairs, free towels, and a great bartender making reasonably priced and yummy drinks! One complaint is that the pool needed more frequent cleaning, and the water temperature in the pool was rather warm (esp considering the air temperature is over 90 degrees!). So not exactly refreshing but the whole pool deck was great. Hotel room: Very decent size for a downtown hotel in any city. Large clean, bathroom, safe that was free to use, a chandelier in the ceiling! Beds were pretty soft for my taste, but not a big deal. We were on the 12th floor (we heard the 10th floor was haunted!). Service: I don't understand the bashing of the hotel staff on this site. Either those reviewers were there during an overcrowded festival weekend that would overwhelm ANY hotel staff or they are simply exaggerating. The service was great (with the exception of room cleaning sometimes getting delayed). Doormen, bell staff, front desk, all wonderful. We all agreed we would definitely stay there again and it is probably one of our favorite hotels in the world (and I've stayed at the Hilton and Doubletree in NOLA, as well as Westins, Hiltons and Ws all over the world).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, horrible service - you decide what's important.”
Reviews.Author: ksd123
Reviews.Content: Preferred-king rooms are in fact often smaller than standard king - not worth the price of the upgrade. Any promises the staff give at time of reservations, check - in, or any other interaction are likely not to be communicated with anyone else. We had 4 different occasions where staff members didn't follow through on their word. And management was just as bad. They just don't seem to get the concept of customer service that one expects in a nice hotel. On the other hand, the location is great. It's within walking distance of almost everything, yet removed from the noise and stench and traffic that befouls many other N.O. hotels. If you want an average sized, clean room in a great location, and don't mind fending for yourself when it comes to service, then you'll find the Monteleone acceptable. If you are at home in the Ritz Carlton, then stay away from here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service Ever!”
Reviews.Author: TravelstheWorld75
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned international traveler for both business and pleasure and I have *never* experienced anything near the egregious customer service that I received at this hotel. My greatest shock was that the managerial staff were exceedingly uncooperative and hostile, while other employees seemed fine and actually embarrassed by their behavior. It is unfortunate that my experience was so negative because the hotel is well located, has many amenities and is historically charming. However, I will never stay at this hotel again and I will tell all my friends and colleagues to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Love the REAL New Orleans Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: amor915
Reviews.Content: When getting ready to book my hotel for Essence Festival I was very aprehensive on choosing the Hotel Monteleone because no one really knew it. Reluctantly I did anyways because all the big hotels were booked...and Im glad they were! We drove to the hotel so when we approached the Hotel Garage the people there were so quick in getting our luggage out and getting us the parking ticket for our car A+ We then stood in line for about 5 min (the line was long because of the festival) when we got to the front our room wasnt ready (we got there around 9am) so they told us that they would call us when it was ready but instead of carring ou luggage everywhere the bell hop (yes they are old school and I LOVED IT) came and got our luggage and stored it for us as we walked around til the room was ready...so of course we went to Bourbon because of the close proximity :-) . Got a couple of drinks then two hours later they called like they said and the room was ready We go to the room and I warned the girls that they room might not be big BUT our intensions are just to sleep in there not to live...I opened the door and WHOA! The room was MUCH more bigger than some tripadvisors said...I had gotten a King size bed room and it was big enough to fit a cot in there (there were 4 women in the room) The next day we went to the rooftop pool (GORGEOUS) although the pool could of been a little cleaner it was still cool enough to sit in. We then grab some drinks and food while we were up there (VERY GOOD PRICES). Later that night before heading to the concert we hit the carousel bar and that was too cute and the bartenders were very quick and helpful The gentleman in the front of the hotel was always there with a smile and greeted us EVERYTIME... I LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE this hotel, I appreicate the feel of old New Orleans then the corporate smug of it...Def going back!

Reviews.Title: “Understaffed and not well trained”
Reviews.Author: italiafiend
Reviews.Content: I am currently at the Hotel Monteleone as I write this. It is late Sunday afternoon (4:00) and I am trying to send a business package. I have been downstairs THREE TIMES trying to find a bellman (because apparently they're the only ones who can send packages) to send this for me. This last time I waited 20 minutes and saw NO ONE. Oh, and our room still hasn't been made up and it's 4;00 in the afternoon. I have asked for the concierge for numerous recommendations -- every one she gives me is some tourist trap with I really long line-- then she tells me to look up menus on-line! The porters out front don't open the door for you, they just stand around and talk. I usually stay at a Ritz or Four Seasons when I'm traveling, and took this on the recommendation of a friend because it was a "better location." What a mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Ocracokey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Moneleone last January and was very disappointed, the staff was sooo rude and the rooms are not what you see on the internet. The room was so small. We go to New Orleans at least once a year, have stayed just about everywhere down in the French Quarter, sorry to say we will never stay at the Monteleone again!

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Old World Hotel w/ Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: TravellinBabe
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I checked in on July 1st and out on July 5th for the Essence Music Festival 2009. This was our 3rd stay in New Orleans, but 1st at Monteleone Hotel. I am a very faithful and loyal Trip Advisor contributor and user, but I sometimes wonder about the reviews written. I'm a New Yorker from birth and we, New Yorkers, can be extremely demanding w/ high expectations at times in regards to fast and prompt service. I write all of that to state, I think many of the reviews I read on this hotel a few months ago in prep for choosing a hotel are very unreasonable, to state the least! Based on the previous reviews, we were so worried about the size of the rooms, that we booked several rooms based on the reviews about the lack of space. That was unnecessary, if you request a large room, they will accomodate. For such a large festival, and the volume of guests, they placed us appropriately according to group size. So our 4 friends from Massachusetts, were placed in a very large room, Room #459, and my friend and I were placed in Room #440, great for no more than 2 people and maybe a small child. In regards to the service in the hotel, I felt that it was up to par with a 4.5 Star hotel. At the rooftop pool, the young men constantly cleaned the water, and re-arranged the towels after other guests left. They were prompt with the drink orders and food service. The fitness gym was up to date with fairly new equipment and was clean. The spa services were fairly reasonable compared to NY prices, and the spa staff, Jennifer and Marie, were very lovely. Our housekeeper, Marisol, was wonderful! She even cleaned our room one day way later than she should have b/c we had the privacy sign on the door until 1pm. Anything we called housekeeping/guest services for, we received promptly! We called and asked if it was ok to remove the items in the mini-bar so that we could store our food, and they explained, as I had thought, that we would be charged, so they offered to bring up to our room a mini-fridge! That was a wonderful touch b/c it's so hot & steamy down there, that we were always in need of cold beverages. And Randy, the Doorman, was excellent, and was always happy to assist us in hailing a taxi. By the way, the hotel AC was always kicking! Our room was always cold, sometimes too cold, but I'd rather have that as opposed to not enough AC! The Carousel bar was wonderful! The drinks were strong and reasonable, $6 for a Tom Collins! The piano singer was hilariously fun and accomodating of special requests! Parker, the bartender is a Rock Star! I was so nervous about eating at Le Cafe for breakfast b/c of the extremely picky reviews! But I must say, that for $15.50/person, the food was great! The omlette station, and the menu was above standard. For the great taste, quality, and service in Le Cafe, I would have expected to pay at least $25 or more. I kept going to Harrah's for the breakfast buffet, which is great, but the hour long line sucks! So for basically the same price I could have spared the heat and lengthy wait, and eaten downstairs. Thanks to my fellow extra picky Trip Advisors, I missed out on breakfast @ Le Cafe everyday of my trip until the last b/c I was so wary!! Unwarranted and Unnecessary! I know that we're in a recession, but don't be so cheap and picky, if you thought that this was expensive, then maybe you should be staying at the Hampton Inn, Travelodge, Motel 6. I'm not discriminating, b/c I have stayed at all types of motels/hotels nationial/international, and you get what you pay for. During a large festival or convention, the larger chain hotels suck b/c of the sheer volume. The taxi stand looks like a block party! The W is overrated in NOLA, the rooms are small, the rate is awful, and folks stay there strictly to be seen and see others! They don't even have a Bliss Spa there! The Loews was an option, based on other Loews that we've stayed at, but the rate was really high, and it wasn't in the French Quarter. The Provincial, Drury, and Homewood Suites are good as far as location on Poydras, if you have an event at the Superdome and you may want to walk! But all of the fun is in the French Quarter! We ate at the Gumbo Shop, which must be a local spot, Court of Two Sisters, Praline Connection, Mother's, and Messina's at the Riverwalk mall! All were absolutely wonderful! In regards to the Cajun Creole Cuisine, us, Northerners/Yankees, are not used to: Everything being Fried, Multiple Carbs on 1 Plate (biscuits, grits, fries, and bread), lack of a Pork alternative like Turkey/Beef Bacon & Sausages, and lack of Salads! LOL! We love it, it's like a guiltless food holiday, that's what makes NOLA special, but everyone was feeling the lack of ruffage/fiber! My only negative criticism of this hotel, is that there seemed to be several meal trays in the hallways during the late nite. I assume that this was due to a lack of late night service. One night I called to inform guest services at 12:30 am that I counted 5 meal trays alone on the 4th floor, and they had someone come and pick them up! Problem solved. From now on, unless the Trip advisor reviews are ablsolutely horrendous, this is our destination hotel for New Orleans, no need to look any further. Monteleone should be in the Top 10!

Reviews.Title: “A Great New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: athomeinthepines
Reviews.Content: The Montleone was an excellent choice since it was near the place where my business meeting took place and was also near the French Quarter and other New Orleans attractions. The price was very affordable, and the service of the staff was outstanding. The only minor complaints are no free internet and small rooms. The small rooms are to be expected in downtown NO, but the internet could be free to provide patrons an extra amenity. I would certianly stay here again and plan to do so on the next trip to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful older hotel @ a great price”
Reviews.Author: Gnacat
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband and 20 year old daughter for a semi business pleasure trip. From the moment we stepped into the lobby we knew we had picked a good one. The front desk let us check in early and fortunately they had a room ready for us despite our change in room accomodations (going from 2 to 3 people) at the last minute. The hotel was absolutely beautiful throughout. Even though an older hotel you never "smelled" the old hotel smell. The rooms were a bit small but the beds were very comfy and the room spotless. The pool was very warm but it has been particularly hot and muggy and it's on the 16th floor with a fabulous view of the city. It's right in the french quarter so it's good walking distance for alot of things. The bar is exceptional - its a carousel bar that actually turns a complete revolution every 15 minutes. The drinks were the best in town. (Go Marvin!). We booked through GTA hotels and got a great room rate of $125/night. The only complaint is that coffee isn't available for takeout before 7 am (and I had a conference earlier than that). You can make it in your room but no take out cups! We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience. Plan to Return Soon!”
Reviews.Author: Mouse63
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Monteleone for a recent trip based on a friendâ€™s suggestion, and we were not disappointed. We had never been to New Orleans, and the hotel was one of the most pleasant, memorable aspects of our trip. We arrived an hour early, and our room was ready, so we were able to check in. The desk clerk, Toya, was friendly and helpful, giving us many details about the hotel layout and services. The garage/parking attendants were also friendly and helpful. The hotel was absolutely beautiful with a gorgeous, lavish lobby. Our bellhop, Ricky, was friendly, charming, and helpful, offering lots of useful information and his services at any time we needed him. Concierge was also warm, welcoming and helpful in giving local restaurant advice. Our executive suite was spacious, clean and offered nice touchesâ€”robes, immaculately folded towels and bathroom accessories, and charming dÃ©cor. We discovered we had forgotten toothpaste when we arrived. I called downstairs to ask if I could buy it in the hotel, and I was told someone would bring some right up. Within minutes, it arrived. I even received a follow-up call to make sure we had received it. When our room was cleaned by the maid service, my clothes I left on the bedroom bench were tidied up! Everything was replaced (soaps, toiletries, coffee, etc). There were always plenty of towels, linens etc. We even returned one afternoon after a long, hot day of sight-seeing to find our robes laid out across our bed!!! Now thatâ€™s luxury! Although we didnâ€™t request a room with a view, our suite looked down on St. Louis Cathedral/Jackson Square, the river, and the French market. The revolving carousel bar was fun, and the piano bar performer was delightful. The bartenders, however, were not as attentive as they could have been. They should have served us a little more quickly instead of focusing all their attention on other patrons. The hotel location was outstanding, within walking distance to everything we wanted to see. It was quiet as well. The doormen were helpful and friendly, and we always greeted us with a smile. The in-room safe was convenient, as well as the bar, although all items were expensive. As a final positive note, I felt extremely safe in this hotel. Of course, not everything can be perfect, although the Monteleone came close. The TVs were outdated. At this price point, I expected flat screen TVs. The cable reception was poor as well. All staff were friendly and courteous; however, there was one exception. I asked a maid how to get to the rooftop pool, and, as she left her cleaning duties to walk us down the hall to the elevator, I heard her say â€œAye-yi-yi-yi-yi.â€� NOT good customer service. Aside from these few negative notes, the Hotel Monteleone was perfect, and we plan to return in the spring. It was a delightful stay in a lovely, warm, elegant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a positive experience all around”
Reviews.Author: OnTour77
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Monteleone for 4 nights. I had booked a regular King room, but upon reading about some very small rooms on TripAdvisor, I called the hotel and they kindly upgraded me to a Preferred King with a river view upon check-in. Even this room wasn't large by any means, but it was very pleasant and more importantly, the bathroom was quite large with plenty of counter space.Water pressure in the shower is excellent--if you have ever stayed anywhere in New Orleans you likely know that it is rare to get decent pressure. The room was very clean and the staff attentive and courteous. I would definitely stay here again. I also had an excellent treatment at the spa (Jetlag package). The spa is small but clean and well-run.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated! Housekeeping are thieves!”
Reviews.Author: br0kera
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently in Monteleone. Is there something good at the hotel yes. The location is actually really good. In the very French Quarter, you are practicly one block away from the Bourban street. But the hotel, the stuff and the atmosphere is really really bad. It feels like a cheap 1* hostel. Although shiny from the outside! The rooms are really old. The air conditioning extremely old. The furniture awful. Thin walls, so that you can hear everything and everyone your neighbour is doing. The lobby is really shiny and the last floor is nice, but it is not enough to compensate for the overpriced hotel. There are many better places in NOLA. I would never book a room again in Monteleone!

Reviews.Title: “First Class all the Way!”
Reviews.Author: apirateover40
Reviews.Content: The location of the Monteleone is excellent! My husband and I enjoyed walking down Royal Street. So many interesting shops!! The hotel was really first class.
